translated: Because one wishes to accomplish one's own work, if one releases or stops the work of others, it is another offense.

original: bdag gi zhing legs par brjod pa'i phyir chu rka bsgyur na 'ongs thang gis che ba mi brtsi'i chu btang zhing bcang pas skyed bri ci zhugs pa brtsis te rin thang tshang na pham par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gi zhing legs par brjod pa'i phyir chu rka bsgyur na 'ongs thang gis che ba mi brtsi'i chu btang zhing bcang pas skyed bri ci zhugs pa brtsis te rin thang tshang na pham par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one digs a canal to irrigate one's field, one is not considered to have stolen water. But if one measures the water that one has taken and its value is equivalent to five māsakas, one commits a transgression of the rule.

original: rkun shas 'dod pa'i @47b phyir rkun po la glags ston pa ni pham par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rkun shas 'dod pa'i @47b phyir rkun po la glags ston pa ni pham par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one shows a thief the way in order to steal, does one commit a transgression of a rule?

original: de'i phyir rkun po dag la sgrub pa'i rgyus bstan na shas thob pas so zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rkun po dag la sgrub pa'i rgyus bstan na shas thob pas so zhes pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: If one shows the way to a thief, one commits a transgression of a rule by obtaining a share.

original: rkun po las shas 'dod pa'i phyir rgyus mkhan byas nas de'i shas nas lag tu 'ongs pa na pham par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rkun po las shas 'dod pa'i phyir rgyus mkhan byas nas de'i shas nas lag tu 'ongs pa na pham par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one shows the way to a thief in order to obtain a share of the stolen goods, when one obtains a share of the stolen goods, one commits a transgression of a rule.

original: sa dang khyim skong zhing rku na ji tsam gyis pham par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: sa dang khyim skong zhing rku na ji tsam gyis pham par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one steals land and a house, how much is it that constitutes a transgression of a rule?

original: sa dang khyim skong pa ni mtshams 'byor na'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: sa dang khyim skong pa ni mtshams 'byor na'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: It is said: If one steals land and a house, it is when one takes possession of the boundary.

original: sa dang khyim skong zhing rku ba bskor ba'i rmang ngam ra ba nas khor yug tu 'khor na des pham par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sa dang khyim skong zhing rku ba bskor ba'i rmang ngam ra ba nas khor yug tu 'khor na des pham par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one encircles the foundation or wall of a field or house that is being built, and then encircles it all the way around, one is defeated.

original: pha rol gyi nor shags dkar bor te rku ba ji tsam gyis pham zhe na ;
analyzed: pha rol gyi nor shags dkar bor te rku ba ji tsam gyis pham zhe na ;
translated: How much must one steal in order to be defeated by stealing another's property through trickery?

original: shags kyis ni gal te rgyal po'i 'khor du rgyal na'o zhes pa yin te /🔽shags dkar 'dong zhing rku ba bla shags su bkye na nam bdag rgyal bar bcad pa'i tshe pham pa'o //
analyzed: shags kyis ni gal te rgyal po'i 'khor du rgyal na'o zhes pa yin te / shags dkar 'dong zhing rku ba bla shags su bkye na nam bdag rgyal bar bcad pa'i tshe pham pa'o //
translated: If one wins through trickery in the king's court, one is defeated.🔽If one steals through trickery in a gambling match, one is defeated when the other party determines that one has won through trickery.

original: bla shags ma yin gyi 'og gzu'i thad du shags dkar song ba nam pham zhe na /
analyzed: bla shags ma yin gyi 'og gzu'i thad du shags dkar song ba nam pham zhe na /
translated: If one does not steal through trickery, but through cheating, when is one defeated?

original: gal te gzu bo'i der na ni pha rol gyis sbyor ba'i re thag bcad na'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te gzu bo'i der na ni pha rol gyis sbyor ba'i re thag bcad na'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: If one is honest, one is defeated when the other party determines that one has lost.

original: 'og gzus bdag rgyal bar bcad la /
analyzed: 'og gzus bdag rgyal bar bcad la /
translated: If one cheats and the other party determines that one has won,

original: de nyid kyis kyang spogs pa'i re thag bcad na re thag nam bcad pa des pham pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis kyang spogs pa'i re thag bcad na re thag nam bcad pa des pham pa'o //
translated: and if the other party also determines that one has cheated, one is defeated when the other party determines that one has lost.

original: 'og gzus bcad pa nyid cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'og gzus bcad pa nyid cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens if the other party does not determine that one has cheated?

original: 'di ni sbyor ba'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni sbyor ba'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: This is the application.

original: 'og gzus rgyal bar bcad pa ni sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: 'og gzus rgyal bar bcad pa ni sbyor ba ste /
translated: The lower part of the body is cut off in order to conquer the enemy.🔽🔽

original: sbom por ston pa'o //
analyzed: sbom por ston pa'o //
translated: The first is the basis, the second is the action and the third is the conclusion.🔽The first is the basis, the second is the action and the third is the conclusion.

original: sho gam rku ba gong du rgyas par ma smos pas na rnam par 'byed pa las ltung ba dang mi ltung ba'i rgyus cir 'gyur ba mdor ston pa ni /
analyzed: sho gam rku ba gong du rgyas par ma smos pas na rnam par 'byed pa las ltung ba dang mi ltung ba'i rgyus cir 'gyur ba mdor ston pa ni /
translated: Since the stealing of tolls was not extensively explained above, the Vinaya Verses concisely teaches the causes of the downfall and non-downfall:

original: rku sems med pa ni sho gam gyi rgyud la nyes pa skye bar ma dogs shig ces pa yin te /
analyzed: rku sems med pa ni sho gam gyi rgyud la nyes pa skye bar ma dogs shig ces pa yin te /
translated: If one has no thought of stealing, do not fear that a fault will arise in the continuum of tolls.

original: dge slong sho gam zlor mi dbang ba'i tshe khyim pas zlor bcol ba dang zlor dbang pa'i tshe khyim pa'i rdzas bslab pa gnyis la bcom ldan 'das nyes pa med par gsungs pa ni khyim pas bcal drang mnyam du bsams pa dang / bdag gis zlor dbang gi pha rol gyi zlor mi dbang bar phye ba med de /
analyzed: dge slong sho gam zlor mi dbang ba'i tshe khyim pas zlor bcol ba dang zlor dbang pa'i tshe khyim pa'i rdzas bslab pa gnyis la bcom ldan 'das nyes pa med par gsungs pa ni khyim pas bcal drang mnyam du bsams pa dang / bdag gis zlor dbang gi pha rol gyi zlor mi dbang bar phye ba med de /
translated: When a bhikṣu is not permitted to pay tolls, if a layperson requests that he pay them and when he is permitted to pay tolls, if he pays the tolls of a layperson, the Bhagavān said that he commits no fault.

original: bdag gis khyer ro cog zlor dbang par bsams pas na 'di gnyis la rku sems med pa'i phyir dogs pa ma bskyed cig par slob dpon nyid kyis bsgrubs pa'i mdo yin no //
analyzed: bdag gis khyer ro cog zlor dbang par bsams pas na 'di gnyis la rku sems med pa'i phyir dogs pa ma bskyed cig par slob dpon nyid kyis bsgrubs pa'i mdo yin no //
translated: The master himself has established that I will pay the duty is a sūtra, because these two have no intention to steal.

original: de ni sho gam gyi rdzas gang gis khyer ba de nyid kyis bcal pa ston pa ni /
analyzed: de ni sho gam gyi rdzas gang gis khyer ba de nyid kyis bcal pa ston pa ni /
translated: The statement The amount of the duty is to be paid by the very same substance with which one is carrying

original: rdzas gang gis khyer ba des sbyin zhes pa yin te /🔽rdzas @48a * //
analyzed: rdzas gang gis khyer ba des sbyin zhes pa yin te / rdzas @48a * //
translated: means The substance with which one is carrying is to be paid as the duty.

original: gang gis khyer zhing sho gam zlo ba des sho gam bcol cig pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis khyer zhing sho gam zlo ba des sho gam bcol cig pa'o //
translated: The statement The duty is to be paid by the very substance with which one is carrying means The duty is to be paid by the very substance with which one is carrying and paying the duty.

original: da ni dngos nyid bstan pa'i phyir dbang bas gzhan gyi bzlas pa ni ma brkus pa ma yin zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: da ni dngos nyid bstan pa'i phyir dbang bas gzhan gyi bzlas pa ni ma brkus pa ma yin zhes pa yin te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the actual substance, it is said, The carrying of another's substance by one who is not authorized is not stealing.

original: dge slong sho gam bzlar dbang bas bdag gis rdzas la ma gtogs pa gzhan gyi rdzas bzlas na bkus par ston pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong sho gam bzlar dbang bas bdag gis rdzas la ma gtogs pa gzhan gyi rdzas bzlas na bkus par ston pa'o //
translated: This teaches that if a monk who is not authorized to pay the duty carries another's substance, except for his own, it is not stealing.

original: mi dbang pas gzhan zlor mi gzhug ces pa ni dge slong sho gam zlor mi dbang na /
analyzed: mi dbang pas gzhan zlor mi gzhug ces pa ni dge slong sho gam zlor mi dbang na /
translated: The statement One who is not authorized should not make another carry means that if a monk is not authorized to pay the duty,

original: khyim pa la bcol zhing ma zlo zhig pa'o /
analyzed: khyim pa la bcol zhing ma zlo zhig pa'o /
translated: he should not entrust it to a layperson and not make him carry it.

original: bzlas na pham par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bzlas na pham par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If he recites it, he is defeated.

original: rnam pa gzhan yang rkun po lta bur 'gyur ba bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan yang rkun po lta bur 'gyur ba bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to remove the idea that he is like a thief,

original: ma tshor bar zlo ba mi 'grub pa'i phyir nan tan mi bya ba ma yin zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: ma tshor bar zlo ba mi 'grub pa'i phyir nan tan mi bya ba ma yin zhes pa yin te /
translated: it is said, “It is not the case that he should not make an effort because he is not caught when he steals.”

original: sho gam du 'gyur pa'i rdzas tshong pa la sogs pas dge slong gi rdzas kyi nang du 'jug cing yo byad srid pas na /
analyzed: sho gam du 'gyur pa'i rdzas tshong pa la sogs pas dge slong gi rdzas kyi nang du 'jug cing yo byad srid pas na /
translated: Because the goods of a trader, etc., which are subject to customs duties, are put among the goods of a monk, and because it is possible that the goods will be lost,

original: ye mig ma cung shig pa'o //
analyzed: ye mig ma cung shig pa'o //
translated: he should not be careless.

original: de'i nan tan ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de'i nan tan ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: How should he make an effort?

original: dge slong du ma srung mar gzhag ces pa yin te /
analyzed: dge slong du ma srung mar gzhag ces pa yin te /
translated: It is said, “He should appoint a monk as a guard.”

original: bdag cag bsod snyoms sam gud du 'dong na phyi na dge slong srung ma gcig gnyis yan chad dus thub pa zhog shig pa'o //
analyzed: bdag cag bsod snyoms sam gud du 'dong na phyi na dge slong srung ma gcig gnyis yan chad dus thub pa zhog shig pa'o //
translated: If we go out for alms or elsewhere, you should stay behind for a while with one or two other monks as a guard.

original: de'i zas sbyin zhes pa ni srung mar gzhag pa de'i zas bsod snyoms la dong ba spyis byin cig pa'o //
analyzed: de'i zas sbyin zhes pa ni srung mar gzhag pa de'i zas bsod snyoms la dong ba spyis byin cig pa'o //
translated: “You should give him food” means that you should give the food of the alms to the one who is appointed as a guard.

original: srung mar gzhag pa de las ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: srung mar gzhag pa de las ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: What should be done by the one who is appointed as a guard?

original: des dgag ces pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: des dgag ces pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: It is said, “He should stop him,” and so forth.

original: bdag cag gi brungs skor du rdzas sbed cing 'dug pa lta na srung ma des khogs shig pa'o //
analyzed: bdag cag gi brungs skor du rdzas sbed cing 'dug pa lta na srung ma des khogs shig pa'o //
translated: If we see that someone has hidden property in our vicinity, we will take care of it.

original: bcug nas bsnyad ces pa ni /
analyzed: bcug nas bsnyad ces pa ni /
translated: If they put it in, tell.

original: de dag gis rdzas bcug na dge slong dag la sbron cig pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis rdzas bcug na dge slong dag la sbron cig pa'o //
translated: If they put the property in, tell the monks.

original: srung ma gzhag tu dge slong med na ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: srung ma gzhag tu dge slong med na ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: If there are no monks to leave the property in the care of, what should be done?

original: med na mtshan ma gad ba ces pa yin te /
analyzed: med na mtshan ma gad ba ces pa yin te /
translated: If there are none, make a sign.

original: dge slong gzhag tu med na brungs la rgya 'am mtshan ma thob shig pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gzhag tu med na brungs la rgya 'am mtshan ma thob shig pa'o //
translated: If there are no monks to leave the property in the care of, make a sign in the vicinity.🔽If those monks return,

original: dris la blang zhes pa ni dge slong de dag slar 'khor na /
analyzed: dris la blang zhes pa ni dge slong de dag slar 'khor na /
translated: Ask and take.

original: nged kyi rdzas kyi nang du khyed kyi nor rdzas bcug pa med grang zhes brtags la gdod bdag cag gi rdzas long shig pa'o //
analyzed: nged kyi rdzas kyi nang du khyed kyi nor rdzas bcug pa med grang zhes brtags la gdod bdag cag gi rdzas long shig pa'o //
translated: If those monks return, examine the property, saying, 'We have not put your property in our property.' Then take our property.

original: gser dngul lta bu bdag cag gi snod bcug pa ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: gser dngul lta bu bdag cag gi snod bcug pa ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: What should be done if they have put in our vessels, which are like gold and silver?

original: gzhan du 'byung bar ma grub na reg par bya zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du 'byung bar ma grub na reg par bya zhes pa yin te /
translated: If it is not established as coming from another, touch it.

original: khyim pa dang dge tshul med dam 'byin du ma btub na bdag cag nyid kyi lag dar te long la phyung shig pa'o //
analyzed: khyim pa dang dge tshul med dam 'byin du ma btub na bdag cag nyid kyi lag dar te long la phyung shig pa'o //
translated: If there are no householders or novices, or if they are unable to do it, then we ourselves should take the initiative and do it.

original: 'di ni ltung ba nyi tshe'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ltung ba nyi tshe'i gnyen po'o //
translated: This is the antidote to a temporary downfall.

original: dkon @48b mchog gsum la sogs pa la bsngos pa'i cho ga ston pa ni /🔽chad pa kho nar bsdos pa ni lag tu ma son kyang ngo zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: dkon @48b mchog gsum la sogs pa la bsngos pa'i cho ga ston pa ni / chad pa kho nar bsdos pa ni lag tu ma son kyang ngo zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The ritual for dedicating to the Three Jewels and so forth is taught in the following verse:🔽“If you have promised something to the Three Jewels, your parents, and so on, even if you have not yet given it, it is as if you have already given it.”

original: dkon mchog gsum dang pha ma la sogs pa la dbul bar bsdos pa ni snying nas bsdogs pa tsam gyis bdag gi ma yin par 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum dang pha ma la sogs pa la dbul bar bsdos pa ni snying nas bsdogs pa tsam gyis bdag gi ma yin par 'grub pa'o //
translated: If you have promised to offer something to the Three Jewels, your parents, and so on, it is as if you have already given it, simply by your sincere intention to do so.

original: de lta bu ni nor gtong ba'i phyir pha ma bsngags zhes pa ni de dag la bsdos pa'i nor sho gam las zlo ba'i tshe sho gam pas mi 'gag par bya ba'i phyir pha ma'i yon tan rgyas par shod cig pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu ni nor gtong ba'i phyir pha ma bsngags zhes pa ni de dag la bsdos pa'i nor sho gam las zlo ba'i tshe sho gam pas mi 'gag par bya ba'i phyir pha ma'i yon tan rgyas par shod cig pa'o //
translated: “If you have promised something to your parents, you should praise them,” meaning that when you are trying to get out of paying a tax, you should speak at length about your parents’ good qualities in order to avoid having to pay it.

original: dkon mchog dag kyang ngo zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dkon mchog dag kyang ngo zhes pa ni /
translated: “The Three Jewels too.”

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi nor sho gam la zlo ba'i tshe 'di dkon mchog gi yon tan rgyas par shod cig pa'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi nor sho gam la zlo ba'i tshe 'di dkon mchog gi yon tan rgyas par shod cig pa'o //
translated: When the wealth of the Three Jewels is being taxed, you should explain the qualities of the Three Jewels in detail.

original: dkon mchog la sogs pa'i yon tan bshad kyang sho gam pas ma btang na ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: dkon mchog la sogs pa'i yon tan bshad kyang sho gam pas ma btang na ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: If the tax collector does not let you go even though you have explained the qualities of the Three Jewels and so forth, what should you do?

original: gzhan gyi nor gyi phyir gzhan gyi nor bskyi ba'i tshul gyis sbyin zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi nor gyi phyir gzhan gyi nor bskyi ba'i tshul gyis sbyin zhes pa yin te /
translated: You should give by the method of protecting the wealth of others for the sake of the wealth of others.

original: chos bshad kyang nges ma btang na sho gam gyi shas sbyin dgos te /
analyzed: chos bshad kyang nges ma btang na sho gam gyi shas sbyin dgos te /
translated: If the tax collector still does not let you go even though you have explained the Dharma, you should give him a portion of the tax.

original: kun gyi dkor las shas shas kyis sbyin du thogs te mi bde na dkon mchog gcig gi dkor las snga shugs su gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: kun gyi dkor las shas shas kyis sbyin du thogs te mi bde na dkon mchog gcig gi dkor las snga shugs su gyis shig pa'o //
translated: If it is not convenient to give a portion of the wealth of all the Three Jewels, you should give a portion of the wealth of one of the Three Jewels.

original: sho gam sbyin pa la sogs pa tshegs bskyang ba zhar la ston pa ni sho gam du 'gyur ba dang bcas te /
analyzed: sho gam sbyin pa la sogs pa tshegs bskyang ba zhar la ston pa ni sho gam du 'gyur ba dang bcas te /
translated: The following verse is stated to show that you should not be concerned about the trouble of paying taxes and so forth.

original: lam du mi 'gro zhes ba yin te /
analyzed: lam du mi 'gro zhes ba yin te /
translated: Do not go on the road without paying the tax.

original: sho gam gyi rdzas khyer la ma 'gro shig pa'o //
analyzed: sho gam gyi rdzas khyer la ma 'gro shig pa'o //
translated: Do not go with the goods that are subject to taxation without paying the tax.

original: mi bskur du mi rung ba'i rkyen cig byung na gdod dkon mchog gsum gyi dkor man chad gang gis khyer yang nyes med sho gam du 'gyur ba dang mi 'gyur ba'i rdzas 'byed cing ston pa ni /🔽der mi 'gyur bar bsgyur ba ni lci ba brtsir bas kyang ngo zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: mi bskur du mi rung ba'i rkyen cig byung na gdod dkon mchog gsum gyi dkor man chad gang gis khyer yang nyes med sho gam du 'gyur ba dang mi 'gyur ba'i rdzas 'byed cing ston pa ni / der mi 'gyur bar bsgyur ba ni lci ba brtsir bas kyang ngo zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: If there is a reason that it is not suitable to pay the tax, then one should distinguish and show which substances are and are not to be taxed, beginning with the property of the Three Jewels.

original: sho gam gyi rdzas su mi 'gyur ba ni lci ba'i khu bas kha dog bsgyur yang sho gam gyi rdzas su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sho gam gyi rdzas su mi 'gyur ba ni lci ba'i khu bas kha dog bsgyur yang sho gam gyi rdzas su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase that which is not to be taxed is changed to be taxed means that even if one changes the color of the substance by dyeing it with a heavy dye, it is not to be taxed.

original: kha tshar dang mtha' tshar bcad pas kyang ngo zhes pa ni ras kyi kha tshar dang mtha' tshar bcad pa tsam gyis kyang sho gam gyi rdzas su mi 'gyur bar ston to //
analyzed: kha tshar dang mtha' tshar bcad pas kyang ngo zhes pa ni ras kyi kha tshar dang mtha' tshar bcad pa tsam gyis kyang sho gam gyi rdzas su mi 'gyur bar ston to //
translated: The phrase by cutting the fringe and the edge shows that even by merely cutting the fringe and the edge of the cloth, it is not to be taxed.

original: ma mthong na blo de mi 'grub ces pa ni cho ga gong me ltar bya ba bdag gi mig sngar ma bab kyi bar du pha rol byed du bcug pa tsam la yid ma rton cig pa'o //
analyzed: ma mthong na blo de mi 'grub ces pa ni cho ga gong me ltar bya ba bdag gi mig sngar ma bab kyi bar du pha rol byed du bcug pa tsam la yid ma rton cig pa'o //
translated: The phrase if it is not seen, that cognition is not established means that until the ritual is performed as above, one should not rely merely on having the other person perform it.

original: sho gam gyi cho ga de ltar rgyas par bstan nas gzhan yang rnam par 'byed pa las 'byung @49a * //
analyzed: sho gam gyi cho ga de ltar rgyas par bstan nas gzhan yang rnam par 'byed pa las 'byung @49a * //
translated: Having thus taught the extensive presentation of the rites of customs duties, the text also teaches the following from the Vinaya Discourses that are supplementary to that presentation:

original: ba zhar la ston pa ni gzhan gyi 'tsho ba mi bcad ces pa la sogs pa yin te /🔽sho gam rku ba sbron pa la sogs pa pha rol cis 'tsho yang rung ste /
analyzed: ba zhar la ston pa ni gzhan gyi 'tsho ba mi bcad ces pa la sogs pa yin te / sho gam rku ba sbron pa la sogs pa pha rol cis 'tsho yang rung ste /
translated: Do not cut off others’ livelihood.

original: de dag gi 'tsho ba la gnod pa ci nas kyang ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi 'tsho ba la gnod pa ci nas kyang ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: No matter what means others use to make a living, such as stealing or informing on others, do not in any way harm their livelihood.

original: yid brtan pa ma yin pa la yid brtan par mi bya zhes pa ni /
analyzed: yid brtan pa ma yin pa la yid brtan par mi bya zhes pa ni /
translated: Do not trust those who are untrustworthy.

original: chos gos dang lhung bzed la sogs pa khyer ba las skur klang gi glags su 'gyur ba bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos gos dang lhung bzed la sogs pa khyer ba las skur klang gi glags su 'gyur ba bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to avoid the risk of being accused of stealing the robes, alms bowl, and so on of those who are not trustworthy,

original: yid mi gcugs pa la gcugs par ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: yid mi gcugs pa la gcugs par ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: do not trust those who are untrustworthy.

original: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What does that mean?

original: 'og ma gong mar na de'i zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: 'og ma gong mar na de'i zhes pa yin te /
translated: The next line explains:🔽If you do so, you will be like the one in the above story.

original: yid brtan pa rab 'bring gi go nor na mdo gong ma ltar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yid brtan pa rab 'bring gi go nor na mdo gong ma ltar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If you make a mistake in trusting those of higher or lower status, you will be like the one in the above story.

original: da ni ji lta bu la yid brtan par bya ba ston te /
analyzed: da ni ji lta bu la yid brtan par bya ba ston te /
translated: Now the text teaches what kind of person you should trust.

original: de ni mdza' ba yid du 'ong ba gla ma dran pa mchod pa bsngags pa /
analyzed: de ni mdza' ba yid du 'ong ba gla ma dran pa mchod pa bsngags pa /
translated: They are: a friend, a pleasing person, a teacher, one who is mindful, one who is worshipful, one who is praiseworthy, and one who is agreeable to take along.

original: khyer na dga' ba rnams so zhes pa ni 'di rnams la yid rton cig pa ste /
analyzed: khyer na dga' ba rnams so zhes pa ni 'di rnams la yid rton cig pa ste /
translated: One should rely on these.

original: de la mdza' ba ni bshes pa'o /
analyzed: de la mdza' ba ni bshes pa'o /
translated: A friend is a companion.

original: yid du 'ong ba ni 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba ni 'thad pa'o //
translated: A pleasing person is a suitable person.

original: bla ma ni slob dpon dang mkhan po'o //
analyzed: bla ma ni slob dpon dang mkhan po'o //
translated: A teacher is a preceptor or an instructor.

original: dran pa ni gang gi tshul khrims dang thos pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dran zhing de ltar 'chos pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa ni gang gi tshul khrims dang thos pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dran zhing de ltar 'chos pa'o //
translated: One who is mindful is one who is mindful of your virtues of morality, learning, etc., and who acts accordingly.

original: mchod pa ni gos la sogs pa bshugs pa dang bsti stang bya bar 'os pa'o //
analyzed: mchod pa ni gos la sogs pa bshugs pa dang bsti stang bya bar 'os pa'o //
translated: One who is worshipful is one who is worthy of your offerings of robes, etc., and of your respect.

original: bsngags pa ni gang gi tshul khrims dang thos pa la sogs pa'i yon tan bsngags shing ston pa'o //
analyzed: bsngags pa ni gang gi tshul khrims dang thos pa la sogs pa'i yon tan bsngags shing ston pa'o //
translated: One who is praiseworthy is one who praises and extols your virtues of morality, learning, etc.

original: khyer na dga' ba ni de'i chos gos dang lhung bzed la sogs pa bdag gis spyad cing khyer na gor ma chag par mi dga' ba med pa'o //
analyzed: khyer na dga' ba ni de'i chos gos dang lhung bzed la sogs pa bdag gis spyad cing khyer na gor ma chag par mi dga' ba med pa'o //
translated: One who is agreeable to take along is one who, when you use his robes, bowl, etc., and take them along, is certainly not displeased.

original: bsod nams kyis bsams pa dang lag pa rje ba'i las bya zhes pa dang / glas ma yin zhes pa ni 'khru zhing 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i las gla rngan gyis ma byed par bsod nams kyi bsam pa 'am lag phod kyis gyis shig pa'o //🔽yul skad kyis mi slu zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bsod nams kyis bsams pa dang lag pa rje ba'i las bya zhes pa dang / glas ma yin zhes pa ni 'khru zhing 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i las gla rngan gyis ma byed par bsod nams kyi bsam pa 'am lag phod kyis gyis shig pa'o // yul skad kyis mi slu zhes pa ni /
translated: The phrase one should do the work of one who is paid by merit means that one should do the work of washing, cooking, and so on, not for wages, but with the thought of merit or with one's own hand.

original: sems la g-yo med na so so'i skad kyis slu zhing g-yor mi 'gyur ba ni lho phyogs kyi dge slong mas /
analyzed: sems la g-yo med na so so'i skad kyis slu zhing g-yor mi 'gyur ba ni lho phyogs kyi dge slong mas /
translated: The phrase one should not deceive by local language means that if one is without deceit in one's mind, one will not deceive and be deceitful with one's own language.🔽This is like the case of a monk from the south

original: shar phyogs kyi dge slob ma la aa ba sa tha zhes byas pa lta bu'o //🔽brkus par dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir stor ba las blangs pa ring du mi bcang zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi dge slob ma la aa ba sa tha zhes byas pa lta bu'o // brkus par dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir stor ba las blangs pa ring du mi bcang zhes pa yin te /
translated: who said to a novice from the east, avasaṭha.🔽In order to eliminate the fear of theft, the text says, One should not keep for a long time what is taken from a place where it was lost.

original: dogs pa'i klags su 'gyur ba srid chu bcang rul ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: dogs pa'i klags su 'gyur ba srid chu bcang rul ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: This means, Do not keep what is stolen for a long time, because it is possible that one will be accused of theft.

original: yun ring du mi bcang na ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: yun ring du mi bcang na ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: If one does not keep it for a long time, what should one do?

original: 'di khang @49b skyong la gtad ces pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di khang @49b skyong la gtad ces pa yin te /
translated: This means, One should entrust it to the caretaker of the monastery.

original: bdag po su'i rjes su gtol med na khang skyong la gtod cig pa'o //
analyzed: bdag po su'i rjes su gtol med na khang skyong la gtod cig pa'o //
translated: If it is not known whose property it is, then it should be entrusted to the caretaker.

original: des kyang ji ltar bya zhe na rab tu 'byung ba'i yin pa lta na /
analyzed: des kyang ji ltar bya zhe na rab tu 'byung ba'i yin pa lta na /
translated: What should he do with it? If it is the property of one who has gone forth,

original: des dge 'dun la ston zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: des dge 'dun la ston zhes pa yin te /
translated: then it should be shown to the Saṅgha.

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos la sogs pa rab tu byung ba'i rdzas shig na su'i yin zhes dge 'dun la ston cig pa'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos la sogs pa rab tu byung ba'i rdzas shig na su'i yin zhes dge 'dun la ston cig pa'o //
translated: If it is an article of one who has gone forth, such as a begging-bowl or Dharma robes, then it should be shown to the Saṅgha, asking, “Whose is it?”

original: de ltar bstan kyang bdag po'i khungs ma phyin pa ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar bstan kyang bdag po'i khungs ma phyin pa ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: Even if it is shown in this way, what should be done if the owner is not found?

original: bdag po ma byung na breng la gdags zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag po ma byung na breng la gdags zhes pa yin no //
translated: If the owner does not appear, then it should be kept for a year.

original: rkun por bskur ba bsal ba'i phyir nad pas ma bsgo bar de'i sman mi bslang zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: rkun por bskur ba bsal ba'i phyir nad pas ma bsgo bar de'i sman mi bslang zhes pa yin te /
translated: In order to eliminate the possibility of theft, it should not be requested for the use of the sick without the permission of the sick person.

original: nad g-yog la sogs pa su yang rung ste /
analyzed: nad g-yog la sogs pa su yang rung ste /
translated: This means that it should not be requested for the use of the sick by anyone, such as a nurse.

original: nad pa nyid kyis 'di lta bu zhig las sman dang nad gsos long shig pa'i lung med par thugs dub ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: nad pa nyid kyis 'di lta bu zhig las sman dang nad gsos long shig pa'i lung med par thugs dub ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: Without the permission of the sick person himself, saying, “Get medicine and nursing for me from such and such a place,” it should not be used.

original: ma byin par len pa'i phas pham pa rnam par 'byed pa'o /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa'i phas pham pa rnam par 'byed pa'o /
translated: This is the analysis of the defeat of taking what is not given.

original: // / da ni phran tshegs las 'byung ba ston te /
analyzed: // / da ni phran tshegs las 'byung ba ston te /
translated: Now, the Vinaya-ksudraka-vastu is taught.

original: bdag po dang bcas pa ma byin bar cho ga gzhan gyis bdag gir mi bya zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bdag po dang bcas pa ma byin bar cho ga gzhan gyis bdag gir mi bya zhes pa ni /
translated: One should not make one's own that which belongs to another, without permission, by other means.

original: 'gro na pa chom pos thebs pa dang / drug sdes mu stegs pa'i rten byas pa lta bu dag bdag yod pa la pha rol gyis ma byin pa phyag dar khrod pa zhe 'am /
analyzed: 'gro na pa chom pos thebs pa dang / drug sdes mu stegs pa'i rten byas pa lta bu dag bdag yod pa la pha rol gyis ma byin pa phyag dar khrod pa zhe 'am /
translated: For example, when one is robbed by thieves, or when the group of six uses the tirthikas' dwelling, one should not, with the thought that it belongs to oneself, take what is not given by another, such as a rag from the dust heap,

original: nga'i lha gang gis zhes thabs kyis brgyud cing kha rngam du len pa ma byad cig pa'o //
analyzed: nga'i lha gang gis zhes thabs kyis brgyud cing kha rngam du len pa ma byad cig pa'o //
translated: or one's own deity, by means of deceit, and take it for oneself.

original: rkun po la sogs pas khyer te de'i nor bu byas pa bdag gi yin bar ngos zin pa dgug cing slar 'phrog gam zhe na /
analyzed: rkun po la sogs pas khyer te de'i nor bu byas pa bdag gi yin bar ngos zin pa dgug cing slar 'phrog gam zhe na /
translated: If one is robbed by thieves, and they make a jewel of one's own, should one recognize it as one's own and summon it back?

original: bdag gir byas pa mi dbrog ces pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag gir byas pa mi dbrog ces pa yin te /
translated: One should not take back what has been made one's own.

original: bslus pa ni ma gtogs kyi bla shags su bkye zhing slang dgug par ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: bslus pa ni ma gtogs kyi bla shags su bkye zhing slang dgug par ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: Except for deception, one should not summon it back by means of a curse.

original: de yang bdag gi bar 'du shes de ltar gyis shig pa yin gyi bar du shes na rtsa bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang bdag gi bar 'du shes de ltar gyis shig pa yin gyi bar du shes na rtsa bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And one should think, It is mine, but if one knows it is not one's own, it becomes a root downfall.

original: dbrog tu mi rung na ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: dbrog tu mi rung na ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: If it is not possible to take it away, what should be done?🔽It is said, Explain the Dharma and return it.

original: 'di chos bshad de bslang zhes pa lus la sogs pa yin te /🔽bzhams shing chos shong la khug shig pa'o//
analyzed: 'di chos bshad de bslang zhes pa lus la sogs pa yin te / bzhams shing chos shong la khug shig pa'o//
translated: This means, Explain the Dharma and take it back.

original: rin phyed kyis kyang ngo zhes pa ni phyed ri bas kyang slar slus shig pa'o //
analyzed: rin phyed kyis kyang ngo zhes pa ni phyed ri bas kyang slar slus shig pa'o //
translated: It is said, Even for half the price, meaning, Even if you are cheated by half the price, take it back.

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos ni ri bas blu ba'i yang rigs so zhes pa ni /
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos ni ri bas blu ba'i yang rigs so zhes pa ni /
translated: It is said, The alms-bowl and robes are also suitable to be taken back,

original: bzhams shing chos bshad de'ang ma ster na 'di dag brtsom zhing btso ba'i tshegs mi chung la spus mkho ba'i phyir ri bas kyang slus @50a * //
analyzed: bzhams shing chos bshad de'ang ma ster na 'di dag brtsom zhing btso ba'i tshegs mi chung la spus mkho ba'i phyir ri bas kyang slus @50a * //
translated: meaning, If you do not give it back even though you have explained the Dharma, since it is not easy to make and the wool is necessary, take it back even if you are cheated by half the price.

original: shig pa'o // ma glas par 'gyur ba bor ba'o zhes te skye bo phal po che'i mngon sum ma yin par mi bkur zhes pa ni /
analyzed: shig pa'o // ma glas par 'gyur ba bor ba'o zhes te skye bo phal po che'i mngon sum ma yin par mi bkur zhes pa ni /
translated: It is said, What is not sold should be abandoned, meaning, What is not sold should be abandoned, meaning, What is not sold should be abandoned, meaning, What is not sold should be abandoned, meaning, What is not sold should be abandoned, meaning, What is not sold should be abandoned, meaning, What is not sold should be abandoned, meaning, What is not sold should be abandoned, meaning, What is not sold should be abandoned, meaning, What is not sold should be abandoned, meaning, What is not sold should be abandoned, meaning, What is not sold should be abandoned, meaning, What is not sold should be abandoned, meaning, What is not sold should be abandoned, meaning, What is not sold should be abandoned, meaning, What is not sold should be abandoned, meaning, What is not sold should be abandoned, meaning, What is not sold should be abandoned, meaning, What is not sold should be abandoned, meaning, What is not sold should be abandoned, meaning, What is not sold should be abandoned, meaning, What is not sold should be abandoned, meaning, What is not sold should be abandoned, meaning, What is not sold should be abandoned, meaning, What is not sold should be abandoned, meaning, What is not sold should be abandoned, meaning, What is not sold should be abandoned, meaning, What is not sold should be abandoned, meaning, What is not sold should be abandoned, meaning, What is not sold should be abandoned, meaning,

original: drug sdes phag ro'i mgo sug blangs pa lta bu 'di dag gis brkus shing khyer gor ma chag go zhes pa'i snol ngan par 'gyur ba lta bu skye bo phal po che'i mig lam du ma bab pa bor ba'o zhes skam por ma len cig pa'o //
analyzed: drug sdes phag ro'i mgo sug blangs pa lta bu 'di dag gis brkus shing khyer gor ma chag go zhes pa'i snol ngan par 'gyur ba lta bu skye bo phal po che'i mig lam du ma bab pa bor ba'o zhes skam por ma len cig pa'o //
translated: The six disciples said, This is surely stolen and carried off by them, like the head and feet of a pig's corpse. This is a slanderous accusation. Do not take it as if it were a matter of no concern, saying, It is lost.

original: mi ma yin yod pa'i re rdzas bdag po nyid de ma yin pa snyam du re ba bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mi ma yin yod pa'i re rdzas bdag po nyid de ma yin pa snyam du re ba bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to dispel the hope that the substance of a corpse in a place where non-humans exist is ownerless,

original: mi ma yin yod pa'i ro'i rdzas ni bdag po med pa ma yin zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: mi ma yin yod pa'i ro'i rdzas ni bdag po med pa ma yin zhes pa yin te /
translated: it is said, The substance of a corpse in a place where non-humans exist is not ownerless.

original: gdon zhugs pa'i ro'i rdzas gdon de nyid dbang bas na bdag po med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gdon zhugs pa'i ro'i rdzas gdon de nyid dbang bas na bdag po med pa ma yin no //
translated: The substance of a corpse in which a spirit has entered is not ownerless because it is under the power of that spirit.

original: de lta bu'i rdzas khyer na slar dur khrod de nyid du bskyal dgos pa'i thabs ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rdzas khyer na slar dur khrod de nyid du bskyal dgos pa'i thabs ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: If one carries off such a substance, what method should one use to avoid having to return it to that very charnel ground?

original: mi bgrungs pa'i phyi bzhin du 'gro bar bya zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: mi bgrungs pa'i phyi bzhin du 'gro bar bya zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: One should go after the one who is not virtuous, and so forth.

original: de kyal ka byed srid pas na rim gro 'di ltar gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: de kyal ka byed srid pas na rim gro 'di ltar gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Since that is a possible joke, do this service.

original: khas bub du nyal ba rkang pa nas gyen du g-yog ces pa ni dur khrod du phyin na rdzas nyid phyir spyin pa dang / de'i 'tshe bas mi tshugs pa'i rim gro 'di ltar gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: khas bub du nyal ba rkang pa nas gyen du g-yog ces pa ni dur khrod du phyin na rdzas nyid phyir spyin pa dang / de'i 'tshe bas mi tshugs pa'i rim gro 'di ltar gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Lying with one's face down, one should cover oneself from the feet upward means that when one goes to the charnel ground, one should give away one's own body, and one should perform this rite to protect oneself from the harm of that.

original: gdon de yang btsan med pa'i ro la 'jug pas na ma smas pa las mi blang zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: gdon de yang btsan med pa'i ro la 'jug pas na ma smas pa las mi blang zhes pa yin te /
translated: Since that spirit enters a corpse that is not possessed, one should not take from that which is not damaged means that one should not take from a corpse that is not possessed.

original: rma btsan med pa'i ro las ma len cig pa'o //
analyzed: rma btsan med pa'i ro las ma len cig pa'o //
translated: One should not take from a corpse that is not possessed by a btsan spirit.

original: de bas na btsan 'phral la gdod dam zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na btsan 'phral la gdod dam zhe na /
translated: Then, is it the btsan spirit that possesses first?

original: bdag gis gdod pa 'am gdod du gzhug pa ma yin zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag gis gdod pa 'am gdod du gzhug pa ma yin zhes pa yin te /
translated: I do not possess first, nor do I cause to possess first means that one should not possess first, nor should one cause another to possess first.🔽One should not take from a corpse that is not possessed by a btsan spirit.🔽Then, is it the btsan spirit that possesses first?

original: bdag gis gdod pa 'am pha rol gdod du 'ang ma gzhug ces pa'o //🔽so shid la sogs pa ma byin na spyad du ye mi rung ba dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir //
analyzed: bdag gis gdod pa 'am pha rol gdod du 'ang ma gzhug ces pa'o // so shid la sogs pa ma byin na spyad du ye mi rung ba dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir //
translated: I do not possess first, nor do I cause to possess first means that one should not possess first, nor should one cause another to possess first.

original: ngal bsos pa nyid so shing dang chu dang go 'dun dang lci ba dang sa rnams ji bder byas pa'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: ngal bsos pa nyid so shing dang chu dang go 'dun dang lci ba dang sa rnams ji bder byas pa'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: In order to dispel the doubt that it is never suitable to use a tooth stick, etc. without giving it, it is said, One should rest, and then use the tooth stick, water, mouthwash, ghee, and earth as one pleases.

original: dge slong gis gnas su phog cing brang btab pa de'i rdzas ming gis smos pa 'di rnams ci bder spyod du bcug pa nyid du gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis gnas su phog cing brang btab pa de'i rdzas ming gis smos pa 'di rnams ci bder spyod du bcug pa nyid du gyur ro //
translated: The property of the monk who was struck and killed in the monastery was said to be his by name. He was allowed to use it as he liked.

original: dge slong la sogs pa gnyen gyis 'phrog pa ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong la sogs pa gnyen gyis 'phrog pa ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: How should one take the property of a monk, etc. who was killed by relatives?

original: dge slong ngam dge tshul ma dad par 'brel pas 'phrog na mi sbyin zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: dge slong ngam dge tshul ma dad par 'brel pas 'phrog na mi sbyin zhes pa yin te /
translated: If a monk or novice monk is killed by a relative who is not faithful, it is said that it should not be given.

original: dge slong mas dge tshul kho na nyid kyi phyir 'gro bar ma dad na gnyen 'phrog pa lam skris shig pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong mas dge tshul kho na nyid kyi phyir 'gro bar ma dad na gnyen 'phrog pa lam skris shig pa'o //
translated: If a nun is not faithful to a novice monk, she should be robbed by relatives.

original: ma byin par len pa'i phas @50b pham pa phran tshegs su gtogs pa'o /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa'i phas @50b pham pa phran tshegs su gtogs pa'o /
translated: This is a minor offense that is included in the defeat of taking what is not given.

original: // / zhus pa las byung ba ston pa ni /
analyzed: // / zhus pa las byung ba ston pa ni /
translated: The explanation of what arises from the questions:

original: ka ka ni bzhi la ma sha ka'o zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: ka ka ni bzhi la ma sha ka'o zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Four kakanis are one mashaka, and so on.

original: 'gro na bu nyi shu la ka ka ni gcig / ka ka ni bzhi la ma sha ka gcig tu brtsi'o //
analyzed: 'gro na bu nyi shu la ka ka ni gcig / ka ka ni bzhi la ma sha ka gcig tu brtsi'o //
translated: When going, twenty sons are one kakani. Four kakanis are considered one mashaka.

original: ma sha ka ni de lta bu yin na de lngas pham zhes smos pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ma sha ka ni de lta bu yin na de lngas pham zhes smos pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If a mashaka is like that, why is it said that five of them are a defeat?

original: lnga ni dper zad kyi k'ar sh'a pa na'i bzhi cha'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: lnga ni dper zad kyi k'ar sh'a pa na'i bzhi cha'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: Five is merely an example, but it is one quarter of a karshapana.

original: ma sha ka lnga zhes smos pa ni gleng ba'i gzhi tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: ma sha ka lnga zhes smos pa ni gleng ba'i gzhi tsam du zad kyi /
translated: The statement five māsakas is merely a basis for discussion.

original: de dngos su ni k'ar sh'a pa na bzhi cha gcig bzung ngo //
analyzed: de dngos su ni k'ar sh'a pa na bzhi cha gcig bzung ngo //
translated: In fact, one quarter of a karshapana is taken as one māsaka.

original: k'ar sh'a pa n'a bzhi cha gcig bzung zhes pa yang yul dang dus kyi bye brag gis na re 'ga' ni ma sha ka bcu gnyis ri /
analyzed: k'ar sh'a pa n'a bzhi cha gcig bzung zhes pa yang yul dang dus kyi bye brag gis na re 'ga' ni ma sha ka bcu gnyis ri /
translated: One quarter of a karshapana is taken as one māsaka, but due to differences of place and time, in some places twelve māsakas are worth one kārṣāpaṇa,

original: ched 'ga' ni bcu drug ri /
analyzed: ched 'ga' ni bcu drug ri /
translated: in some places sixteen,

original: ched 'ga' ni sum cu rtsa gnyis ri /🔽ched 'ga' ni bzhi bcu ri ba la sogs pa rin thang gcig tu bcad pa med na /
analyzed: ched 'ga' ni sum cu rtsa gnyis ri / ched 'ga' ni bzhi bcu ri ba la sogs pa rin thang gcig tu bcad pa med na /
translated: in some places thirty-two,🔽in some places forty and so on.

original: k'ar sh'a pa na bzhi cha gcig bzung bas ma sha ka ldar gyur pa yul dang dus gang la brten te de ltar dper bstan zhe na /
analyzed: k'ar sh'a pa na bzhi cha gcig bzung bas ma sha ka ldar gyur pa yul dang dus gang la brten te de ltar dper bstan zhe na /
translated: If the value is not fixed, then how is it that one quarter of a karshapana is taken as one māsaka?

original: 'di gang na nyi shu'i thang de la brten pas so zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di gang na nyi shu'i thang de la brten pas so zhes pa yin te /
translated: This is based on the twentieth part of a karshapana.

original: dge slong nor can gyis rgyal po'i khab nas shing brkus pa'i tshe /
analyzed: dge slong nor can gyis rgyal po'i khab nas shing brkus pa'i tshe /
translated: When the monk Dhanika stole wood from Rājagṛha,

original: ma sha ka nyi shus k'ar sh'a pa na gcig rnyed pas na /
analyzed: ma sha ka nyi shus k'ar sh'a pa na gcig rnyed pas na /
translated: Since twenty māṣas are equal to one kārṣāpaṇa,

original: de'i bzhi cha gcig bzung bas ma sha ka ldar gyur pa de la brten par zad do //
analyzed: de'i bzhi cha gcig bzung bas ma sha ka ldar gyur pa de la brten par zad do //
translated: one quarter of that is four māṣas.

original: de ltar dus dang yul gyi bye brag gis k'ar sh'a pa na khyad par du mi mthun pa ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar dus dang yul gyi bye brag gis k'ar sh'a pa na khyad par du mi mthun pa ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: If one takes that as the basis, then how should one understand the difference in the value of a kārṣāpaṇa according to time and place?

original: 'di rku ba'i dus dang gnas su brtsi zhing gtan la dbab ces pa yin te /🔽yul dang dus gang na ma sha ka bcu gnyis kyis k'ar sh'a pan gcig rnyed pa'i tshe ni ma sha ka gsum gyis kyang pham par brtsi /
analyzed: 'di rku ba'i dus dang gnas su brtsi zhing gtan la dbab ces pa yin te / yul dang dus gang na ma sha ka bcu gnyis kyis k'ar sh'a pan gcig rnyed pa'i tshe ni ma sha ka gsum gyis kyang pham par brtsi /
translated: This is to be determined according to the time and place of the theft.🔽When twelve māṣas are equal to one kārṣāpaṇa, then three māṣas are to be considered a pārājika.

original: yul dang dus gang na ma sha ka bzhi bcus k'ar sh'a pa na gcig rnyed pa'i tshe ni ma sha ka bcus pham par 'gyur ba la sogs pa nam gang du brkus pa'i dus dang gnas de'i rin thang gis brtsi zhing gtan la phob shig pa'o //
analyzed: yul dang dus gang na ma sha ka bzhi bcus k'ar sh'a pa na gcig rnyed pa'i tshe ni ma sha ka bcus pham par 'gyur ba la sogs pa nam gang du brkus pa'i dus dang gnas de'i rin thang gis brtsi zhing gtan la phob shig pa'o //
translated: When forty māṣas are equal to one kārṣāpaṇa, then ten māṣas are to be considered a pārājika.

original: ma sha ka lda la sogs pa'i rin thang gis pham mo zhes 'byung ba rin po che kha cig rin thang gzhal du med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma sha ka lda la sogs pa'i rin thang gis pham mo zhes 'byung ba rin po che kha cig rin thang gzhal du med pa'i phyir /
translated: Some say: The value of a maśaka of salt and so on is not the value of a pam.

original: brkus kyang mi pham du re ba'i dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: brkus kyang mi pham du re ba'i dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: To dispel the doubt that one may think, “I will not be defeated even if I steal precious substances because their value cannot be calculated,”

original: ci ste rin thang bcad mi nus pa'i ni mchog gi mthar gyur pa'o zhes pa yin te /🔽ma sha @51a * //
analyzed: ci ste rin thang bcad mi nus pa'i ni mchog gi mthar gyur pa'o zhes pa yin te / ma sha @51a * //
translated: the root text states, “The highest value is not the value of a pam.”

original: ka lnga ri bas kyang pham na nor rin po che lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: ka lnga ri bas kyang pham na nor rin po che lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: If five maśakas of salt are the value of a pam, then what need is there to mention precious substances?

original: ma sha ka lnga las lhag pa'i nang du bsdu bar zad do //
analyzed: ma sha ka lnga las lhag pa'i nang du bsdu bar zad do //
translated: They are included within the five maśakas of salt.

original: ha cang chung ste rin thang med pa brkus pa lta bu chung ba'i phyir rin thang med pas brkus kyang nyes med du re ba bstsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ha cang chung ste rin thang med pa brkus pa lta bu chung ba'i phyir rin thang med pas brkus kyang nyes med du re ba bstsal ba'i phyir /
translated: To dispel the doubt that one may think, “I will not be defeated even if I steal something of very little value because its value cannot be calculated,”🔽the root text states, “The lowest value is not the value of a pam.”

original: 'di chung ba ni ma tshang bar mi gtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di chung ba ni ma tshang bar mi gtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: The lowest value is not included in the incomplete.

original: rtsva mchog la sogs pa rin thang chung du brkus pa'ang ma tshang ba'i nang du gtogs par zad pas na sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rtsva mchog la sogs pa rin thang chung du brkus pa'ang ma tshang ba'i nang du gtogs par zad pas na sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Even stealing grass and so on of little value is included in the category of incomplete, and so it is a serious offense.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ring bsrel nyo tshong mi byed pa lta bu brkus pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ring bsrel nyo tshong mi byed pa lta bu brkus pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What if one steals a Buddha’s relics, which are not for sale?

original: sangs rgyas kyi ring bsrel ni 'dir gzhal du med pa'i rin po che'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ring bsrel ni 'dir gzhal du med pa'i rin po che'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: “Buddha’s relics are priceless jewels here” means

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi ring bsrel brkus pa ni gzhal du med pa'i rin po che brkus pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi ring bsrel brkus pa ni gzhal du med pa'i rin po che brkus pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: that stealing a Blessed One’s relics is like stealing priceless jewels.

original: de brkus so cog pham par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de brkus so cog pham par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one steals any of them, is it a defeating offense?

original: mchod pa'i phyir na nyes byas zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: mchod pa'i phyir na nyes byas zhes pa yin te /
translated: “If it is for worship, it is a minor offense” means

original: mchod pa bya ba'i phyir rku ba ni nyes byas su zad do //
analyzed: mchod pa bya ba'i phyir rku ba ni nyes byas su zad do //
translated: that stealing for the purpose of worship is only a minor offense.

original: rku sems yod kyang dpe blangs pa la nyes pa med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rku sems yod kyang dpe blangs pa la nyes pa med par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that even though one has a mind to steal, there is no offense if one takes a model is

original: bris pa ni nyes med ces pa yin te /
analyzed: bris pa ni nyes med ces pa yin te /
translated: “A drawing is not an offense.”

original: dar ma brkus te dpe bris pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dar ma brkus te dpe bris pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense in stealing silk and drawing a model.

original: rna cha dang gdu bu la sogs pa nyams par byas te brkus pa ji tsam gyis pham par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rna cha dang gdu bu la sogs pa nyams par byas te brkus pa ji tsam gyis pham par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one steals earrings, bracelets, and so on, what is the extent of the defeat?

original: nyams pas rku ba ni de'i tshe rku ba'i dngos po'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: nyams pas rku ba ni de'i tshe rku ba'i dngos po'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: Stealing that which is damaged means that at the time of stealing, the object is damaged.

original: nyams par byas nas rku na nam nyams par byas pa de'i tshe pham mo //🔽gling gzhan gyi nor la bdag po yod pa bzhin du byang gi sgra mi snyan la 'ang bdag po yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: nyams par byas nas rku na nam nyams par byas pa de'i tshe pham mo // gling gzhan gyi nor la bdag po yod pa bzhin du byang gi sgra mi snyan la 'ang bdag po yod dam zhe na /
translated: If one steals after damaging it, then at the time of damaging it, there is a defeat.🔽Just as wealth in other continents belongs to an owner, does wealth in Kuru in the north also belong to an owner?

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi ni bdag bo med pa'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi ni bdag bo med pa'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: Wealth in Kuru in the north has no owner.

original: bdag gi 'o zhes par sems pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gi 'o zhes par sems pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no thought of mine.

original: de'i rdzas brkus pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rdzas brkus pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens if one steals its wealth?

original: 'di ni bdag gi bzhin no zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi bzhin no zhes pa yin te /
translated: It is said, “It is as if it were mine.”

original: bdag gi nor brkus na sbom por 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag gi nor brkus na sbom por 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: If one steals the wealth of another, it is a serious violation.

original: zhus pa las dngos por gtogs pa dang / bdag por gtogs pa dang / byed par gtogs pa dang / zin par gtogs pa bzhin 'byung ba las de yan chad du dngos por gtogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: zhus pa las dngos por gtogs pa dang / bdag por gtogs pa dang / byed par gtogs pa dang / zin par gtogs pa bzhin 'byung ba las de yan chad du dngos por gtogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The explanation of what is included in things and what is included in the master, what is included in action and what is included in what is grasped, is as follows.

original: // / bdag por gtogs pa dang ston pa ni /
analyzed: // / bdag por gtogs pa dang ston pa ni /
translated: What is included in the master and the teacher is🔽as follows.

original: de'i tshe kho na nyid ston pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa @51b yin te /🔽gser bdag sprul du gyur cing srung ba lta bu la sogs pa rku ba'i tshe mi 'am /
analyzed: de'i tshe kho na nyid ston pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa @51b yin te / gser bdag sprul du gyur cing srung ba lta bu la sogs pa rku ba'i tshe mi 'am /
translated: At that time, the teacher of reality and so on.

original: byol song bdag po gang yin ba'i nyid dang sbyor cig pa'o //
analyzed: byol song bdag po gang yin ba'i nyid dang sbyor cig pa'o //
translated: When stealing, one should be like a master of gold, a master of cattle and so on, who is the master of humans and animals.

original: bcom ldan 'das mi yin pa las mya ngan las 'das par gyur pa'i dkor brkus pa yang mi'i nor brkus pa dang 'dra bar dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir 'das pa ni lha bzhin zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mi yin pa las mya ngan las 'das par gyur pa'i dkor brkus pa yang mi'i nor brkus pa dang 'dra bar dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir 'das pa ni lha bzhin zhes pa yin te /
translated: In order to dispel the doubt that the Blessed One, who became a buddha and attained nirvana, is like a human who steals wealth, it is said that the transcendent one is like a god.

original: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa dang / rang rgyal ba dang / nyan thos mya ngan las 'das pa rnams kyi dkor brkus pa ni lha'i nor brkus pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa dang / rang rgyal ba dang / nyan thos mya ngan las 'das pa rnams kyi dkor brkus pa ni lha'i nor brkus pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: The Blessed One said that stealing the wealth of those who have attained nirvana—whether a Buddha, a Solitary Sage, or a Disciple—is like stealing the wealth of the gods.

original: da ni byed par gtogs pa ston te /
analyzed: da ni byed par gtogs pa ston te /
translated: Now the text teaches what is involved in the act.

original: ster ba ye byin par spyod pa sbyor ba bzhin zhes pa ni nga'i nor rdzas la ci bder spyod cig ces byas pa dang / rku sems kyis gtan du dbang ba bzhin du spyod na sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ster ba ye byin par spyod pa sbyor ba bzhin zhes pa ni nga'i nor rdzas la ci bder spyod cig ces byas pa dang / rku sems kyis gtan du dbang ba bzhin du spyod na sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Like using what was given to you to give to others” means that if you use the wealth of another person, thinking “I will use this as I wish,” or if you use it as if it were your own forever with a thieving attitude, you commit a serious violation.

original: sngags dang sman dag gis spyin du bcug pa yang ngo zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sngags dang sman dag gis spyin du bcug pa yang ngo zhes pa ni /
translated: “Also if you cause someone to give through spells and medicine.”

original: sngags dang sman gyis pha rol gyi sems bsgyur te bdag la nor 'bul du bcug na yang sbom por 'gyur ba'o //🔽pha rol gyi phyir ni rtsa ba bzhin zhes pa ni bdag gi phyir ma yin gyi gzhan gyi phyir rku 'am /
analyzed: sngags dang sman gyis pha rol gyi sems bsgyur te bdag la nor 'bul du bcug na yang sbom por 'gyur ba'o // pha rol gyi phyir ni rtsa ba bzhin zhes pa ni bdag gi phyir ma yin gyi gzhan gyi phyir rku 'am /
translated: If you cause someone to give you their wealth by using spells and medicine to influence their mind, you commit a serious violation.

original: rkur bcug na rtsa ba dang 'dra ba'i sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rkur bcug na rtsa ba dang 'dra ba'i sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “For the sake of others, like the root.” If you steal for the sake of others, or cause someone else to steal for the sake of others, you commit a serious violation, like the root.

original: brgyud pa yang ngo zhes pa ni bdag gi yin nam /
analyzed: brgyud pa yang ngo zhes pa ni bdag gi yin nam /
translated: Also lineage means: is it mine?

original: bdag po med par ma nges pa las bdag gi yin pa 'am bdag po med do 'am byin no bar bsams te /
analyzed: bdag po med par ma nges pa las bdag gi yin pa 'am bdag po med do 'am byin no bar bsams te /
translated: Or is it not ascertained to be without an owner? Thinking it is mine, or it is without an owner, or it has been given,

original: khyer ba lta bu sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: khyer ba lta bu sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: is a serious offense.

original: bsdams te 'thad pa rku bar 'dod pa yang ngo zhes pa ni 'di ltar byed cing rkun 'dam pa'i tshe sbom pa'o //
