translated: Therefore, in the Questions of Upāli, it is asked: Venerable One, how many types of stealing are there? and it is replied: Upāli, there are six.

original: mthus rku ba dang / sgyus rku ba dang / gtams pa rku ba dang / phyir sbyin ba rku ba dang / mi ster te rku ba dang / chos rku ba rnams so //
analyzed: mthus rku ba dang / sgyus rku ba dang / gtams pa rku ba dang / phyir sbyin ba rku ba dang / mi ster te rku ba dang / chos rku ba rnams so //
translated: Stealing through force, stealing through deception, stealing through trickery, stealing through fraud, stealing through theft, and stealing through Dharma.

original: btsun ba de dag las gang gis mthar 'gyur zhes pa dang / au p'a li chos rku ba ma gtogs pa'i gzhan thams cad kyis mthar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: btsun ba de dag las gang gis mthar 'gyur zhes pa dang / au p'a li chos rku ba ma gtogs pa'i gzhan thams cad kyis mthar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: When asked, Venerable, through which of these does one become an outcast? he said, All except for stealing through Dharma.

original: gnas dang bcas pa'ang ma yin zhes pa ni gzhi 'am gnas dang bcas te khyer na 'ang ma brkus pa ma yin par ston pa'o //
analyzed: gnas dang bcas pa'ang ma yin zhes pa ni gzhi 'am gnas dang bcas te khyer na 'ang ma brkus pa ma yin par ston pa'o //
translated: Nor with a basis shows that if one takes it with a basis or foundation, it is not stealing.

original: bsad pa brkus pa ma yin zhes pa phyugs lta bu bsad nas rku bar bsams na bsad pa'i tshe rtsa ba'i sbyor bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: bsad pa brkus pa ma yin zhes pa phyugs lta bu bsad nas rku bar bsams na bsad pa'i tshe rtsa ba'i sbyor bar ston pa'o //
translated: Stealing through killing is when one thinks, I will kill and steal, and at the time of killing, it shows the basic preparation.

original: phyogs gcig ni gnas nas 'phags pa ma yin zhes pa ni do shal lta bu la sogs pa rku na kun blangs pa ni ma yin kyi phyed tsam bteg pa lta bus pham par mi 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig ni gnas nas 'phags pa ma yin zhes pa ni do shal lta bu la sogs pa rku na kun blangs pa ni ma yin kyi phyed tsam bteg pa lta bus pham par mi 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
translated: One part is not rising from the place which means that if one steals a necklace, etc., one is not defeated by taking half of it, as if one were taking all of it.

original: sprug cing klog na brkus pa'o zhes pa na shing tog lta bu la sogs pa sprugs te /
analyzed: sprug cing klog na brkus pa'o zhes pa na shing tog lta bu la sogs pa sprugs te /
translated: If one steals by shaking and reading, it is stolen, which means that if one steals fruit, etc., by shaking it,

original: rku bar byas na lhags pas pham par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rku bar byas na lhags pas pham par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: one is defeated by what falls.

original: phug nas 'dzag cing 'brul ba ni 'ongs na'o zhes pa ni nas sam 'bru mar lta bu la sogs pa snod phug nas 'dzag pa dang / 'brul ba'i thabs kyis rku ba ni nam 'brul zhing zag na brkus par ston pa'o //
analyzed: phug nas 'dzag cing 'brul ba ni 'ongs na'o zhes pa ni nas sam 'bru mar lta bu la sogs pa snod phug nas 'dzag pa dang / 'brul ba'i thabs kyis rku ba ni nam 'brul zhing zag na brkus par ston pa'o //
translated: If it oozes and leaks from a hole, it is stolen when it comes out, which means that if one steals grain, oil, etc., by the method of oozing and leaking from a hole in the container, it is taught that it is stolen when it oozes and leaks.

original: 'dzag cing 'brul ba de thigs re 'bru rer bcad cing brtsi 'am rgyun gcig tu bcad ce na /
analyzed: 'dzag cing 'brul ba de thigs re 'bru rer bcad cing brtsi 'am rgyun gcig tu bcad ce na /
translated: If that which oozes and leaks is cut into drops and grains and counted, or is it cut into a single stream?

original: de ni 'dir mjug gi bar du rdzas gcig go zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'dir mjug gi bar du rdzas gcig go zhes pa yin te /
translated: Here it is said to be a single substance until the end.

original: de ltar 'dzag cing 'brul ba nam btang ba 'am bcad pa'i tshigs gcig gis bzung ste rin thang tshang ngam ma tshang ba las dbye zhing bcad pa'o //🔽phung po las nam bcus pa lan re brkus pa re'o zhes pa ni phung po las 'chu zhing rku na sbyor pa tha dad pa'i phyir bcus pa lan re zhing brkus pa lan rer 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'dzag cing 'brul ba nam btang ba 'am bcad pa'i tshigs gcig gis bzung ste rin thang tshang ngam ma tshang ba las dbye zhing bcad pa'o // phung po las nam bcus pa lan re brkus pa re'o zhes pa ni phung po las 'chu zhing rku na sbyor pa tha dad pa'i phyir bcus pa lan re zhing brkus pa lan rer 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Thus, if one steals or misappropriates a single part of the Sangha's property, whether it is given or not, it is to be determined whether the value is complete or not, and one is to be expelled.🔽If one steals from the Sangha's property, then for each time one steals, it is a separate preparation, so for each time one steals, it is a separate preparation.

original: du ma'i stor ba de dag so so'i shas so zhes pa ni bdag po du ma'i nor cig @54a * //
analyzed: du ma'i stor ba de dag so so'i shas so zhes pa ni bdag po du ma'i nor cig @54a * //
translated: If many people have lost their property, then it is a part of each individual's property.

original: car du brkus na bdag po de dag so so'i nor re re zhing rin thang tshang ngam ma tshang ba brtsi'i thams cad kyi nor gcig tu bsdus te phyir rin thang tshang ngam ma tshang ba dang / rku ba rnams kyang ngo zhes pa ni rku ba yang mang po zhig na bgo skal gyi shas rin thang tshang ngam ma tshang ba dang sbyor cig pa'o //
analyzed: car du brkus na bdag po de dag so so'i nor re re zhing rin thang tshang ngam ma tshang ba brtsi'i thams cad kyi nor gcig tu bsdus te phyir rin thang tshang ngam ma tshang ba dang / rku ba rnams kyang ngo zhes pa ni rku ba yang mang po zhig na bgo skal gyi shas rin thang tshang ngam ma tshang ba dang sbyor cig pa'o //
translated: The thieves are also said to be one in the sense that they are many thieves who are connected to the value of their share, whether it is complete or not.

original: blo mi gcig pa 'dir brkus pa thob pa'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: blo mi gcig pa 'dir brkus pa thob pa'o zhes pa ni /
translated: The thought I obtained this by stealing is not the same as the thought of the others.

original: rdzas gcig la rkun po du ma 'doms pa de dag dang po nas bgros pa med na so sos ci thob pa'i rin thang la pham mam mi pham pa dang sbyor cig pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas gcig la rkun po du ma 'doms pa de dag dang po nas bgros pa med na so sos ci thob pa'i rin thang la pham mam mi pham pa dang sbyor cig pa'o //
translated: If there are many thieves who steal one substance, if they did not first consult each other, then whether the value of what each obtains is complete or not is applied to whether or not they are defeated.

original: ma byin par len pa'i phas pham pa zhus par gtogs pa'o /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa'i phas pham pa zhus par gtogs pa'o /
translated: This concludes the questions on the defeating offense of taking what is not given.

original: // / dngos po dang bdag po dang / sgrub pa dang / zin par gtogs pa zhus pa las 'byung ba rnams de ltar bstan nas /
analyzed: // / dngos po dang bdag po dang / sgrub pa dang / zin par gtogs pa zhus pa las 'byung ba rnams de ltar bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the questions on substance, owner, means, and possession, now, the questions on the basis are explained.

original: bye brag tu nges pa las 'byung ba da ston pa ni /
analyzed: bye brag tu nges pa las 'byung ba da ston pa ni /
translated: The following is taught from the chapter on ascertainment of individual matters.

original: blangs pa'i snga rol du shi ba ni slar gtad ces pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: blangs pa'i snga rol du shi ba ni slar gtad ces pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: One who dies before taking the robe is as follows.

original: 'god pa'i tshes grangs su bcug ste rnyed pa mnos pa las khyer te 'ongs pa 'am /
analyzed: 'god pa'i tshes grangs su bcug ste rnyed pa mnos pa las khyer te 'ongs pa 'am /
translated: One who has taken the robe but not entered the number of monks, and who dies on the way to the place of ordination, or

original: spar spar du 'god pa tsam na grangs su bcug pa'i dge slong bar ma skabs su shi na shi ba de'i shas skal rnyed pa gang nas 'ongs pa'i gnas su slar skyol cig pa'o //
analyzed: spar spar du 'god pa tsam na grangs su bcug pa'i dge slong bar ma skabs su shi na shi ba de'i shas skal rnyed pa gang nas 'ongs pa'i gnas su slar skyol cig pa'o //
translated: one who dies while merely being placed in the row of those who are being ordained, that monk’s share of the robe is to be returned to the place from which it came.

original: bzlog pa ni shi ba'i yo byad do zhes pa rnyed pa lag tu byin nas /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni shi ba'i yo byad do zhes pa rnyed pa lag tu byin nas /
translated: The opposite is the deceased’s property.

original: shi na shi ba de nyid kyi yo byad du gtogs pas dge 'dun gyis bgos shig pa'o //
analyzed: shi na shi ba de nyid kyi yo byad du gtogs pas dge 'dun gyis bgos shig pa'o //
translated: If he dies after the robe is given into his hand, it belongs to the deceased himself, and the Saṅgha should divide it.🔽The Saṅgha is like a brother, therefore it is not the case that the stolen property is not to be taken as one’s own.

original: dge 'dun ni spun bzhin pas na de'i phyir brkus pa bdag gir ma byas pa ma yin zhes pa ni spun gyi nor ma bgos pa'i spyi'i yin te /
analyzed: dge 'dun ni spun bzhin pas na de'i phyir brkus pa bdag gir ma byas pa ma yin zhes pa ni spun gyi nor ma bgos pa'i spyi'i yin te /
translated: This is the general rule for the property of a brother that is not divided.

original: so sor dbang pa'i 'du shes yod pa bzhin du spyi'i phyir brkus pa bdag kyang de'i nang du gtogs pas na bgo skal du gses pa'i shas dang mi sbyar gyi /
analyzed: so sor dbang pa'i 'du shes yod pa bzhin du spyi'i phyir brkus pa bdag kyang de'i nang du gtogs pas na bgo skal du gses pa'i shas dang mi sbyar gyi /
translated: Just as there is a perception of individual ownership, since the thief belongs to the general category of ownership, it is not like a portion of a shared inheritance.

original: spyi khong 'thul bas na gzhan gyi phyir brkus pa lta bu la sogs yin te bdag gir byas pa'o //
analyzed: spyi khong 'thul bas na gzhan gyi phyir brkus pa lta bu la sogs yin te bdag gir byas pa'o //
translated: Since the general category is violated, it is like stealing for the sake of others.🔽If there is no difference in ownership, it is like stealing one's own property.

original: bdag po tha mi dad na bdag gi bzhin zhes pa ni yon bdag gis gnas khang gcig gi tshang sgyur bsngos pa'i rdzas dge slong gis gnas khang gud du brkus shing spar na spyir bdag po @54b tha mi dad pa'i phyir bdag gi nor brkus pa bzhin no🔽// byol lam mi blang bar des na lhag mas brkus pa ni yan lag de ma yin zhes pa ni dge slong rkun pos dbang med pa las byol lam /
analyzed: bdag po tha mi dad na bdag gi bzhin zhes pa ni yon bdag gis gnas khang gcig gi tshang sgyur bsngos pa'i rdzas dge slong gis gnas khang gud du brkus shing spar na spyir bdag po @54b tha mi dad pa'i phyir bdag gi nor brkus pa bzhin no // byol lam mi blang bar des na lhag mas brkus pa ni yan lag de ma yin zhes pa ni dge slong rkun pos dbang med pa las byol lam /
translated: This is when a patron has dedicated the property of a single house to a monastery, and a monk steals and moves the property to another house. In general, since there is no difference in ownership, it is like stealing one's own property.🔽If one does not take it by force or stealth, then stealing the remainder is not that branch.

original: rkun po mi bya yang dag par bsams na rkun po gzhan gyis brkus pa'i khri na de la mi 'khri ba'o //
analyzed: rkun po mi bya yang dag par bsams na rkun po gzhan gyis brkus pa'i khri na de la mi 'khri ba'o //
translated: This is when a monk thief does not take by force or stealth, but when he thinks, “I will not steal,” he does not take what was stolen by another thief.

original: skal ba bdag gir bya bar 'dod na mi blang bar bsams pa ma yin zhes pa ni dge slong rkun po dang 'grogs te dong bas bdag gis rkun po ni mi bya /
analyzed: skal ba bdag gir bya bar 'dod na mi blang bar bsams pa ma yin zhes pa ni dge slong rkun po dang 'grogs te dong bas bdag gis rkun po ni mi bya /
translated: This means that if one thinks, “I will not be a thief,

original: shas skal khong gis byin pa ni blang bar bsams na rkun por mi 'gyur ba ma yin pa'o//
analyzed: shas skal khong gis byin pa ni blang bar bsams na rkun por mi 'gyur ba ma yin pa'o//
translated: but I will take what he gives me as my share,” then one does not avoid being a thief.🔽If one performs the action that belongs to that, it is not that it does not belong to it.

original: der gtogs pa'i las byas na de'i ma yin pa ma yin zhes pa ni lam bsrung ngam bya ra byed pa la sogs pa rkun po de dag gi stongs mo byas na ma brkus pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: der gtogs pa'i las byas na de'i ma yin pa ma yin zhes pa ni lam bsrung ngam bya ra byed pa la sogs pa rkun po de dag gi stongs mo byas na ma brkus pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: This means that if one helps the thieves by guarding the path or by being a lookout, then one does not avoid stealing.🔽It is not that one’s companion or attendant does not become a thief.

original: lhan cig spyod pa dang nye gnas rkun por mi 'gyur ba ma yin zhes pa ni lhan cig spyod pa 'am nye gnas rkun pos khyer te /
analyzed: lhan cig spyod pa dang nye gnas rkun por mi 'gyur ba ma yin zhes pa ni lhan cig spyod pa 'am nye gnas rkun pos khyer te /
translated: This means that if one’s companion or attendant is carried off by thieves,

original: kha phyin cing dbang du byas pa las slar brkus shing khyer na rkun por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: kha phyin cing dbang du byas pa las slar brkus shing khyer na rkun por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and one steals and carries him off again, then one becomes a thief.

original: bskor ba ni mtshams brtsan zhes pa ni khyim sa 'am ra pa'i sal sogs pas bskor zhing rku ba ni thong ris la sogs mtshams tsam gyis bskor na yang rkun por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bskor ba ni mtshams brtsan zhes pa ni khyim sa 'am ra pa'i sal sogs pas bskor zhing rku ba ni thong ris la sogs mtshams tsam gyis bskor na yang rkun por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Encircling means that if one encircles a house or a field with a fence, etc., and steals, it is also a theft even if it is only encircled by a boundary such as a ditch.

original: mtshams su 'dug pa spos na 'dis ma skongs pa yin zhes pa ni 'o bas sam mu tshigs la sogs pa'i mtshams spos shing bsgyur na rkun por mi 'gyur ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams su 'dug pa spos na 'dis ma skongs pa yin zhes pa ni 'o bas sam mu tshigs la sogs pa'i mtshams spos shing bsgyur na rkun por mi 'gyur ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: If one moves the boundary, it is not made up by this, means that if one moves the boundary such as a fence or a wall, it is not that it is not a theft.

original: mngon sum du khyer ba mi snang na brkus pa'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum du khyer ba mi snang na brkus pa'o zhes pa ni /
translated: If one carries it off in the presence of the owner, but it is not seen, it is a theft, means

original: bdag po'i mig lam du brkus shing khyer ba ni mi snang bar ma gyur na rkun por mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: bdag po'i mig lam du brkus shing khyer ba ni mi snang bar ma gyur na rkun por mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: that if one steals and carries off in the presence of the owner's eyes, but it is not seen, it is not a theft.

original: gos 'tshong ba ra ro ba'i rdzas dge slong gis rkur ma zug pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gos 'tshong ba ra ro ba'i rdzas dge slong gis rkur ma zug pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a monk did not steal the goods of a cloth merchant who was drunk.

original: mi ni mthus phrogs pa las dbang du byas na'o zhes pa ni mi'i mthus phrogs pa des dbang du byas te kha phyin na gdod brkus par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mi ni mthus phrogs pa las dbang du byas na'o zhes pa ni mi'i mthus phrogs pa des dbang du byas te kha phyin na gdod brkus par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If a human is overpowered by force, it is done under the control of that, means that if a human is overpowered by force, and if one carries it off under the control of that, then it is a theft.

original: bdag ni de ltar ma yin zhes pa ni bdag nyid rkun po la sogs pa'i lag nas slar bros pa la ni bdag gis bdag brkus pa'i khron du mi 'gyur ba'o //🔽gang rku bar brnab pa de dang ma brnab par 'bral ba ni khyer pa ma yin zhes @55a * //
analyzed: bdag ni de ltar ma yin zhes pa ni bdag nyid rkun po la sogs pa'i lag nas slar bros pa la ni bdag gis bdag brkus pa'i khron du mi 'gyur ba'o // gang rku bar brnab pa de dang ma brnab par 'bral ba ni khyer pa ma yin zhes @55a * //
translated: The phrase I am not like that means that when one escapes from the hands of thieves and so forth, one is not a thief of oneself.

original: pa ni gos rnying ba'i zhar la rin po che ri ba'i gos 'ongs pa lta bu gang rku bar brnab pa de'i rin thang brtsir zad kyi rku bar ma bsams pa'i rdzas zla la 'ongs pa'i rin thang dang mi sbyor ba'o //🔽su gang gis ci thob pa de de'i 'o bar dam bcas pa gzhan gyis brkus pa sbom po'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: pa ni gos rnying ba'i zhar la rin po che ri ba'i gos 'ongs pa lta bu gang rku bar brnab pa de'i rin thang brtsir zad kyi rku bar ma bsams pa'i rdzas zla la 'ongs pa'i rin thang dang mi sbyor ba'o // su gang gis ci thob pa de de'i 'o bar dam bcas pa gzhan gyis brkus pa sbom po'o zhes pa ni /
translated: The phrase that which is not intended to be stolen is not taken means that when one steals something, one is only charged with the value of what one intended to steal, not with the value of something else that one may have gotten by mistake, like a valuable piece of cloth in place of an old piece of cloth.

original: rkun pos lag mdangs thob brtsan par dam pa cas pa gcig gi grogs dge slong gis byas na pha rol gyir brkus pa'i sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rkun pos lag mdangs thob brtsan par dam pa cas pa gcig gi grogs dge slong gis byas na pha rol gyir brkus pa'i sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The phrase whatever is obtained by whomever is his, and if another steals it, it is a serious offense means that if a monk helps a thief who has vowed to steal something, then the monk incurs a serious offense for stealing the other's property.

original: bdag po dang bcas pa'i dur khrod nas khyer ba yang ngo zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bdag po dang bcas pa'i dur khrod nas khyer ba yang ngo zhes pa ni /
translated: Also, taking from a charnel ground that has an owner is a serious transgression.

original: bdag po yod pa'i dur khrod kyi rdzas khyer na yang sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bdag po yod pa'i dur khrod kyi rdzas khyer na yang sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one takes an article from a charnel ground that has an owner, it is a serious transgression.

original: de yang dur khrod 'di nyid dang / dbang po bar bdag pos bdag gir byas pa mkhyen na ni pham gyi gshed po la sogs pa 'di'i rdzas de dbang ba'i rigs so bar yongs su bzung ba las khyer ba ni sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de yang dur khrod 'di nyid dang / dbang po bar bdag pos bdag gir byas pa mkhyen na ni pham gyi gshed po la sogs pa 'di'i rdzas de dbang ba'i rigs so bar yongs su bzung ba las khyer ba ni sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Moreover, if one takes an article from this charnel ground that is owned by a powerful person, it is a defeating offense. If one takes an article from this charnel ground that is owned by a demon, etc., it is a serious transgression.

original: la phug gis dang sdong po dang lo ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu'i ra ba la sogs pa sngags kyis skams na'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: la phug gis dang sdong po dang lo ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu'i ra ba la sogs pa sngags kyis skams na'o zhes pa ni /
translated: If one steals a garden of eggplants, trees, leaves, flowers, fruits, etc., by means of a spell,🔽what is the transgression?

original: 'di dag lta bu sngags kyis skams pa cir 'gyur zhe na cung zad pa'i sbom por ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag lta bu sngags kyis skams pa cir 'gyur zhe na cung zad pa'i sbom por ston pa'o //
translated: It is a slight transgression.

original: rta rkun 'di ltar bya'o zhes chas kyis brdod dam zhen te lus kyis bsgyur na'o zhes pa ni rta chas kyis brid dam zhon nas ngas thabs 'di ltar brku'o zhes mgo kyog pa la sogs pa lus kyis bsgyur ba cir 'gyur zhe na sbom por ston pa'o //
analyzed: rta rkun 'di ltar bya'o zhes chas kyis brdod dam zhen te lus kyis bsgyur na'o zhes pa ni rta chas kyis brid dam zhon nas ngas thabs 'di ltar brku'o zhes mgo kyog pa la sogs pa lus kyis bsgyur ba cir 'gyur zhe na sbom por ston pa'o //
translated: It is a serious offense to act with the body, such as shaking one’s head, and so on, by saying, “I will steal by this method.”

original: gru yang ngo zhes pa ni gru'i steng du 'dzegs nas thabs 'di ltar brku'o zhes lus kyis bsgyur na yang sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gru yang ngo zhes pa ni gru'i steng du 'dzegs nas thabs 'di ltar brku'o zhes lus kyis bsgyur na yang sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Also, a boat is like that. If one acts with the body, saying, “I will steal by this method,” by climbing onto a boat, it is also a serious offense.

original: 'di las 'di ltar na yang ngo zhes pa ni rta dang gru'i steng nas rdzas 'di dang 'di ltar brku'o zhes lus kyis bsgyur zhing 'chos na yang sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di las 'di ltar na yang ngo zhes pa ni rta dang gru'i steng nas rdzas 'di dang 'di ltar brku'o zhes lus kyis bsgyur zhing 'chos na yang sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: In this case, it is also like that. If one acts with the body, saying, “I will steal this and that object in this way,” on a horse or boat, it is also a serious offense.

original: pha ma dang pho nu dang sring mo dang mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang mchod rten dang dge 'dun la sogs pa la spags pa sho gam gcod pa las bzlas na'o zhes pa ni 'di rnams la dbul zhing sbyin pa sho gam las bzlas nas yang pha rol gyi phyir brkus pa'i sbom por ston pa'o //🔽brnyas @55b pa dang bskyis pa mi sbyin bar bsams pa'o zhes pa ni de dag mi sbyin par bsams pa yang sbom por 'gyur ba'o //🔽gzhan gyi phyir byin pa bgos na yang ngo zhes pa ni dge 'dun mchod ston gsol cig pa la sogs pa'i zong spags shing /🔽brdzangs pa las bltebs su brkus pa yang sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: pha ma dang pho nu dang sring mo dang mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang mchod rten dang dge 'dun la sogs pa la spags pa sho gam gcod pa las bzlas na'o zhes pa ni 'di rnams la dbul zhing sbyin pa sho gam las bzlas nas yang pha rol gyi phyir brkus pa'i sbom por ston pa'o // brnyas @55b pa dang bskyis pa mi sbyin bar bsams pa'o zhes pa ni de dag mi sbyin par bsams pa yang sbom por 'gyur ba'o // gzhan gyi phyir byin pa bgos na yang ngo zhes pa ni dge 'dun mchod ston gsol cig pa la sogs pa'i zong spags shing / brdzangs pa las bltebs su brkus pa yang sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One should steal for the sake of others, having stolen from those who have stolen from the Three Jewels. This teaches that stealing from those who have stolen from the Three Jewels is a serious offense.

original: brkus na yan lag gcig ma tshang ba'i phyir sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: brkus na yan lag gcig ma tshang ba'i phyir sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one steals it, it is a serious transgression, because one part of the limb is missing.

original: nas chan dang 'bras chan dang / phye dang nya dang / sha dang bca' ba la sogs pa mi dbang ba'i zas blangs na'o zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa'i zas 'di rnams mi dbang ba las brkus na yang sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nas chan dang 'bras chan dang / phye dang nya dang / sha dang bca' ba la sogs pa mi dbang ba'i zas blangs na'o zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa'i zas 'di rnams mi dbang ba las brkus na yang sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one takes food that is not one’s share, such as barley gruel, rice, flour, fish, meat, or cakes, it is a serious transgression if one steals it from where it is not one’s share.

original: gzhan gyis blangs par mi shes pa mi dbang ba ma yin zhes ba ni bdag gi zan skal zlas mnos par rgyus ma shes te zos pa ni mi dbang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis blangs par mi shes pa mi dbang ba ma yin zhes ba ni bdag gi zan skal zlas mnos par rgyus ma shes te zos pa ni mi dbang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one does not know that it has been taken by another, it is not not one’s share. If one eats without knowing that one has been assigned one’s share of food, it is not not one’s share.

original: nyes med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: nyes med par ston pa'o //
translated: This shows that there is no fault.

original: gang nod cing len pa la yang de bzhin du nyes med do //
analyzed: gang nod cing len pa la yang de bzhin du nyes med do //
translated: There is no fault if one takes it and receives it in the same way.

original: ma bcol ba ma yin zhes pa ni dge slong zla gcig zas mi dbang ba las dbang ngo snyam te /
analyzed: ma bcol ba ma yin zhes pa ni dge slong zla gcig zas mi dbang ba las dbang ngo snyam te /
translated: If one is not invited, it is not not one’s share. A monk who is not allowed to eat for a month thinks that he is allowed to eat.

original: mdza' bos bsnyen mdong byas nas mnos pa de nyid kyis ma khyer pha rol yang ma bcol ba nyes par ston pa'o //
analyzed: mdza' bos bsnyen mdong byas nas mnos pa de nyid kyis ma khyer pha rol yang ma bcol ba nyes par ston pa'o //
translated: A friend invites him to eat, and he accepts. Because he was not invited by the other, this shows that there is a fault.

original: yang gcig tu na mi dbang ba'i zas dbang ngo snyam du bsams te ma bcol bar pha rol gyi phyir mnos pa la yang nyes med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: yang gcig tu na mi dbang ba'i zas dbang ngo snyam du bsams te ma bcol bar pha rol gyi phyir mnos pa la yang nyes med par ston pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is taught that there is no fault in taking food for another without being asked, thinking, “I will take the food of one who is not in control.”🔽If one eats without being invited, there is an offense.

original: ma bos par zos na nyes byas zhes pa ni mgron du ma gnyer bar zos pa bdag gis shes kyang rung ma shes kyang rung byin ba'i shas yod pas na rkun por ni mi 'gyur gyis dra ma'i chos ma yin pas na nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ma bos par zos na nyes byas zhes pa ni mgron du ma gnyer bar zos pa bdag gis shes kyang rung ma shes kyang rung byin ba'i shas yod pas na rkun por ni mi 'gyur gyis dra ma'i chos ma yin pas na nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one eats without being invited, whether one knows or does not know that there is food given, one does not become a thief because of the existence of the food given, but because it is not the Dharma of a monk, there is an offense.🔽Also, if one goes to steal, there is an offense.

original: rkur 'gro pa yang ngo zhes pa ni mdo 'og ma'i yul bstan pa'i phyir smos pa yin te /
analyzed: rkur 'gro pa yang ngo zhes pa ni mdo 'og ma'i yul bstan pa'i phyir smos pa yin te /
translated: This is stated to indicate the object of the lower sūtra.

original: rkur 'gro na nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rkur 'gro na nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one goes to steal, there is an offense.🔽Also, if one goes after discussing it, there is a separate offense.

original: bgros pa yang de dang tha dad ces pa ni kha nas gleng zhing gros byas pa la sogs pa yang 'gro bar 'du shes te nyes byas su zad pas na sbyor ba tha dad par mi @56a * //
analyzed: bgros pa yang de dang tha dad ces pa ni kha nas gleng zhing gros byas pa la sogs pa yang 'gro bar 'du shes te nyes byas su zad pas na sbyor ba tha dad par mi @56a * //
translated: If one discusses it with one’s mouth, makes a plan, and so on, and goes, it is included in going, and there is only an offense. Therefore, the performance is not separate.

original: drang ngo // shin tu brtags la dbang po med pa zhes blang zhes pa ni rdzas yan par 'dug pa 'dod byar du mi blang gi bdag po yod dam med pa la sogs pa bdag kyang the tshom mi lta /
analyzed: drang ngo // shin tu brtags la dbang po med pa zhes blang zhes pa ni rdzas yan par 'dug pa 'dod byar du mi blang gi bdag po yod dam med pa la sogs pa bdag kyang the tshom mi lta /
translated: One should not take it, thinking, I am not sure whether it has a master or not.

original: gzhan yang 'phya ba'i glags med pa'i phyir shin tu rtogs la gdong long shig par ston pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phya ba'i glags med pa'i phyir shin tu rtogs la gdong long shig par ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase having examined well shows that one should not take it, thinking, I will not be blamed by others.

original: lus kyis nyal bar mi bya zhes pa ni dge slong rmon pa'i mdun du rol bcad de nyal ba lta bur bu lon gyi phyir sgo nyal la sogs pa ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyis nyal bar mi bya zhes pa ni dge slong rmon pa'i mdun du rol bcad de nyal ba lta bur bu lon gyi phyir sgo nyal la sogs pa ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: The phrase one should not lie down with one's body means that one should not lie down in the doorway, like a monk who lies down in the doorway of a debtor, thinking, I will not get up until I have received my wages.

original: bya tshad mi gzhig ces pa ni dge slong gi gnas na sgo da med pa'i tshang yod na shig shig ces 'og nas 'byung bas na 'di ni dge slong gi gnas ma yin na /
analyzed: bya tshad mi gzhig ces pa ni dge slong gi gnas na sgo da med pa'i tshang yod na shig shig ces 'og nas 'byung bas na 'di ni dge slong gi gnas ma yin na /
translated: The phrase one should not destroy the eggs means that if there is a nest without a doorway in the dwelling place of a monk, one should not destroy it, thinking, This is not the dwelling place of a monk,

original: sgo nga med pa'i tshang yang ma 'jig shig par ston pa'o //
analyzed: sgo nga med pa'i tshang yang ma 'jig shig par ston pa'o //
translated: since it will be said below, One should not destroy the eggs.🔽 The phrase one should not destroy the nest shows that one should not destroy the nest even if it is without eggs.

original: der mi gnas pas dbyar gyi gos skal mi mnod ces pa dbyar gnas de na ma 'dug pas /
analyzed: der mi gnas pas dbyar gyi gos skal mi mnod ces pa dbyar gnas de na ma 'dug pas /
translated: Since they do not stay there, they do not take up the share of the summer robe.

original: gos la sogs pa dbyar gyi rnyed pa mi dbang gis ma len cig pa'o //
analyzed: gos la sogs pa dbyar gyi rnyed pa mi dbang gis ma len cig pa'o //
translated: Since they do not stay in that rainy season retreat, they do not take the robe and so on that is the gain of the summer.🔽If one thinks of the owner, there is no fault in taking it from a thief.

original: spyin bdag tu bsams na rkun po las khyer na nyes pa med ces pa ni 'di ltar gzhag na rkun po las rdzas khyer ba nyes med par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: spyin bdag tu bsams na rkun po las khyer na nyes pa med ces pa ni 'di ltar gzhag na rkun po las rdzas khyer ba nyes med par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one thinks of the owner, there is no fault in taking the goods from a thief.🔽One should not take what is not manifest, what is stolen by a thief, except for the sign.

original: mtshan ma ma gtogs shing rkun pos brkus pa mi mngon pa mi blang ngo zhes pa ni god ma ltar blang ba yang rkun por grags shid rkun po'i mtshan ma ma brtags pa las don man gyi rdzas ma len cig pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma ma gtogs shing rkun pos brkus pa mi mngon pa mi blang ngo zhes pa ni god ma ltar blang ba yang rkun por grags shid rkun po'i mtshan ma ma brtags pa las don man gyi rdzas ma len cig pa'o //
translated: One should not take goods of another, without examining the sign of the thief, even if one takes it like a lost article.🔽Having taken it from the thief, one should dye it, cut it, and wear it.

original: de las khyer ba dras nas kha dog bsgyur te bcad zhes pa ni don man gyi rdzas de thabs 'di ltar spu bsgyur la gdod chongs shig pa'o //
analyzed: de las khyer ba dras nas kha dog bsgyur te bcad zhes pa ni don man gyi rdzas de thabs 'di ltar spu bsgyur la gdod chongs shig pa'o //
translated: One should take that article of another by this method of dyeing and cutting it.

original: de ltar byas kyang slong na sbyin zhes pa ni rjes de ltar spu bsgyur kyang nor bdag gis ngos zin nas slar 'dod zer na byin cig pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar byas kyang slong na sbyin zhes pa ni rjes de ltar spu bsgyur kyang nor bdag gis ngos zin nas slar 'dod zer na byin cig pa'o //
translated: If he says, I will take your wealth by force, then give it to him.🔽If he says, I will take your wealth by theft, then give it to him.🔽If he says, I will take your wealth by deception, then give it to him.🔽If he says, I will take your wealth by magic, then give it to him.🔽If he says, I will take your wealth by sorcery, then give it to him.

original: sgyu mi bya zhes pa ni bdag gi nor gzhan gyis khyer ba ngo can thabs kyis brgyud pa la sogs pa'i sgyu ma byed cig pa'o //🔽gleng gzhi ni 'phags pa dga' ba'i slob ma spod bas bzod pa'i phyir byis pa rnams ngo chen byed du btsud pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sgyu mi bya zhes pa ni bdag gi nor gzhan gyis khyer ba ngo can thabs kyis brgyud pa la sogs pa'i sgyu ma byed cig pa'o // gleng gzhi ni 'phags pa dga' ba'i slob ma spod bas bzod pa'i phyir byis pa rnams ngo chen byed du btsud pa lta bu'o //
translated: If he says, I will take your wealth by fraud, then give it to him.🔽If he says, I will take your wealth by force, then give it to him.🔽If he says, I will take your wealth by theft, then give it to him.🔽If he says, I will take your wealth by deception, then give it to him.🔽If he says, I will take your wealth by magic, then give it to him.🔽If he says, I will take your wealth by sorcery, then give it to him.

original: sngags kyis btang ba nyes med ces pa ni mi rkun pos khyer ba lta bu la sogs pa sngags kyis bsdigs shing phrogs pa la nyes med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: sngags kyis btang ba nyes med ces pa ni mi rkun pos khyer ba lta bu la sogs pa sngags kyis bsdigs shing phrogs pa la nyes med par ston pa'o //
translated: If he says, I will take your wealth by fraud, then give it to him.🔽If he says, I will take your wealth by force, then give it to him.🔽If he says, I will take your wealth by theft, then give it to him.

original: bdag gi byi bas khyer ba blangs na @56b yang ngo zhes pa ni byi bas khyer ba'i rdzas slar blangs pa las nyes med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi byi bas khyer ba blangs na @56b yang ngo zhes pa ni byi bas khyer ba'i rdzas slar blangs pa las nyes med pa'o //
translated: If he says, I will take your wealth by deception, then give it to him.🔽If he says, I will take your wealth by magic, then give it to him.🔽If he says, I will take your wealth by sorcery, then give it to him.🔽If he says, I will take your wealth by fraud, then give it to him.🔽If he says, I will take your wealth by force, then give it to him.🔽If he says, I will take your wealth by theft

original: dge slong gzhan gyi nor de'i phyir na yang ngo zhes pa dge slong gzhan gyi rdzas byi bas khyer ba bdag gi nor du bya ba'i phyir phrogs pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dge slong gzhan gyi nor de'i phyir na yang ngo zhes pa dge slong gzhan gyi rdzas byi bas khyer ba bdag gi nor du bya ba'i phyir phrogs pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: This means that it is not a case of stealing another monk's property that a mouse has carried off, thinking it is one's own wealth.

original: khyod de nyid kyi phyir phrogs na nyes med /
analyzed: khyod de nyid kyi phyir phrogs na nyes med /
translated: If you steal for that very purpose, there is no fault.🔽If a deer comes to you out of fear of a hunter, honor it.🔽 This means that if you do not give it back, there is no fault in taking it.🔽If that deer dies, give its corpse to the hunter.

original: ri dags rngon pas zhed de gan du su 'ongs pa bkur zhes pa ni skyabs bya ba'i phyir 'di lta bu slar ma byin te khyer na nyes med de 'di shi na de la sbyin zhes pa ni ri dags de shi na ro rngon pa la byin cig
analyzed: ri dags rngon pas zhed de gan du su 'ongs pa bkur zhes pa ni skyabs bya ba'i phyir 'di lta bu slar ma byin te khyer na nyes med de 'di shi na de la sbyin zhes pa ni ri dags de shi na ro rngon pa la byin cig
translated: This means that if the deer dies, give its corpse to the hunter.

original: pa'o // ma byin par len pa'i phas pham pa bye brag tu nges pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o // ma byin par len pa'i phas pham pa bye brag tu nges pa'o //
translated: The defeat of taking what is not given is ascertained in particular.

original: ma byin par len pa'i phas pham pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa'i phas pham pa rdzogs so /
translated: The defeat of taking what is not given is complete.

original: // / ma byin par len pa'i phas pham pa de ltar bstan nas /
analyzed: // / ma byin par len pa'i phas pham pa de ltar bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the defeat of taking what is not given,

original: gsod pa'i phas pham pa da ston pa ni /
analyzed: gsod pa'i phas pham pa da ston pa ni /
translated: now the defeat of killing is taught.

original: nad pa 'chi bar sems pa dang mthun pa'i bsnyad pa mi bsnyad ces pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: nad pa 'chi bar sems pa dang mthun pa'i bsnyad pa mi bsnyad ces pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Do not give advice that accords with the thoughts of a patient who is thinking of dying, and so on.

original: nad pa 'chi bar 'dod pa dang mthun pa nyid na /
analyzed: nad pa 'chi bar 'dod pa dang mthun pa nyid na /
translated: Do not say such things as, If it is agreeable to the sick person to die,

original: dug zos kyang bla'o zhes pa lta bu la sogs pa'i tshig ma 'byin cig pa'o //🔽'di 'chi ba dang 'gal bar gyis shig ces ma bsgo bar mi shes pa mi gzhag ces pa ni nad g-yog tu gzhug pa shes nyen chung ba zhig yin te /
analyzed: dug zos kyang bla'o zhes pa lta bu la sogs pa'i tshig ma 'byin cig pa'o // 'di 'chi ba dang 'gal bar gyis shig ces ma bsgo bar mi shes pa mi gzhag ces pa ni nad g-yog tu gzhug pa shes nyen chung ba zhig yin te /
translated: it is all right for him to take poison.🔽 Do not leave in an ignorant person the responsibility of saying, Do this to counteract death, when you are not present.🔽 If you are a nurse who is not very skilled, you should not leave the sick person without giving him detailed instructions, such as, Do this and this to counteract death.

original: nad pa'i zur mi thub tsam gyi tshod na ji nas kyang 'chi ba dang 'gal ba'i tshul 'di dang 'di ltar gyis shig ces zhib tu bsgo bar nad pa'i drud du ma bzhag shig pa'o //
analyzed: nad pa'i zur mi thub tsam gyi tshod na ji nas kyang 'chi ba dang 'gal ba'i tshul 'di dang 'di ltar gyis shig ces zhib tu bsgo bar nad pa'i drud du ma bzhag shig pa'o //
translated: Do not leave the sick person without giving him detailed instructions, such as, Do this and this to counteract death.

original: thabs gzhan yod na ma yin zhes pa ni mi brda phrad pa gzhag tu yong na /🔽gong ma lta bu'i shes nyen chung ba bsgor zin kyang nad pa'i drung du ma bzhag shig pa'o //
analyzed: thabs gzhan yod na ma yin zhes pa ni mi brda phrad pa gzhag tu yong na / gong ma lta bu'i shes nyen chung ba bsgor zin kyang nad pa'i drung du ma bzhag shig pa'o //
translated: If there is another way, do not do it.

original: 'chi ba'i yo byad ma yin zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i yo byad ma yin zhes pa ni /
translated: If there is a person who understands, do not leave the sick person without giving him detailed instructions, such as, Do this and this to counteract death.🔽 Do not leave in the sick person's presence things that are not for his use.

original: nad pa'i drung du mtshon dang / thag srad la sogs pa ma 'jog shig pa'o //
analyzed: nad pa'i drung du mtshon dang / thag srad la sogs pa ma 'jog shig pa'o //
translated: Do not leave in the sick person's presence things such as weapons and ropes.

original: 'di 'chir rtsol na nang g-yog gis gcugs zhes pa ni nad pa de 'geg gam mtshon gyis 'debs shid 'chir rtsol na nad g-yog gis gcugs shing de ltar byed du ma gzhug shig pa'o //🔽nor gyi phyir pha rol 'chir re ba mi bya zhes pa ni nad pa'i gos sam lhung bzed 'dod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di 'chir rtsol na nang g-yog gis gcugs zhes pa ni nad pa de 'geg gam mtshon gyis 'debs shid 'chir rtsol na nad g-yog gis gcugs shing de ltar byed du ma gzhug shig pa'o // nor gyi phyir pha rol 'chir re ba mi bya zhes pa ni nad pa'i gos sam lhung bzed 'dod pa'i phyir /
translated: This means that if the patient is about to die, either by being killed or by suicide, the attendant should not let him do it.🔽One should not wish for the death of another for the sake of one's own gain.

original: nad pa 'chir re lta bu'i ma rungs pa'i ngan sems ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: nad pa 'chir re lta bu'i ma rungs pa'i ngan sems ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: This means that one should not have the evil thought of wishing for the death of a patient who desires one's robe or begging-bowl.

original: mi bya ba bya bar sems kyis kyang rjes su yi rang bar mi bya zhes pa ni mngal nas ltung @57a * //
analyzed: mi bya ba bya bar sems kyis kyang rjes su yi rang bar mi bya zhes pa ni mngal nas ltung @57a * //
translated: One should not even rejoice in the thought of doing what should not be done.

original: bar byed pa lta bu la sogs pa mi bu ba'i rnams kyis kyang rjes su bya dka' bar mi bya na lus dang ngag gis lta ci smos zhes pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: bar byed pa lta bu la sogs pa mi bu ba'i rnams kyis kyang rjes su bya dka' bar mi bya na lus dang ngag gis lta ci smos zhes pa ston pa'o //
translated: This means that one should not even rejoice in the thought of doing what is difficult to do, such as falling from a cliff, and so on. What need is there to speak of doing it with body or speech?

original: da ni gsong pa'i yan lag tu gtogs pa ston te /
analyzed: da ni gsong pa'i yan lag tu gtogs pa ston te /
translated: Now he teaches the branch of the vow.

original: 'tsho ba 'gags zhes pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i 'tsho ba skad cig rnams mi 'byung bar 'gags pa ni 'tsho ba 'gags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba 'gags zhes pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i 'tsho ba skad cig rnams mi 'byung bar 'gags pa ni 'tsho ba 'gags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The cessation of life refers to the cessation of the non-arising of the momentary lives of the future.

original: der sems pa zhes pa ni ma bsams 'tsho ba 'gags pa 'ang srid pas na der sems pa zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: der sems pa zhes pa ni ma bsams 'tsho ba 'gags pa 'ang srid pas na der sems pa zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: The word 'there' refers to the cessation of life, because it is possible that life ceases without intention.

original: de yang su'i 'tsho ba zhe na mi'i 'gro ba zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang su'i 'tsho ba zhe na mi'i 'gro ba zhes pa yin te /
translated: To which life does this refer? It refers to the life of the human realm.

original: 'tsho ba 'gags pa de'ang mi'i rgyud kyi 'tsho ba 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba 'gags pa de'ang mi'i rgyud kyi 'tsho ba 'gags pa'o //
translated: The cessation of life also refers to the cessation of life in the human continuum.

original: de yang ci'i bgegs she na /
analyzed: de yang ci'i bgegs she na /
translated: What obstructs that?

original: lus de dang 'brel pa 'phangs pa gzhan la bcol ba rnams tha mi dad ces pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: lus de dang 'brel pa 'phangs pa gzhan la bcol ba rnams tha mi dad ces pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The text says 'those that are hurled by the body or by what is connected to the body, without distinction' and so on.

original: khu tshur ram thal mo la sogs pa lus kyis sam lus dang 'brel pa ste ral gri la sogs pa lag chas sam /

analyzed: chu dang mer gtong ba zhes pa ni chu dang mer btang ste bsad na yang nyes par 'gyur ba'o //

analyzed: lhags pa dang tsha bar 'jog na'o zhes pa ni tsha ches pa dang lhags pa che tshes par bzung ste bzhag nas bsad na yang nyas par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Placing in the cold and heat means that if one kills by placing in excessive heat or cold, one commits an offense.

original: pho nyar @57b gtong ba la sogs pa zhes pa ni 'chi ba'i sa gang na yod par pho nyar gtong ngam khyod kyi ma de na 'dug gis sod shig ces pa lta bur 'drid cing btang ste bsad na yang nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: pho nyar @57b gtong ba la sogs pa zhes pa ni 'chi ba'i sa gang na yod par pho nyar gtong ngam khyod kyi ma de na 'dug gis sod shig ces pa lta bur 'drid cing btang ste bsad na yang nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Sending a messenger and so on means that if one kills by sending a messenger to the place of death or by deceiving and sending, saying, Your mother is there, kill her, one commits an offense.

original: chung dur byas pas kyang ngo zhes pa ni bam kol lam rtsi mtshog tsam gyis bsad na yang nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: chung dur byas pas kyang ngo zhes pa ni bam kol lam rtsi mtshog tsam gyis bsad na yang nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Even by making small means that if one kills by a small weapon or a needle, one commits an offense.

original: skyes pa dang bud med dang ma ning gsod pa zhes pa ni 'di dag gang bsad kyang nyes par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: skyes pa dang bud med dang ma ning gsod pa zhes pa ni 'di dag gang bsad kyang nyes par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Killing a male, female or neuter means that if one kills any of these, one commits an offense.

original: gong du mi 'gro ba zhes smos pa des rgyas par ston pa'o //
analyzed: gong du mi 'gro ba zhes smos pa des rgyas par ston pa'o //
translated: The above statement, not ascending, teaches this extensively.

original: de'i lan bon gyis phyis shi na'o zhes pa ni bsad par bshams pa'i mod la ni ma shi'i de'i rkyen gyis phyis shi na yang nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i lan bon gyis phyis shi na'o zhes pa ni bsad par bshams pa'i mod la ni ma shi'i de'i rkyen gyis phyis shi na yang nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The answer is: “If he dies later.” If he does not die at the very moment of the killing, but dies later due to that cause, there is an offense.

original: bcug pa'i 'og tu na des ma lan zhes pa ni pha rol na sdar sod cig par smras sam bcol ba las phyis 'gyod de bzlog cing bcug pa'i 'og tu shi na sbom po yod du zad kyi shi ba nyid des ma lan par ston pa'o //
analyzed: bcug pa'i 'og tu na des ma lan zhes pa ni pha rol na sdar sod cig par smras sam bcol ba las phyis 'gyod de bzlog cing bcug pa'i 'og tu shi na sbom po yod du zad kyi shi ba nyid des ma lan par ston pa'o //
translated: “If he dies later, it is not due to that,” means that if he is told to kill someone else, or if he is ordered to kill, but later regrets it and stops, and if he dies later, there is only a serious offense. It shows that his death is not due to that.

original: ma bsams par lto mnyes pa'i ma dang mngal ni sbom po'o zhes pa ni mngal na 'dug pa bsad pa'i phyir ma'i lto mnyes pa las mngal na 'dug pa ni ma shi'i ma bsad par ma bsams pa lta bu shi ba lta bu gsod par shom pa'i sbom🔽po yod par zad kyi ma shi ba nyes med par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ma bsams par lto mnyes pa'i ma dang mngal ni sbom po'o zhes pa ni mngal na 'dug pa bsad pa'i phyir ma'i lto mnyes pa las mngal na 'dug pa ni ma shi'i ma bsad par ma bsams pa lta bu shi ba lta bu gsod par shom pa'i sbom🔽po yod par zad kyi ma shi ba nyes med par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “If the mother is satisfied with food, but not the fetus, it is serious,” means that if the mother is satisfied with food, but the fetus in the womb is not, and if the fetus dies due to killing it, it is only a serious offense. It shows that the mother is not killed, and the fetus is not considered.🔽“If the mother is not satisfied with food, but the fetus is, it is serious,” means that if the mother is not satisfied with food, but the fetus in the womb is, and if the fetus dies due to killing it, it is only a serious offense. It shows that the mother is not killed, and the fetus is not considered.

original: khas blangs pa'i rgyud gsod par zhugs na'o zhes pa ni sod cig ces kyang mi zer /
analyzed: khas blangs pa'i rgyud gsod par zhugs na'o zhes pa ni sod cig ces kyang mi zer /
translated: It is said that if one engages in killing a sentient being who has taken vows,🔽it is not clear whether one says “Kill!”

original: ma gsod cig kyang mi zer ro zhes pa lta bu gsal por ni ma smras /
analyzed: ma gsod cig kyang mi zer ro zhes pa lta bu gsal por ni ma smras /
translated: or “Do not kill!”

original: sems la ni bsad du dga' ba lta bu'i tshul ston na sbom bor 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sems la ni bsad du dga' ba lta bu'i tshul ston na sbom bor 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one shows a manner of delighting in killing, it is a serious offense.🔽It is said that if one says, “I will give you the means to die by your own hand,”

original: khyod kyi ming gis 'chi ba'i yo byad sbyin no zhes zer na yang ngo zhes pa ni mtshon la sogs pa 'chi ba'i yo byad khyod kyis bskur ro zhes byas te 'chir 'dod pa la mtshon sbyin par shom pa la mi 'chugs shing mgo kyog pa 'am /
analyzed: khyod kyi ming gis 'chi ba'i yo byad sbyin no zhes zer na yang ngo zhes pa ni mtshon la sogs pa 'chi ba'i yo byad khyod kyis bskur ro zhes byas te 'chir 'dod pa la mtshon sbyin par shom pa la mi 'chugs shing mgo kyog pa 'am /
translated: if one says, “You sent me the means to die by your own hand, such as a weapon,” and one prepares to give a weapon to one who wishes to die, but the other person does not die,

original: tshig zur tsam gyis khas blangs na yang sbom por 'gyur ba'o//
analyzed: tshig zur tsam gyis khas blangs na yang sbom por 'gyur ba'o//
translated: and if one promises by merely nodding one’s head or by a hint, it is a serious offense.🔽It is said that if one kills another nonhuman who is not an animal,

original: byol song ma yin pa gzhan dang / sprul pa yang ngo zhes pa ni byol song ma yin pa'i mi ma yin gzhan dang / sprul pa bsad na yang sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: byol song ma yin pa gzhan dang / sprul pa yang ngo zhes pa ni byol song ma yin pa'i mi ma yin gzhan dang / sprul pa bsad na yang sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: or a magical emanation, it is a serious offense.

original: de la mir sprul pa bsad pa ni mi'i 'du shes yod pa'i phyir spyor ba'i tshe sbom po'o //
analyzed: de la mir sprul pa bsad pa ni mi'i 'du shes yod pa'i phyir spyor ba'i tshe sbom po'o //
translated: If one kills a human emanation, since one has the perception of a human, it is serious at the time of the deed.

original: bsad pa'i tshe nyes pa med /
analyzed: bsad pa'i tshe nyes pa med /
translated: There is no fault if one kills at the time of death.

original: @58a * // lhar sprul pa bsad pa ni lhar 'du shes na nyes byas /
analyzed: @58a * // lhar sprul pa bsad pa ni lhar 'du shes na nyes byas /
translated: If one kills a god emanation, if one has the perception of a god, it is a wrong action.

original: mir 'du shes na sbom po'o //
analyzed: mir 'du shes na sbom po'o //
translated: If one has the perception of a human, it is serious.

original: byol song du sprul pa la sogs pa yang de bzhin /
analyzed: byol song du sprul pa la sogs pa yang de bzhin /
translated: The same applies to killing an animal emanation and so on.

original: dri ba'i lung med par nad pa la sman mi sbyin zhes pa ni dri bar 'os pa la dris pa'i lung med par thug thub tu sman ma sbyin cig pa'o //
analyzed: dri ba'i lung med par nad pa la sman mi sbyin zhes pa ni dri bar 'os pa la dris pa'i lung med par thug thub tu sman ma sbyin cig pa'o //
translated: Do not give medicine to the sick without asking is a prohibition against giving medicine to the sick without asking those who are suitable to be asked.

original: dri bar 'os pa de gang zhe na sman pa dang de las rab tu byung ba dang / de la brten pa 'di dag la dris zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: dri bar 'os pa de gang zhe na sman pa dang de las rab tu byung ba dang / de la brten pa 'di dag la dris zhes pa yin no //
translated: What are those who are suitable to be asked? They are physicians, those who have gone forth in that doctrine and those who rely on them.

original: nad bu can la yang ngo zhes pa ni yun rings su na ba la yang nad dang sman gyi nyams drod yod pas na dris shig / dge slong rgan rabs shes nyen can la yang ngo zhes pa ni 'di lta bu la yang dris shig pa'o //
analyzed: nad bu can la yang ngo zhes pa ni yun rings su na ba la yang nad dang sman gyi nyams drod yod pas na dris shig / dge slong rgan rabs shes nyen can la yang ngo zhes pa ni 'di lta bu la yang dris shig pa'o //
translated: Also, to an elder monk who is forgetful means that one should ask about this kind of thing.

original: de dag gang la yang drir rung ngam zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gang la yang drir rung ngam zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, To whom is it suitable to ask?

original: gong ma gyed na 'og ma'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: gong ma gyed na 'og ma'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: It is said, If the higher is not available, the lower.

original: rtag tu smos pa de dag kun la drir mi rung gi gong ma med na rim bzhin du 'og ma rnams la dris shig pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu smos pa de dag kun la drir mi rung gi gong ma med na rim bzhin du 'og ma rnams la dris shig pa'o //
translated: It is not suitable to ask all of those who are always mentioned. If the higher is not available, one should ask the lower ones in order.

original: phan par 'dod na gsod pa sman ma yin pa byin na 'bri ba med ces pa ni dge slong mas mi rgod drug cu rtsab mo dang tshar bsres te byin pa lta bu pham par bsams te /
analyzed: phan par 'dod na gsod pa sman ma yin pa byin na 'bri ba med ces pa ni dge slong mas mi rgod drug cu rtsab mo dang tshar bsres te byin pa lta bu pham par bsams te /
translated: If one wishes to benefit, it is said, If one gives medicine that is not medicine to kill, there is no offense, meaning that if one thinks, I will kill the sixty-one bandits, and gives them poison, there is no offense.

original: bsad na yang 'bri ba med de pham par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bsad na yang 'bri ba med de pham par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one kills, there is no offense, but there is a defeat.

original: me theg pa'i khur bteg pa'i grogs mi bya zhes pa ni mi theg pa'i lci ba bteg pa'i grogs ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: me theg pa'i khur bteg pa'i grogs mi bya zhes pa ni mi theg pa'i lci ba bteg pa'i grogs ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: Do not be a companion who lifts a load that cannot be lifted means do not be a companion who lifts a heavy load that cannot be lifted.

original: de lta bu bteg tu ye mi rung ngam zhe na gal te de lta bu'i rkyen cig na khyim pa dang sbrel la cig car du bteg par skad sbyar zhing bteg ces pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu bteg tu ye mi rung ngam zhe na gal te de lta bu'i rkyen cig na khyim pa dang sbrel la cig car du bteg par skad sbyar zhing bteg ces pa yin te /
translated: If it is asked, Is it never suitable to lift such a load? if there are such conditions, then the companion should say, Lift! and lift it simultaneously with the layperson.

original: las sar pa byed pa la sogs pa'i tshe grogs mi byar mi rung na thabs 'di ltar gyis shig pa'o /
analyzed: las sar pa byed pa la sogs pa'i tshe grogs mi byar mi rung na thabs 'di ltar gyis shig pa'o /
translated: If it is unsuitable to be a companion when performing a new action, and so on, then one should do it in the following way.

original: 'jog pa na yang mnyam par skad sbyar zhes pa ni gong ma ltar khyer la 'jog pa'i tshe na snga phyir ma khyer bar zhog shig pa'o //
analyzed: 'jog pa na yang mnyam par skad sbyar zhes pa ni gong ma ltar khyer la 'jog pa'i tshe na snga phyir ma khyer bar zhog shig pa'o //
translated: When placing it, also say, 'Equal!' means that when the load is lifted as before and placed, it should be placed without lifting it earlier or later.

original: pha gu mi 'phang zhes pa ni las sar pa'i tshe gcig la gcig pha gum 'dor cig pa'o //
analyzed: pha gu mi 'phang zhes pa ni las sar pa'i tshe gcig la gcig pha gum 'dor cig pa'o //
translated: Do not throw the load means that when performing a new action, do not throw the load at each other.

original: grum pa dang gas pa ma bsgo bar mi sbyin zhes pa ni pha gu long 'dogs pa'i tshe grum zhing gas pa yod pa na sbron cig pa'o //
analyzed: grum pa dang gas pa ma bsgo bar mi sbyin zhes pa ni pha gu long 'dogs pa'i tshe grum zhing gas pa yod pa na sbron cig pa'o //
translated: Do not give without informing about cracks and breaks means that when attaching a load to a load, if there are cracks and breaks, inform the other.

original: rkun po spa gong zhing bsdigs zhes pa ni rkun po 'ongs na gnod sems med pas sdigs ri gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: rkun po spa gong zhing bsdigs zhes pa ni rkun po 'ongs na gnod sems med pas sdigs ri gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase threaten the thief means that if a thief comes, you should threaten him without any thought of harming him.

original: de la bsdigs pa'i rnam grangs ston pa ni /🔽gand'i @58b la sogs pa ma phog par 'phangs zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la bsdigs pa'i rnam grangs ston pa ni / gand'i @58b la sogs pa ma phog par 'phangs zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The following passage shows the various ways of threatening:🔽Do not strike him with a weapon, etc.,

original: gand'i ma bu la sogs pa ma phog par 'phongs shig pa'o //
analyzed: gand'i ma bu la sogs pa ma phog par 'phongs shig pa'o //
translated: and so on. Do not strike him with a weapon, a stick, or anything else.

original: rdul gyi bum pa dang thal ba'i gyo mo yang rlung phyogs su 'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rdul gyi bum pa dang thal ba'i gyo mo yang rlung phyogs su 'o zhes pa ni /
translated: Even the dust of the pot and the ashes of the hearth should be thrown to the windward side.

original: rkun po la 'di rnams kyis mi phog par rlung phyogs su gtor cig pa'o //
analyzed: rkun po la 'di rnams kyis mi phog par rlung phyogs su gtor cig pa'o //
translated: Throw these things to the windward side so that they will not strike the thief.🔽Keep a sling.

original: 'ur rdo bcang zhes pa ni rkun po bsdigs pa'i lag cha 'di 'ang chongs shig pa'o //
analyzed: 'ur rdo bcang zhes pa ni rkun po bsdigs pa'i lag cha 'di 'ang chongs shig pa'o //
translated: Keep this implement for threatening the thief.

original: de'i zhar la gzhan yang ston pa ni /
analyzed: de'i zhar la gzhan yang ston pa ni /
translated: The following passage shows other things that should be done in this connection:

original: dge slong chad pa mi phul zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: dge slong chad pa mi phul zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Do not offer a monk for punishment, and so on.

original: sngon dge slong gzhon nus rings 'dod pa'i rgan po phul te bub nas shi ba lta bu ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: sngon dge slong gzhon nus rings 'dod pa'i rgan po phul te bub nas shi ba lta bu ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: Do not act like the young monk who, out of a desire to be first, offered an old man for punishment and then killed him.

original: de lta bas na 'di'i dan rogs bya zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di'i dan rogs bya zhes pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, one should help him.

original: rgan po de'i dan rogs gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: rgan po de'i dan rogs gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Help the elder.

original: dan rogs thabs ji ltar zhe na /🔽ngal sos gzhug ces pa la sogs pa yin te de'i nyams kyis mi nus na ngal so zhing bstir bcug shig pa'o //
analyzed: dan rogs thabs ji ltar zhe na / ngal sos gzhug ces pa la sogs pa yin te de'i nyams kyis mi nus na ngal so zhing bstir bcug shig pa'o //
translated: How should one help him?🔽If he is tired and cannot go, let him rest and sleep.

original: snod blang ba de'i lhung bzed snod la sogs bdag gis long la khyer cig pa'o //
analyzed: snod blang ba de'i lhung bzed snod la sogs bdag gis long la khyer cig pa'o //
translated: If he is unable to carry his bowl and so on, take them yourself.

original: bza' ba dang btung ba'i dus su ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bza' ba dang btung ba'i dus su ni ma yin te /
translated: But not at the time of eating and drinking.

original: gnas su cig car byin par mi nus na lhung bzed bkru gral gzhag / byin len bya brtag ces pa ni rgan po dang / bdag cag dang / mnyam du rings par 'gro mi nus la gdugs tshod mi sleb pa tsam gyi chod na rgan po dal gyis 'ong du bcug la bdag cag sngar dong ste /
analyzed: gnas su cig car byin par mi nus na lhung bzed bkru gral gzhag / byin len bya brtag ces pa ni rgan po dang / bdag cag dang / mnyam du rings par 'gro mi nus la gdugs tshod mi sleb pa tsam gyi chod na rgan po dal gyis 'ong du bcug la bdag cag sngar dong ste /
translated: If he is unable to go quickly with us, the elder should be allowed to go slowly, and we should go on ahead.

original: thabs 'di ltar gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: thabs 'di ltar gyis shig pa'o //
translated: This is the method.

original: gdugs tshod kyi dus su 'ang ma phyin pa tsam gyi tshod la /
analyzed: gdugs tshod kyi dus su 'ang ma phyin pa tsam gyi tshod la /
translated: Even if he does not arrive at the time of the meal,

original: gal te phyi na khyer la bsu zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te phyi na khyer la bsu zhes pa yin te /
translated: If it is outside, bring it and I will receive it.

original: rgan pho gdugs tshod mi sleb na zan nos la slar bstsu shig pa'o //
analyzed: rgan pho gdugs tshod mi sleb na zan nos la slar bstsu shig pa'o //
translated: If the old man does not arrive for the meal, eat the food and bring it back to him.

original: bsad pa'i phas pham pa rnam par 'byed pa'o /
analyzed: bsad pa'i phas pham pa rnam par 'byed pa'o /
translated: This is the analysis of the defeating offense of killing.

original: // / rnam par 'byed pa las 'byung ba de ltar bstan nas /
analyzed: // / rnam par 'byed pa las 'byung ba de ltar bstan nas /
translated: Having taught in accordance with the analysis,

original: phran tshegs las 'byung ba da ston te /
analyzed: phran tshegs las 'byung ba da ston te /
translated: now it is taught in accordance with the Ksudraka Collection.

original: mi'i 'gro ba'i lag pa bcad na sbom po'o zhes pa la lag pa yin te /
analyzed: mi'i 'gro ba'i lag pa bcad na sbom po'o zhes pa la lag pa yin te /
translated: If one cuts off the arm of a human being, it is a serious violation.

original: kha cig ni ched du gsad pa'i phyir lag pa bcad na sbom por 'chad mod /
analyzed: kha cig ni ched du gsad pa'i phyir lag pa bcad na sbom por 'chad mod /
translated: Some explain that if one cuts off the arm in order to kill, it is a serious violation.

original: de ni gsod par sbyor ba'i khongs su 'dus pas na /
analyzed: de ni gsod par sbyor ba'i khongs su 'dus pas na /
translated: But that is included in the preparation for killing,

original: skabs 'dir ni de la mi bya'o /
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni de la mi bya'o /
translated: so here it is not to be done.

original: rngam zhing nang ste lag pa bcad na sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rngam zhing nang ste lag pa bcad na sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one cuts off the arm in anger, it is a serious violation.

original: tshal mes gtong na'o zhes pa ni sems can yod @59a * //
analyzed: tshal mes gtong na'o zhes pa ni sems can yod @59a * //
translated: If one sets fire to a forest, it is a serious violation if there are sentient beings there.

original: par shes pa dang / yod par dogs pa dang / med par shes pa gsum la yod par shes pa dang / dogs te me btang na 'gro ba gang 'tshig pa dang / du tshig pa'i tshul bzhin du nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: par shes pa dang / yod par dogs pa dang / med par shes pa gsum la yod par shes pa dang / dogs te me btang na 'gro ba gang 'tshig pa dang / du tshig pa'i tshul bzhin du nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The three are: knowing that it exists, doubting that it exists, and knowing that it does not exist. If one sets fire to a village, thinking that it exists, or doubting that it exists, then one is guilty in the same way that one would be if one burned a village.

original: 'di ni dgos pa'i phyir sems can yod par shes kyang bsdoms te mi gtong bas na sbom po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dgos pa'i phyir sems can yod par shes kyang bsdoms te mi gtong bas na sbom po'o //
translated: This is a serious offense because, although one knows that sentient beings exist, one does not save them out of necessity.

original: skra can 'tshong na'o zhes pa ni skra can ma yin te /
analyzed: skra can 'tshong na'o zhes pa ni skra can ma yin te /
translated: If one sells a woman with hair, one is not selling a woman without hair.

original: mi btsong na sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mi btsong na sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one does not sell a woman, one commits a serious offense.

original: gang gis brkus pa de rgyal po'i 'khor du phul ba'o zhes pa ni bsad pa'i phyir phul ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gis brkus pa de rgyal po'i 'khor du phul ba'o zhes pa ni bsad pa'i phyir phul ba ma yin gyi /
translated: If one steals something and offers it to the king's court, one is not offering it in order to be killed.

original: nang zhing khros pas phul na sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nang zhing khros pas phul na sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one offers it out of inner anger, one commits a serious offense.

original: gsod pa'i phas pham pa phran tshegs su gtogs pa'o /
analyzed: gsod pa'i phas pham pa phran tshegs su gtogs pa'o /
translated: The father who kills is included in the minor offenses of the defeating offense.

original: // / phran tshegs las byung ba de ltar bstan nas /
analyzed: // / phran tshegs las byung ba de ltar bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the minor offenses that arise from the text,

original: zhus pa las 'byung ba da ston pa ni sbed de bstan na'o zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhus pa las 'byung ba da ston pa ni sbed de bstan na'o zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: now, the teaching that arises from the questions is taught: If one teaches while hiding, and so on.

original: bdag dang 'khon yod pa gshed mas zhed pa dang ; so da par dga' nas 'di ltar song ngam 'di lta bu zhig na 'dug go zhes rbad cing bstan na ston pa'i tshe sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bdag dang 'khon yod pa gshed mas zhed pa dang ; so da par dga' nas 'di ltar song ngam 'di lta bu zhig na 'dug go zhes rbad cing bstan na ston pa'i tshe sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one is delighted to see the enemy of oneself who is to be killed by the executioner, and one points out, “He is going like this or he is staying like this,” then at the time of pointing out, there is a serious offense.

original: dpe ni ma dang mngal lo //
analyzed: dpe ni ma dang mngal lo //
translated: The example is a mother and a womb.

original: mi mang po zhig gshed mas phyi dar mar zhed pa'i nang na gcig cig sod par dga' nas bstan cing sbed pa las phyis kun zin te /
analyzed: mi mang po zhig gshed mas phyi dar mar zhed pa'i nang na gcig cig sod par dga' nas bstan cing sbed pa las phyis kun zin te /
translated: When many people are frightened by the executioner outside, if one is delighted to kill one of them, and one points out and conceals that person, later all are killed.

original: kha btags pa nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: kha btags pa nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the offense of lying?

original: gang bsad par dga' ba de bstan pa'i tshe ni sbom po'o //
analyzed: gang bsad par dga' ba de bstan pa'i tshe ni sbom po'o //
translated: If one is delighted to kill, then at the time of pointing out, there is a serious offense.

original: bsad nas ni pham par 'gyur /
analyzed: bsad nas ni pham par 'gyur /
translated: If one kills, there is a defeat.

original: kha cig ni de'i zla la zin te /
analyzed: kha cig ni de'i zla la zin te /
translated: Some say that one is bound by the month.

original: bsad pa du yod pa'i sbom por 'gyur ro zhes kyang 'chad de dper ni mngal nyed pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bsad pa du yod pa'i sbom por 'gyur ro zhes kyang 'chad de dper ni mngal nyed pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is explained that there is a serious offense for each one killed. The example is like killing a womb.

original: rang lcebs pa ni sbom po'o zhes pa ni bdag gis bdag gsod pa la sogs pa sbom por 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: rang lcebs pa ni sbom po'o zhes pa ni bdag gis bdag gsod pa la sogs pa sbom por 'gyur ba ste /
translated: If one kills oneself, there is a serious offense. This is a serious offense for killing oneself and so on.

original: 'di ni sbyor ba'i tshe la bya /
analyzed: 'di ni sbyor ba'i tshe la bya /
translated: This is to be applied at the time of preparation.
