original: // / de lta nang 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes zer yang yid ma ches te de bzhin du byas na sbom po'o zhes pa ni khrus dang 'chag tu gzhug pa la sogs pa byas na nga'i nyams kyis mi nus te /🔽'chi gor ma chag go zhes nad pa zer yang de'i nyams dang ma sbyar bar nan gyis khrid cing 'chag tu bcug pa la sogs pa byas na sbom po'o //
analyzed: // / de lta nang 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes zer yang yid ma ches te de bzhin du byas na sbom po'o zhes pa ni khrus dang 'chag tu gzhug pa la sogs pa byas na nga'i nyams kyis mi nus te / 'chi gor ma chag go zhes nad pa zer yang de'i nyams dang ma sbyar bar nan gyis khrid cing 'chag tu bcug pa la sogs pa byas na sbom po'o //
translated: If one says, “In that case, I will die,” but still does not believe it, and one acts accordingly, it is a serious offense.🔽If one says, “I am not able to do this because of my illness,” and one is led by force, and one is made to walk, and so on, it is a serious offense.

original: shir zad ces nad g-yog ma byas na'o zhes pa ni myur du shi yang bla bar bsams te nad g-yog ma byas na sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: shir zad ces nad g-yog ma byas na'o zhes pa ni myur du shi yang bla bar bsams te nad g-yog ma byas na sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one does not nurse the sick, thinking, “Let them die,” it is a serious offense.

original: mi 'phrod pa'i zas sbyin na'o zhes pa ni nad pa dang mi 'phrod par shes pa'i zas sbyin na sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'phrod pa'i zas sbyin na'o zhes pa ni nad pa dang mi 'phrod par shes pa'i zas sbyin na sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one gives food that is not suitable for the sick, it is a serious offense.

original: 'bras ma smin pa brtol na'o zhes pa 'di'ang sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras ma smin pa brtol na'o zhes pa 'di'ang sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one breaks open unripe fruit, it is a serious offense.

original: sa gtams su 'jug pa dang sgo bar du 'tshir ba la sogs pa'i nan can byed na'o zhes pa 'di lta bu la sogs pa'i nan la 'dor na yang sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sa gtams su 'jug pa dang sgo bar du 'tshir ba la sogs pa'i nan can byed na'o zhes pa 'di lta bu la sogs pa'i nan la 'dor na yang sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is a serious offense if one throws him down a cliff, or if one presses him between doors, and so on.

original: 'di yan chad du bstan pa ni bsad sems med du zin yang brlang sems su gyur pa'i phyir sbom por 'gyur ba sha stag go /
analyzed: 'di yan chad du bstan pa ni bsad sems med du zin yang brlang sems su gyur pa'i phyir sbom por 'gyur ba sha stag go /
translated: Up to this point, even if one does not have the intention to kill, because one has a violent attitude, it is only a serious offense.

original: g-yang du 'dor ba dang 'gegs pa la sogs pas 'chir rtsol na'o zhes pa ni 'di ltar byed cing bdag 'chir rtsol na ma shir zin kyang sbom por 'gyur ba'o //🔽nad pa la mtshon dang thag srad gya tshom du mi sbyin zhes pa ni dgos pa'i don ched mad pa 'am /
analyzed: g-yang du 'dor ba dang 'gegs pa la sogs pas 'chir rtsol na'o zhes pa ni 'di ltar byed cing bdag 'chir rtsol na ma shir zin kyang sbom por 'gyur ba'o // nad pa la mtshon dang thag srad gya tshom du mi sbyin zhes pa ni dgos pa'i don ched mad pa 'am /
translated: If one tries to kill by throwing him over a cliff, or by strangling him, and so on, it is like this: if one tries to kill oneself, even if one does not die, it is a serious offense.🔽One should not give a sick person a weapon or a rope thoughtlessly.

original: 'chir rtsol lam mi rtsol ba'i nyams drod dang ma sbyar bar thag srad la sogs pa gya tshom du ma sbyin cig pa ste /
analyzed: 'chir rtsol lam mi rtsol ba'i nyams drod dang ma sbyar bar thag srad la sogs pa gya tshom du ma sbyin cig pa ste /
translated: One should not give a weapon or a rope thoughtlessly without regard for whether the patient is trying to kill himself or not.

original: gong du 'chi ba'i yo byad mi gzhag ces pa ni nad g-yog gis bya ba yin gyi 'di ni dge slong ngo cog spyis bya'o //🔽zhal ta shes bzhin du bya zhes pa ni mkhar lan la sogs pa g-yos pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gong du 'chi ba'i yo byad mi gzhag ces pa ni nad g-yog gis bya ba yin gyi 'di ni dge slong ngo cog spyis bya'o // zhal ta shes bzhin du bya zhes pa ni mkhar lan la sogs pa g-yos pa'i tshe /
translated: The statement above, Do not leave the dying person unattended, refers to the duties of the nurse, but this verse refers to the general duties of all monks.

original: las mi'i smas 'grums su mi 'gyur ba'i zhal ta char gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: las mi'i smas 'grums su mi 'gyur ba'i zhal ta char gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase act with full awareness means that when you are preparing food, such as gruel, for the sick person, you should do so in a way that does not harm the workers.

original: sngags kyis thal mos bsnun pa yang ngo zhes pa ni gdon 'dres zin pa'i nad pa la 'debs pa ni thal mo la bzlas te bsnun pa lta bu @60a * //
analyzed: sngags kyis thal mos bsnun pa yang ngo zhes pa ni gdon 'dres zin pa'i nad pa la 'debs pa ni thal mo la bzlas te bsnun pa lta bu @60a * //
translated: The phrase even if you have to strike with your hand means that when you are treating a patient who is possessed by a spirit, you should recite a mantra over your hand and then strike the patient.

original: yang ma 'os pa'i drag shul ma byed par ji ran du gyis shig pa'o //🔽brnangs pa brdegs pa yang ngo zhes pa ni brnangs pa dbyung ba'i phyir brdegs pa yang ji ran du gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: yang ma 'os pa'i drag shul ma byed par ji ran du gyis shig pa'o // brnangs pa brdegs pa yang ngo zhes pa ni brnangs pa dbyung ba'i phyir brdegs pa yang ji ran du gyis shig pa'o //
translated: You should do this in a way that is appropriate to the situation, without being too harsh.🔽 The phrase even if you have to beat him means that if you have to beat the patient in order to remove something from his throat, you should do so in a way that is appropriate to the situation.

original: sbab btang ba yang de ltar shin tu brtags par gyur nas so zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sbab btang ba yang de ltar shin tu brtags par gyur nas so zhes pa ni /
translated: The phrase even if you have to let him out means that you should do this after you have carefully examined the patient.

original: 'og na mi yod dam med pa la sogs pa gong du smos pa ltar shes bzhin du brtags la /
analyzed: 'og na mi yod dam med pa la sogs pa gong du smos pa ltar shes bzhin du brtags la /
translated: As stated above, Is there a person below or not? and so forth, examine with introspection.

original: de nas gdod thong shig pa'o //
analyzed: de nas gdod thong shig pa'o //
translated: Then, only then, say let go.

original: mod zhan pa logs su ba khur lci ba bskur bar mi bya zhes pa ni shing lta bu mgo mjug ster bcad de 'degs pa na mod zhan pa'i logs su stongs shing grogs ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: mod zhan pa logs su ba khur lci ba bskur bar mi bya zhes pa ni shing lta bu mgo mjug ster bcad de 'degs pa na mod zhan pa'i logs su stongs shing grogs ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: Do not place a heavy load on the weak means that when lifting a log, for example, cut it into pieces and do not place it on the weak side, do not help them.

original: mgo 'dud la mi 'gro zhes pa ni thug re 'thab pa lta bu 'am lag 'gros ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: mgo 'dud la mi 'gro zhes pa ni thug re 'thab pa lta bu 'am lag 'gros ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: Do not go bowing the head means do not fight with each other or compete with each other.

original: ma bslabs par slob tu mi gzhug ces pa ni gtar ka la la sogs pa'i dpyad bdag byang bar mi shes na pha rol bdag la slob tu mi gzhug ces pa'o //
analyzed: ma bslabs par slob tu mi gzhug ces pa ni gtar ka la la sogs pa'i dpyad bdag byang bar mi shes na pha rol bdag la slob tu mi gzhug ces pa'o //
translated: Do not make the untrained train means that if one does not know how to perform a surgical procedure such as venesection, one should not make others train on oneself.

original: mtshon cha 'phen du ma gzhug ces pa ni mda' dang 'phang mdud la sogs pas lta ba tsam gyi phyir yang pha rol la 'phongs zhes ma zer cig pa'o //
analyzed: mtshon cha 'phen du ma gzhug ces pa ni mda' dang 'phang mdud la sogs pas lta ba tsam gyi phyir yang pha rol la 'phongs zhes ma zer cig pa'o //
translated: Do not shoot weapons means do not say shoot at others even for the sake of seeing arrows, slingshots, and so on.

original: nad pa mi nus pa lam du mi bkri zhes pa ni nad pa 'gro mi nus pa ma bkri shig pa'o //
analyzed: nad pa mi nus pa lam du mi bkri zhes pa ni nad pa 'gro mi nus pa ma bkri shig pa'o //
translated: “Do not lead a sick person who is unable to go on the path” means do not lead a sick person who is unable to go.

original: gsod pa'i phas pham pa bye brag tu nges pa'o //
analyzed: gsod pa'i phas pham pa bye brag tu nges pa'o //
translated: This is the specific definition of the defeating offense of killing.

original: gsod pa'i phas pham pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: gsod pa'i phas pham pa rdzogs so /
translated: The defeating offense of killing is complete.

original: // / gsod pa'i phas pham pa de ltar bstan nas /
analyzed: // / gsod pa'i phas pham pa de ltar bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the defeating offense of killing,

original: brdzun gyi phas pham pa de lta bu yin zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brdzun gyi phas pham pa de lta bu yin zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach “the defeating offense of lying is like that,”

original: bdag mi'i chos las bla ma dang ldan par 'du shes sbas te smra na'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag mi'i chos las bla ma dang ldan par 'du shes sbas te smra na'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: it is said, “If one conceals the perception that one possesses a quality superior to that of a human being and speaks.”

original: mi'i chos las bla ma dang ldan pa yang smras /
analyzed: mi'i chos las bla ma dang ldan pa yang smras /
translated: One speaks of possessing a quality superior to that of a human being.

original: 'du shes kyang sbas /
analyzed: 'du shes kyang sbas /
translated: One conceals the perception.🔽One speaks of being oneself.

original: bdag kyang yin par smra na pham par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bdag kyang yin par smra na pham par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one does this, one incurs a defeating offense.

original: mi las bla ma'i chos dang ldan par smras pa nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: mi las bla ma'i chos dang ldan par smras pa nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is it like to speak of possessing a quality superior to that of a human being?

original: mthong ngam mthong /
analyzed: mthong ngam mthong /
translated: “I saw it.”

original: sgra thos nga'i sgra thos /
analyzed: sgra thos nga'i sgra thos /
translated: “I heard the sound.”

original: thad du 'gro nga'i thang du 'ong /🔽lhan cig tu smras /
analyzed: thad du 'gro nga'i thang du 'ong / lhan cig tu smras /
translated: “I went to the plain.”🔽“I spoke together.”

original: kun du smras /
analyzed: kun du smras /
translated: “I spoke all around.”

original: mgu bar smras /
analyzed: mgu bar smras /
translated: “I spoke with delight.”

original: rtag par yang lhan cig tu 'grogs shing nga dang nga lhan cig go zhes zer na der gyur to zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: rtag par yang lhan cig tu 'grogs shing nga dang nga lhan cig go zhes zer na der gyur to zhes pa yin te /
translated: If one says, “I always associate with them and they are with me,” then that is the case.

original: 'di dag ltar 'ang drul zhing 'grogs pa skad du zer na mi las bla mar smras pa nyid du gyur to //
analyzed: 'di dag ltar 'ang drul zhing 'grogs pa skad du zer na mi las bla mar smras pa nyid du gyur to //
translated: If one says, “I have been with them in this way,” then that is the case.

original: mthong ngam mthong zhes pa la sogs pa nyi tsher 'gyur ram gang gi dmigs las @60b 'gyur ;
analyzed: mthong ngam mthong zhes pa la sogs pa nyi tsher 'gyur ram gang gi dmigs las @60b 'gyur ;
translated: If one says, “I saw them,” or “I saw such and such,” then that is the case.

original: dmigs nyid la bye brag ci yod ce na /🔽lha klu gnod sbyin dri za mi 'am ci yi dags 'dre /
analyzed: dmigs nyid la bye brag ci yod ce na / lha klu gnod sbyin dri za mi 'am ci yi dags 'dre /
translated: What is the difference between the two?🔽The difference is that of gods, nagas, yakshas, gandharvas, kinnaras, pretas, bhutas, kumbhandas, and pisachas.

original: grul bum lus srul po dag gi dmigs las so zhes pa dang phyag dar khrod kyi 'dre ni sbom por byed do zhes pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: grul bum lus srul po dag gi dmigs las so zhes pa dang phyag dar khrod kyi 'dre ni sbom por byed do zhes pa rnams yin te /
translated: The ghost of a charnel ground is a serious offense.

original: lha la sogs pa mthong ba yang mi las bla ma'i chos dang ldan pas gdod mthong bas na de dag mthong bas smras na mi las bla ma'i chos brdzun du smras pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lha la sogs pa mthong ba yang mi las bla ma'i chos dang ldan pas gdod mthong bas na de dag mthong bas smras na mi las bla ma'i chos brdzun du smras pa'i phyir /
translated: If one says, “I saw gods and so forth,” then that is the case because one sees them through the Dharma of a higher rebirth than a human.

original: pham par 'gyur ba dang / thal srin tsam gyis tshod mi las bla ma'i chos dang mi ldan yang mthong srid pa'i phyir de dag mthong ngo zhes brdzun du smras na sbom por 'gyur ba rnams ston to//
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba dang / thal srin tsam gyis tshod mi las bla ma'i chos dang mi ldan yang mthong srid pa'i phyir de dag mthong ngo zhes brdzun du smras na sbom por 'gyur ba rnams ston to//
translated: It is said that if one lies about seeing such phenomena, one commits a serious offense, since one would be lying about seeing phenomena that one has not seen.

original: mi las bla ma'i chos nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi las bla ma'i chos nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What are the phenomena that are higher than humans?

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes dang / bsam gtan dang tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa dang / 'bras bu dang / mngon par shes pa la sogs pa ni bla ma'i chos so zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes dang / bsam gtan dang tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa dang / 'bras bu dang / mngon par shes pa la sogs pa ni bla ma'i chos so zhes pa yin te /
translated: The phenomena that are higher than humans are the perception of impermanence and so on, the meditative concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless realm, the results and higher perceptions and so on.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes bcu dang / mi gtsang ba'i 'du shes bcu dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas pa la sogs pa gzugs med pa'i ris bzhi dang / rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi dang /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes bcu dang / mi gtsang ba'i 'du shes bcu dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas pa la sogs pa gzugs med pa'i ris bzhi dang / rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi dang /
translated: The ten perceptions of impermanence and so on, the ten perceptions of impurity, the four meditative concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless states such as infinite space and so on, the four results of virtuous effort such as stream enterer and so on, the six higher perceptions and so on are the phenomena that are higher than humans.

original: sngon gyi gnas dran pa la sogs pa mngon bar shes pa drug dang / gzhan yang zag pa yod pa dang med pa'i yon tan no cog mi las bla ma'i chos so //🔽rang gi mtshan nyid gzung bas nyon mongs pa dang las zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma ni sbom por byed do zhes pa ni lus sam gzugs la sogs pa gang yang rung ste dmigs pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid gzung bas 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas dran pa la sogs pa mngon bar shes pa drug dang / gzhan yang zag pa yod pa dang med pa'i yon tan no cog mi las bla ma'i chos so // rang gi mtshan nyid gzung bas nyon mongs pa dang las zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma ni sbom por byed do zhes pa ni lus sam gzugs la sogs pa gang yang rung ste dmigs pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid gzung bas 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs
translated: The six superknowledges, such as the recollection of former abodes, and also all the qualities of the realm of desire and the formless realm, are the Dharma of those higher than men.🔽The root downfall is incurred when one says, By apprehending the specific characteristics of objects, such as form, I will pacify the afflictions and karma, and so on.

original: pa 'dub cing dang lta ba'i zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma 'am rgyu tsam bdag la yong do zhes zer na sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: pa 'dub cing dang lta ba'i zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma 'am rgyu tsam bdag la yong do zhes zer na sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The root downfall is incurred when one says, By apprehending the specific characteristics of objects, such as form, I will pacify the afflictions, such as desire, and the karma, and I will create the mere sign of tranquility, the cause of liberation.

original: de la zhi gnas ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la zhi gnas ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Tranquility is of two kinds:

original: de kho na nyid yid la byed pa zhes bya ba dang / mos pa yid la bya ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid yid la byed pa zhes bya ba dang / mos pa yid la bya ba zhes bya'o //
translated: that which is called the mental orientation toward reality and that which is called the mental orientation toward faith.

original: de la de kho na nyid yid la byed pa ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: de la de kho na nyid yid la byed pa ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: The mental orientation toward reality is the perception of impermanence, and so on.

original: mos pa yid la byed pa ni tshad med pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa yid la byed pa ni tshad med pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The attention of aspiration is the immeasurables and so on.

original: rnam pa de gnyis kyang bsgom pa'i ngo bo nyid do /
analyzed: rnam pa de gnyis kyang bsgom pa'i ngo bo nyid do /
translated: Those two aspects are the essence of meditation.

original: ma chud pa ma yin pas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: ma chud pa ma yin pas bsdus pa'o //
translated: Since it is not incomplete, it is included.

original: de'i mtshan ma ni 'dod pa'i @61a * //🔽khams nas spyod pa'i mnyan pa dang / bsams pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mtshan ma ni 'dod pa'i @61a * // khams nas spyod pa'i mnyan pa dang / bsams pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: Its sign is the knowledge of the desire realm.

original: de la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are also two aspects:

original: nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa dang / mi ldang ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa dang / mi ldang ba'o //
translated: that which is associated with affliction and that which is not associated with affliction.

original: skabs 'dir ni mi gtsang ba la sogs pas nyon mongs pa dang ldang ba ma rdzogs pa la bya /
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni mi gtsang ba la sogs pas nyon mongs pa dang ldang ba ma rdzogs pa la bya /
translated: In this context, it refers to the incomplete knowledge of impurity and so on that is associated with affliction.

original: de dang ldan pa'i chos smra na de dang ldan bar ma smras pa ma yin zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i chos smra na de dang ldan bar ma smras pa ma yin zhes pa ni /
translated: If one possesses that, it is not the case that one does not possess the Dharma teacher.

original: dgon pa'i gnas yang ba 'di lta bu zhig na rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa la mi ma yin mi 'tsher zad kyi gzhan thams cad la 'tshe ba de na kho bo'ang 'dug 'dug ste ma gces so zhe'am /
analyzed: dgon pa'i gnas yang ba 'di lta bu zhig na rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa la mi ma yin mi 'tsher zad kyi gzhan thams cad la 'tshe ba de na kho bo'ang 'dug 'dug ste ma gces so zhe'am /
translated: In this isolated place, even stream-enterers and so on are not harmed by non-humans. However, all others are harmed. I also stay here and am not cherished.

original: yon bdag gi khyim 'di lta bu zhig na rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i stan ni spa ba 'ding ste /
analyzed: yon bdag gi khyim 'di lta bu zhig na rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i stan ni spa ba 'ding ste /
translated: In such and such a patron's house, the seats of stream-enterers and so forth are spread out, and I also sit there.

original: kho bo 'ang 'dug 'dug go zhes zer ba lta bur de dang ldan pa'i chos su smra na mi las bla ma'i chos dang ldan bar ma smras pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: kho bo 'ang 'dug 'dug go zhes zer ba lta bur de dang ldan pa'i chos su smra na mi las bla ma'i chos dang ldan bar ma smras pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: If one speaks of the Dharma as being endowed with that, one is not said to speak of the Dharma as being superior to humans.

original: bdag la bsams nas 'di lta bu dag yod do zhes khungs gzhan la 'byin cing ston pa'o zhes pa ni dngos su bdag nyid yin par bsgrub la khungs gud du 'byin te dge slong dag gi nang na lha mtho 'am lha dang 'drul ba dag lha yod ces
analyzed: bdag la bsams nas 'di lta bu dag yod do zhes khungs gzhan la 'byin cing ston pa'o zhes pa ni dngos su bdag nyid yin par bsgrub la khungs gud du 'byin te dge slong dag gi nang na lha mtho 'am lha dang 'drul ba dag lha yod ces
translated: If one says, I have such and such, thinking of oneself, and one cites another as a source and shows it, this is directly establishing oneself as the source. If one says, Among the monks, there are gods or those equal to gods,

original: zer na sbom por 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zer na sbom por 'gyur pa'o //
translated: one commits a serious offense.

original: khungs phyung na ma yin zhes pa ni gong ma skad du smra ba'i khungs bdag yin par smras na ni sbom po ma yin te rtsa bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: khungs phyung na ma yin zhes pa ni gong ma skad du smra ba'i khungs bdag yin par smras na ni sbom po ma yin te rtsa bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one does not cite a source, it is said that if one says, The source of the above statement is myself, it is not serious, but a root offense.

original: legs par ma bsams par lung mi bstan zhes pa ni /
analyzed: legs par ma bsams par lung mi bstan zhes pa ni /
translated: One should not give scriptural transmission without proper reflection.

original: mood gal gyi bus char 'bab pa la sogs par lung bstan pa lta bu gtan la bab pa'am legs par ma bsams pa'i lung ston pa ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: mood gal gyi bus char 'bab pa la sogs par lung bstan pa lta bu gtan la bab pa'am legs par ma bsams pa'i lung ston pa ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: Do not give predictions that are not well-considered, such as that Maudgalyayana's son will rain down.

original: brdzun smra ba rnam par 'byed pa'o /
analyzed: brdzun smra ba rnam par 'byed pa'o /
translated: This is the analysis of lying.🔽The analysis that occurs in the Vinaya is the teaching, but it does not occur in the Ksudraka Collection.

original: // / rnam par 'byed pa las 'byung ba ni bstan pa yin phran tshegs las 'byung ba ni med pas na zhus pa las 'byung ba ston pa ni /
analyzed: // / rnam par 'byed pa las 'byung ba ni bstan pa yin phran tshegs las 'byung ba ni med pas na zhus pa las 'byung ba ston pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the analysis that occurs in the Questions of Upali is:

original: thob pa las nyams par smras na bla ma ma smras pa ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: thob pa las nyams par smras na bla ma ma smras pa ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: If one says that one has degenerated from obtainment, it is not not saying that one has not degenerated from the guru, and so on.

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi las nyams so zhes thob pa las nyams pa skad du zer na bla ma'i chos ma smras pa ma yin te pham par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi las nyams so zhes thob pa las nyams pa skad du zer na bla ma'i chos ma smras pa ma yin te pham par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one says that one has degenerated from the four results of the sravaka, it is not not saying that one has degenerated from the guru's Dharma, and so on.

original: bla ma smra bar 'dod nas ming mthun pa'i don brjod na sbom po'o zhes pa ni so sor thar pa la sogs pa slob pa la brten te nga slob pa yin no @61b zhe na /
analyzed: bla ma smra bar 'dod nas ming mthun pa'i don brjod na sbom po'o zhes pa ni so sor thar pa la sogs pa slob pa la brten te nga slob pa yin no @61b zhe na /
translated: If one wishes to say that one has degenerated from the guru, but one expresses the meaning with similar words, it is a serious violation.

original: so sor thar pa lobs zin pa la brten te ma slob pa'o zhes zer ba lta bu la sogs pa ni bla ma smra bar 'dod nas de skad du brgyud pas na sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: so sor thar pa lobs zin pa la brten te ma slob pa'o zhes zer ba lta bu la sogs pa ni bla ma smra bar 'dod nas de skad du brgyud pas na sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One who says, I have already learned the pratimoksa, but I am not training in it, is a serious offense because he is a guru who speaks in this way.

original: log na'o zhes pa ni nga ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o zhes smra bar brtsams pa las /
analyzed: log na'o zhes pa ni nga ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o zhes smra bar brtsams pa las /
translated: If one says, I am a stream enterer, but then says,

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'o zhes smras pa de lta bu ji ltar bsams bzhin du ma grub pas na sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'o zhes smras pa de lta bu ji ltar bsams bzhin du ma grub pas na sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: I am a once returner, then since it is not established as one thinks, it is a serious offense.🔽If one says, You are a stream enterer, but then says,

original: zur zer na yang ngo zhes pa ni khyod rgyun du zhugs na yu bo cag rgyun du zhugs pa gnyis yod pa zhig na zhe'am /
analyzed: zur zer na yang ngo zhes pa ni khyod rgyun du zhugs na yu bo cag rgyun du zhugs pa gnyis yod pa zhig na zhe'am /
translated: If you are a stream enterer, then we have two stream enterers, or

original: khyod dang 'dra bar gyur na yu bo cag gnyis rgyun du zhugs pa 'thob kyang srid na zhes zur zer ba lta bu yang sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: khyod dang 'dra bar gyur na yu bo cag gnyis rgyun du zhugs pa 'thob kyang srid na zhes zur zer ba lta bu yang sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If you become like me, then we may obtain stream enterer, then it is a serious offense.

original: gong ma skad du sngar smras la mjug la nga ni ma yin zhes pa lta bu bden pa mjug la brtags la blon nam mi blon zhe na /
analyzed: gong ma skad du sngar smras la mjug la nga ni ma yin zhes pa lta bu bden pa mjug la brtags la blon nam mi blon zhe na /
translated: If one says to a superior, I said this before, but now I am not, and if one examines the truth of the end, one may think, Should I be a minister or not?

original: phyis yang dag par na yang de ma gyur ba ma yin zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: phyis yang dag par na yang de ma gyur ba ma yin zhes pa yin te /
translated: Later, if one says, In reality, I did not do that, one is not a minister.

original: phyis bden pa smras kyang des mi blon te sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: phyis bden pa smras kyang des mi blon te sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Even if one speaks the truth later, one is not a minister, and it is a serious offense.

original: zhus par gtogs pa'o /
analyzed: zhus par gtogs pa'o /
translated: This is included in questioning.

original: // / bye brag tu nges pa las 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: // / bye brag tu nges pa las 'byung ba ni /
translated: From the Vinaya it says:

original: btsun pa dgra bcom na gos la sogs pa'i mchog 'os so //
analyzed: btsun pa dgra bcom na gos la sogs pa'i mchog 'os so //
translated: Venerable, one who is an arhat is worthy of the best robes and so forth.

original: sdig pa'i chos spangs pas na bram ze'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i chos spangs pas na bram ze'o //
translated: Because they have abandoned sinful qualities, they are brahmins.

original: btsun pas dbang po drug shin tu btul sbas bsrungs pa bsgoms so zhes smras kyang mi smra bar khas blangs na sbom po'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: btsun pas dbang po drug shin tu btul sbas bsrungs pa bsgoms so zhes smras kyang mi smra bar khas blangs na sbom po'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: If one says, Venerable, the six senses are well subdued, hidden, guarded, and cultivated, but accepts it without speaking, it is a serious offense.

original: pha rol gyis rnam pa 'di gnyis skad du lkugs na mi smra /
analyzed: pha rol gyis rnam pa 'di gnyis skad du lkugs na mi smra /
translated: If one remains silent when the other speaks in these two ways,

original: kha rog pa'i tshul gyis khas len na sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: kha rog pa'i tshul gyis khas len na sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: if one accepts it in a quiet manner, it is a serious offense.

original: de la mi gcang ba la sogs pa bsgoms pas dul ba ni shin tu btul ba'o //
analyzed: de la mi gcang ba la sogs pa bsgoms pas dul ba ni shin tu btul ba'o //
translated: The well-tamed is the taming by the meditation of the non-contempt, etc.

original: zag pa med pa'i las skyes pas dben pa ni shin tu sbas pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i las skyes pas dben pa ni shin tu sbas pa'o //
translated: The well-hidden is the seclusion by the arising of the uncontaminated action.

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin pas btsas pa ni shin tu bsrungs pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin pas btsas pa ni shin tu bsrungs pa'o //
translated: The well-guarded is the protection by the mindfulness and the self-possession.

original: mi rtsod pa la sogs pa mngon du byas pa ni shin tu bsgoms pa'o //🔽gal te btsun pa dgra bcom pa na bdag gi bsod snyoms bzhes /
analyzed: mi rtsod pa la sogs pa mngon du byas pa ni shin tu bsgoms pa'o // gal te btsun pa dgra bcom pa na bdag gi bsod snyoms bzhes /
translated: The well-cultivated is the realization of the non-quarrel, etc.🔽If the Venerable Arhat accepts my alms-food,

original: khyim du byon ;
analyzed: khyim du byon ;
translated: he should come to my house,

original: stan la bzhugs /
analyzed: stan la bzhugs /
translated: sit on the seat,

original: phyag rtsabs ba zhes /
analyzed: phyag rtsabs ba zhes /
translated: wash his feet,🔽eat the food,

original: bshos gsol / skrums dang bcas pa snoms /🔽rjes su yi rang bar mdzod /
analyzed: bshos gsol / skrums dang bcas pa snoms / rjes su yi rang bar mdzod /
translated: take the leftovers,🔽and depart.

original: gshegs she na de bzhin du byed pa'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gshegs she na de bzhin du byed pa'o zhes pa ni /
translated: I will do so is the definite lie.

original: 'di skad du byas na'ang mi smra bar de bzhin du byed na sbom por 'gyur ba'o //🔽brdzun bye @62a * //
analyzed: 'di skad du byas na'ang mi smra bar de bzhin du byed na sbom por 'gyur ba'o // brdzun bye @62a * //
translated: Even if he does it this way, if he does not speak, but does it anyway, it is a sthūlātyaya.

original: brag tu nges pa'o //
analyzed: brag tu nges pa'o //
translated: The definite lie is the lie that is certain.

original: bla ma'i brdzun rdzogs so /
analyzed: bla ma'i brdzun rdzogs so /
translated: The lie of the guru is finished.

original: // / phas pham pa bzhi de ltar bstan nas /
analyzed: // / phas pham pa bzhi de ltar bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the four defeats in this way,

original: khu ba 'byin pa la sogs pa dge 'dun gyi lhag ma da ston pa ni /
analyzed: khu ba 'byin pa la sogs pa dge 'dun gyi lhag ma da ston pa ni /
translated: The remaining offenses of the monks are the emission of semen and so on.🔽

original: rmi lam na ni med pa bzhin no zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: rmi lam na ni med pa bzhin no zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The teacher shows that the residual category of the Saṅgha is like a dream, etc.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du bya ba la ma gtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du bya ba la ma gtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not included in worldly conventions,

original: rmi lam du med pa bzhin no //🔽de'i 'bras bu'ang ma byas pa'o zhes pa ni rmi lam du khu ba 'byin pa la sogs pa lus dang ngag gi rnam grangs g-yos pa ni byas pa'am /
analyzed: rmi lam du med pa bzhin no // de'i 'bras bu'ang ma byas pa'o zhes pa ni rmi lam du khu ba 'byin pa la sogs pa lus dang ngag gi rnam grangs g-yos pa ni byas pa'am /
translated: it is like a dream.🔽The result of that is also not produced.

original: dngos su bsgrubs pa ma yin par ston pa'o //
analyzed: dngos su bsgrubs pa ma yin par ston pa'o //
translated: This shows that the movement of the body and speech in a dream, such as emitting semen, is not produced or directly accomplished.

original: de'i yan lag ston pa ni 'byin pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i yan lag ston pa ni 'byin pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The teacher shows its branches, such as emitting, etc.

original: 'byin par byed pa'ang yan lag gcig go //
analyzed: 'byin par byed pa'ang yan lag gcig go //
translated: Emitting is one branch.

original: de'ang ji lta bur bsams pas she na /
analyzed: de'ang ji lta bur bsams pas she na /
translated: Moreover, how is it imagined?

original: der 'dod na zhes pa yin te 'byin 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: der 'dod na zhes pa yin te 'byin 'dod pa'o //
translated: If one desires that, it is the desire to emit.

original: de yang su zhe na nyid kyi khu ba zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang su zhe na nyid kyi khu ba zhes pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, who is it? It is one’s own semen.

original: pha rol gyi ma yin gyi bdag gi'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyi ma yin gyi bdag gi'o //
translated: It is not the other’s, but one’s own.

original: gnas nas 'phags pa dang sbubs su son pa dang / dbang po las thal ba'i bye brag phal cher yod na gang ltar phyung ba lhag mar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gnas nas 'phags pa dang sbubs su son pa dang / dbang po las thal ba'i bye brag phal cher yod na gang ltar phyung ba lhag mar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the semen is emitted from its place, enters the sheath, and is emitted from the organ, then it is emitted in most cases. But if it is emitted in some other way, is it still emitted?

original: thog mar zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: thog mar zhes pa yin te /
translated: It is emitted if it is emitted from the beginning.

original: mkhris pa lta bur lus la de'i yul gud du nges par med kyi /
analyzed: mkhris pa lta bur lus la de'i yul gud du nges par med kyi /
translated: It is not that the semen is in a particular place in the body, like bile.

original: bu ram shing dang yungs kar bsngos pa lta bur lus kun la khyab par yod pas na /
analyzed: bu ram shing dang yungs kar bsngos pa lta bur lus kun la khyab par yod pas na /
translated: It is like sugarcane or sesame oil, which are found throughout the plant or seed.

original: thog ma'i gnas nas bskyod cing spags pas lhag mar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: thog ma'i gnas nas bskyod cing spags pas lhag mar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Therefore, if it is emitted from its place, it is emitted.

original: thog ma nas g-yos pa'i tshad ni 'dod chags cher ldang ba dang / bde ba'i nyams lhag par skye ba dang / snying 'dar zhing yan lag g-yo ba yin no zhes myong ba kha cig zer ro //
analyzed: thog ma nas g-yos pa'i tshad ni 'dod chags cher ldang ba dang / bde ba'i nyams lhag par skye ba dang / snying 'dar zhing yan lag g-yo ba yin no zhes myong ba kha cig zer ro //
translated: Some masters say that the measure of emission from the beginning is when the passion increases, the experience of pleasure increases, and the heart trembles and the limbs move.

original: 'byin par 'dod pa yang bde ba'i don la sogs pa rnam pa mang po zhig gi ched du'ang 'byin na gang gi phyir phyung bas nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'byin par 'dod pa yang bde ba'i don la sogs pa rnam pa mang po zhig gi ched du'ang 'byin na gang gi phyir phyung bas nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one wishes to emit semen for many purposes, such as for the sake of pleasure, why is it a fault to emit it?

original: bde ba dang reg pa dang sa bon dang sman dang / sad pa rnams kyi phyir na bye brag med ces pa yin te /
analyzed: bde ba dang reg pa dang sa bon dang sman dang / sad pa rnams kyi phyir na bye brag med ces pa yin te /
translated: The phrase “without distinction” means that it is for the sake of pleasure, contact, seed, medicine, and fire.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams gang gi phyir phyung yang lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams gang gi phyir phyung yang lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever is mentioned by name is what is meant by “etc.”

original: de yang rnam pa gang gis 'byin ce na /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gang gis 'byin ce na /
translated: By what means does one emit?

original: reg pa zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: reg pa zhes pa yin te /
translated: The phrase “contact” is supplied.

original: tshul bzhin yid la mi byed pa la sogs pas ma yin gyi reg pas so //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la mi byed pa la sogs pas ma yin gyi reg pas so //
translated: One does not emit through improper attention, and so on, but through contact.

original: reg pa tsam gyis nyed par 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: reg pa tsam gyis nyed par 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Does one emit merely through contact?

original: 'bad pa @62b zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bad pa @62b zhes pa yin te /

translated: If it is done by showing, it is also a fault. If one likes and is attached to the above being done by a woman, one will have a full fault.

original: gos kyis bar bcad pa ni 'og ma'o zhes pa ni gos kyis bar du bcad de reg na sbom por 'gyur ba'o//
analyzed: gos kyis bar bcad pa ni 'og ma'o zhes pa ni gos kyis bar du bcad de reg na sbom por 'gyur ba'o//
translated: If it is interrupted by cloth, it is a minor offense. If one touches while interrupted by cloth, it becomes a serious offense.

original: nyes byas 'god pa las gzhan ma yin zhes pa ni spyad du mi bzod pa la gos kyis bar bcad de reg pa reg pa'i tshe nyes byas /
analyzed: nyes byas 'god pa las gzhan ma yin zhes pa ni spyad du mi bzod pa la gos kyis bar bcad de reg pa reg pa'i tshe nyes byas /
translated: It is not different from the offense of emission. If one cannot bear to be touched, and touches while interrupted by cloth, it is a minor offense at the time of touch.

original: sbyor ba'i tshe ni nyes pa gzhan du dbab tu med pas nyes byas kyang sbom por ston pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i tshe ni nyes pa gzhan du dbab tu med pas nyes byas kyang sbom por ston pa'o //
translated: At the time of the application, since the fault cannot be transferred to another, even a minor fault is taught to be a serious one.

original: dge slong ma la mi reg ces pa ni chags pa med kyang ma reg @66a * //
analyzed: dge slong ma la mi reg ces pa ni chags pa med kyang ma reg @66a * //
translated: Do not touch a nun means do not touch her even without attachment.

original: shig pa'o // bud med la ma yin zhes pa ni dge slong ma yin pa'i bud med gzhan la'ang ma reg shig pa'o //
analyzed: shig pa'o // bud med la ma yin zhes pa ni dge slong ma yin pa'i bud med gzhan la'ang ma reg shig pa'o //
translated: Do not touch a woman means do not touch a woman who is not a nun.

original: de ltar na bud med gang la'ang reg tu ye mi rung ngam zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na bud med gang la'ang reg tu ye mi rung ngam zhe na /
translated: Thus, is it never permissible to touch any woman?

original: reg par bya ba ni chus khyer ba brgyal te zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: reg par bya ba ni chus khyer ba brgyal te zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Touching is permissible if she is carried away by water, faints and so on.

original: chus khyer ba lta bu bzung ba'i tshe ni rag kyang bla'o //
analyzed: chus khyer ba lta bu bzung ba'i tshe ni rag kyang bla'o //
translated: If she is carried away by water, it is permissible to touch her even with attachment.

original: brtse bas sdug bsngal dang 'brel ba ni nyes med ces kyang 'og nas 'byung na /
analyzed: brtse bas sdug bsngal dang 'brel ba ni nyes med ces kyang 'og nas 'byung na /
translated: If she is afflicted by suffering due to compassion, there is no fault, as will be stated later.

original: 'di skad du bstan pa cir dgos she na /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan pa cir dgos she na /
translated: What is the purpose of teaching this?

original: mdo 'og nas 'byung ba'i yul bstan dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo 'og nas 'byung ba'i yul bstan dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is for the purpose of teaching the object that will be stated in the sutra below.

original: dpung pa 'am skra nas so zhes pa ni gong ma ltar dbyung ba yang skra 'am ;
analyzed: dpung pa 'am skra nas so zhes pa ni gong ma ltar dbyung ba yang skra 'am ;
translated: Touch her by the shoulder or hair means if she is carried away by water, it is permissible to pull her out by the hair or by the shoulder.

original: dpung pa nas bzung la phyung shig pa'o //
analyzed: dpung pa nas bzung la phyung shig pa'o //
translated: Hold him by the shoulders and pull him out!

original: ma dang bu sring gi 'du shes gzhag ste'o zhes pa ni chus khyer ba 'di'ang /
analyzed: ma dang bu sring gi 'du shes gzhag ste'o zhes pa ni chus khyer ba 'di'ang /
translated: Place the idea of mother, son, and sister, means Hold him with the idea that this one being carried away by the water

original: 'di lta bu'i 'du shes zhog la zung shig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i 'du shes zhog la zung shig pa'o //
translated: is like this, and so on.

original: dran pa brta ba'i phyir bye phung la khas spub ste gzhag ces pa ni chus khyer ba phyi nas gzag cing brta ba'i thabs 'di ltar gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa brta ba'i phyir bye phung la khas spub ste gzhag ces pa ni chus khyer ba phyi nas gzag cing brta ba'i thabs 'di ltar gyis shig pa'o //
translated: In order to be mindful, lie down on the ground, face down, and rest, means The method of being carried away by the water and being rescued is like this.

original: bsrung ba ni khri'u bzhin zhes pa ni bdag gis las kyang mi gtong bar rgyangs kyis bsrungs pa khri'u bzhin du gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: bsrung ba ni khri'u bzhin zhes pa ni bdag gis las kyang mi gtong bar rgyangs kyis bsrungs pa khri'u bzhin du gyis shig pa'o //
translated: As for protection, it is like a bench, means Do not give up your work, but protect it like a bench.

original: zas la 'gro ba ni ba lang rdzi dang phyugs rdzi la bcol zhes pa ni zas la 'gro na thabs 'di ltar gyis shig pa'o ;
analyzed: zas la 'gro ba ni ba lang rdzi dang phyugs rdzi la bcol zhes pa ni zas la 'gro na thabs 'di ltar gyis shig pa'o ;
translated: As for going for alms, it is like a cowherd and a herdsman, means When going for alms, do it like this.

original: /'tsho 'am mi 'tsho ba yang dang yang brtag par bya zhes pa ni 'tsho 'am mi 'tsho skabs skabs su rtogs shig pa'o //
analyzed: /'tsho 'am mi 'tsho ba yang dang yang brtag par bya zhes pa ni 'tsho 'am mi 'tsho skabs skabs su rtogs shig pa'o //

original: brtse zhing sems gtsang na bud med kyis bkyud pa nyes med ces pa ni bdag gi sems brtse ba'am skyon med na bud med 'khyud cing 'dzin du bcug kyang bla bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: brtse zhing sems gtsang na bud med kyis bkyud pa nyes med ces pa ni bdag gi sems brtse ba'am skyon med na bud med 'khyud cing 'dzin du bcug kyang bla bar ston pa'o //
translated: If one is compassionate and pure in mind, it is not wrong to be embraced by a woman. This shows that if one has a compassionate mind or is faultless, then even if one is made to embrace and hold a woman, there is no fault.

original: lus reg pa rnam par 'byed pa'o /
analyzed: lus reg pa rnam par 'byed pa'o /
translated: This is the analysis of the contact of the body.

original: // / da ni zhus pa dang bye brag tu nges pa las reg pa'i bye brag 'dod pas reg pa dang dra ma'i tshul dang / 'phyar ba dang dra ma dang mthun pa dang / mi 'dod bzhin du reg pa lnga 'byung ba ston te /

translated: Now, from among the questions and specific ascertainments, it shows the five types of contact that arise: contact through desire, the method of the net, contact that is like a net, contact that is like a net and a snare, and contact that is not desired.

original: 'jam mnyen dro ba'i bsams pas na sbom po'o zhes pa ni 'dod chags kyis ma yin gyi 'di dag lta bu'i bsams pas rag na sbom por 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jam mnyen dro ba'i bsams pas na sbom po'o zhes pa ni 'dod chags kyis ma yin gyi 'di dag lta bu'i bsams pas rag na sbom por 'gyur te /

original: 'di ni reg pa'i khyad par 'dod pa'i reg pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni reg pa'i khyad par 'dod pa'i reg pa'o //

original: brtse bas sdug bsngal dang 'brel ba ni nyes med ces pa ni me dang @66b g-yang du 'dor bar rtsol ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal las dbyung ba'i phyir reg pa ni nyes med pa'o //

translated: The statement There is no offense if the suffering is due to affection means that there is no offense if one causes pain in order to remove greater suffering, such as when one tries to remove a child from a fire or a pit.

original: ma dang bu sring la de'i 'du shes kyis so zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ma dang bu sring la de'i 'du shes kyis so zhes pa ni /
translated: The statement if one has the perception of mother, daughter, or sister means that

original: bslangs dang sa dang bong ba la sogs pa bud med kyi dbang por 'jug na sbom po zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: bslangs dang sa dang bong ba la sogs pa bud med kyi dbang por 'jug na sbom po zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The statement if one is practicing in order to attain the state of a buddha means that there is no offense if one engages in sexual intercourse with one's wife in order to attain the state of a buddha.

original: 'di dag ltar byed na sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ltar byed na sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If you do these things, it is a serious offense.🔽If you touch a woman with your foot or shoulder, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: rkang pa dang phrag pas bud med phul na nyes byas zhes pa ni yengs pa'i sems kyis 'di dag ltar byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rkang pa dang phrag pas bud med phul na nyes byas zhes pa ni yengs pa'i sems kyis 'di dag ltar byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //

original: de'i stan la yang ngo zhes pa ni bud med 'dug kyang rung mi 'dug kyang rung ste de'i stan du rkang pa la sogs pas bskyod cing bskul na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ba ste /

original: mdo 'di gsum ni 'phyar bas reg pa'o //
analyzed: mdo 'di gsum ni 'phyar bas reg pa'o //

analyzed: bud med bred de 'gyel ba bslang ba'o zhes pa ni 'di ltar gyur pa nyid kyis 'ongs pa tsam gyi tshod la slong na nyes byas so //
translated: If a woman is frightened and falls down, and you help her up, it is an offense of wrong conduct if you do so just because you want to touch her.

original: mdo 'di ni dra ma dang mthun par reg pa'o //🔽'di gsum bud med kyis na nyes med ces pa ni /
analyzed: mdo 'di ni dra ma dang mthun par reg pa'o // 'di gsum bud med kyis na nyes med ces pa ni /
translated: This passage concerns touching a woman in a way that is not in accordance with propriety.🔽These three are not offenses if the woman initiates them.

original: mdo gong ma gsum bud med kyis tshur byas pa ni nyes med pa'o //
analyzed: mdo gong ma gsum bud med kyis tshur byas pa ni nyes med pa'o //
translated: These three passages do not constitute an offense if the woman initiates the contact.

original: bzung ba yang ngo zhes pa ni dge slong nyid mi 'dod bzhin du bud med kyis bzung ba ni nyes med /
analyzed: bzung ba yang ngo zhes pa ni dge slong nyid mi 'dod bzhin du bud med kyis bzung ba ni nyes med /
translated: Also, if a woman holds him is also without fault means that if a woman holds a monk who does not wish it, there is no fault.

original: mas bkyud na'o zhes pa ni mas bkyud pa nyes med /
analyzed: mas bkyud na'o zhes pa ni mas bkyud pa nyes med /
translated: If she embraces him from behind means that if she embraces him from behind, there is no fault.

analyzed: bu mo pang par 'dug pa'o zhes pa ni 'di ltar gyur pa la'ang nyes med /

original: bud med 'gyel te steng du ltung ba'o zhes pa ni /🔽bud med bsdad cing bsdos pas bdag gi steng du ltung ngam /
analyzed: bud med 'gyel te steng du ltung ba'o zhes pa ni / bud med bsdad cing bsdos pas bdag gi steng du ltung ngam /

analyzed: bdag bsdad cing bsdos pas bud med kyi steng du lhung ba la nyes med pa ste /

original: 'di dag ni mi 'dod bzhin du reg pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni mi 'dod bzhin du reg pa'o //
translated: These are unintentional contacts.

original: lus reg pa bye brag tu nges pa'o //
analyzed: lus reg pa bye brag tu nges pa'o //
translated: This is the specific analysis of physical contact.

original: lus reg pa'o /
analyzed: lus reg pa'o /

original: // / smra ba dge 'dun gyi lhag ma 'chad par 'dod pa ni /
analyzed: // / smra ba dge 'dun gyi lhag ma 'chad par 'dod pa ni /
translated: The chapter on the Saṅgha’s remainder offenses that are spoken of is

original: rgyo tshig tu smra @67a * //🔽na'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyo tshig tu smra @67a * //🔽na'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: if he speaks with words of teasing.

original: gong du legs par smras pa'i zur cha 'go zhing spyad bzod pa dang / de'i bde ba dang chags pa zhes smos pa rnams lta bus rgyo ba'i tshig smras na dge 'dun gyi lhag mar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gong du legs par smras pa'i zur cha 'go zhing spyad bzod pa dang / de'i bde ba dang chags pa zhes smos pa rnams lta bus rgyo ba'i tshig smras na dge 'dun gyi lhag mar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one speaks words that are filled with the above mentioned terms, such as “well spoken” and “forbearance,” and “the bliss and attachment” and so on, then one commits a partial defeat of the Saṅgha.

original: ji lta bur smras pas smre tshig tu 'gyur zhe na ;
analyzed: ji lta bur smras pas smre tshig tu 'gyur zhe na ;

original: rgyo ba la sogs pa'i don gyis zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyo ba la sogs pa'i don gyis zhes pa yin te /

original: de la gnyug ma dang nye bar gdags pa gnyis yod pa las /
analyzed: de la gnyug ma dang nye bar gdags pa gnyis yod pa las /

original: mi tshangs par spyod pa dang 'khrig pa zhes bya ba lta bu gnyug ma'i tshig smras na nyes pa rangs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mi tshangs par spyod pa dang 'khrig pa zhes bya ba lta bu gnyug ma'i tshig smras na nyes pa rangs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If one speaks natural terms such as “unclean conduct” and “copulation,” then one commits a serious offense.

original: nga dang lhan cig tu nyol zhes pa la sogs pa nye ba'i tshig gis na nyes pa rangs par mi 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: nga dang lhan cig tu nyol zhes pa la sogs pa nye ba'i tshig gis na nyes pa rangs par mi 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
translated: If one speaks figurative terms such as “sleep with me,” and so on, then one does not commit a serious offense.

original: 'di yang bdag gi phyir ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di yang bdag gi phyir ma yin gyi /
translated: This is not for one’s own sake,

original: gzhan gyi phyir na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyir na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: but for the sake of others, and so it is a serious offense.

original: smre tshig tu smra ba de yang yi ge dang tshig du mas bsgrubs pa yang yong /
analyzed: smre tshig tu smra ba de yang yi ge dang tshig du mas bsgrubs pa yang yong /
translated: The words of regret are also accomplished by many letters and words.

original: nyang nyung gis bsgrubs pa'ang yod na ;
analyzed: nyang nyung gis bsgrubs pa'ang yod na ;
translated: There are also those accomplished by few.

original: gang gis nyes par 'gyur ba ston pa ni /
analyzed: gang gis nyes par 'gyur ba ston pa ni /
translated: The teaching on what constitutes a downfall is:

original: gang gis brda phrad par gyur na de go ba'i mtha'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gis brda phrad par gyur na de go ba'i mtha'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: “When there is understanding through the use of symbols, that is the end of understanding.”

original: yi ge dang tshig 'di snyed cig gis nyes par 'gyur zhes grangs chad pa med kyi /
analyzed: yi ge dang tshig 'di snyed cig gis nyes par 'gyur zhes grangs chad pa med kyi /

original: gang smra bar 'dod pa des yi ge 'am tshig tu smras kyang rung ste /
analyzed: gang smra bar 'dod pa des yi ge 'am tshig tu smras kyang rung ste /
translated: It is taught that when one wishes to say something, it is sufficient to say the letters or words.

original: nam brda phrad par gyur na go ba'i mtha' des gzung bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: nam brda phrad par gyur na go ba'i mtha' des gzung bar ston pa'o //
translated: When there is understanding through the use of symbols, that is the end of understanding.

original: don des rtogs par smra na ni sbyor na ma yin zhes pa ni rgyo tshig nyid smra bar ma bstsal te /
analyzed: don des rtogs par smra na ni sbyor na ma yin zhes pa ni rgyo tshig nyid smra bar ma bstsal te /
translated: If one says something else that is understood by the meaning, it is not a downfall if it is not a direct expression.

original: de dang nye ba'i tshig gzhan smras na /
analyzed: de dang nye ba'i tshig gzhan smras na /
translated: If one says another word that is similar to the one intended,🔽it is not a serious downfall because it is not a direct expression.

original: rtsa bar sbyor ba ma yin pas sbom por yang mi 'gyur du reb bstsal ba'i phyir 'di smos pa yin te /
analyzed: rtsa bar sbyor ba ma yin pas sbom por yang mi 'gyur du reb bstsal ba'i phyir 'di smos pa yin te /
translated: This is stated to eliminate doubt.

original: de dang nye ba'i tshig smras na yang sbom por 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: de dang nye ba'i tshig smras na yang sbom por 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
translated: It shows that even if one speaks words that are close to those, it is a serious offense.

original: sngogs pa dang mi sngogs pa dang / gsol ba dang / 'jebs par gsol ba dang / 'dri ba dang / kun 'dri ba dang / bsnyad pa dang / yid smon dang / gshe ba dang / slar zlos pa'i tshig tha dad pa de dag la bye brag med ces pa ni ming gis smos pa'i tshig 'di dag / gang skad du smras kyang rung ste rgyo tshig dang bsres na lhag mar 'gyur du 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: sngogs pa dang mi sngogs pa dang / gsol ba dang / 'jebs par gsol ba dang / 'dri ba dang / kun 'dri ba dang / bsnyad pa dang / yid smon dang / gshe ba dang / slar zlos pa'i tshig tha dad pa de dag la bye brag med ces pa ni ming gis smos pa'i tshig 'di dag / gang skad du smras kyang rung ste rgyo tshig dang bsres na lhag mar 'gyur du 'dra ba'o //
translated: As for without distinction, the different words such as to hint, not to hint, to request, to request in detail, to ask, to ask in detail, to inform, to wish, to scold, and to repeat are similar in that if one mixes them with frivolous speech, they become a downfall, no matter what words are used.

original: de la sngogs pa ni sring mo khyod kyi sgo gsum ni yongs su rgyas pa'o zhes zer ba'o //
analyzed: de la sngogs pa ni sring mo khyod kyi sgo gsum ni yongs su rgyas pa'o zhes zer ba'o //
translated: As for to hint, it is to say, Sister, your three doors are very open.

analyzed: mi sngogs pa ni sgo gsum yongs su ma rgyas pa'o @67b zhes zer ba'o //

analyzed: gsol ba ni sring mo tshur 'di dang 'di lta bu dag bya'o zhes zer ba'o //

analyzed: 'jebs par gsol ba ni bud med kyis skyes pa la 'di lta bu dag byas na skyes pa de'i yid du 'ong zhing sdug pa yin bas na /

original: khyod kyis 'di dang 'di lta bu dag byas na /
analyzed: khyod kyis 'di dang 'di lta bu dag byas na /

analyzed: nga'i sdug cing yid du 'ong bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'o //

analyzed: mi na tha mar ma byas kyang ma sbyor ba ma yin zhes pa ni mi'i 'gro ba mang la na 'dug pa lta bu 'am cig shos shi'am gud du song ba lta bu'i rkyen gyis btsal te smyan gyi mjug ma grub na sngon gyi sbyor ba ldebs su mi stor bar ston pa'o //
translated: This teaches that even if one does not complete the conclusion of the go-between activity due to conditions such as many people in the human realm being sick, or the other person having died or gone elsewhere, the previous engagement is not lost.🔽If the activity of one result is completed, the individual agents do not lose it.

original: 'bras bu gcig gi bya ba zin na byed pa so so chud mi za zhes pa ni mi mang po zhig gis gnyis sprad pa'i smyan byas na /
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig gi bya ba zin na byed pa so so chud mi za zhes pa ni mi mang po zhig gis gnyis sprad pa'i smyan byas na /
translated: This teaches that if many people act as go-betweens to bring two people together,

original: smyan byed pa du yod pa thams cad lhag ma re rer 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: smyan byed pa du yod pa thams cad lhag ma re rer 'gyur gyi /
translated: all those who act as go-betweens become go-betweens for each remaining person.

original: mang po'i ldebs sam khongs rlag tu mi 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: mang po'i ldebs sam khongs rlag tu mi 'gyur bar ston pa'o //

original: 'dir pho nya ni bdag go zhes pa ni smyan gyi skabs 'dir pho nya lta bu yang bdag dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: 'dir pho nya ni bdag go zhes pa ni smyan gyi skabs 'dir pho nya lta bu yang bdag dang 'dra ste /
translated: Here, the messenger is like oneself.

original: des than blangs pa la sogs pa sbyor ba gsum gyis sprad na yang nyes pa rangs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: des than blangs pa la sogs pa sbyor ba gsum gyis sprad na yang nyes pa rangs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This teaches that if one brings together through the three activities of accepting a fee and so on, one's fault is complete.

original: yang na smyan gyis shig par pho nya las cha lan blangs shing bskyal na yang de bzhin du nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang na smyan gyis shig par pho nya las cha lan blangs shing bskyal na yang de bzhin du nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Or, if the messenger receives the fee and delivers the message, there is also a similar fault.

original: de'i bdag po ni sprang pa'o zhes pa ni sprang par bya ba gnyis kyi @69b pha ma 'am rjed bon lta bu bdag po yod pa la thag bcad de sprad na nyes pa rangs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag po ni sprang pa'o zhes pa ni sprang par bya ba gnyis kyi @69b pha ma 'am rjed bon lta bu bdag po yod pa la thag bcad de sprad na nyes pa rangs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The owner is the beggar. If one decides that the owner of the two beggars is the father or mother or the one who sent them, and gives to them, there is a complete fault.

original: nyes byas su byed pa na gzhan la'o zhes pa ni sprad pa gnyis kyi bdag po ma yin te dbang med pa gzhan la than blangs pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba byas kyang nyes byas su zad par ston ba'o ;
analyzed: nyes byas su byed pa na gzhan la'o zhes pa ni sprad pa gnyis kyi bdag po ma yin te dbang med pa gzhan la than blangs pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba byas kyang nyes byas su zad par ston ba'o ;
translated: If one commits a misdeed, it is to another. The owner of the two beggars is not the owner, but if one makes the effort to take from another who is powerless, it is only a misdeed.

original: / yi ge dang yig brda dang phyogs dang brda dang mtshan ma rnams ni tshig bzhin zhes pa ni 'di rnams gang ltar byas kyang tshig gis bsgrubs pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: / yi ge dang yig brda dang phyogs dang brda dang mtshan ma rnams ni tshig bzhin zhes pa ni 'di rnams gang ltar byas kyang tshig gis bsgrubs pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: The letters, signs, directions, symbols, and indications are like words. If one does any of these, it is like establishing with words.

original: nyes pa rangs par ston pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa rangs par ston pa'o //
translated: It is taught that there is a complete fault.

original: de la phyogs zhes pa ni kun dga' la sogs pa'i phyogs su dus btab pa'o ;
analyzed: de la phyogs zhes pa ni kun dga' la sogs pa'i phyogs su dus btab pa'o ;

original: ; brda zhes pa ni snga dro la sogs pa'i brda skad sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: ; brda zhes pa ni snga dro la sogs pa'i brda skad sbyor ba'o //
translated: The term sign means to make an appointment by means of a sign, such as the early morning and so on.

original: mtshan ma zhes pa ni skra bregs shing gos ngur smrig bgos na zhes pa la sogs pa'o //🔽stu 'tshong ma ni ma khugs pa'o zhes pa ni stu 'tshong ma lta bu zong spyin pa la rag tu zad bas ma khugs pa gzod 'gugs pa la ma gtogs pa re ka bstsal ba'i phyir 'di skad du smos pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshan ma zhes pa ni skra bregs shing gos ngur smrig bgos na zhes pa la sogs pa'o // stu 'tshong ma ni ma khugs pa'o zhes pa ni stu 'tshong ma lta bu zong spyin pa la rag tu zad bas ma khugs pa gzod 'gugs pa la ma gtogs pa re ka bstsal ba'i phyir 'di skad du smos pa yin te /
translated: The term symbol means to make an appointment by means of a symbol, such as shaving the head and wearing saffron-colored robes.🔽The term prostitute means one who is not yet engaged, because one is only a prostitute when one is engaged in selling one's body. This is stated in order to exclude those who are already engaged.

original: ma khugs pa gzod 'gugs pa dang 'dra bas na sprad na yang nyes pa rangs par ston pa'o //
analyzed: ma khugs pa gzod 'gugs pa dang 'dra bas na sprad na yang nyes pa rangs par ston pa'o //
translated: It is said that even if one engages in sex with a prostitute, one still commits a downfall, because it is similar to engaging in sex with one who is not yet engaged.

original: bzhi tshun chad bdag gi ma yin par zhugs pa'o zhes pa ni sngon mdza' na lta bu'i tshul du lan gsum tshun chang sprad kyi ;
analyzed: bzhi tshun chad bdag gi ma yin par zhugs pa'o zhes pa ni sngon mdza' na lta bu'i tshul du lan gsum tshun chang sprad kyi ;
translated: One who is not yet engaged means one who has not yet been engaged in sex three times or more, like a former friend.

original: bzhir ma sprad pa zhig na rnal du khugs pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bzhir ma sprad pa zhig na rnal du khugs pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: One who has not been engaged in sex four times or more is not yet engaged.

original: ma khugs pa gzod 'gugs pa dang nyes pa rangs par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ma khugs pa gzod 'gugs pa dang nyes pa rangs par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: If one does not accept the wife, one must accept her again and the fault is then cleared.

original: 'thabs nas zhig go zhes pa ni na nyung ngam chung ma gang yang rung sngon dbang du red cing gong rnying du gyur pa las 'thabs na dbang du red pa gong rnying zhig pa'o //
analyzed: 'thabs nas zhig go zhes pa ni na nyung ngam chung ma gang yang rung sngon dbang du red cing gong rnying du gyur pa las 'thabs na dbang du red pa gong rnying zhig pa'o //
translated: If one fights and then separates, one must separate from a wife who was previously under one’s control and was one’s former wife.

original: chung ma'o cog 'thabs pas 'jig gam zhe na /
analyzed: chung ma'o cog 'thabs pas 'jig gam zhe na /
translated: If one fights with any wife, does one separate?

original: de'i dbang du red pa las chung ma ma yin par bsgrags na'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i dbang du red pa las chung ma ma yin par bsgrags na'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: If one proclaims her to be not one’s wife, one separates from her.

original: chus byin pa dang rin gyis nyos pa dang rgyal mtshan gyis srogs pa gsum ni dbang du byas pa yin pas na 'thabs te chung ma yin par bsgrags pa las bsdums na nyes pa rangs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: chus byin pa dang rin gyis nyos pa dang rgyal mtshan gyis srogs pa gsum ni dbang du byas pa yin pas na 'thabs te chung ma yin par bsgrags pa las bsdums na nyes pa rangs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one fights with the three types of wives—those given by parents, those bought with wealth and those obtained through the banner of victory—and then reconciles with them, proclaiming them to be one’s wife, the fault is cleared.

original: srog chags bzhin pa ni de'i mod la ba dang / 'thabs ma thag pa dang / rtsva bcad pa dang / rdo gsum bor ba dang / spyad pa btang ba dang / chung ma ma yin par bsgrags pa dang / @70a * //
analyzed: srog chags bzhin pa ni de'i mod la ba dang / 'thabs ma thag pa dang / rtsva bcad pa dang / rdo gsum bor ba dang / spyad pa btang ba dang / chung ma ma yin par bsgrags pa dang / @70a * //
translated: and just rung with a bell.🔽If one acts as a matchmaker for many sentient beings, one commits an offense equal to the number of times one delivers the message.🔽If one fights with any of these named people, one commits an offense equal to the number of times one fights.

original: dril brdungs pa rnams so zhes pa ni sems can du ma'i smyan byas na dus sprad pa'i grangs bzhin du sbyor ba dang / rtsa bar 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar 'thabs pa ming gis smos pa 'di rnams las slar bsdums na 'thabs pa'i rim pa bzhin du nyes par 'gyur ba'o//
analyzed: dril brdungs pa rnams so zhes pa ni sems can du ma'i smyan byas na dus sprad pa'i grangs bzhin du sbyor ba dang / rtsa bar 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar 'thabs pa ming gis smos pa 'di rnams las slar bsdums na 'thabs pa'i rim pa bzhin du nyes par 'gyur ba'o//
translated: If one reconciles, one commits an offense equal to the number of times one fights.

original: de la de'i mod la zhes pa ni 'thabs pa'i mod la dge slong gis bcug cing bsdums pa'o //
analyzed: de la de'i mod la zhes pa ni 'thabs pa'i mod la dge slong gis bcug cing bsdums pa'o //
translated: In this case, “just” means that the monk reconciles the fight immediately after it occurs.

original: de ma thag pa zhes pa ni 'thabs pa'i 'og tu rtsva bcad ces pa ni rtsva ti lin ti li ka rked du bcad pa bzhin du bdag cag sba shug kyang gyes te mi 'dum mo zhes zer zhing 'thabs pa'o //
analyzed: de ma thag pa zhes pa ni 'thabs pa'i 'og tu rtsva bcad ces pa ni rtsva ti lin ti li ka rked du bcad pa bzhin du bdag cag sba shug kyang gyes te mi 'dum mo zhes zer zhing 'thabs pa'o //
translated: “Immediately” means that after the fight, “the grass was cut” means that the grass was cut in the middle like a Tīlī grass. “We too are like that” means that they were separated and did not reconcile.

original: rdo gsum bor zhes pa ni rdo gsum phyogs gsum du bor ba'am rdo gsum gyis bsnun te 'thabs shing gyes pa'o //
analyzed: rdo gsum bor zhes pa ni rdo gsum phyogs gsum du bor ba'am rdo gsum gyis bsnun te 'thabs shing gyes pa'o //
translated: “Three stones were thrown” means that three stones were thrown in three directions, or that they fought and separated, having struck with three stones.

original: spyod pa btang zhes pa ni so nam btang ba'am /
analyzed: spyod pa btang zhes pa ni so nam btang ba'am /
translated: “The conduct was abandoned” means that farming was abandoned.

original: khyim thab la rim gro byed du ma bcug pa'o //
analyzed: khyim thab la rim gro byed du ma bcug pa'o //
translated: “They were not allowed to serve their husbands” means that they were not allowed to serve their husbands.

original: chung ma ma yin par bsgrags zhes pa ni nga'i chung ma ma yin no zhes par 'jig rten kun shes par bsgrags pa'o //
analyzed: chung ma ma yin par bsgrags zhes pa ni nga'i chung ma ma yin no zhes par 'jig rten kun shes par bsgrags pa'o //
translated: “They were proclaimed as not being wives” means that it was proclaimed to the whole world that they were not their wives.

original: dril brdungs zhes pa ni khyim thab gtong ba'i phyir lha khang du song nas dril brdung ba'o //
analyzed: dril brdungs zhes pa ni khyim thab gtong ba'i phyir lha khang du song nas dril brdung ba'o //
translated: “The bell was rung” means that they went to the temple to abandon their husbands and rang the bell.

original: 'di la nyes byas su byed pa ni thog ma gsum mo zhes pa ni de'i mod la ba dang / de ma thag pa dang / rtsva bcad pa'i 'thabs pa gsum las slar bsdums na nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la nyes byas su byed pa ni thog ma gsum mo zhes pa ni de'i mod la ba dang / de ma thag pa dang / rtsva bcad pa'i 'thabs pa gsum las slar bsdums na nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one reconciles them, it becomes a misdeed.

original: de la 'di zhes pa ni dbang du byas pa la gtod pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: de la 'di zhes pa ni dbang du byas pa la gtod pa'i tshig go //
translated: In this case, “this” is a word that refers to the one who is in control.

original: de la dbang du byas pa'i chung ma dang 'thabs te rdo gsum bor ba las bsdums na snga ma'i nyes byas gsum dang / sbom po gcig go //
analyzed: de la dbang du byas pa'i chung ma dang 'thabs te rdo gsum bor ba las bsdums na snga ma'i nyes byas gsum dang / sbom po gcig go //
translated: If one reconciles a wife who is in control after fighting and throwing three stones, it is three previous misdeeds and one serious offense.

original: spyad pa btang ba las bsdums na nyes byas gsum dang sbom po gnyis so //
analyzed: spyad pa btang ba las bsdums na nyes byas gsum dang sbom po gnyis so //
translated: If one reconciles after giving up the practice, it is three misdeeds and two serious offenses.

original: chung ma ma yin par bsgrags pa las bsdums na nyes byas gsum sbom po gsum lhag ma gcig go //
analyzed: chung ma ma yin par bsgrags pa las bsdums na nyes byas gsum sbom po gsum lhag ma gcig go //

original: dril brdungs pa las bsdums na /
analyzed: dril brdungs pa las bsdums na /
translated: If one reconciles after ringing the bell,

original: nyes byas gsum sbom po bzhi /
analyzed: nyes byas gsum sbom po bzhi /

original: lhag ma gnyis so //
analyzed: lhag ma gnyis so //

analyzed: rim bzhin du ma 'thabs na 'di dag so so'i nyes pa dmigs dang sbyar bar zad do //

original: 'di ci'i phyir khyim mi dbub /🔽'di'ang gyos po'i khyim du mi 'gro mi 'dri zhes smras na'o zhes pa ni khye'u 'di ci'i phyir khyim mi dbub /
analyzed: 'di ci'i phyir khyim mi dbub / 'di'ang gyos po'i khyim du mi 'gro mi 'dri zhes smras na'o zhes pa ni khye'u 'di ci'i phyir khyim mi dbub /

translated: The teaching on the origin of acting as a matchmaker is as follows: “The grave offense is acting as a matchmaker for a pregnant woman, one who is not pregnant, one who is certain, one who is not available, one who is bought, one who is engaged, or one who is being courted by oneself.”

analyzed: de la sbrum ba ni mngal na yod pa'i smyan byed pa'o //

analyzed: nges pa ni dka' thub la gnas shing 'du ba sdom pas spong ba'o //
translated: “Certainty” means that she is living with him through ascetic practices and vows of union.

analyzed: bsten pa med pa ni ma ning dang za ma lta bu gzhug gnas med pa'o //

translated: “Subdued” means that she is subdued and controlled.

translated: “I am a matchmaker” means that if a man wants to meet a woman like this,🔽I will find a way to bring them together.

analyzed: khas blangs pa bstan na'o zhes pa ni bud med dus mal du sdod pa 'gro ba'i lam yogs su mthong ba las skyes pa dus mal du 'ongs bas 'di lta bu'i bud med ji mthong zhes smras pa dang / rgyus shes bzhin du shing ngam rtsig drung 'di lta bu zhing na sdod cing 'dug go zhes bstan na sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “I will show you the one I promised” means that a man who comes to the bed at the right time sees a woman sitting on the path to the bed. He asks, “What kind of woman is this?” and she replies, “I am sitting on such and such a tree or wall.” If she shows him, it is a serious offense.

analyzed: // / smyan byed / pa bye brag tu nges pa las 'byung ba ston pa ni /

analyzed: byin pa las bkyigs pa sprad na sbom po'o zhes pa ni sngon gnyen du 'thabs zin pa zhig las gnyen zla gcig cig gis bkyigs sam phongs dor byas pa las dge @71a * //

analyzed: slong gis bsdums shing sprad na'o //

translated: This refers to a case where one calls and gives a woman or a man for the sake of making merit, as in the case of the previous rule.🔽If one calls and gives for the sake of another, it is also a sthūlātyaya.

original: gzhan gyi don dang ldan na yang ngo zhes pa ni chos kyi ched kyis gong ma ltar byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don dang ldan na yang ngo zhes pa ni chos kyi ched kyis gong ma ltar byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: This refers to a case where one does not act as above for the sake of the Dharma, but
