analyzed: khyim 'di dang skye bo 'di kun khyod la 'bul lo zhes pa'i than skyel ba lta bu la sogs pa gzhan gyi tshul gyis 'bod cing skad sbyor na sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: calls and gives a woman or a man to another, saying, “I give this house and all these people to you.”

original: ma khros na yang gzhan du zhes par sems can ma 'dus pa ma yin zhes pa ni 'tshog pa'i ltung ba las ma khros na yang ka ba la mi bsnun /
analyzed: ma khros na yang gzhan du zhes par sems can ma 'dus pa ma yin zhes pa ni 'tshog pa'i ltung ba las ma khros na yang ka ba la mi bsnun /
translated: The downfall of striking is stated:🔽Do not strike a pillar,

original: rtsig pa la mi bsnun /🔽gzhan du'ang ma yin zhes 'byung bas na /
analyzed: rtsig pa la mi bsnun / gzhan du'ang ma yin zhes 'byung bas na /
translated: do not strike a wall,🔽and do not strike anywhere else.

original: gzhan du'ang ma yin zhes pa'i khongs su sems can yang ma 'dus pa ma yin par ston pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan du'ang ma yin zhes pa'i khongs su sems can yang ma 'dus pa ma yin par ston pa ste /
translated: The phrase “anywhere else” includes sentient beings.

original: skabs 'dir cir ston ce na /
analyzed: skabs 'dir cir ston ce na /
translated: What does this passage teach?

original: skyes pa dang bud med /
analyzed: skyes pa dang bud med /
translated: It teaches that you should not strike a man, a woman,🔽or a neuter person with your fist or palm.🔽The basis is a person who is capable of understanding the words of a monk.🔽The motivation is the wish to strike.

original: sngon brda skad sbyar ba ltar dge slong gis lus la khu tshur ram thal mos bsnun pa dang / skad 'byor cing sprad par gyur pa lta bu'i gleng gzhi yod pas na nyes byas su 'gyur bar ston pa'o //🔽smyan byed pa bye brag tu nges pa'o //
analyzed: sngon brda skad sbyar ba ltar dge slong gis lus la khu tshur ram thal mos bsnun pa dang / skad 'byor cing sprad par gyur pa lta bu'i gleng gzhi yod pas na nyes byas su 'gyur bar ston pa'o // smyan byed pa bye brag tu nges pa'o //
translated: The act is to strike with your fist or palm.

original: smyan byed pa'o /
analyzed: smyan byed pa'o /
translated: The conclusion is the actual blow.

original: // / khang pa dge 'dun gyi lhag ma ston par 'dod pa ni /
analyzed: // / khang pa dge 'dun gyi lhag ma ston par 'dod pa ni /
translated: The downfall of acting as a matchmaker is specified.🔽Acting as a matchmaker is stated:

original: spyod lam bzhi mi shong na nyes med ces pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: spyod lam bzhi mi shong na nyes med ces pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Do not act as a matchmaker.

original: 'greng ba dang / 'dres pa dang / 'gro ba'i spyod lam spyad par byar med pa'i dog pa lta zhig brtsigs na nyes par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'greng ba dang / 'dres pa dang / 'gro ba'i spyod lam spyad par byar med pa'i dog pa lta zhig brtsigs na nyes par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one builds a house in a place where it is not allowed to stand, walk, or mix, there is no fault.

original: bcol ba dang ma bcol ba mi btsan zhes pa ni khang pa brtsigs pa ma brtags pa la sogs ba'i skyon yod na rtsig tu bcug pa'i mi la yang nyid kyis brtsigs pa dang 'dra ba'i nyes pa rangs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bcol ba dang ma bcol ba mi btsan zhes pa ni khang pa brtsigs pa ma brtags pa la sogs ba'i skyon yod na rtsig tu bcug pa'i mi la yang nyid kyis brtsigs pa dang 'dra ba'i nyes pa rangs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is said, What is entrusted and what is not entrusted is not authoritative, meaning that if there are faults such as not examining the house to be built, then for the person who is made to build it, it is as if they themselves built it, and they will incur the fault.

original: bcol kyang bdag bzhin zhes pa ni ma brtags pa la sogs pa'i skyon yod na pha rol rtsig tu bcug kyang nyes pa bdag la 'dre bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: bcol kyang bdag bzhin zhes pa ni ma brtags pa la sogs pa'i skyon yod na pha rol rtsig tu bcug kyang nyes pa bdag la 'dre bar ston pa'o //
translated: It is said, Even if entrusted, it is like oneself, meaning that if there are faults such as not examining it, then even if one makes another person build it, it is taught that the fault will be shared with oneself.

original: smras pa bzhin du ma byas kyang lus dang ngag gis khas len pa'o zhes pa ni sngar rtsig tu bcol ba'i tshe /
analyzed: smras pa bzhin du ma byas kyang lus dang ngag gis khas len pa'o zhes pa ni sngar rtsig tu bcol ba'i tshe /
translated: It is said, Even if one does not act as spoken, one accepts it with body and speech, meaning that when previously one was made to build, one accepted it with body and speech.

original: ji nas kyang brtags shing rung bar gyis shig bsgo ba las bcol ba'i ming des bsgo ba bzhin du ma byas te ma brtags shing mi rung bar brtsigs pa las bcol pa de der phyis 'ongs pa dang / ngag gis ma nyes te @71b legs so zhes zer ram /
analyzed: ji nas kyang brtags shing rung bar gyis shig bsgo ba las bcol ba'i ming des bsgo ba bzhin du ma byas te ma brtags shing mi rung bar brtsigs pa las bcol pa de der phyis 'ongs pa dang / ngag gis ma nyes te @71b legs so zhes zer ram /
translated: The king said, You should have examined and built it properly. The man who was ordered did not do as he was told. He did not examine and built it improperly. Later, the one who ordered him came there and said, It is not your fault, it is good.

original: lus kyis shing rtsi la sogs pa snon cing slong na gnyi ga la nyes pa rangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus kyis shing rtsi la sogs pa snon cing slong na gnyi ga la nyes pa rangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he says that with his speech and adds and asks for wood, glue, etc. with his body, both will be at fault.

original: byed ba ni mchog go zhes pa ni khyim brtsigs par brtsams pa las /
analyzed: byed ba ni mchog go zhes pa ni khyim brtsigs par brtsams pa las /
translated: The one who does is supreme means that when one begins to build a house,

original: gtan du ye ma btang bar byas pa ni ma yin gyi lo 'ga' 'am zla ba du mas bcad de labs kyis yang rtsig byed na sbyor ba gcig tu zad par ston pa'o //
analyzed: gtan du ye ma btang bar byas pa ni ma yin gyi lo 'ga' 'am zla ba du mas bcad de labs kyis yang rtsig byed na sbyor ba gcig tu zad par ston pa'o //
translated: it is not that one never gives up completely, but if one stops for a few years or months and then resumes building, it shows that the preparation is finished.

original: bsgrub pa gcig pas na 'thabs pa'i mod la ba la sogs pa'i rim pa bzhin du yan lag re re sbyor ba re re'o zhes par re ba bstsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgrub pa gcig pas na 'thabs pa'i mod la ba la sogs pa'i rim pa bzhin du yan lag re re sbyor ba re re'o zhes par re ba bstsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Since it is accomplished in one, the moment of fighting, like the stages of wool, etc., each limb is a single application. To dispel the hope that there is one for each limb, it is said:

original: yan lag rnams ni tha dad du mi byed do zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: yan lag rnams ni tha dad du mi byed do zhes pa yin te /
translated: The limbs are not to be made separately.

original: ma brtags pa la sogs yan lag re re zhing sbyor ba re rer 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ma brtags pa la sogs yan lag re re zhing sbyor ba re rer 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not the case that each limb, such as not investigating, is a separate application.

original: rtsa ba gcig gi sbyar ba'ang gcig par ston pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba gcig gi sbyar ba'ang gcig par ston pa'o //
translated: It shows that even the application of a single root is one.

original: khang pa'i lhag mar 'gyur ba ji ltas she na /
analyzed: khang pa'i lhag mar 'gyur ba ji ltas she na /
translated: How is it the remainder of a house?

original: bslangs pa zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: bslangs pa zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: It is the one who asks for it, etc.

original: sa gzhi gzhan las bslangs pa'o //
analyzed: sa gzhi gzhan las bslangs pa'o //
translated: It is asked for from another site.

original: des bsgo ba la zhes pa ni khyim pa'i rgyu spyad cing shing rtsi la sogs pa bdag gis bslangs sam slong du bcug na yang ngo //
analyzed: des bsgo ba la zhes pa ni khyim pa'i rgyu spyad cing shing rtsi la sogs pa bdag gis bslangs sam slong du bcug na yang ngo //
translated: The one who is ordered is the one who uses the householder's means, and if he asks for it himself or has someone else ask for it, it is also so.

original: dngos po mi gtsang ba zhes ba ni sa gzhi mi gtsang bar brtsigs na nyes par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: dngos po mi gtsang ba zhes ba ni sa gzhi mi gtsang bar brtsigs na nyes par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The thing is impure means that if it is built on an impure site, there is an offense.

original: 'di btsal ba ni 'og nas 'chad /
analyzed: 'di btsal ba ni 'og nas 'chad /
translated: This is sought out as will be explained below.

original: ma gsol bar gnas byed pa zhes pa ni dge 'dun la gsol ba ma btab par thug thub tu brtsigs pa'o //
analyzed: ma gsol bar gnas byed pa zhes pa ni dge 'dun la gsol ba ma btab par thug thub tu brtsigs pa'o //
translated: The one who makes a dwelling without asking is the one who builds it by himself without asking the Saṅgha.

original: zin na'o zhes pa ni thams cad brtsigs zin na gdod nyes pa rangs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zin na'o zhes pa ni thams cad brtsigs zin na gdod nyes pa rangs par 'gyur ba'o //

original: 'og ma yang 'di dag bzhin te bslangs pa ma gtogs zhes pa ni yan lag gong du smos pa 'di rnams las bslangs pa'i yan lag gzhan thams cad gtsug lag khang brtsigs ba'i yan lag kyang yin par ston pa'o //
