original: ma brtags pa rtsod pa can ma spangs pa ni mi gtsang ba'o zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: ma brtags pa rtsod pa can ma spangs pa ni mi gtsang ba'o zhes pa yin no //
translated: The unmonitored is that which is not abandoned due to conflict.

original: de dag kyang ji lta bu @72a * //
analyzed: de dag kyang ji lta bu @72a * //
translated: What are they?

original: zhe na ; sdig sbrul phra mo tshang bcas pa dang / rgyal po dang lha'i khang pa /
analyzed: zhe na ; sdig sbrul phra mo tshang bcas pa dang / rgyal po dang lha'i khang pa /
translated: The unmonitored is a place with a nest of poisonous snakes, a royal palace,

original: mu stegs pa'i gnas dang mda' chags pa dang / mi gcod pa'i shing dang / 'dom gang tshun chad kyi nyen 'khor na chu bo dang grog po dang / khron pas chod pas 'di dag rim bzhin no zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: mu stegs pa'i gnas dang mda' chags pa dang / mi gcod pa'i shing dang / 'dom gang tshun chad kyi nyen 'khor na chu bo dang grog po dang / khron pas chod pas 'di dag rim bzhin no zhes pa yin te /
translated: a place of non-Buddhists, a place with a target, a tree that is not to be cut, and within a distance of one fathom, a place obstructed by a river, a ravine, or a pit.

original: de la sdig sbrul gyi tshang bcas pa zhes pa ni ma brtags pa'o //
analyzed: de la sdig sbrul gyi tshang bcas pa zhes pa ni ma brtags pa'o //
translated: Among these, a place with a nest of poisonous snakes is unmonitored.

original: rgyal po zhes pa nas mi gcod pa'i shing zhes pa'i bar du smos pa rnams ni rtsod pa can no //🔽'dom gang zhes pa nas /
analyzed: rgyal po zhes pa nas mi gcod pa'i shing zhes pa'i bar du smos pa rnams ni rtsod pa can no // 'dom gang zhes pa nas /
translated: From a royal palace up to a tree that is not to be cut are places of conflict.

original: khron pas chod ces pa'i bar du smos pa rnams ni ma spangs pa'o //
analyzed: khron pas chod ces pa'i bar du smos pa rnams ni ma spangs pa'o //
translated: From a place within a distance of one fathom up to a place obstructed by a pit are places not abandoned.

original: gong du tshad las lhag ches smos pa'i tshad ji tsam zhe na /
analyzed: gong du tshad las lhag ches smos pa'i tshad ji tsam zhe na /
translated: If one exceeds the measure mentioned above, what is the measure?

original: tshad ma'i khru phyed dang do ni bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma'i khru phyed dang do ni bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho zhes pa yin te /
translated: A cubit of a valid person is called a sugata cubit.

original: mi tha mal ba'i khru phyed dang dol bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang du ston pa'o //
analyzed: mi tha mal ba'i khru phyed dang dol bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang du ston pa'o //
translated: Half a cubit of an ordinary person is a sugata cubit.

original: des khang pa'i tshad ston pa ni /
analyzed: des khang pa'i tshad ston pa ni /
translated: The measure of the house is taught:🔽Twelve and seven of those cubits is the width.

original: nang rgya'i tshad de'i bcu gnyis dang bdun no zhes pa yin te khang pa'i nang rgya chur ni bde par gshegs pa'i mtho bcu gnyis zhes phyed dang do ni bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: nang rgya'i tshad de'i bcu gnyis dang bdun no zhes pa yin te khang pa'i nang rgya chur ni bde par gshegs pa'i mtho bcu gnyis zhes phyed dang do ni bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho zhes pa yin te /
translated: The width of the house is twelve sugata cubits.

original: gang du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho bdun gyi tshad las lhag par byas na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho bdun gyi tshad las lhag par byas na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one makes it more than seven sugata cubits, it becomes a downfall.

original: gong du gsol zhes smos pa gsol ba'i tshad tsam zhe na /
analyzed: gong du gsol zhes smos pa gsol ba'i tshad tsam zhe na /
translated: If it is said above to request, what is the measure of requesting?

original: gsol ba dge 'dun las thob pa ni gsol ba'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: gsol ba dge 'dun las thob pa ni gsol ba'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: Requesting is obtaining from the saṅgha.

original: gsol nas dge 'dun gyis gnang ba byin na gsol bar chud pa'o //
analyzed: gsol nas dge 'dun gyis gnang ba byin na gsol bar chud pa'o //
translated: If one requests and the saṅgha gives permission, it is included in the request.

original: mi gtsang na mi gsol zhes pa ni ma brtags pa la sogs pa'i skyon yod pa tsam gyi tshod na dge 'dun la brtag pa'i gsol ba ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: mi gtsang na mi gsol zhes pa ni ma brtags pa la sogs pa'i skyon yod pa tsam gyi tshod na dge 'dun la brtag pa'i gsol ba ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: If it is impure, do not request. This means that if there is only a fault such as not examining, do not make a request to the Saṅgha to examine.

original: nyid ma bskos pa'i dge slong dag gis rtogs shing yid ches par bya zhes pa ni khang pa brtsigs par dge 'dun la gsol na dge 'dun nyid kyis thog tu phyung la brtag pa'am /
analyzed: nyid ma bskos pa'i dge slong dag gis rtogs shing yid ches par bya zhes pa ni khang pa brtsigs par dge 'dun la gsol na dge 'dun nyid kyis thog tu phyung la brtag pa'am /
translated: The text says, The Saṅgha itself should investigate and the monks who have not been appointed should understand and have confidence. This means that if one requests the Saṅgha to build a house, the Saṅgha itself should go to the site and examine it,

original: dge slong kha cig bskos pas brtag cing gtan la pho ba shig pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong kha cig bskos pas brtag cing gtan la pho ba shig pa'o //
translated: or some appointed monks should investigate and determine it.

original: gding ba'ang de bzhin zhes pa ni lo drug ma lon par gdeng ba 'grub pa'i sdom pa gsol na yang dge 'dun gyis thabs 'di ltar rtogs shig pa'o //
analyzed: gding ba'ang de bzhin zhes pa ni lo drug ma lon par gdeng ba 'grub pa'i sdom pa gsol na yang dge 'dun gyis thabs 'di ltar rtogs shig pa'o //
translated: The text says, The same applies to the sitting mat. This means that if one requests the vow of accomplishment of the sitting mat before six years have passed, the Saṅgha should investigate in this way.

original: byas pa rnyed cing spyad pa la nyes med ces pa ni sngon brtsigs zin pa zhig rnyed dam de spyod pa ni @72b nyes med pa'o //
analyzed: byas pa rnyed cing spyad pa la nyes med ces pa ni sngon brtsigs zin pa zhig rnyed dam de spyod pa ni @72b nyes med pa'o //
translated: The text says, If one finds a used one, there is no fault in using it. This means that if one finds one that was built previously, or uses it, there is no fault.

original: rnying pa bcos pa yang ngo zhes pa ni sngon gyi rnying pa bcos na nyes med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: rnying pa bcos pa yang ngo zhes pa ni sngon gyi rnying pa bcos na nyes med par ston pa'o //
translated: Also, repairing old ones means that it is taught that there is no fault in repairing old ones.

original: khang pa'i dge 'dun gyi lhag ma rnam par 'byed pa'o /
analyzed: khang pa'i dge 'dun gyi lhag ma rnam par 'byed pa'o /
translated: The Saṅgha's excess in building a temple.

original: // / gtsug lag khang brtsigs pa dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'i yan lag rnams ni gong du bstan pas na /
analyzed: // / gtsug lag khang brtsigs pa dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'i yan lag rnams ni gong du bstan pas na /
translated: Since the branches of the Saṅgha's excess in building a temple have been taught above,

original: de'i bye brag tsam zhig ston pa ni dge 'dun gyi phyir ro zhes pa yin te bzhi yan chad 'dus pa'i phyir brtsigs na /
analyzed: de'i bye brag tsam zhig ston pa ni dge 'dun gyi phyir ro zhes pa yin te bzhi yan chad 'dus pa'i phyir brtsigs na /
translated: only a distinction of that is taught: for the Saṅgha. If one builds with four or more people gathered,

original: khyim pa'i yang rung ste dge 'dun gyi lhag mar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: khyim pa'i yang rung ste dge 'dun gyi lhag mar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: it is suitable for householders too, and it becomes the Saṅgha's excess.

original: gzhung las de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi phyir zhes pa smos pa 'di gleng gzhi'i gcig tu zad do //
analyzed: gzhung las de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi phyir zhes pa smos pa 'di gleng gzhi'i gcig tu zad do //
translated: In the text, it says for the Saṅgha of the Tathāgata's disciples, but this is just one of the nidānas.

original: gtsug lag khang dge 'dun gyi lhag ma rnam par 'byed pa'o /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang dge 'dun gyi lhag ma rnam par 'byed pa'o /
translated: The Saṅgha's excess in building a temple.

original: // / lhag ma 'di gnyis 'dra ba'i phyir zhus pa las 'byung ba cig car du bsdus te ston pa ni /
analyzed: // / lhag ma 'di gnyis 'dra ba'i phyir zhus pa las 'byung ba cig car du bsdus te ston pa ni /
translated: Since these two remainders are similar, they are taught together in the questions:

original: brtsams pa ni sbyor ba'o zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: brtsams pa ni sbyor ba'o zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The preparation is the beginning of the construction.

original: brtsigs par brtsams na sbyor bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: brtsigs par brtsams na sbyor bar ston pa'o //
translated: If one begins the construction, it is the preparation.🔽If it is not covered, then even if it is completed, it is the same.

original: ma khebs na zin kyang de bzhin zhes pa ni thog mar bar na khang ba'am gtsug lag khang gzhan zin kyang sbom po las med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: ma khebs na zin kyang de bzhin zhes pa ni thog mar bar na khang ba'am gtsug lag khang gzhan zin kyang sbom po las med par ston pa'o //
translated: This shows that if the roof or the temple is not completed, then even if the other parts are completed, there is no offense of a serious transgression.

original: du ma'i phyir na'o zhes pa ni khang pa brtsigs pa ma brtags pa la sogs pa'i skyon yod du zin kyang gcig gi phyir ma yin te du ma'i phyir brtsigs na sbom po la sogs par ston pa'o //
analyzed: du ma'i phyir na'o zhes pa ni khang pa brtsigs pa ma brtags pa la sogs pa'i skyon yod du zin kyang gcig gi phyir ma yin te du ma'i phyir brtsigs na sbom po la sogs par ston pa'o //
translated: Because of many, means that even if the construction of the house has faults such as not being examined, it is not for the sake of one, but for the sake of many.

original: ma btang na'o zhes pa ni khang pa'i sa gzhi pha rol gyis ma byin par brtsigs na yang sbom por ston pa'o //
analyzed: ma btang na'o zhes pa ni khang pa'i sa gzhi pha rol gyis ma byin par brtsigs na yang sbom por ston pa'o //
translated: If it is not given up, means that even if the site of the house is not given by the other, it is a serious transgression.

original: pham par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na sa gtan du bdag gir bya ba'i 'du shes med kyi de nyid kyi khyim du 'gyur ba'i 'du shes yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pham par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na sa gtan du bdag gir bya ba'i 'du shes med kyi de nyid kyi khyim du 'gyur ba'i 'du shes yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is it not a downfall? Because there is no perception of the site as one’s own forever, but rather the perception that it is the house of the other.

original: gang zag gi na'o zhes pa ni khang pa brtsigs pa'i nor pha rol las bslangs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang zag gi na'o zhes pa ni khang pa brtsigs pa'i nor pha rol las bslangs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The “person” is not the wealth that is borrowed from others to build a house.🔽

original: gang zag nyid kyi nor gyis na sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang zag nyid kyi nor gyis na sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The phrase “of a person” means that if one borrows wealth from another person to build a house, it is a serious offense.

original: ma zin pa yang ngo zhes pa ni gzhan gyis brtsigs pa'i 'phro bslang ste zin par byas na yang sbom por 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ma zin pa yang ngo zhes pa ni gzhan gyis brtsigs pa'i 'phro bslang ste zin par byas na yang sbom por 'gyur pa'o //
translated: The phrase “even if not taken” means that if one takes over the building of a house that another person has begun, it is a serious offense.

original: bslangs pa'i 'og tu ma byas na nyes byas zhes pa ni sa gzhi bslang ste btang ngam rgyu spyad bslangs nas btang na nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //🔽khang pa dang gtsug lag khang dge 'dun gyi lhag mar gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bslangs pa'i 'og tu ma byas na nyes byas zhes pa ni sa gzhi bslang ste btang ngam rgyu spyad bslangs nas btang na nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o // khang pa dang gtsug lag khang dge 'dun gyi lhag mar gtogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase “if one does not build after borrowing” means that if one borrows the wealth of another person to build a house, but then does not build, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: khang pa dang gtsug lag khang dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o /🔽// / rtsa ba med pa dge 'dun gyi lhag ma ston par 'dod @73a * //
analyzed: khang pa dang gtsug lag khang dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o /🔽// / rtsa ba med pa dge 'dun gyi lhag ma ston par 'dod @73a * //
translated: The phrase “a house and a temple belonging to the saṅgha” means that if one borrows the wealth of the saṅgha to build a house or a temple, it is a serious offense.🔽The phrase “a house and a temple belonging to the saṅgha” means that if one borrows the wealth of the saṅgha to build a house or a temple, it is a serious offense.🔽The phrase “without a basis” means that if one borrows the wealth of the saṅgha to build a house or a temple, it is a serious offense.🔽The phrase “without a basis” means that if one borrows the wealth of the saṅgha to build a house or a temple, it is a serious offense.

original: pa ni ; dge slong nyams pa la yang phas pham pas skur na'o zhes pa la sogs pa yin te dge tshul ma yin gyi dge slong yin na nyams pa yang rung ste /🔽mi tshangs par spyad pa la sogs pas skur na lhag mar 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: pa ni ; dge slong nyams pa la yang phas pham pas skur na'o zhes pa la sogs pa yin te dge tshul ma yin gyi dge slong yin na nyams pa yang rung ste / mi tshangs par spyad pa la sogs pas skur na lhag mar 'gyur pa'o //
translated: If one accuses a novice or a fully ordained bhikṣu of sexual misconduct and so on, it is a downfall.🔽If one expels a fully ordained bhikṣu or bhikṣuṇī who is not degenerate, it is a serious transgression.

original: pa ri ba sha las dge slong dang dge slong ma bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang ma nyams pa bskrad na nyes pa rangs par 'gyur gyi /🔽nyams pa bskrad na nyes byas zhes pa skabs 'dir de dang mi sbyor gyi /
analyzed: pa ri ba sha las dge slong dang dge slong ma bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang ma nyams pa bskrad na nyes pa rangs par 'gyur gyi / nyams pa bskrad na nyes byas zhes pa skabs 'dir de dang mi sbyor gyi /
translated: If one expels a degenerate bhikṣu or bhikṣuṇī, it is a minor offense.

original: nyams ba la skur na yang nyes pa rangs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nyams ba la skur na yang nyes pa rangs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This is not applied in this context, but if one accuses a degenerate bhikṣu of a defeating offense, it is a serious transgression.🔽The phrase “also if degenerate” is a commentary on the following passage:

original: nyams pa la yang zhes smos pa nyid ni 'og nas dge slong dang dge slong ma'i bslab pa'i yan lag ni bsnyen par rdzogs par rdzogs pa dang ma nyams pa'o zhes 'byung ba de 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: nyams pa la yang zhes smos pa nyid ni 'og nas dge slong dang dge slong ma'i bslab pa'i yan lag ni bsnyen par rdzogs par rdzogs pa dang ma nyams pa'o zhes 'byung ba de 'grel pa'o /
translated: The branches of training of bhikṣus and bhikṣuṇīs are fully ordained bhikṣus and bhikṣuṇīs who are not degenerate.

original: 'dir nyid kyi phyogs yan lag ma yin zhes pa ni chub par smras pa las nyid kyi phyogs su 'gyur ba ni mtshan gcig pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir nyid kyi phyogs yan lag ma yin zhes pa ni chub par smras pa las nyid kyi phyogs su 'gyur ba ni mtshan gcig pa ste /
translated: The term “one’s faction” refers to those who have the same name,🔽those who have taken vows, and those who have been struck by the view of the Buddha.

original: dge slong dang khas blangs pa ste sangs rgyas kyi lta ba la brdegs na ltung bar 'gyur gyi mtshan ma gcig pa dge slong ma dang / lha sbyin gyi phyogs su khas blangs pa brdegs na nyes byas zhes pa skabs 'dir de dang mi sbyor gyi /
analyzed: dge slong dang khas blangs pa ste sangs rgyas kyi lta ba la brdegs na ltung bar 'gyur gyi mtshan ma gcig pa dge slong ma dang / lha sbyin gyi phyogs su khas blangs pa brdegs na nyes byas zhes pa skabs 'dir de dang mi sbyor gyi /
translated: Here, the term “one’s faction” does not refer to those who have taken vows in the faction of a fully ordained nun or in the faction of Devadatta.

original: mtshan tha dad pa dang khas len pa tha dad pa la skur na'ang nyes par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan tha dad pa dang khas len pa tha dad pa la skur na'ang nyes par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: If one disparages those who have different names and different vows, one also commits an offense.🔽The Autocommentary states:

original: mtshan dang khas blangs pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i 'grel pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan dang khas blangs pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i 'grel pa ste /
translated: “One’s faction” refers to those who have the same name and have taken vows.

original: skur pa 'debs pha'i skabs 'dir nyid kyi phyogs nyi tshe yan lag tu 'gyur ba ma yin gyi mtshan tha dad pa dang / khas len tha dad pa la skur na yang nyes pa rangs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: skur pa 'debs pha'i skabs 'dir nyid kyi phyogs nyi tshe yan lag tu 'gyur ba ma yin gyi mtshan tha dad pa dang / khas len tha dad pa la skur na yang nyes pa rangs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Here, in the context of disparaging, one does not only disparage those who are a part of one’s faction. If one disparages those who have different names and different vows, one also commits an offense.

original: brdzun du smras pas so zhes pa ni mthong ba thos pa dang dogs ba'i rtsa ba med la yang dag pa ma yin pa brdzun du smras na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: brdzun du smras pas so zhes pa ni mthong ba thos pa dang dogs ba'i rtsa ba med la yang dag pa ma yin pa brdzun du smras na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By lying, means that if one lies with a false thing, without a basis of what is seen, heard, or suspected, one will incur an offense.

original: gang la skur ba de nyid kyi mdun du smras pas nyes par 'gyur ram zhe na su la bsgo yang rung zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: gang la skur ba de nyid kyi mdun du smras pas nyes par 'gyur ram zhe na su la bsgo yang rung zhes pa yin te /
translated: If one lies in the presence of the one who is being slandered, does one incur an offense?  It is said, it is appropriate to whomsoever it is addressed.

original: gang skur par bya ba de nyid la smra bar ma zad kyi su'i mdun du smras kyang rung ste nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang skur par bya ba de nyid la smra bar ma zad kyi su'i mdun du smras kyang rung ste nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Not only does one lie to the one who is being slandered, but one incurs an offense by lying in the presence of anyone.

original: ji ltar bsams kyang rung ngam zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bsams kyang rung ngam zhe na /
translated: Is it appropriate to think whatever one wants?

original: 'bral bar 'dod pas so zhes pa yin te bab bab tu bsams pas ma yin gyi tshangs par spyod pa dang 'bral bar 'dod pas skur na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'bral bar 'dod pas so zhes pa yin te bab bab tu bsams pas ma yin gyi tshangs par spyod pa dang 'bral bar 'dod pas skur na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is said, by one who desires to separate, meaning that it is not appropriate to think whatever one wants, but one incurs an offense by slandering with the desire to separate from pure conduct.

original: rtsa ba gzhan pa de ma yin zhes pa ni mthong ba'i rtsa ba yod pa @73b las thos pa la sogs pas glengs na rtsa ba de nyid las ma glengs te bsnor ba'i phyir skur par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba gzhan pa de ma yin zhes pa ni mthong ba'i rtsa ba yod pa @73b las thos pa la sogs pas glengs na rtsa ba de nyid las ma glengs te bsnor ba'i phyir skur par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The other root is not, which means that if one recalls from the root of seeing, and so on, and does not recall from that very root, but instead distorts it, then one deprecates.

original: brjed na yod pa ma yin zhes pa ni sngon mthong ba la sogs pa'i rtsab yod pa las de ni brjed kyi mthong ba la sogs pa'i rtsa bas gdod skur na sngon gyi nyes pa de med pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: brjed na yod pa ma yin zhes pa ni sngon mthong ba la sogs pa'i rtsab yod pa las de ni brjed kyi mthong ba la sogs pa'i rtsa bas gdod skur na sngon gyi nyes pa de med pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: If one forgets, it is not that it exists, which means that if one forgets from the root of previous seeing, and so on, and if one deprecates from the root of seeing, and so on, from the beginning, then that is similar to the previous fault.

original: skur par 'gyur ba'o /
analyzed: skur par 'gyur ba'o /
translated: One deprecates.

original: rtsa ba yod du 'gro ba las rtsa ba bsnor te glengs pa dang rtsa pa med pa ni ma yin gyi yod pa las brjed pa lta ba yan lag tu ji phyir mi brtsi zhes pa ba stsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rtsa ba yod du 'gro ba las rtsa ba bsnor te glengs pa dang rtsa pa med pa ni ma yin gyi yod pa las brjed pa lta ba yan lag tu ji phyir mi brtsi zhes pa ba stsal ba'i phyir /
translated: It is not that one recalls from the root that exists, and distorts the root, and that one does not recall from the root that does not exist, but that one recalls from the root that exists, and forgets it. Why is that not counted as a branch of view?🔽In response to that, it is said:

original: don de nyid na'ang brdzun du mi byed pa ma yin zhes pa ni mthong ba'i rtsa ba yod du zin kyang thos pa dang dogs pas glengs na 'du shes brtsan pa'i phyir brdzun du mi 'gyur ba ma yin pa dang / rtsa ba yod kyang brjed na skur pa'i 'du shes de nyid brtsan pa'i phyir brtsan du mi 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: don de nyid na'ang brdzun du mi byed pa ma yin zhes pa ni mthong ba'i rtsa ba yod du zin kyang thos pa dang dogs pas glengs na 'du shes brtsan pa'i phyir brdzun du mi 'gyur ba ma yin pa dang / rtsa ba yod kyang brjed na skur pa'i 'du shes de nyid brtsan pa'i phyir brtsan du mi 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: If one is questioned about what one has seen, even though one has a basis, one does not lie because one is certain about one's perception.

original: dper na dngos su mig lam ga na 'dug la /
analyzed: dper na dngos su mig lam ga na 'dug la /
translated: For example, if something is actually present in one's field of vision,

original: bdag gi snying lam na med pa snyam zhig nas /
analyzed: bdag gi snying lam na med pa snyam zhig nas /
translated: but one thinks, I don't have it in my heart,

original: gzhan gyis dris pa'i tshe med do zhes smras pa las phyis yod par 'gyur ba lta bu 'du shes brtsan pa'i phyir brdzun du mi 'gyur ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis dris pa'i tshe med do zhes smras pa las phyis yod par 'gyur ba lta bu 'du shes brtsan pa'i phyir brdzun du mi 'gyur ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: and later it turns out that one does have it, one does not lie because one is certain about one's perception when one says, I don't have it, in response to another's question.

original: rtsa ba med pa dge 'dun gyi lhag ma rnam par 'byed pa'o /
analyzed: rtsa ba med pa dge 'dun gyi lhag ma rnam par 'byed pa'o /
translated: The remainder of the downfalls that have no basis are explained.

original: // / gzhan gyi chas skur pa'am gzhan du cham yin pas skur pa'i lhag ma ston par 'dod pa ni /
analyzed: // / gzhan gyi chas skur pa'am gzhan du cham yin pas skur pa'i lhag ma ston par 'dod pa ni /
translated: The desire to accuse another of having the accouterments of a monk or of having them in another place is a remainder downfall.

original: snyad gzhan la bstan pa'i tshig gis brdzun pa'o zhes pa yin te 'di dang 'di mi tshangs par spyod do zhes gsal por ni mi smra'i mi gsal ba la brten te /
analyzed: snyad gzhan la bstan pa'i tshig gis brdzun pa'o zhes pa yin te 'di dang 'di mi tshangs par spyod do zhes gsal por ni mi smra'i mi gsal ba la brten te /
translated: It is not a lie if one does not clearly say, “I have seen this and this person engage in impure conduct,” but rather one relies on something unclear.

original: brdzun du skur na rtsa bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: brdzun du skur na rtsa bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: If one lies, it is a root downfall.

original: dper na gyad bu nor dang autpa la'i mdog kyang mthong mi tshangs par spyod pa yang mthong ngo zhes zer ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gyad bu nor dang autpa la'i mdog kyang mthong mi tshangs par spyod pa yang mthong ngo zhes zer ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like saying, “I have seen Gyadubunor and Utpala Color, and I have seen them engage in impure conduct.”

original: dge slong nyams pa las yang phas pham pas skur na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yan lag gzhan ni gong du bstan pa dang 'dra'o //🔽gzhan gyi chas skur pa'am /
analyzed: dge slong nyams pa las yang phas pham pas skur na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yan lag gzhan ni gong du bstan pa dang 'dra'o // gzhan gyi chas skur pa'am /
translated: The other factors, such as “from a fully ordained monk who has degenerated,” and so on, are similar to those explained above.🔽It is a partial defeat of the Saṅgha if one lies about something else,

original: gzhan du cha ma yin pas skur pa'i dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o /
analyzed: gzhan du cha ma yin pas skur pa'i dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o /
translated: or if one lies about something that is not a part of something else.

original: // / rtsa ba med pa dang chas skur ba gnyis zhus ba las 'byung ba cig car du bsdus te ston ba ni /
analyzed: // / rtsa ba med pa dang chas skur ba gnyis zhus ba las 'byung ba cig car du bsdus te ston ba ni /
translated: The two, rootless and partial lies, are taught together in the Questions of Revata Sūtra.

original: bstan du med pas skur pa ni sbom bo'o zhes pa la sogs ba yin te /
analyzed: bstan du med pas skur pa ni sbom bo'o zhes pa la sogs ba yin te /
translated: “A lie that is not indicated is a serious violation,” and so on.

original: dge slong ma mtshan ma med pa'i ma ning dang / mi tshangs par spyod do zhe 'am /
analyzed: dge slong ma mtshan ma med pa'i ma ning dang / mi tshangs par spyod do zhe 'am /
translated: If one says, “A fully ordained monk who is a neuter without genitals or a fully ordained nun who is a neuter without genitals engages in sexual intercourse,”

original: dge slong mo mtshan med pa'i ma ning ma dang mi tshangs par spyod do zhes skur @74a * //
analyzed: dge slong mo mtshan med pa'i ma ning ma dang mi tshangs par spyod do zhes skur @74a * //
translated: or if one says, “A fully ordained monk who is a neuter without genitals engages in sexual intercourse with a neuter without genitals,”

original: na gnas med cing mi srid pa'i phyir sbom por 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: na gnas med cing mi srid pa'i phyir sbom por 'gyur ba ste /
translated: then one commits a serious offense because there is no possibility of that.

original: 'di'ang kha rkub kyi sgo las ma glengs na de ltar 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'ang kha rkub kyi sgo las ma glengs na de ltar 'gyur pa'o //
translated: If one does not accuse someone of anal intercourse, then that is the case.

original: ming nas ma smos na yang ngo zhes pa ni mang po'i mdun du 'di dag gi nang na mi tshangs par spyod pa dang / ma sha ka lnga las lhag par brkus pa dang / me'i srog bcad pa dang mi las bla ma'i chos brdzun du smra ba dag yod do zhes zer zhing gang gis nyes pa'i ming nas mi 'byin na sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ming nas ma smos na yang ngo zhes pa ni mang po'i mdun du 'di dag gi nang na mi tshangs par spyod pa dang / ma sha ka lnga las lhag par brkus pa dang / me'i srog bcad pa dang mi las bla ma'i chos brdzun du smra ba dag yod do zhes zer zhing gang gis nyes pa'i ming nas mi 'byin na sbom por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one does not mention the name of the person, then one commits a serious offense if one says in the presence of many, “Among these, there are those who engage in sexual intercourse, who steal more than five māshaka coins, who kill with fire, and who lie about a higher spiritual status than they have,” and one does not mention the name of the person who committed the offense.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen gyis na yang ngo zhes pa ni 'di 'ang de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa'o zhes skur na mi gsod pa'i sbom pos skur du zad pas nyes byas su 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen gyis na yang ngo zhes pa ni 'di 'ang de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa'o zhes skur na mi gsod pa'i sbom pos skur du zad pas nyes byas su 'gyur ba dang /
translated: If one disparages one who has drawn blood with evil intent toward the Tathagata, then one commits a heinous offense.

original: dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa la zhugs so zhes skur na yang sbom pos skur du zad pas nyes byas su 'gyur bar sten pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa la zhugs so zhes skur na yang sbom pos skur du zad pas nyes byas su 'gyur bar sten pa'o //
translated: If one disparages one who has caused a schism in the Sangha, then one commits a heinous offense.

original: de la yang kha cig 'chad pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa yin no zhes skur na /
analyzed: de la yang kha cig 'chad pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa yin no zhes skur na /
translated: Some explain that if one disparages one who has drawn blood with evil intent toward the Tathagata,

original: mtshams med pas skur pa yin /
analyzed: mtshams med pas skur pa yin /
translated: then one commits a heinous offense.

original: de ltar mtshams med pas skur na ni dge slong gi ngo bo med bar skur pas phas pham pas skur ba bzhin du dge 'dun gyi lhag mar 'gyur ba bzhin du dge 'dun dbyen byas so bar skur pa'ang de bzhin te /
analyzed: de ltar mtshams med pas skur na ni dge slong gi ngo bo med bar skur pas phas pham pas skur ba bzhin du dge 'dun gyi lhag mar 'gyur ba bzhin du dge 'dun dbyen byas so bar skur pa'ang de bzhin te /
translated: If one disparages one who has caused a schism in the Sangha, then one commits a heinous offense.

original: lhag mar 'gyur ro zhes 'chad /🔽bsams nas smras so zhes pa la sogs pas zur zer na nyes byas zhes pa ni mang po'i mdun du ngas bsams te /
analyzed: lhag mar 'gyur ro zhes 'chad / bsams nas smras so zhes pa la sogs pas zur zer na nyes byas zhes pa ni mang po'i mdun du ngas bsams te /
translated: The rest are similar.🔽If one says, “I thought and said this,” and so on, and one is speaking indirectly, it is a wrong action.

original: smra ba'i gleng ba 'di dag gi nang na yod do zhes yid srid skur zhing zur zer na nyes byas su 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: smra ba'i gleng ba 'di dag gi nang na yod do zhes yid srid skur zhing zur zer na nyes byas su 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
translated: This teaches that if one speaks indirectly, saying, “I thought and said this,” and so on, in the presence of many, and one’s intention is to slander, it is a wrong action.

original: chas skur pa la yang 'di bzhin du zur zer ba srid do //
analyzed: chas skur pa la yang 'di bzhin du zur zer ba srid do //
translated: Also, in the case of indirect slander, it is possible to speak indirectly.

original: rtsa ba med pa cha zhus pa'o /
analyzed: rtsa ba med pa cha zhus pa'o /
translated: The root text is quoted in full.

original: // / dge 'dun gyi dbyen dge 'dun gyi lhag mar 'gyur ba da ston pa ni /
analyzed: // / dge 'dun gyi dbyen dge 'dun gyi lhag mar 'gyur ba da ston pa ni /
translated: The root text now teaches that schism in the Saṅgha is a serious offense.

original: pha rol gyi 'khor kha drangs na sbom pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: pha rol gyi 'khor kha drangs na sbom pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: If one invites the followers of the other party, it is a serious offense.

original: mdo 'di nyid ni zhar las ston pa'o //
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid ni zhar las ston pa'o //
translated: This sūtra is taught as an aside.

original: 'di man chad ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen la sogs lhag ma bzhi khong 'thul ba'i mtshan nyid ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'di man chad ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen la sogs lhag ma bzhi khong 'thul ba'i mtshan nyid ston pa'o //
translated: From here on, the text teaches the characteristics of the four remaining serious offenses, such as schism in the Saṅgha.

original: mi gtong bar sran 'dzugs pa'i tshul zlog pa bzhin du bsdeb ces pa ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa la sogs pa dge 'dun gyis bzlog @74b pa ni mi gtong pa'i tshul du lus sam ngag gam mi smra bas sran 'dzugs na zlog pa lan gsum gyi🔽bar du zlog pa'i grangs bzhin du sbyor bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mi gtong bar sran 'dzugs pa'i tshul zlog pa bzhin du bsdeb ces pa ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa la sogs pa dge 'dun gyis bzlog @74b pa ni mi gtong pa'i tshul du lus sam ngag gam mi smra bas sran 'dzugs na zlog pa lan gsum gyi bar du zlog pa'i grangs bzhin du sbyor bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The phrase “like a reversal, one should apply it to the non relinquishment of a vow” means that if a schismatic monk and so on is reversed by the Saṅgha, if he does not relinquish his vow, he should apply himself to it through body, speech or silence.

original: zlog pa bzhin du gsol ba'o zhes pa ni dge 'dun mkhyen par zhu zhing gsol ba zlog pa nyid ma yin pas sbyor bar mi 'gyur du re ba sel bar ston pa yin te gsol pa yang zlog pa bzhin du sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zlog pa bzhin du gsol ba'o zhes pa ni dge 'dun mkhyen par zhu zhing gsol ba zlog pa nyid ma yin pas sbyor bar mi 'gyur du re ba sel bar ston pa yin te gsol pa yang zlog pa bzhin du sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase “like a reversal, one should apply it to the request” means that if a schismatic monk and so on is reversed by the Saṅgha, he should apply himself to it through body, speech or silence.

original: ngag ni skad ma gcig go zhes pa ni zlog pa la sogs pa'i tshig du ma yod du zin kyang bsnyad pa'i mjug ma rdzogs kyi bar du rgyun gcig tu brtsi bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: ngag ni skad ma gcig go zhes pa ni zlog pa la sogs pa'i tshig du ma yod du zin kyang bsnyad pa'i mjug ma rdzogs kyi bar du rgyun gcig tu brtsi bar ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase “speech is a single moment” means that even though there are many words of reversal and so on, it is taught that they are considered to be a single continuum until the conclusion of the statement is finished.

original: slob pa rnams gcig tu re ba bstsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: slob pa rnams gcig tu re ba bstsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to completely eliminate the hope of those in training,

original: zlos pa ni so sor ro zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: zlos pa ni so sor ro zhes pa yin te /
translated: Repetition is each one.

original: zlos pa lan rer sbyor ba re rer ston pa'o //🔽bsnyad pa ni ma yin zhes pa ni mjug gcod par bsnyon pa ni gud dud byung du med de /
analyzed: zlos pa lan rer sbyor ba re rer ston pa'o // bsnyad pa ni ma yin zhes pa ni mjug gcod par bsnyon pa ni gud dud byung du med de /
translated: Repetition is showing each application in each repetition.🔽It is not said is the conclusion.

original: bzlas pa tha ma'i khongs su 'dus par ston pa'o //
analyzed: bzlas pa tha ma'i khongs su 'dus par ston pa'o //
translated: Denial is not elsewhere, but is shown to be included in the final repetition.🔽Application is preparation.

original: zhugs pa ni sbyor ba'o zhes pa ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen la zhugs pa la sogs pa de dag la zhugs pa'i sbyor bar ston pa ste /
analyzed: zhugs pa ni sbyor ba'o zhes pa ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen la zhugs pa la sogs pa de dag la zhugs pa'i sbyor bar ston pa ste /
translated: It shows that the preparations for those who have applied themselves to schism in the Saṅgha and so on are preparations for that.

original: de la gzhan pa la sogs pa'i tshe ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: de la gzhan pa la sogs pa'i tshe ni nyes byas so //
translated: At other times than that, it is a minor offense.

original: gsol ba tsam phyin chad ni sbom po'o //🔽bskrad pa'i las ma byas par sdan tshogs su 'dod pa la sogs pas /
analyzed: gsol ba tsam phyin chad ni sbom po'o // bskrad pa'i las ma byas par sdan tshogs su 'dod pa la sogs pas /
translated: From the mere request onward, it is a serious offense.🔽Without performing the action of banishing, if one says, “I will go to the assembly,” and so on,

original: 'gro'o zhes kha tshas zer ba dang gleng ba dang bskul ba ma byas par sngan tshogs su bka' blo ma bde bar zer ba sbyor ba'i yang sbyor bar ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'gro'o zhes kha tshas zer ba dang gleng ba dang bskul ba ma byas par sngan tshogs su bka' blo ma bde bar zer ba sbyor ba'i yang sbyor bar ston pa ni /
translated: without having made an agreement, a promise, or an exhortation, if one says, “I will go to the assembly,” it is said that one is not comfortable with the command.

original: bskrad pa dang gleng ba dang bskul ba ma byas pa ni de'i'o zhes pa yin te khyim sun 'byin pa bskrad pa la sogs pa'am brtsams par chad mi bzod de /
analyzed: bskrad pa dang gleng ba dang bskul ba ma byas pa ni de'i'o zhes pa yin te khyim sun 'byin pa bskrad pa la sogs pa'am brtsams par chad mi bzod de /
translated: The phrase “not to expel, admonish or incite” means that one should not expel a monk who is a troublemaker in the household, or one should not admonish or incite a monk who is unable to tolerate the interruption of his work.🔽The phrase “one should not be displeased” means that one should not be displeased with the Saṅgha for not admonishing or inciting a monk who is a troublemaker in the household, or one should not be displeased with a monk who is unable to tolerate the interruption of his work for not being admonished or incited.🔽The phrase “one should not be displeased” also refers to not being displeased with a monk who is a troublemaker in the household for not being expelled, or with a monk who is unable to tolerate the interruption of his work for not being admonished or incited.🔽The phrase “one should not be displeased” means that one should not be displeased with the Saṅgha for not expelling a monk who is a troublemaker in the household, or one should not be displeased with a monk who is unable to tolerate the interruption of his work for not being admonished or incited.🔽The phrase “one should not be displeased” also refers to not being displeased with a monk who is a troublemaker in the household for not being expelled, or with a monk who is unable to tolerate the interruption of his work for not being admonished or incited.

original: dge 'dun la kha tshas zer ba dang / bslab ba'i phyir gleng zhing bskul ba ma brtsams par snga nas bka' blo mi bde bar zer ba lta bu ni sbyor ba de yang sbyor ba ste nyes byas su 'gyur bar ston pa'o //🔽'di skad du zer ba'i gang zag la bsgo ba la sogs pa'i las bya'am mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: dge 'dun la kha tshas zer ba dang / bslab ba'i phyir gleng zhing bskul ba ma brtsams par snga nas bka' blo mi bde bar zer ba lta bu ni sbyor ba de yang sbyor ba ste nyes byas su 'gyur bar ston pa'o // 'di skad du zer ba'i gang zag la bsgo ba la sogs pa'i las bya'am mi bya zhe na /
translated: The phrase “one should not be displeased” means that one should not be displeased with the Saṅgha for not expelling a monk who is a troublemaker in the household, or one should not be displeased with a monk who is unable to tolerate the interruption of his work for not being admonished or incited.

original: 'di la mi bsgo zhes pa yin te 'di lta bu la bsgo bas bzhams pa'i bsgo ba yang ma byed cig pa'o //🔽gong ma lta bu ni ma yin gyi dbyen la sogs pa la zhugs pa gor ma chag par bsgo'am mi bsgo zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la mi bsgo zhes pa yin te 'di lta bu la bsgo bas bzhams pa'i bsgo ba yang ma byed cig pa'o // gong ma lta bu ni ma yin gyi dbyen la sogs pa la zhugs pa gor ma chag par bsgo'am mi bsgo zhe na /
translated: The phrase “one should not be displeased” also refers to not being displeased with a monk who is a troublemaker in the household for not being expelled, or with a monk who is unable to tolerate the interruption of his work for not being admonished or incited.

original: 'di dag la bzhams pa dang las kyis mi bsgo ba ma yin zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag la bzhams pa dang las kyis mi bsgo ba ma yin zhes pa yin te /
translated: The phrase “one should not be displeased” means that one should not be displeased with the Saṅgha for not expelling a monk who is a troublemaker in the household, or one should not be displeased with a monk who is unable to tolerate the interruption of his work for not being admonished or incited.

original: de la bzhams pa ni tshangs pa mtshungs @75a * //
analyzed: de la bzhams pa ni tshangs pa mtshungs @75a * //
translated: In this regard, to be agreeable means to be like Brahma.

original: par spyod pa mdza' bas tshig 'jam po la sogs pas gros gdab cing bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: par spyod pa mdza' bas tshig 'jam po la sogs pas gros gdab cing bzlog pa'o //
translated: The first is to be reconciled, which is to be dissuaded by gentle speech and so on from a pure friend.🔽The second is to be dissuaded, which is to be dissuaded by the saṅgha.

original: bzlog pa las 'byung ba rnams kyi lhag ma bzhin ma byung zhe na /
analyzed: bzlog pa las 'byung ba rnams kyi lhag ma bzhin ma byung zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, “What is the remainder of those that arise from being dissuaded?”

original: de'i mjug tu ma btang na'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i mjug tu ma btang na'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: It is said, “If it is not relinquished after that.”

original: zlog pa'i las zin gyi bar du ma btang na lhag mar 'gyur ba'o//
analyzed: zlog pa'i las zin gyi bar du ma btang na lhag mar 'gyur ba'o//
translated: If it is not relinquished until the action of being dissuaded is completed, it becomes a remainder.

original: de yan chad du khong du 'thul ba'i mtshan nyid bstan nas /
analyzed: de yan chad du khong du 'thul ba'i mtshan nyid bstan nas /
translated: After teaching the characteristics of the first two,

original: da ni rim pa bzhin du so so'i mtshan nyid ston pa ste /
analyzed: da ni rim pa bzhin du so so'i mtshan nyid ston pa ste /
translated: now the characteristics of each are taught in order.

original: don gang ma bstan pas dbyen gyi lhag mar 'gyu zhe na /
analyzed: don gang ma bstan pas dbyen gyi lhag mar 'gyu zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, “What is the meaning of the remainder of schism?”

original: zhugs pas so zhes pa yin te dge 'dun gyi dben la zhugs pa ma btang na rtsa bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhugs pas so zhes pa yin te dge 'dun gyi dben la zhugs pa ma btang na rtsa bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is said, “By entering,” which means that if the saṅgha is not released from schism, it becomes a root downfall.

original: ji ma btang zhe na dben no zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ma btang zhe na dben no zhes pa yin no //
translated: If it is asked, “What is not released?” it is said, “Schism.”

original: de'ang su'i zhe na dge 'dun gyi'o zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: de'ang su'i zhe na dge 'dun gyi'o zhes pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, if it is asked, “Whose schism?” it is said, “The saṅgha’s.”

original: dge 'dun 'byed pa dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o /
analyzed: dge 'dun 'byed pa dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o /
translated: Dividing the saṅgha is a partial defeat of the saṅgha.

original: // / rjes su phyogs pa'i lhag ma ston te /
analyzed: // / rjes su phyogs pa'i lhag ma ston te /
translated: The remaining part of the offense of schism is taught.

original: ji ma btang bas rjes su phyogs pa'i lhag mar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ma btang bas rjes su phyogs pa'i lhag mar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one does not stop, how does one become a remainder of schism?

original: de'i grogs su 'bad na'o zhes pa yin te dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa la zhugs pa de'i grogs su btang na lhag mar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i grogs su 'bad na'o zhes pa yin te dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa la zhugs pa de'i grogs su btang na lhag mar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is said that if one makes effort to assist that person, then one becomes a remainder. If one sends a messenger to assist the person who is engaged in creating a schism in the saṅgha, then one becomes a remainder.

original: rjes su phyogs pa dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o /
analyzed: rjes su phyogs pa dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o /
translated: The remainder of schism is to side with the schism.

original: // / sun 'byin pa dge 'dun gyi lhag ma ston te //
analyzed: // / sun 'byin pa dge 'dun gyi lhag ma ston te //
translated: The remaining part of the offense of corrupting families is taught.

original: khong 'thul ba'i mtshan nyid las gzhi blangs nas ji ma btang bas khyim sun 'byin pa dge 'dun gyi lhag mar 'gyur zhe na /🔽bdag skyod par byed pa'i dge 'dun la 'di dag gis 'dir bsam pa log pa 'di lta bu dag la zhugs so zhes brdzun zer na'o zhes pa yin te bdag skrod pa'i dge 'dun la 'bod pa la sogs pas 'gro ba'o zhes brdzun sbyor zhing kha tshas zer
analyzed: khong 'thul ba'i mtshan nyid las gzhi blangs nas ji ma btang bas khyim sun 'byin pa dge 'dun gyi lhag mar 'gyur zhe na / bdag skyod par byed pa'i dge 'dun la 'di dag gis 'dir bsam pa log pa 'di lta bu dag la zhugs so zhes brdzun zer na'o zhes pa yin te bdag skrod pa'i dge 'dun la 'bod pa la sogs pas 'gro ba'o zhes brdzun sbyor zhing kha tshas zer
translated: If one does not stop, how does one become a remainder of corrupting families?

original: na lhag mar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: na lhag mar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is said that if one lies to the saṅgha that is expelling oneself, saying, “These people have entered into this kind of perverse thought here,” then one becomes a remainder. If one lies to the saṅgha that is expelling oneself, saying, “I am going to Ābhi and so on,” and one speaks with a forked tongue, then one becomes a remainder.

original: khyim sun 'byin pa dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o /
analyzed: khyim sun 'byin pa dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o /
translated: Causing regret in householders is a partial defeat for the Saṅgha.

original: // / bka' blo mi bde ba'i lhag ma ston te ci ma btang bas bka' blo mi bde ba'i dge 'dun gyi lhag mar 'gyur zha na /
analyzed: // / bka' blo mi bde ba'i lhag ma ston te ci ma btang bas bka' blo mi bde ba'i dge 'dun gyi lhag mar 'gyur zha na /
translated: The partial defeat of the Saṅgha for not giving up the view is taught.

original: dge slong gi lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi phyir glengs na dge slong dag gis bdag la 'dis mi brdzi bar byed pa'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: dge slong gi lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi phyir glengs na dge slong dag gis bdag la 'dis mi brdzi bar byed pa'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: If a monk is accused for the sake of the higher morality of a monk, he should not be intimidated by the thought, “This person is trying to intimidate me.”

original: tshul khrims kyi phyir dge slong 'gas glengs na legs kyang rung nyes kyang rung /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phyir dge slong 'gas glengs na legs kyang rung nyes kyang rung /
translated: If a monk is accused for the sake of morality, whether it is good or bad,

original: bal tshul khrims so cog gi phyir dge slong ngo cog gis ma gleng shig / nga yang mi nyan to zhes tshig gi lam gcod cing bka' blo bde bas mi brdzi bar byed na @75b dge 'dun gyi lhag mar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bal tshul khrims so cog gi phyir dge slong ngo cog gis ma gleng shig / nga yang mi nyan to zhes tshig gi lam gcod cing bka' blo bde bas mi brdzi bar byed na @75b dge 'dun gyi lhag mar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “No monk should accuse another monk for the sake of morality, and I will not listen to it.” If he blocks the path of speech and intimidates with the words of the partial defeat, it becomes a partial defeat of the Saṅgha.

original: bka' blo mi bde ba dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bka' blo mi bde ba dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o //
translated: The partial defeat of the Saṅgha for not giving up the view is taught.

original: dge 'dun gyi lhag ma rdzogs so /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi lhag ma rdzogs so /
translated: The partial defeats of the Saṅgha are complete.

original: // / spang ba'i ltung ba bshad par 'dod de /
analyzed: // / spang ba'i ltung ba bshad par 'dod de /
translated: The faults to be abandoned are explained.

original: 'chang ba la sogs pa bslab pa rnams kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid je ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'chang ba la sogs pa bslab pa rnams kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid je ston pa ni /
translated: The general characteristics of the trainings such as the precepts of upholding and so on are taught.

original: snga ma med pa nyin zhag gcig gi mjug ma zad pa ni med pa ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: snga ma med pa nyin zhag gcig gi mjug ma zad pa ni med pa ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The former is not nonexistent. The latter is not nonexistent.

original: zhag gcig gam drug gam bdun nam /🔽bcu'am zla ba tshigs kyis gzung ba rnams de dag gi snga logs kyi zhag grangs sam /
analyzed: zhag gcig gam drug gam bdun nam / bcu'am zla ba tshigs kyis gzung ba rnams de dag gi snga logs kyi zhag grangs sam /
translated: One day, six days, seven days,🔽ten days, or a month are held by their parts.

original: thun grangs dang mi sbyor gyi nyin zhag gi mjug ma zad pa'i tshigs kyis bzung bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: thun grangs dang mi sbyor gyi nyin zhag gi mjug ma zad pa'i tshigs kyis bzung bar ston pa'o //
translated: They are not connected with the number of days or periods of the former days, but are taught to be held by the parts of the end of the day.

original: thams cad de ltar mtha' mjug ma zad pa'i so nyi tshes brtsi'o //
analyzed: thams cad de ltar mtha' mjug ma zad pa'i so nyi tshes brtsi'o //
translated: All are calculated in this way by the end of the day.

original: nyin mtshan la sogs pa de'i khongs su mi brtsi'am zhe na /
analyzed: nyin mtshan la sogs pa de'i khongs su mi brtsi'am zhe na /
translated: Are day and night not calculated within that?

original: gnas pa ni sbyor ba'i snod do zhes pa yin te bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang / bsnyen par rdzogs kyang lta ba mi gtong ba dang / dge tshul mi snang bar bkar ba dang / bud med dang khyim gcig gi nang na nyal ba dang /
analyzed: gnas pa ni sbyor ba'i snod do zhes pa yin te bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang / bsnyen par rdzogs kyang lta ba mi gtong ba dang / dge tshul mi snang bar bkar ba dang / bud med dang khyim gcig gi nang na nyal ba dang /
translated: This shows that one who is fully ordained, one who does not relinquish wrong views even though fully ordained, one who is a novice monk who is expelled, one who sleeps with a woman in the same house,

original: 'od la nyal ba dang g-yul gyi nang na 'dug pa rnams nyin zhag gi mjug ma zad kyi bar du gnas shing 'dug pa'i nyin zhag sbyor ba'i snod du 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'od la nyal ba dang g-yul gyi nang na 'dug pa rnams nyin zhag gi mjug ma zad kyi bar du gnas shing 'dug pa'i nyin zhag sbyor ba'i snod du 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
translated: one who sleeps in the light, and one who stays in the midst of battle are vessels for the application of the day and night as long as the end of the day and night has not passed.

original: de yang g-yul gyi nang na gnas pa ma gtogs pa gzhan ni mtshan mo sbyor ba'i snod du byed do //
analyzed: de yang g-yul gyi nang na gnas pa ma gtogs pa gzhan ni mtshan mo sbyor ba'i snod du byed do //
translated: Moreover, except for one who stays in the midst of battle, the others make the night a vessel for the application.

original: nyin zhag gi tha ma ston pa ni skya rengs dang po'i thog ma de'i 'o zhes pa yin te //
analyzed: nyin zhag gi tha ma ston pa ni skya rengs dang po'i thog ma de'i 'o zhes pa yin te //
translated: The end of the day is taught to be the first part of the dawn.

original: skya rengs sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po de gsum 'char ba las dang po'i sngon po shar na /
analyzed: skya rengs sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po de gsum 'char ba las dang po'i sngon po shar na /
translated: If the first blue, yellow, and red dawns arise,

original: nyin zhag gi thog ma yin par ston ba'o //
analyzed: nyin zhag gi thog ma yin par ston ba'o //
translated: it is taught that the first blue is the beginning of the day.

original: de'i 'grel pa ston pa ni /
analyzed: de'i 'grel pa ston pa ni /
translated: The commentary on that is:🔽If it is past, the action is to be done before dawn.

original: thal na las ni 'char du cha ba'o zhes pa yin te gso sbyin dang tshul nas 'byung ba lta bu tshes grangs dang sbyar ba'i bslab pa rnams skya rengs shar ba ma tshor te /
analyzed: thal na las ni 'char du cha ba'o zhes pa yin te gso sbyin dang tshul nas 'byung ba lta bu tshes grangs dang sbyar ba'i bslab pa rnams skya rengs shar ba ma tshor te /
translated: This is like the case of the poṣadha vows and the vows from the rules of training that are connected with the lunar phases.

original: thal na nyi ma shar tshun chad nyin zhag gi mthar brtsis la las gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: thal na nyi ma shar tshun chad nyin zhag gi mthar brtsis la las gyis shig pa'o //
translated: If it is past, then the action is to be done before the sun rises, and it is to be counted as the end of the day.🔽The primary factor in the downfall is the perception of ownership.

original: spang ba ni bdag gir 'du shes pa gtso bo zhes pa ni gud nas bdag gi rdzas su bskur ba lta bu la sogs pa bdag gi yin par ma shes kyi bar du spang ba'i ltung par mi 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: spang ba ni bdag gir 'du shes pa gtso bo zhes pa ni gud nas bdag gi rdzas su bskur ba lta bu la sogs pa bdag gi yin par ma shes kyi bar du spang ba'i ltung par mi 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
translated: This shows that until one knows that something is one’s own, as in the case of something that has been given to oneself, it is not a downfall.

original: de la ma byin par len pa dang shi ba'i yo byad lta bu ni 'di dang sbyar du mi rung ngo /
analyzed: de la ma byin par len pa dang shi ba'i yo byad lta bu ni 'di dang sbyar du mi rung ngo /
translated: In this context, it is not appropriate to apply the example of taking what is not given or the possessions of a dead person.

original: @76a * // dngos su ni gzhan gyi nor yin la bdag gi yin snyam du 'du shes pa las zhag bcu thal bar bzhag pa ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @76a * // dngos su ni gzhan gyi nor yin la bdag gi yin snyam du 'du shes pa las zhag bcu thal bar bzhag pa ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: In actuality, it is the wealth of another, but one thinks it is one’s own.

original: bsngos na 'di yal ba'o zhes pa ni gzhan gyi nor ram rdzas su bsngos na bdag gi ma yin par ston pa'o //
analyzed: bsngos na 'di yal ba'o zhes pa ni gzhan gyi nor ram rdzas su bsngos na bdag gi ma yin par ston pa'o //
translated: If it is dedicated, it is lost. This shows that if it is dedicated to another's wealth or substance, it is not one's own.

original: rab tu 'byung ba'i phyir nges par byas pa'am de bzhin zhes pa ni rab tu 'byung ba rnams kyi gos su bsngos te bzhag pa lta bu yang nyes par mi 'gyur te 'di ni rab tu 'byung ba'i phyir lhung bzed lhag pa bcangs kyang bla ba las drangs
analyzed: rab tu 'byung ba'i phyir nges par byas pa'am de bzhin zhes pa ni rab tu 'byung ba rnams kyi gos su bsngos te bzhag pa lta bu yang nyes par mi 'gyur te 'di ni rab tu 'byung ba'i phyir lhung bzed lhag pa bcangs kyang bla ba las drangs
translated: If it is definitely for the sake of going forth, or if it is like that, it is not a fault. This is like the case of the bowl of a renunciate, which is kept dedicated as clothing for the sake of going forth.

original: pa'o // gos rung bar byas pa yang ngo zhes pa ni ming 'di zhes bya ba'i gos zhes sngags kyis rung bar byas pa yang bdag gi mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: pa'o // gos rung bar byas pa yang ngo zhes pa ni ming 'di zhes bya ba'i gos zhes sngags kyis rung bar byas pa yang bdag gi mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is also the case of clothing that is made suitable. This is like the case of the mantra that makes suitable the clothing of one called by such and such a name, which is not one's own.

original: 'dir rgyun chags pa ni 'jig go zhes pa ni bcangs pa'i gos bsngo ba la sogs pa bdag gir bya ba ma byas na /
analyzed: 'dir rgyun chags pa ni 'jig go zhes pa ni bcangs pa'i gos bsngo ba la sogs pa bdag gir bya ba ma byas na /
translated: Here, the continuity of that which is kept is destroyed. This shows that if the clothing that is kept is not dedicated and so forth, it is not made one's own.

original: bdag gi srel ba'i rgyun chad cing 'jig par ston pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gi srel ba'i rgyun chad cing 'jig par ston pa ste /
translated: The continuity of that which is kept is severed and destroyed.

original: dngos su gos snga ma rnyed nas zhag bzhi 'am lnga lon te med par byas pa'i 'og tu rnyed pa snga ma'i zhag grangs dang mi sbyor bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: dngos su gos snga ma rnyed nas zhag bzhi 'am lnga lon te med par byas pa'i 'og tu rnyed pa snga ma'i zhag grangs dang mi sbyor bar ston pa'o //
translated: This teaches that if one obtains the former cloth and then discards it after four or five days, the new cloth is not to be counted from the number of days of the former cloth.

original: rgyun chad pa de nyi tsher zad dam zhe na /
analyzed: rgyun chad pa de nyi tsher zad dam zhe na /
translated: Is the interruption of the number of days only a temporary matter?🔽It is also the degeneration of the nature.

original: rang bzhin nyams pa yang ngo zhes pa yin te bcang ba'i gos bcangs nas zhag gnyis sam gsum mam bcur ma lon pa rnams tshun chad du lon yang rung ba'i skabs su smos pa la sogs pa rang bzhin nyams par red na /
analyzed: rang bzhin nyams pa yang ngo zhes pa yin te bcang ba'i gos bcangs nas zhag gnyis sam gsum mam bcur ma lon pa rnams tshun chad du lon yang rung ba'i skabs su smos pa la sogs pa rang bzhin nyams par red na /
translated: If one wears the cloth to be worn and then discards it after two, three or ten days, or if one discards it within the period mentioned in the sutra, then the degeneration of the nature is discarded.

original: nam sangs pa tshun chad zhag grangs kyi mgo gdod btsugs te brtsi'o //
analyzed: nam sangs pa tshun chad zhag grangs kyi mgo gdod btsugs te brtsi'o //
translated: From the time one discards it, one begins to count the number of days.

original: sngon gyi zhag grangs dang mi sbyar bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi zhag grangs dang mi sbyar bar ston pa'o //
translated: This teaches that the number of days of the former cloth is not to be counted.🔽If this exists, the other also arises in its nature.

original: 'di yod na gzhan yang de'i dngos por skye'o zhes pa ni sngon bdag gir byas pa yod na phyis rnyed pa yang bdag gir byas pa de'i khongs su 'gro ste /
analyzed: 'di yod na gzhan yang de'i dngos por skye'o zhes pa ni sngon bdag gir byas pa yod na phyis rnyed pa yang bdag gir byas pa de'i khongs su 'gro ste /
translated: If one has previously taken possession of it, then later obtaining it also goes into the category of that which has been taken possession of.

original: de yang gang zhe na bdun pa dang / bcu pa dang / zla ba gcig pa rnams de dag so so rigs rigs su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na bdun pa dang / bcu pa dang / zla ba gcig pa rnams de dag so so rigs rigs su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Further, what are they? The seven day, the ten day, and the one month vows are each a type of vow.

original: de la zhag bdun pa'i bye brag ston pa ni /
analyzed: de la zhag bdun pa'i bye brag ston pa ni /
translated: The seven day vow is taught in the sūtras:

original: bdun pa ni rigs gcig go zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: bdun pa ni rigs gcig go zhes pa yin te /
translated: The seven day vow is one type.

original: bdun pa'i sman bdag gir byas pa ni de dang 'dra ba'i rigs phyis rnyed na de'i khongs su 'gre bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bdun pa'i sman bdag gir byas pa ni de dang 'dra ba'i rigs phyis rnyed na de'i khongs su 'gre bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: The seven day medicine is taken for a specific period of time. If medicine of a similar type is obtained later, it is included in the original vow.

original: rigs mi gcig pa ni de ltar mi 'gyur gyi /🔽zhag bdun pa'i bar sngar byin gyis brlabs pa dang / phyis kyang mar zhig rnyed pa las snga ma bdun las thal te brgyad du bcangs na /
analyzed: rigs mi gcig pa ni de ltar mi 'gyur gyi / zhag bdun pa'i bar sngar byin gyis brlabs pa dang / phyis kyang mar zhig rnyed pa las snga ma bdun las thal te brgyad du bcangs na /
translated: But if it is not of a similar type, it is not included.🔽If one who has previously consecrated seven day medicine obtains butter later, if one keeps it for more than seven days,

original: snga ma @76b bdun las 'das pa'i khrin du phyi ma 'ang spang dgos pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: snga ma @76b bdun las 'das pa'i khrin du phyi ma 'ang spang dgos pa lta bu yin no //
translated: then the later medicine must be discarded in addition to the original seven.

original: de'i ltung ba yod na bdag gir byas pa'i yo byad do cog spangs pa'o zhes pa ni sngar spang ba'i ltung ba gcig byung na de nam ma spangs ma bshags kyi bar du phyis rnyed pa'i yo byad do cog spang dgos par ston pa'o //
analyzed: de'i ltung ba yod na bdag gir byas pa'i yo byad do cog spangs pa'o zhes pa ni sngar spang ba'i ltung ba gcig byung na de nam ma spangs ma bshags kyi bar du phyis rnyed pa'i yo byad do cog spang dgos par ston pa'o //
translated: If one has a downfall of that, one must give up all the articles that one has consecrated as one’s own. This shows that if one has a single downfall of forsaking the training, one must give up all the articles one has acquired until one has forsaken that downfall and confessed it.

original: chung ba'i dum bu ni de ma yin zhes pa ni gos mes tshig pa'am byi bas zos pa'i dum bu khru gang khor yug tu med pa ni spang mi dgos par ston te ltung ba nyi tshe ni bshags dgos so //
analyzed: chung ba'i dum bu ni de ma yin zhes pa ni gos mes tshig pa'am byi bas zos pa'i dum bu khru gang khor yug tu med pa ni spang mi dgos par ston te ltung ba nyi tshe ni bshags dgos so //
translated: A small piece is not that. This shows that one does not need to give up a piece of cloth burned by fire or eaten by rats, if it is not a cubit in circumference. One must confess the minor downfall.

original: dge 'dun gyi yang ngo zhes pa ni dge 'dun gyi gos bdag gir byin gyis brlabs pa las bral bar gyur na /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi yang ngo zhes pa ni dge 'dun gyi gos bdag gir byin gyis brlabs pa las bral bar gyur na /
translated: Also of the community. If one becomes separated from the consecrated articles of the community,

original: bdag nyid kyi ma yin pa'i phyir spang ni mi dgos kyi ltung ba bshags dgos pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi ma yin pa'i phyir spang ni mi dgos kyi ltung ba bshags dgos pa'o //
translated: one does not need to give them up, because they are not one’s own, but one must confess the downfall.

original: 'dir med pa nyid brtsan no zhes pa ni spang ba'i ltung ba 'byung ba las spang ba'i rdzas mes tshig pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis med par gyur na /
analyzed: 'dir med pa nyid brtsan no zhes pa ni spang ba'i ltung ba 'byung ba las spang ba'i rdzas mes tshig pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis med par gyur na /
translated: Here, if it is lost, it is to be confessed means that if the substance to be given up is lost through a condition such as being burned by fire, then since it is lost, the downfall is to be confessed.

original: med pa nyid spangs pa yin pas na ltung ba nyi tshe shogs shig pa'o //
analyzed: med pa nyid spangs pa yin pas na ltung ba nyi tshe shogs shig pa'o //
translated: Thus, the downfall is to be confessed alone.

original: 'di gsum gtan pa brubs na med ces pa ni gtan pa brubs pa'i tshe bcang ba dang / 'bral pa dang / kha sogs su 'jog pa gsum gyi nyes pa med par ston pa'o /
analyzed: 'di gsum gtan pa brubs na med ces pa ni gtan pa brubs pa'i tshe bcang ba dang / 'bral pa dang / kha sogs su 'jog pa gsum gyi nyes pa med par ston pa'o /
translated: If these three are lost, there is no downfall means that when one is lost, there is no fault in keeping the other two, in separating from the other two, or in keeping them in one's mouth, etc.

original: // / spyi'i mtshan nyid de ltar bstan nas /
analyzed: // / spyi'i mtshan nyid de ltar bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the general characteristics in that way,

original: 'chang ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid ston pa yod pas so zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'chang ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid ston pa yod pas so zhes pa yin no //
translated: the characteristics of keeping are taught: If it exists, it is to be kept.

original: ci yod ce na bdag gir ro zhes pa yin te bdag gir byas pa yod na'o //
analyzed: ci yod ce na bdag gir ro zhes pa yin te bdag gir byas pa yod na'o //
translated: What exists? It is to be kept if it is made one's own.

original: bdag gir byas pa'o cog gi yan lag tu 'gyur ram zhe na /🔽zhag bcur rgyun chags na'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag gir byas pa'o cog gi yan lag tu 'gyur ram zhe na / zhag bcur rgyun chags na'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: Does it become a part of everything that is made one's own?🔽If it is continuous for ten days.

original: zhag bcu'i bar du bdag gir byas na'o //
analyzed: zhag bcu'i bar du bdag gir byas na'o //
translated: It is to be kept if it is made one's own for ten days.

original: de yang gang gi tshe nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang gi tshe nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: When does one commit an offense?🔽When the first day of another month arrives.

original: zhag gzhan gyi dang pos so zhes pa yin te zhag bcu gcig gi thog ma la thug na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhag gzhan gyi dang pos so zhes pa yin te zhag bcu gcig gi thog ma la thug na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one reaches the first day of the eleventh day, one commits an offense.

original: ci zhag bcur bcangs pas nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhag bcur bcangs pas nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Does one commit an offense by keeping it for ten days?🔽From cloth.

original: gos las so zhes pa yin te lhung bzed dang sman la sogs pa gzhan bcangs bas ma yin gyi gos bcangs pas nyes par 'gyur ba'o /
analyzed: gos las so zhes pa yin te lhung bzed dang sman la sogs pa gzhan bcangs bas ma yin gyi gos bcangs pas nyes par 'gyur ba'o /
translated: One commits an offense by keeping cloth, not by keeping other things such as a begging bowl or medicine.

original: // / gos so cog las nyes par 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: // / gos so cog las nyes par 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Does one commit an offense by keeping any kind of cloth?

original: tshad kyi mtha' ni 'khor gsum yog pa'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: tshad kyi mtha' ni 'khor gsum yog pa'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: The limit of the measure is that it covers the three areas.

original: lte ba man chad pus mo gnyis yan chad kyi bar yog pa yan chad las nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lte ba man chad pus mo gnyis yan chad kyi bar yog pa yan chad las nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: One commits an offense by keeping cloth that covers more than the area between the navel and the two knees.

original: tshad de tsam mo cog la nyes par 'gyur ram zhe na /🔽byin gyis @77a * //
analyzed: tshad de tsam mo cog la nyes par 'gyur ram zhe na / byin gyis @77a * //
translated: Does one commit an offense by keeping cloth of that measure?

original: ma brlabs na'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: ma brlabs na'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: If it is not consecrated.

original: rung bar byas ba la sogs pas byin gyis ma brlabs na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rung bar byas ba la sogs pas byin gyis ma brlabs na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One commits an offense if it is not consecrated by means of being made allowable and so on.

original: de nyi tsher yang ma zad kyi /
analyzed: de nyi tsher yang ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only that,

original: brlabs kyang rgyun chags pa dang ldan na'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: brlabs kyang rgyun chags pa dang ldan na'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: but if one possesses the continuous empowerment.

original: sngar rnyed pa ni byin gyis ma brlabs par lus /
analyzed: sngar rnyed pa ni byin gyis ma brlabs par lus /
translated: The former is the previously obtained that remains without empowerment.

original: phyis rnyed pa ni byin gyis brlabs pa las snga ma zhag bcu las 'das na phyi ma byin gyis brlabs kyang mi phan te yang dgos par ston pa'o //
analyzed: phyis rnyed pa ni byin gyis brlabs pa las snga ma zhag bcu las 'das na phyi ma byin gyis brlabs kyang mi phan te yang dgos par ston pa'o //
translated: The latter is the later obtained that is empowered. If the former is past ten days, then even if the latter is empowered, it is not beneficial. This teaches that it must be empowered again.

original: de ci'i phyir de lta zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir de lta zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: sngar byin gyis ma brlabs pa yod pa de tshun chad kyi khrin gyis gzhan no zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: sngar byin gyis ma brlabs pa yod pa de tshun chad kyi khrin gyis gzhan no zhes pa yin te /
translated: The former is the previously obtained that remains without empowerment. The latter is the later obtained that is empowered.

original: snga ma byin gyis ma brlabs pa'i zhar gyis phyi ma'ang sbang dgos par ston pa ste snga ma zhag bcu 'das pa brtsan gyi phyi ma byin gyis brlabs kyang rung ste zhag bcur brtsi'o //
analyzed: snga ma byin gyis ma brlabs pa'i zhar gyis phyi ma'ang sbang dgos par ston pa ste snga ma zhag bcu 'das pa brtsan gyi phyi ma byin gyis brlabs kyang rung ste zhag bcur brtsi'o //
translated: This teaches that the former must be empowered by the power of the former remaining without empowerment. Whether the former is empowered or not, it is counted as ten days.

original: 'chang ba'i sbang pa'o /
analyzed: 'chang ba'i sbang pa'o /
translated: This is the section on the fault of keeping.

original: // / da ni 'bral ba'i spang ba bstan te de'i zhar la bsnyad pa je ston pa ni /
analyzed: // / da ni 'bral ba'i spang ba bstan te de'i zhar la bsnyad pa je ston pa ni /
translated: Now the fault of separation is taught, and the related topics are presented.

original: gding ba dang bral ba nyes med ces pa yin te /
analyzed: gding ba dang bral ba nyes med ces pa yin te /
translated: The phrase one is not at fault if one is without a mat means

original: gding ba la 'bral ba med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: gding ba la 'bral ba med par ston pa'o //
translated: that one is not separated from one's mat.

original: 'bral ba med pa'i phyir gar yang bla'am zhe na /
analyzed: 'bral ba med pa'i phyir gar yang bla'am zhe na /
translated: If one is not separated from one's mat, then wherever one goes, one may take it with one?

original: gding ba bzhag ste mi 'gro zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: gding ba bzhag ste mi 'gro zhes pa yin te /
translated: The phrase one does not go, having left one's mat behind means

original: gar 'gro dgur gding ba khyer cig pa'o //
analyzed: gar 'gro dgur gding ba khyer cig pa'o //
translated: that one should take one's mat wherever one goes.🔽If one is to take it wherever one goes, then it is not proper to leave it behind?

original: gar 'gro dgur gzhag du ye mi rung bar khyer ram zhe na gal te de nyid du slar 'khor btsam gyi tshod na ma yin zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: gar 'gro dgur gzhag du ye mi rung bar khyer ram zhe na gal te de nyid du slar 'khor btsam gyi tshod na ma yin zhes pa yin te /
translated: The phrase except if one is returning to one's own dwelling means

original: nub mo slar 'khor ba tsam gyi tshod nam khyer yang sla ba'o //🔽de ltar bsams te song ba las dus ma yin par gyur na der gnas zhes pa ni gong ma ltar byas te song ba las phyis pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis slar mi 'khor ba tsam gyi tshod na /
analyzed: nub mo slar 'khor ba tsam gyi tshod nam khyer yang sla ba'o // de ltar bsams te song ba las dus ma yin par gyur na der gnas zhes pa ni gong ma ltar byas te song ba las phyis pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis slar mi 'khor ba tsam gyi tshod na /
translated: that it is easy to take it with one for the time of returning to one's dwelling after going out at night.🔽If one goes, thinking in this way, and then it becomes the wrong time, then one should stay there as described above.

original: der gzhi non cig pa'o //
analyzed: der gzhi non cig pa'o //
translated: If one is unable to return because of conditions such as darkness, then one should stay there means that one should stay where one is.

original: de brnyas te'o zhes pa ni de ltar gzhi mnan pa'i tshe gding ba gzhan las rnyos pa gzhi non cig pa'o //
analyzed: de brnyas te'o zhes pa ni de ltar gzhi mnan pa'i tshe gding ba gzhan las rnyos pa gzhi non cig pa'o //
translated: And if it is not found, then that means that when the mat is pressed down in that way, the other mat that is found is pressed down.

original: brnyar ma rnyed na ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: brnyar ma rnyed na ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: If a mat is not found, what should be done?

original: ma rnyed na bla gos bzhi bltabs su byos la phal cher mel tshe bya zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: ma rnyed na bla gos bzhi bltabs su byos la phal cher mel tshe bya zhes pa yin te /
translated: If it is not found, then one should make a four-fold fold of the upper robe and mostly do the watch.

original: brnyar ma rnyed na thabs 'di ltar gyis shig pa ste 'di yan ni phran tshegs las 'byung ba'o//
analyzed: brnyar ma rnyed na thabs 'di ltar gyis shig pa ste 'di yan ni phran tshegs las 'byung ba'o//
translated: If a mat is not found, one should do it in this way. This is from the Ksudraka.

original: sbyar ma gzhag par mi 'os pa'i gnas su dbyar gyi ras chen mi gzhag ces pa ni sbyar ma gzhag pa'i gnas 'og nas 'byung pa ma yin bar dbyar gyi ras chen ma 'jog shig pa'o //
analyzed: sbyar ma gzhag par mi 'os pa'i gnas su dbyar gyi ras chen mi gzhag ces pa ni sbyar ma gzhag pa'i gnas 'og nas 'byung pa ma yin bar dbyar gyi ras chen ma 'jog shig pa'o //
translated: One should not place the rainy season cloth in a place where it is not suitable to place a mat means that one should not place the rainy season cloth in a place other than the place where a mat is not placed, which will be explained below.

original: char 'bab na ma yin zhes pa ni char pa bab na yang ras chen ma 'jig shig pa'o //
analyzed: char 'bab na ma yin zhes pa ni char pa bab na yang ras chen ma 'jig shig pa'o //
translated: Not if it is raining means that one should not place the rainy season cloth even if it is raining.

original: chu bos chod par @77b 'gro na ma yin zhes pa ni rab brgal ba'i tshe 'dis bgrod dgos pas na /
analyzed: chu bos chod par @77b 'gro na ma yin zhes pa ni rab brgal ba'i tshe 'dis bgrod dgos pas na /
translated: Not if one is going across a river means that when crossing, one must cross with this.

original: chu brkal ba'i tshe'ang ma 'jog par khyer cig pa'o //
analyzed: chu brkal ba'i tshe'ang ma 'jog par khyer cig pa'o //
translated: When crossing water, carry it without setting it down.🔽If you are afraid of these, carry it without setting it down as previously mentioned.

original: 'di dag gis dogs na ma yin gong du smos pa lta bu dag gis dogs na yang ras chen ma 'jog par khyer cig pa'o //🔽dge slong dang bcas sgo 'phar dang bcas par ldan pa'i gnas dang char 'bab bzhin pa dang / 'bab tu dogs pa dang 'gro bar bya ba chus btsal ba 'di dag ma yin la sdom pa ma thob cing gtan pa ma brubs na sbyar ma med par gar yang mi 'gro zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa rnam pa lta bu ma yin zhing sdom pa
analyzed: 'di dag gis dogs na ma yin gong du smos pa lta bu dag gis dogs na yang ras chen ma 'jog par khyer cig pa'o // dge slong dang bcas sgo 'phar dang bcas par ldan pa'i gnas dang char 'bab bzhin pa dang / 'bab tu dogs pa dang 'gro bar bya ba chus btsal ba 'di dag ma yin la sdom pa ma thob cing gtan pa ma brubs na sbyar ma med par gar yang mi 'gro zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa rnam pa lta bu ma yin zhing sdom pa

analyzed: thob pa dang gtan pa brubs pa'i gdeng med na chos gos sbyar ma gzhag tu mi rung gis gar 'gro yang khyer cig pa'o //
