analyzed: chos gos kyi gnas su ma phyin pa lta na phyung ste gzhan la byin gyis brlab pa gnyen po'o zhes pa ni gal te char la sogs pas 'dzem ste bskur du mi rung na slar 'khor bar bsams te /
translated: If the robe is not yet at the place for the robe, then one should take it out and bless another.

original: chas pa las ma 'khor na /
analyzed: chas pa las ma 'khor na /
translated: If one thinks of returning, but does not return,

original: snga ma'i sngags yid kyis phyung la /
analyzed: snga ma'i sngags yid kyis phyung la /
translated: then one should mentally take out the former mantra.

original: khyim pa'i gos skya bo yan chad ji snyed pa la byin gyis rlobs shig pa'o //
analyzed: khyim pa'i gos skya bo yan chad ji snyed pa la byin gyis rlobs shig pa'o //
translated: One should bless as many as one can of the lay person's clothes, even if they are white.🔽If one is unable to put on the robes because of old age and sickness, one should give the vow of non-separation.

original: rgas shing na bas sbyar ma mi theg na mi 'bral ba'i sdom pa sbyin zhes pa ni chos gos nyams kyis mi theg pa tsam du rgas shing na /
analyzed: rgas shing na bas sbyar ma mi theg na mi 'bral ba'i sdom pa sbyin zhes pa ni chos gos nyams kyis mi theg pa tsam du rgas shing na /
translated: If one is unable to put on the robes because of old age and sickness,

original: chos gos dang 'bral bar gnang ba'i sdom pa gsol na dge 'dun gyis de lta bu la mi 'bral ba'i sdom pa byin cig pa'o //
analyzed: chos gos dang 'bral bar gnang ba'i sdom pa gsol na dge 'dun gyis de lta bu la mi 'bral ba'i sdom pa byin cig pa'o //
translated: if one requests the vow of permission to be without the robes, the Saṅgha should give the vow of non-separation to such a one.

original: gos gang las 'bral bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gos gang las 'bral bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: From which robe is one separated?

original: smras pa / byin gyis brlabs pa dang / sdom pa ma thob pa las byed ces pa yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / byin gyis brlabs pa dang / sdom pa ma thob pa las byed ces pa yin te /
translated: It is said: One acts from that which is blessed and from that which has not obtained the vow.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa'i gos gsum las gang yang rung ba dang / gong ma lta bu'i sdom pa ma thob pa las 'bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa'i gos gsum las gang yang rung ba dang / gong ma lta bu'i sdom pa ma thob pa las 'bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One is separated from any of the three robes that are consecrated, or from the vows that are like the higher ones.

original: nam yang rung ste 'bral bar 'gyur ram zhe na /🔽gnas de'i nye spyod dang bcas pa las gud na 'dug ste skya rengs shar na'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: nam yang rung ste 'bral bar 'gyur ram zhe na / gnas de'i nye spyod dang bcas pa las gud na 'dug ste skya rengs shar na'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: At what time is one separated?🔽One is separated if one stays apart from the place and its appurtenances, when dawn breaks.

original: gnas gang du 'dug pa de'i nye spyod la yang ma gtogs pa'i logs shig na 'dug 'dug pa las skya rengs kyis chod na 'bral bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: gnas gang du 'dug pa de'i nye spyod la yang ma gtogs pa'i logs shig na 'dug 'dug pa las skya rengs kyis chod na 'bral bar ston pa'o //
translated: This shows that one is separated if one stays apart from the appurtenances of the place where one stays, and dawn breaks.

original: de la gnas shes pa der 'dug pa tsam gyis gnas su mi 'gyur bas na de mtshan nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: de la gnas shes pa der 'dug pa tsam gyis gnas su mi 'gyur bas na de mtshan nyid ston pa ni /
translated: Since one does not become a monk by merely knowing that place and staying there, the characteristics of that are taught.

original: mtshams yod pa ni gnas kyi mtha' mtshams @78a * //🔽so zhes pa yin te //
analyzed: mtshams yod pa ni gnas kyi mtha' mtshams @78a * // so zhes pa yin te //
translated: The boundary of the place is the limit of the boundaries.

original: mtshams gar bcad pa'i gnas de tshun chad mtshams kyi mtha' ston pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams gar bcad pa'i gnas de tshun chad mtshams kyi mtha' ston pa'o //
translated: This shows that the limit of the boundaries is the extent of the place where the boundaries are drawn.

original: bdag po tha dad pa rnams mtshams kyis btsal ba bzhin du bdag po gcig gi gnas na mtshams kyis btsal ba yang nyes par 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: bdag po tha dad pa rnams mtshams kyis btsal ba bzhin du bdag po gcig gi gnas na mtshams kyis btsal ba yang nyes par 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: If the boundary is searched for in the abode of a single owner, it is not differentiated. If the abode is generally owned by a single owner, then searching for the boundary within that is not searching for a different boundary by searching for the owner.🔽If the owner is different, it is common in the door and so on.🔽If the boundary is searched for in the abode of a single owner, it is not differentiated. If the abode is generally owned by a single owner, then searching for the boundary within that is not searching for a different boundary by searching for the owner.🔽If the owner is different, it is common in the door and so on.🔽If the boundary is searched for in the abode of a single owner, it is not differentiated. If the abode is generally owned by a single owner, then searching for the boundary within that is not searching for a different boundary by searching for the owner.🔽If the owner is different, it is common in the door and so on.🔽If the boundary is searched for in the abode of a single owner, it is not differentiated. If the abode is generally owned by a single owner, then searching for the boundary within that is not searching for a different boundary by searching for the owner.🔽If the owner is different, it is common in the door and so on.

original: bdag po gcig na mtshams kyis btsal ba ni tha dad du mi byed ces pa yin te gnas spyir bdag po gcig dbang ba zhig na de'i nang na mtshams kyis btsal ba tsam ni bdag po brtsan bas mtshams tha dad du mi 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: bdag po gcig na mtshams kyis btsal ba ni tha dad du mi byed ces pa yin te gnas spyir bdag po gcig dbang ba zhig na de'i nang na mtshams kyis btsal ba tsam ni bdag po brtsan bas mtshams tha dad du mi 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
translated: If the boundary is searched for in the abode of a single owner, it is not differentiated. If the abode is generally owned by a single owner, then searching for the boundary within that is not searching for a different boundary by searching for the owner.

original: bdag po tha dad na yang sgo la sogs par thun mong ba yin te /
analyzed: bdag po tha dad na yang sgo la sogs par thun mong ba yin te /
translated: If the owner is different, it is common in the door and so on.

original: rgyas par ni rnam par 'byed pa las 'byung ba dang sbyor cig / nor dang lta bas ma bye ba yang ngo zhes pa ni spun lta bu nor ma bgos pa dang mu stegs lta ba mi mthun pas ma phye ba'i gnas kyang tha dad mi byed par
analyzed: rgyas par ni rnam par 'byed pa las 'byung ba dang sbyor cig / nor dang lta bas ma bye ba yang ngo zhes pa ni spun lta bu nor ma bgos pa dang mu stegs lta ba mi mthun pas ma phye ba'i gnas kyang tha dad mi byed par
translated: If the boundary is searched for in the abode of a single owner, it is not differentiated. If the abode is generally owned by a single owner, then searching for the boundary within that is not searching for a different boundary by searching for the owner.🔽If the owner is different, it is common in the door and so on.🔽If the boundary is searched for in the abode of a single owner, it is not differentiated. If the abode is generally owned by a single owner, then searching for the boundary within that is not searching for a different boundary by searching for the owner.

original: ston pa'o // yal ga dang yan lag ma 'dres pa ni gnas so so'o zhes pa ni yal ga'i yan lag 'dab ma 'dres pa bzhin du chos gos gzhag ste bdag kyang yal ga gcig la 'dug na gnas tha dad pas 'bral bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ston pa'o // yal ga dang yan lag ma 'dres pa ni gnas so so'o zhes pa ni yal ga'i yan lag 'dab ma 'dres pa bzhin du chos gos gzhag ste bdag kyang yal ga gcig la 'dug na gnas tha dad pas 'bral bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The root of the branches is the trunk.

original: mdo ni thun mong ngo zhes pa ni yal ga'i mdo bdag gis bsrungs sam /
analyzed: mdo ni thun mong ngo zhes pa ni yal ga'i mdo bdag gis bsrungs sam /
translated: The root of the trunk is the root.

original: mdor chos gos gzhag la bdag de las gyes pa'i yal gar 'dug kyang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mdor chos gos gzhag la bdag de las gyes pa'i yal gar 'dug kyang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If I guard the root or if I place my robes at the root and I sit on a branch that is separated from that, there is no separation.🔽The root and so on are also.🔽The root of the branches is the trunk.

original: rtsa ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pa yang ngo zhes pa ni yal ga rnams kyi rtsa ba ni sdong po sdong po'i drungs ni rtsa bas na /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pa yang ngo zhes pa ni yal ga rnams kyi rtsa ba ni sdong po sdong po'i drungs ni rtsa bas na /
translated: The root of the trunk is the root.

original: rtsa ba bdag gis bsrungs sam rtsa bar chos gos bzhag la bdag steng du 'dzegs na yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtsa ba bdag gis bsrungs sam rtsa bar chos gos bzhag la bdag steng du 'dzegs na yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If I guard the root or if I place my robes at the root and I climb up, there is no separation.

original: stsogs pa zhes pa'i nang du ni rtsa bas gar slebs pa'i sa khyon yang bsdu bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: stsogs pa zhes pa'i nang du ni rtsa bas gar slebs pa'i sa khyon yang bsdu bar ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase and so on indicates that the area reached by the root is also included.

original: shing gi lo ma dang 'dab mas 'dab chags pa ni gnas gcig go zhes pa ni shing gi lo ma dang 'dab ma 'dab chags 'brel par 'dug na gnas gcig par ston pa'o //
analyzed: shing gi lo ma dang 'dab mas 'dab chags pa ni gnas gcig go zhes pa ni shing gi lo ma dang 'dab ma 'dab chags 'brel par 'dug na gnas gcig par ston pa'o //
translated: The leaves and branches of a tree are one place, if the leaves and branches of a tree are connected.

original: khebs pa bzhin du 'og gi phyogs kyang der chud do zhes pa ni thog bor ba'i 'og tu ji snyed 'dus pa kun de'i 'og tu gtogs pas na /
analyzed: khebs pa bzhin du 'og gi phyogs kyang der chud do zhes pa ni thog bor ba'i 'og tu ji snyed 'dus pa kun de'i 'og tu gtogs pas na /
translated: The lower part is included in that, as if it were covered.

original: chos gos steng du gzhag la bdag 'og tu 'dug kyang rung bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: chos gos steng du gzhag la bdag 'og tu 'dug kyang rung bar ston pa'o //
translated: It is taught that it is suitable to put the robe on top and sit below.🔽Boats and carts are also like that.

original: gru dang shing rta yang ngo zhes pa ni gru dang shing rtas ji snyed khebs pa yang de'i 'og tu gtogs pas na chos gos steng du bzhag la @78b bdag 'og tu 'dug yang mi 'bral /
analyzed: gru dang shing rta yang ngo zhes pa ni gru dang shing rtas ji snyed khebs pa yang de'i 'og tu gtogs pas na chos gos steng du bzhag la @78b bdag 'og tu 'dug yang mi 'bral /
translated: It is taught that it is suitable to put the robe on top and sit below, because the extent covered by a boat or cart is included in that.🔽In a desert, the extent covered by the limbs is the limit.

original: mtshams med na yan lag gis khebs pa mtha'o zhes pa ni mtshams med pa'i thang bu la 'dug na bdag gi lus kyis mi khebs pa'i tshun chad gnas su ston pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams med na yan lag gis khebs pa mtha'o zhes pa ni mtshams med pa'i thang bu la 'dug na bdag gi lus kyis mi khebs pa'i tshun chad gnas su ston pa'o //
translated: It is taught that if one sits on a small piece of land in a desert, the extent not covered by one’s body is the place.

original: gnas de dag ltar bstan nas da ni nye spyod ston te de'ang 'jug pa dang mkho ba'o //
analyzed: gnas de dag ltar bstan nas da ni nye spyod ston te de'ang 'jug pa dang mkho ba'o //
translated: Having taught those places, now the near vicinity is taught, which is also the approach and the necessary.

original: de la 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'jug pa ni /
translated: Among those, the approach is:

original: 'dom gang 'khor yug ni nye spyod do zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dom gang 'khor yug ni nye spyod do zhes pa yin te /
translated: The near vicinity is a fathom in all directions.

original: gnas kyi mtshams las 'dom gang khor yug tshun chad 'chags la sogs pa bshad ba'i 'grul zags 'jug cing nye bar spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gnas kyi mtshams las 'dom gang khor yug tshun chad 'chags la sogs pa bshad ba'i 'grul zags 'jug cing nye bar spyod pa'o //
translated: Within a fathom's distance all around the boundary of the place, one enters and uses the approach for the purpose of explaining the creation and so forth.

original: de'i khyad par grong rnam pa gsum gyi nye spyod ston pa ni /
analyzed: de'i khyad par grong rnam pa gsum gyi nye spyod ston pa ni /
translated: The teaching on the near vicinity of the three types of villages is:

original: grong rtsig pas bskor na 'od ma'i shing rta phyugs drug dang ldan pas ji tsam khebs pa dang / bya gag 'babs pa'i khyon nam lam mo zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: grong rtsig pas bskor na 'od ma'i shing rta phyugs drug dang ldan pas ji tsam khebs pa dang / bya gag 'babs pa'i khyon nam lam mo zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: If the village is surrounded by walls, it is the extent covered by a six-oxen cart of bamboo, or the area where a crow can fly or walk.

original: grong rabs bskor ba zhig na de'i nye spyod kyi tshad ming gis smos pa 'di tsam gyis zung shig pa'o //
analyzed: grong rabs bskor ba zhig na de'i nye spyod kyi tshad ming gis smos pa 'di tsam gyis zung shig pa'o //
translated: If a village is surrounded by walls, one should understand that the extent of its near vicinity is just this much, as stated by name.

original: shing thabs kyis bskor nar lug gi rdul tam mi rang bzhin gyis 'dzem pa can gyi bshang sa'i lam mo zhes pa ni grong shing thags kyis bskor ba zhig na de'i nye spyod kyis tshigs ming gis smos pa 'di tsam gyis zung shig pa'o //
analyzed: shing thabs kyis bskor nar lug gi rdul tam mi rang bzhin gyis 'dzem pa can gyi bshang sa'i lam mo zhes pa ni grong shing thags kyis bskor ba zhig na de'i nye spyod kyis tshigs ming gis smos pa 'di tsam gyis zung shig pa'o //
translated: The path of excrement of a person who is naturally shy is a path of excrement of a person who is naturally shy, in a village surrounded by trees, which is called by the name of the nearest place.

original: 'obs kyis bskor na skas them pa bcu gnyis pa'am phyag dar gyi bong rdo rags pa'i lam mo zhes pa ni grong 'obs kyis bskor ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'obs kyis bskor na skas them pa bcu gnyis pa'am phyag dar gyi bong rdo rags pa'i lam mo zhes pa ni grong 'obs kyis bskor ba zhig na /
translated: The path of a village surrounded by a moat is a path of a village surrounded by a moat, which is called by the name of the nearest place.

original: de'i nye spyod kyi sa tshigs ming gis smos pa 'di tsam gyis zung shig /'jug pa'i nye spyod de ltar bstan nas /
analyzed: de'i nye spyod kyi sa tshigs ming gis smos pa 'di tsam gyis zung shig /'jug pa'i nye spyod de ltar bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the near-action of entering,

original: mkho ba'i nye spyod ston pa ni /
analyzed: mkho ba'i nye spyod ston pa ni /
translated: the teaching of the near-action of necessity is:

original: de'i gnas ni go re long dang / 'gro ba dang 'dug pa dang thul yabs kyis ji tsam slebs pa'i khongs so zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i gnas ni go re long dang / 'gro ba dang 'dug pa dang thul yabs kyis ji tsam slebs pa'i khongs so zhes pa yin te /
translated: The place of that is the area reached by the sound of the call, going and staying, and the sound of the whip.

original: mkho ba'i nye spyod kyi sa tshigs ming gis smos pa 'di tsam gyis zung shig pa'o //
analyzed: mkho ba'i nye spyod kyi sa tshigs ming gis smos pa 'di tsam gyis zung shig pa'o //
translated: The place of the near-action of necessity is called by the name of the nearest place.

original: lam du zhugs pa'i mi dang ma bral la mtshams med na 'dom bzhi bcu dgu'o zhes pa ni lam thog thag tu song la ra ba la sogs pa'i mtshams kyis kyang ma btsal na /

analyzed: dbus nas rgyang grags khor yug tshun chad mtshams su brtsi'o //

original: de phan chad mtshams su ma brtsi shig pa'o //
analyzed: de phan chad mtshams su ma brtsi shig pa'o //
translated: If one goes along the path and does not leave the presence of people on the path, and if there is no break, then forty-nine cubits.

original: 'bral ba'i spang ba rnam par 'byed pa'o /
analyzed: 'bral ba'i spang ba rnam par 'byed pa'o /
translated: If one goes

original: // /'bral ba zhus pa las 'byung ba ston pa ni dam dum gyur kyang byin gyis brlabs pa mi yal zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: // /'bral ba zhus pa las 'byung ba ston pa ni dam dum gyur kyang byin gyis brlabs pa mi yal zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The teaching on the arising of the request for separation is “Even if it is torn, the consecration does not disappear. ”

original: byin gyis brlabs pa'i gos rnying pa la sogs pas dam dum gyur kyang bdag gi ma yin par mi 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa'i gos rnying pa la sogs pas dam dum gyur kyang bdag gi ma yin par mi 'gyur bas na /
translated: Even if the consecrated old clothes and so forth are torn, they do not become not one’s own.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa yal bar mi 'gyur bar ston pa'o ;
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa yal bar mi 'gyur bar ston pa'o ;
translated: Therefore, it teaches that the consecration does not disappear.

original: / spang pa la mi 'chags pa ma yin zhes pa ni spang bar 'gyur ba'i gos la byin gyis brlabs na'ang sngags ni mi 'chags pa med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: / spang pa la mi 'chags pa ma yin zhes pa ni spang bar 'gyur ba'i gos la byin gyis brlabs na'ang sngags ni mi 'chags pa med par ston pa'o //
translated: “It is not the case that one does not confess the abandonment” teaches that even if one consecrates the clothes that are to be abandoned, the mantra is not abandoned.

original: dge 'dun gyi yang ngo zhes pa ni dge 'dun gyi gos la byin gyis brlabs na'ang mi 'chags pa med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi yang ngo zhes pa ni dge 'dun gyi gos la byin gyis brlabs na'ang mi 'chags pa med par ston pa'o //
translated: “It is also the Saṅgha’s” teaches that even if one consecrates the Saṅgha’s clothes, they are not abandoned.

original: 'di las 'bral par yang 'gyur zhes pa ni dge 'dun gyi gos de bdag gi ma yin du zin kyang byin gyis brlabs na 'bral bar 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'di las 'bral par yang 'gyur zhes pa ni dge 'dun gyi gos de bdag gi ma yin du zin kyang byin gyis brlabs na 'bral bar 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
translated: “One also separates from this” teaches that even if one consecrates the Saṅgha’s clothes that are not one’s own, one separates from them.

original: gzhan gnas kyang gzhan gyi gnas su mi 'gyur zhes pa ni bdag gi gnas su khyim pa la sogs pa phyi mi gzhan 'dug kyang /
analyzed: gzhan gnas kyang gzhan gyi gnas su mi 'gyur zhes pa ni bdag gi gnas su khyim pa la sogs pa phyi mi gzhan 'dug kyang /
translated: The line even if others are present, they are not in my place means that even if other people, such as laypeople, are present in my place,

original: bdag gi gnas su 'gyur ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi gnas su 'gyur ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: they are not in my place.

original: de cir ston ce na bdag gi gnas su phyi mi 'dug kyang 'bral ba'i nyen du mi 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: de cir ston ce na bdag gi gnas su phyi mi 'dug kyang 'bral ba'i nyen du mi 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
translated: What does this show? It shows that even if other people are not present in my place, I will not be in danger of being separated from them.

original: lta ba zhes pa gzhan dang 'di'i chos sum chud pa ma yin zhes pa ni bdag cag mu stegs pa gzhan gyi gnas kyis bskal na /
analyzed: lta ba zhes pa gzhan dang 'di'i chos sum chud pa ma yin zhes pa ni bdag cag mu stegs pa gzhan gyi gnas kyis bskal na /
translated: The line I do not share their views means that if I were to share the views of other tīrthikas,

original: gong du lta bas bskal zhes smos ba'i nang du 'dus par ston pa'o //
analyzed: gong du lta bas bskal zhes smos ba'i nang du 'dus par ston pa'o //
translated: it would be included in the above line I am not separated from them by views.

original: sgo gang thun mong ma yin zhes pa ni sgo gang thun mong ba'i nang du 'dus par ston pa'o //
analyzed: sgo gang thun mong ma yin zhes pa ni sgo gang thun mong ba'i nang du 'dus par ston pa'o //
translated: The line I do not share their doors means that it would be included in the above line I am not separated from them by doors.

original: nor zhes pas ni pha dang bur yang ma yin zhes pa ni pha dang bur sgo bye na yang /
analyzed: nor zhes pas ni pha dang bur yang ma yin zhes pa ni pha dang bur sgo bye na yang /
translated: The line I am not their father or son means that even if the door between a father and son were open,

original: gong du nor zhes smos pa'i khongs su 'dus par ston pa'o //
analyzed: gong du nor zhes smos pa'i khongs su 'dus par ston pa'o //
translated: it would be included in the above line I am not separated from them by wealth.

original: sbangs pa yang de bzhin zhes pa ni lhung bzed khas phub pa yang de'i tshul las 'gyur te na ro bgos sam ma bgos pa dang sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: sbangs pa yang de bzhin zhes pa ni lhung bzed khas phub pa yang de'i tshul las 'gyur te na ro bgos sam ma bgos pa dang sbyor ba'o //
translated: Also, if the begging bowl is turned upside down, it is the same way. This is applied to whether or not the food is divided.

original: smyen gnas kyang ngo zhes pa ni du ma smyen ngan cig car du spyod na de dag la nor bgos sam ma bgos pa las lhung ba mang nyung gi grangs su 'gyur bar ston pa'o //🔽'di grong gir 'gyur gyi @79b gtsug lag khang gi nye spyod ma yin zhes pa ni grong dang gtsug lag khang gi bar na 'dom gang las med pa zhig na /
analyzed: smyen gnas kyang ngo zhes pa ni du ma smyen ngan cig car du spyod na de dag la nor bgos sam ma bgos pa las lhung ba mang nyung gi grangs su 'gyur bar ston pa'o // 'di grong gir 'gyur gyi @79b gtsug lag khang gi nye spyod ma yin zhes pa ni grong dang gtsug lag khang gi bar na 'dom gang las med pa zhig na /
translated: Also, if there are many, it is the same way. This shows that if one engages in many bad deeds at once, the number of downfalls is determined by whether or not the food is divided among them.🔽This is a village, not a monastic boundary. This shows that if there is less than a fathom between the village and the monastery,

original: de grong gi nye spyod du 'gyur gyi gtsug lag khang du ma yin par ston pa ni /
analyzed: de grong gi nye spyod du 'gyur gyi gtsug lag khang du ma yin par ston pa ni /
translated: it is a village boundary, not a monastic boundary.

original: khyim pa yod na de'i than khor mtshams bcad pa'i khongs su mi rung ba bzhin no //🔽'bral ba'i spangs pa zhus pa'o //
analyzed: khyim pa yod na de'i than khor mtshams bcad pa'i khongs su mi rung ba bzhin no // 'bral ba'i spangs pa zhus pa'o //
translated: If there are householders, it is not suitable to be included in the boundary of their house.

original: 'bral ba'i spangs pa'o /
analyzed: 'bral ba'i spangs pa'o /
translated: This is the explanation of the downfall of separation.

original: // / zla ba'i spang ba 'chad par 'dod pa ni /
analyzed: // / zla ba'i spang ba 'chad par 'dod pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the downfall of the moon

original: langs su reb med na chung ste khru gang khor yug pa'ang rangs pa bzhin zhes pa yin te phyi ma rnyed du re ba med na ni chung ba'i tshad khru gang khor yug pa yan chad kyang 'khor gsum yog pa'i rangs pa dang 'dra ste /🔽zhag bcu 'das na spang bar 'gyur ba'o /
analyzed: langs su reb med na chung ste khru gang khor yug pa'ang rangs pa bzhin zhes pa yin te phyi ma rnyed du re ba med na ni chung ba'i tshad khru gang khor yug pa yan chad kyang 'khor gsum yog pa'i rangs pa dang 'dra ste / zhag bcu 'das na spang bar 'gyur ba'o /
translated: If there is no hope of obtaining a larger one, even a small one, one cubit in circumference, is suitable.

original: khyin gyis brlabs pa yang yod na yang ngo zhes pa ni byin gyis brlabs pa'i chos gos gsum yod na gdod gong ma ltar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: khyin gyis brlabs pa yang yod na yang ngo zhes pa ni byin gyis brlabs pa'i chos gos gsum yod na gdod gong ma ltar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one has the three robes consecrated by the ritual of consecration, then it is as above.

original: ji ltar na 'jog pa'i spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'jog pa'i spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one become guilty of a downfall through keeping?

original: gzhan du na zhag sum cu 'das na'o zhes pa yin te mdo gong ma gnyis ltar ma yin na zhag sum cu 'das par bzhag pas spangs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na zhag sum cu 'das na'o zhes pa yin te mdo gong ma gnyis ltar ma yin na zhag sum cu 'das par bzhag pas spangs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one does not do as in the two previous sutras, one becomes guilty of a downfall by keeping the robe for more than thirty days.

original: kha dog la sogs pa mi 'dra ba ni ma 'das pa'o zhes pa ni snga ma rnyed zin pa dang / phyis rnyed du re ba gnyis ser po 'am dmar po la sogs pa kha dog srel zhing gyur te /
analyzed: kha dog la sogs pa mi 'dra ba ni ma 'das pa'o zhes pa ni snga ma rnyed zin pa dang / phyis rnyed du re ba gnyis ser po 'am dmar po la sogs pa kha dog srel zhing gyur te /
translated: The different colors and so forth are not the same.

original: mi mthun na ma rangs pa dang 'dra bas gzhag par ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun na ma rangs pa dang 'dra bas gzhag par ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: This means that the former, which is already obtained, and the latter, which is hoped to be obtained, are either yellow or red, and so forth, and if they are not the same, do not set them aside, as if displeased.

original: de la sogs zhes pa ni bal dang ras lta bu'am ras dang zar ma lta bu'am /
analyzed: de la sogs zhes pa ni bal dang ras lta bu'am ras dang zar ma lta bu'am /
translated: The and so forth refers to wool and cloth, or cloth and silk,

original: stug srab kyi khyad yod pa la sogs pa rigs pa mi 'dra ba rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: stug srab kyi khyad yod pa la sogs pa rigs pa mi 'dra ba rnams la bya'o //
translated: or the difference of thick and thin, and so forth, and should be applied to the different types of reasoning.

original: dkar po ni kha dog thams cad do zhes pa ni dkar po ni sngar rnyed kyang rung phyis rnyed kyang rung bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: dkar po ni kha dog thams cad do zhes pa ni dkar po ni sngar rnyed kyang rung phyis rnyed kyang rung bar ston pa'o //
translated: White is all colors. This means that whether white is obtained earlier or later, it is taught that it is the same.

original: der grub na bcu tshogs snga ma der gtogs zhes pa ni zla ba gcig tu stsogs par 'jog pa /
analyzed: der grub na bcu tshogs snga ma der gtogs zhes pa ni zla ba gcig tu stsogs par 'jog pa /
translated: If it is established there, the former set of ten belongs there. This means that it is posited for one month and so forth.

original: dang po tshes gcig la rnyed de bzhag pa'i kha stsogs phyi ma zhag bzhi'am lnga lon te rnyed na zhag bcu ma 'das par byin gyis rlobs shig pa'o//
analyzed: dang po tshes gcig la rnyed de bzhag pa'i kha stsogs phyi ma zhag bzhi'am lnga lon te rnyed na zhag bcu ma 'das par byin gyis rlobs shig pa'o//
translated: If one finds the first day of the month and leaves it, and finds the next one four or five days later, then consecrate it so that it is not past ten days.

original: de ste zhag bcu thal na spang par ston pa'o //
analyzed: de ste zhag bcu thal na spang par ston pa'o //
translated: If it is past ten days, it is taught that it is to be relinquished.

original: de bzhin nyi shu dang sum cu thal na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyi shu dang sum cu thal na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If it is past twenty or thirty days, there is an offense.

original: gos ci 'dra ba dang tshad ji tsam pa la byin gyis brlabs pa 'chags pa dang / bzlog na spang bar 'gyur ba rnams 'di man chad ston te /
analyzed: gos ci 'dra ba dang tshad ji tsam pa la byin gyis brlabs pa 'chags pa dang / bzlog na spang bar 'gyur ba rnams 'di man chad ston te /
translated: From here on it is taught what kind of cloth and how much is to be consecrated, what is to be relinquished if it is the opposite, and so forth.

original: ma spyad na sbyar ma'i mtha' ni nyi rim mo @80a * //🔽zhes pa ni gsar las sbyar 'drub na nyi rim tshun chad du gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: ma spyad na sbyar ma'i mtha' ni nyi rim mo @80a * // zhes pa ni gsar las sbyar 'drub na nyi rim tshun chad du gyis shig pa'o //
translated: If one does not use it, the edge of the patch is the edge of the sun.🔽This means that if one is sewing a new patch, one should do it within the edge of the sun.

original: gding ba yang ngo zhes pa ni gding ba yang gsar las 'drub na nyi rim tshun chad du gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: gding ba yang ngo zhes pa ni gding ba yang gsar las 'drub na nyi rim tshun chad du gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The mat is also like that. This means that if one is sewing a new mat, one should do it within the edge of the sun.

original: stod g-yogs smad g-yogs ni chig thang ngo zhes pa ni 'di gnyis gsar las byed na gcig thang du gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: stod g-yogs smad g-yogs ni chig thang ngo zhes pa ni 'di gnyis gsar las byed na gcig thang du gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The upper and lower robes are one set.🔽If you wear them in season, they are the sun and moon.

original: dus su dengs na nyi rim mo zhes pa ni gong du smos pa'i gos 'di dag dpyid dang dbyar dang dgun dang dus gsum gyi zla ba bzhi gang yang rung ba cig thal bar spyad na /
analyzed: dus su dengs na nyi rim mo zhes pa ni gong du smos pa'i gos 'di dag dpyid dang dbyar dang dgun dang dus gsum gyi zla ba bzhi gang yang rung ba cig thal bar spyad na /
translated: If you make these robes mentioned above, you should use them for any of the four months of the three seasons: spring, summer, and winter.

original: thang ba nyi rim du bya ba nas sbyar ma bzhi rim du bya ba'i bar du lta bas des klog shig pa'o//
analyzed: thang ba nyi rim du bya ba nas sbyar ma bzhi rim du bya ba'i bar du lta bas des klog shig pa'o//
translated: If they are worn out, you should make them into the sun and moon, and so on, up to the four sets.

original: phyag dar khrod kyi ni nges pa med ces pa ni phyag dar khrod pa las 'drub na rim du bya ba chad pa med do //
analyzed: phyag dar khrod kyi ni nges pa med ces pa ni phyag dar khrod pa las 'drub na rim du bya ba chad pa med do //
translated: There is no restriction on the use of rags.

original: dengs shing bsrabs na lhan ba ci dran du gdab ces pa ni spyad spyad de dengs sam sgos bshud pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis rdol du cha na lhan pa gar 'os par ci dran du thob shig pa'o //
analyzed: dengs shing bsrabs na lhan ba ci dran du gdab ces pa ni spyad spyad de dengs sam sgos bshud pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis rdol du cha na lhan pa gar 'os par ci dran du thob shig pa'o //
translated: If they are worn out and torn, you should patch them as you wish.

original: lhag par mi bya zhes pa ni du rim du byas pa'i tshad gong du bstan pa las lhag par byas sam lhan cig dran du babs pa las lhag ste /
analyzed: lhag par mi bya zhes pa ni du rim du byas pa'i tshad gong du bstan pa las lhag par byas sam lhan cig dran du babs pa las lhag ste /
translated: The phrase in excess means that if one does it in excess of the measure taught above, or in excess of what one can remember at the same time,

original: kun yog pa btab na nyes byas su 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: kun yog pa btab na nyes byas su 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
translated: it is taught that one commits an offense.

original: spong bar yang byed ces pa ni rim pa lhag pa la sogs pa gong ma ltar byas na spang bar 'gyur par ston pa'o//
analyzed: spong bar yang byed ces pa ni rim pa lhag pa la sogs pa gong ma ltar byas na spang bar 'gyur par ston pa'o//
translated: The phrase and also abandons means that if one does it in excess of the measure and so forth as above, one abandons it.

original: bcos nas 'di nyid dang sbyar ro zhes pa'i sems ma bskyed par rung bar mi dbral zhes pa sbyar ma dri mas gos sam kha dog yal ba 'chos par 'dod na 'phral la slar 'di nyid dang sbyar ro zhes pa'i sems sam bskyed par gzu lums su sbyar🔽mas 'byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: bcos nas 'di nyid dang sbyar ro zhes pa'i sems ma bskyed par rung bar mi dbral zhes pa sbyar ma dri mas gos sam kha dog yal ba 'chos par 'dod na 'phral la slar 'di nyid dang sbyar ro zhes pa'i sems sam bskyed par gzu lums su sbyar🔽mas 'byed cig pa'o //
translated: If one wishes to repair it, one should not separate it from this very robe, thinking, I will connect it later. If one wishes to repair a robe that is soiled with stains or has lost its color, one should not rashly separate it from this very robe, thinking, I will connect it later, but should generate the thought, I will repair it and connect it to this very robe.

original: ji ltar yang rung ste phral ba las ma sbyar gyi bar du spong bar byed ces pa ni gong ma ltar byas te dral tam gzu lums su dral kyang rung ste phral ba las zhag bcu thal gyi bar du ma sbyar bar lus na spang bar 'gyur ba'o
analyzed: ji ltar yang rung ste phral ba las ma sbyar gyi bar du spong bar byed ces pa ni gong ma ltar byas te dral tam gzu lums su dral kyang rung ste phral ba las zhag bcu thal gyi bar du ma sbyar bar lus na spang bar 'gyur ba'o
translated: As long as it is not sewn, it is to be abandoned means that it is to be abandoned if it is not sewn for more than ten days after it is separated, whether it is separated as above or separated by force.

original: // sbyar ma ston pa'i skabs su de dang 'brel ba ston pa ni /
analyzed: // sbyar ma ston pa'i skabs su de dang 'brel ba ston pa ni /
translated: The teaching connected with the above in the section on sewing is:

original: sbyar ma'i tshal bu ni dgu nas nyi shu lnga'i bar du ste zung btang zhes pa ni sbyar ma 'drub pa'i tshal bu dgu pa nas nyi shu lnga'i bar du grangs zung du 'gyur ba bcu dang bcu gnyis la sogs pa khol gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: sbyar ma'i tshal bu ni dgu nas nyi shu lnga'i bar du ste zung btang zhes pa ni sbyar ma 'drub pa'i tshal bu dgu pa nas nyi shu lnga'i bar du grangs zung du 'gyur ba bcu dang bcu gnyis la sogs pa khol gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The patches of the sewn robe are from nine to twenty-five.  Pairs means that the patches for making the sewn robe are from nine to twenty-five, and the pairs are ten, twelve, and so on.

original: de las lhag par mi bya ba ston pa ni /
analyzed: de las lhag par mi bya ba ston pa ni /
translated: The teaching on not making more than that is:

original: 'di las lhag pa bem bu'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di las lhag pa bem bu'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: More than that is a patchwork.

original: tshal bu nyi shu lnga las lhag @80b par byas na tshem bu'am bem bur 'gyur bas nam byed cig par ston pa'o //
analyzed: tshal bu nyi shu lnga las lhag @80b par byas na tshem bu'am bem bur 'gyur bas nam byed cig par ston pa'o //
translated: If one makes more than twenty-five patches, it becomes a patchwork or a patchwork robe, so one should not make it.

original: tshal bu de'i dkyil 'khor rangs dang phyed kyi rim pa ji ltar byas ba ston pa ni /
analyzed: tshal bu de'i dkyil 'khor rangs dang phyed kyi rim pa ji ltar byas ba ston pa ni /
translated: The explanation of how to make the mandala of the three, five, seven, nine, eleven, thirteen, fifteen, seventeen, nineteen, twenty-one, twenty-three, and twenty-five parts is:

original: de la dang bo gsum ni dkyil 'khor phyed dang gsum pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa yin te de la dang po'i tshal bu dgu pa dang bcu gcig pa dang bcu gsum pa gsum dkyil 'khor ni phyed dang gsum gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: de la dang bo gsum ni dkyil 'khor phyed dang gsum pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa yin te de la dang po'i tshal bu dgu pa dang bcu gcig pa dang bcu gsum pa gsum dkyil 'khor ni phyed dang gsum gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Among them, the first three are one and a half mandalas, and so on. Among them, the first three parts, the nine, eleven, and thirteen parts, are one and a half mandalas.

original: gnyis pa ni dkyil 'khor phyed dang bzhi'o zhes pa ni tshal bu bco lnga pa dang bcu bdun pa dang bcu dgu pa gsum gyi dkyil 'khor phyed dang bzhir gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni dkyil 'khor phyed dang bzhi'o zhes pa ni tshal bu bco lnga pa dang bcu bdun pa dang bcu dgu pa gsum gyi dkyil 'khor phyed dang bzhir gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The second is four half-mandalas. The fifteen, seventeen, and nineteen parts are four half-mandalas.

original: gsum pa ni dkyil 'khor phyed dang lnga'o zhes pa ni tshal bu nyi shu gcig pa dang nyi shu gsum pa dang nyi shu lnga pa gsum gyi dkyil 'khor phyed dang lngar gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni dkyil 'khor phyed dang lnga'o zhes pa ni tshal bu nyi shu gcig pa dang nyi shu gsum pa dang nyi shu lnga pa gsum gyi dkyil 'khor phyed dang lngar gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The third is five half-mandalas. The twenty-one, twenty-three, and twenty-five parts are five half-mandalas.

original: de la stod g-yogs kyi tshal bu ni bdun pa dkyil 'khor ni phyed dang gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de la stod g-yogs kyi tshal bu ni bdun pa dkyil 'khor ni phyed dang gsum pa'o //
translated: Among them, the upper robe part is seven, and the mandala is one and a half.

original: smad g-yogs kyi tshal bu ni lnga pa dkyil 'khor ni phyed dang do ba'o //
analyzed: smad g-yogs kyi tshal bu ni lnga pa dkyil 'khor ni phyed dang do ba'o //
translated: The lower robe is five parts, and the half-mandala is the sixth.

original: 'di gnyis kyi dkyil 'khor dang tshal bu gzhung las ci phyir mi 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi dkyil 'khor dang tshal bu gzhung las ci phyir mi 'byung zhe na /
translated: Why are the mandala and parts not mentioned in the scriptures for these two?

original: bcad cing gtubs pa nges ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcad cing gtubs pa nges ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cutting and sewing is not definite.

original: 'o na tshal bu dang dkyil 'khor gyi tshad 'di skad du ci phyir bstan zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na tshal bu dang dkyil 'khor gyi tshad 'di skad du ci phyir bstan zhe na /
translated: Well then, why is the measure of the parts and mandala taught like this?

original: de ni tshe dang ldan pa dag dgongs shig / bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi pa'i gos 'di stod g-yogs su byin gyis brlabs te 'dod na dkyil 'khor phyed dang gsum pa'i bdun par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni tshe dang ldan pa dag dgongs shig / bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi pa'i gos 'di stod g-yogs su byin gyis brlabs te 'dod na dkyil 'khor phyed dang gsum pa'i bdun par bya'o //
translated: The venerable ones should listen: I, the fully ordained monk named so-and-so, consecrate this robe as the upper robe. If I wish, I can make it seven fingers wide and one and a half mandalas long.

original: bar chad ma byung na bkru /🔽gding / sbyar /
analyzed: bar chad ma byung na bkru / gding / sbyar /
translated: If there are no obstacles, I will wash it,🔽spread it out,🔽apply it,

original: bsdeb / btso /
analyzed: bsdeb / btso /
translated: combine it, boil it,🔽and sew it according to the conditions.

original: glan / drub rnams rkyen ji bzhin du bya'o zhes pa dang de bzhin du bdag gi gos 'di byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: glan / drub rnams rkyen ji bzhin du bya'o zhes pa dang de bzhin du bdag gi gos 'di byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: And likewise, I consecrate this robe of mine...

original: 'dod na dkyil 'khor phyed dang gsum pa'i lnga par bya'o zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags las 'byung bas na 'di skad du smos pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod na dkyil 'khor phyed dang gsum pa'i lnga par bya'o zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags las 'byung bas na 'di skad du smos pa yin no //
translated: If one wishes, one should make it five cubits in the half-mandala and three cubits in the full mandala, as stated in the mantras.

original: de lta bus na 'di dag bsdams par brad kyis gcad du mi rung ba med zhus pa'i ma mo las kyang sbyar ma ni mi bcad du mi rung gi stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs dang la ni chad pa med do zhes 'byung ba la sogs pa yin no
analyzed: de lta bus na 'di dag bsdams par brad kyis gcad du mi rung ba med zhus pa'i ma mo las kyang sbyar ma ni mi bcad du mi rung gi stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs dang la ni chad pa med do zhes 'byung ba la sogs pa yin no
translated: Thus, it is said that it is not suitable to cut off these robes, as stated in the Vinaya: The upper robe and the lower robe should not be cut off, but the connecting strip may be cut off.

original: // sbyar ma la sogs chos gos 'di dag gi tshad ji tsam zhes byin gyis brlabs chen po ni nyid kyi khru gsum dang lnga'o zhes pa la sogs pa yin te chen po'i tshad ni srid du khru lnga zheng du khru gsum par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: // sbyar ma la sogs chos gos 'di dag gi tshad ji tsam zhes byin gyis brlabs chen po ni nyid kyi khru gsum dang lnga'o zhes pa la sogs pa yin te chen po'i tshad ni srid du khru lnga zheng du khru gsum par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The size of these Dharma robes such as the connecting strip is asked: The great consecration is three and a half of one's own cubits, and so on. The size of the great one is five cubits in length and three cubits in width.

original: chung du ni khru tshad @81a * //
analyzed: chung du ni khru tshad @81a * //
translated: The small one is two cubits in length and one and a half cubits in width.

original: kyis gnyi gar bsgyur zhes pa ni che chung gi tshang srid du khru byed dang lnga /
analyzed: kyis gnyi gar bsgyur zhes pa ni che chung gi tshang srid du khru byed dang lnga /
translated: The medium one is four cubits in length and two cubits in width. Both means both the great and small sizes.

original: zheng du ni khru phyed dang gsum gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: zheng du ni khru phyed dang gsum gyis shig pa'o //
translated: finger-widths.

original: bar ma ni 'phring gi tshad do zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bar ma ni 'phring gi tshad do zhes pa ni /
translated: The medium is the measure of the large.

original: che chung gi tshang gong du smos pa'i bar ma ni /
analyzed: che chung gi tshang gong du smos pa'i bar ma ni /
translated: The medium measure of the large is

original: 'bring gi tshad yin par ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'bring gi tshad yin par ston pa'o //
translated: taught to be the measure of the medium.

original: smad g-yogs kyi tshad ni gong du bstan pa rnam pa gsum du'ang ma zad pas na /
analyzed: smad g-yogs kyi tshad ni gong du bstan pa rnam pa gsum du'ang ma zad pas na /
translated: The measure of the lower robe is not only the three measures taught above.

original: smad g-yogs ni gnyis dang lnga'am /
analyzed: smad g-yogs ni gnyis dang lnga'am /
translated: The lower robe is two and five or🔽two and four.

original: gnyis dang bzhi'o zhes pa dang / dkyil 'khor gsum yog pa yan chad kyang ngo zhes pa yin te /🔽srid du khru lnga zheng du do pa 'am srid du khu bzhi /🔽zheng du khru do pa'am /
analyzed: gnyis dang bzhi'o zhes pa dang / dkyil 'khor gsum yog pa yan chad kyang ngo zhes pa yin te / srid du khru lnga zheng du do pa 'am srid du khu bzhi / zheng du khru do pa'am /
translated: It is also the measure of the three circles.

original: lte ba dang bus mo'i 'khor yog pa yan chad /
analyzed: lte ba dang bus mo'i 'khor yog pa yan chad /
translated: The measure of the lower robe is five cubits in length and two in width, or four cubits in length and two in width.

original: smad g-yogs kyi tshad du ston pa'o //
analyzed: smad g-yogs kyi tshad du ston pa'o //
translated: The measure of the lower robe is also the measure of the three circles.

original: lus kyi bdun cha'i gnyis khru tshad ngo zhes pa ni /
analyzed: lus kyi bdun cha'i gnyis khru tshad ngo zhes pa ni /
translated: The measure of the lower robe is taught to be two-thirds of the body.

original: khru dang lus kyi khru ring thung yod na lus kyi srid ji tsam par srad bus gcal la bdun du bltabs pa'i bltabs gnyis la khru'i tshad du gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: khru dang lus kyi khru ring thung yod na lus kyi srid ji tsam par srad bus gcal la bdun du bltabs pa'i bltabs gnyis la khru'i tshad du gyis shig pa'o //
translated: If there is a difference in cubits and the length of the body, then the length of the body should be measured with a string, and two of the folds of the seven folds should be made into the measure of a cubit.

original: mi 'khyud na bsgrog par bya zhes pa ni lus sbom ches te smad g-yogs kyi tshad gong du bstan pas mi 'khyud na zhabs ma'i thabs su gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'khyud na bsgrog par bya zhes pa ni lus sbom ches te smad g-yogs kyi tshad gong du bstan pas mi 'khyud na zhabs ma'i thabs su gyis shig pa'o //
translated: If it does not cover the body, it should be sewn together, means that if the lower robe does not cover the body because of the thickness of the body, then it should be made into a skirt.

original: stod g-yogs kyis mi 'khyud na yang sgrog cing gsum par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: stod g-yogs kyis mi 'khyud na yang sgrog cing gsum par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: If the upper robe does not cover the body, it should be sewn together and made into a third robe.

original: zla ba'i spang ba rnam par 'byed pa'o /
analyzed: zla ba'i spang ba rnam par 'byed pa'o /
translated: This is the analysis of the prohibition of the moon.

original: // / zla ba'i spang ba zhus ba las 'byung ba bsdus te ston pa ni /
analyzed: // / zla ba'i spang ba zhus ba las 'byung ba bsdus te ston pa ni /
translated: The summary of the questions on the prohibition of the moon is taught:

original: chung ngu bzhin du de bas chung ba ni zhes bya'o zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: chung ngu bzhin du de bas chung ba ni zhes bya'o zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The smaller ones are called even smaller than that.

original: khru gang khor yug tu med par chung ba kha sogs su bzhag ste zhag bcu 'das na che chung gi tshad ji tsam pa bzhin du nyes byas su ston pa'o //
analyzed: khru gang khor yug tu med par chung ba kha sogs su bzhag ste zhag bcu 'das na che chung gi tshad ji tsam pa bzhin du nyes byas su ston pa'o //
translated: If a cubit is placed in the mouth and so forth, and ten days pass, then the size of the offense is taught according to the size of the object.

original: dkyil 'khor phyed mi yog pa ni re bar mi bya zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor phyed kyang mi yog pa tsam gyi tshod phyi ma'i kha sogs su bzhag na zhag bcu 'das pas nyes byas su ston pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor phyed mi yog pa ni re bar mi bya zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor phyed kyang mi yog pa tsam gyi tshod phyi ma'i kha sogs su bzhag na zhag bcu 'das pas nyes byas su ston pa'o //
translated: Do not hope for a half mandala to be sufficient means that if you leave a half mandala or less in the next village, and so on, you commit an offense after ten days have passed.

original: mi rung ba yang ngo zhes pa ni gso ma dang rda bal la sogs pa mi rung ba yang kha sogs su ma 'jog shig pa'o //
analyzed: mi rung ba yang ngo zhes pa ni gso ma dang rda bal la sogs pa mi rung ba yang kha sogs su ma 'jog shig pa'o //
translated: Also what is unsuitable means do not leave in the next village, and so on, unsuitable things such as flax and wool.

original: gdong phyis dang chu tshags dang gding ba dang dre'u rdog la sogs pa dang yo byad kyi gos su byin gyis ma brlabs pa yang ngo zhes pa ni 'di rnams so so'i rdzas su ma bsngos na 'di dag las kha stsogs su ma 'jog shig pa'o //🔽zla ba'i spang ba zhus pa'o //
analyzed: gdong phyis dang chu tshags dang gding ba dang dre'u rdog la sogs pa dang yo byad kyi gos su byin gyis ma brlabs pa yang ngo zhes pa ni 'di rnams so so'i rdzas su ma bsngos na 'di dag las kha stsogs su ma 'jog shig pa'o // zla ba'i spang ba zhus pa'o //
translated: Also what is not consecrated as a robe for requisites means do not leave in the next village, and so on, face-washing cloths, water strainers, sitting mats, donkey loads, and so on, unless they are consecrated as a robe for requisites.🔽The prohibition on the month is finished.

original: zla ba'i spang ba'o /🔽// /'khru ba spang ba'i zhar la @81b ston pa ni /
analyzed: zla ba'i spang ba'o / // /'khru ba spang ba'i zhar la @81b ston pa ni /
translated: The prohibition on the month.🔽The prohibition on washing is taught in the context of:

original: sbrum pa ni gnas dben par ro zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: sbrum pa ni gnas dben par ro zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: A pregnant woman in a secluded place.

original: dge slong ma sbrum na gnas dben par zhog shig pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma sbrum na gnas dben par zhog shig pa'o //
translated: If a nun is pregnant, she should be placed in a secluded place.

original: 'di dge slong ma dag gis yal par mi dor zhes pa ni dge slong ma sbrum ba 'khyam du mi gzhug pa la sogs pa'i rim gro dge slong ma gzhan gyis gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dge slong ma dag gis yal par mi dor zhes pa ni dge slong ma sbrum ba 'khyam du mi gzhug pa la sogs pa'i rim gro dge slong ma gzhan gyis gyis shig pa'o //
translated: This means that nuns should not abandon her. This means that other nuns should take care of her, not allowing the pregnant nun to wander about, and so forth.

original: 'di kha zas sbyin zhes pa ni sbrum pa de dge slong ma gzhan gyis zas skyol la byin cig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di kha zas sbyin zhes pa ni sbrum pa de dge slong ma gzhan gyis zas skyol la byin cig pa'o //
translated: This means that other nuns should give her food.

original: 'di nyid dang 'og nas 'byung ba'i bslab pa gnyen dang gnyen ma yin pa las ltung ba dang mi ltung bar 'gyur bas na gnyen gyi mtshan nyid nyi tshe ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid dang 'og nas 'byung ba'i bslab pa gnyen dang gnyen ma yin pa las ltung ba dang mi ltung bar 'gyur bas na gnyen gyi mtshan nyid nyi tshe ston pa ni /
translated: The following two trainings are taught in order to show the characteristics of a relative, since they are downfalls for a relative but not for a non-relative.

original: gnyen ni pha ma gnyis kyi rgyud re nas bdun brgyud kyi bar du snga bas so zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyen ni pha ma gnyis kyi rgyud re nas bdun brgyud kyi bar du snga bas so zhes pa yin te /
translated: A relative is someone in one’s paternal or maternal lineage up to seven times removed.

original: pha ma gnyis kyi rgyud re nas bdun rgyud kyi bar du khyo shug zung sha stag tu sbyar ba'i nye rgyud dang bdag nyid nas bu tsha rabs bdun gyi bar du 'brel ba rnams gnyan du bskor ba'o //
analyzed: pha ma gnyis kyi rgyud re nas bdun rgyud kyi bar du khyo shug zung sha stag tu sbyar ba'i nye rgyud dang bdag nyid nas bu tsha rabs bdun gyi bar du 'brel ba rnams gnyan du bskor ba'o //
translated: The “close relatives” are those who have been related as husband and wife for seven generations on the side of either one’s mother or father. The “powerful relatives” are those who have been related by marriage for seven generations on one’s own side.

original: 'khru ba'i spang bar ces 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'khru ba'i spang bar ces 'gyur zhe na /
translated: “What is the rule for bathing?”

original: 'du shes gtsor byed ces pa yin te sbyar ba dang rtsa ba kun la 'du shes brtsan par ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes gtsor byed ces pa yin te sbyar ba dang rtsa ba kun la 'du shes brtsan par ston pa'o //
translated: “The rule for bathing is that one should be careful about one’s perception.” This means that one should be careful about one’s perception in all the basic and subsidiary downfalls.

original: mdo 'di go sla ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mdo 'di go sla ba'i phyir /
translated: “This sūtra is easy to understand.”

original: 'di 'bring ces pa yin te 'bring ces gong du ston par 'du shes brtsan no bar go bar gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di 'bring ces pa yin te 'bring ces gong du ston par 'du shes brtsan no bar go bar gyis shig pa'o //
translated: “This is the medium one.” This means that one should understand that the medium one is the one that was taught above, and that one should be careful about one’s perception.

original: 'du shes brtsan pa'i yul gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'du shes brtsan pa'i yul gang yin zhe na /
translated: “What is the object of being careful about one’s perception?”

original: dge slong ma dang dge bsnyen ma yin pa'o zhes pa yin te dge slong ma yin bar 'du shes pa dang gnyen ma yin par 'du shes na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma dang dge bsnyen ma yin pa'o zhes pa yin te dge slong ma yin bar 'du shes pa dang gnyen ma yin par 'du shes na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “A fully ordained nun and a female novice.” This means that if one perceives her as a fully ordained nun and not as a relative, one commits an offense.

original: 'di nyi tsher ma zad pas na /
analyzed: 'di nyi tsher ma zad pas na /
translated: “This is not the only case.”

original: 'og ma yang ngo zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: 'og ma yang ngo zhes pa yin te /
translated: “The same applies to the following.”

original: len pa'i spang ba 'og nas 'byung ba la yang gong du smos pa'i 'du shes 'di gnyis brtsan par ston pa'o //
analyzed: len pa'i spang ba 'og nas 'byung ba la yang gong du smos pa'i 'du shes 'di gnyis brtsan par ston pa'o //
translated: This also shows that the two perceptions mentioned above are to be applied to the following downfalls of accepting.

original: ji byas pas 'khru ba spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji byas pas 'khru ba spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one avoid the downfall of washing?🔽It is to entrust to a monk who is not a relative the washing, dying, or stretching of any of one’s own three robes or of the mat.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa bdag gi rnying pa bskur 'os pa chos gos gding ba rnams gang yang rung ste 'khru 'tshed 'chag tu bcol na'o zhes pa yin te byin gyis brlabs pa gsum las gang yang rung ba dang / gding ba la sogs pa 'khrur bcug kyang rung 'tshed du bcug kyang rung /🔽'chag tu bcug kyang rung ste nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa bdag gi rnying pa bskur 'os pa chos gos gding ba rnams gang yang rung ste 'khru 'tshed 'chag tu bcol na'o zhes pa yin te byin gyis brlabs pa gsum las gang yang rung ba dang / gding ba la sogs pa 'khrur bcug kyang rung 'tshed du bcug kyang rung / 'chag tu bcug kyang rung ste nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One incurs a downfall by entrusting any of the three to be washed, dyed, or stretched.

original: phyogs gcig byas na yang las su byas pa'o zhes pa ni phyogs 'ga' 'am gra 'ga' bkrus na yang ril gyis bkrus pa dang @82a * //
analyzed: phyogs gcig byas na yang las su byas pa'o zhes pa ni phyogs 'ga' 'am gra 'ga' bkrus na yang ril gyis bkrus pa dang @82a * //
translated: If one washes even a part of the robe, or if one washes even a part of the mat, it is as if the whole had been washed.

original: 'dra'o // lan cig chur bsubs na yang de bzhin /
analyzed: 'dra'o // lan cig chur bsubs na yang de bzhin /
translated: If one washes it once in water, it is the same.

original: byas na byed du bcug pa'o zhes pa ni bcol ba tsam gyis ma yin gyi /
analyzed: byas na byed du bcug pa'o zhes pa ni bcol ba tsam gyis ma yin gyi /
translated: If one does it oneself, it is the same as if one had had it done.

original: dge slong mas bkru ba la sogs pa'i las byas na gdod byed du bcug bar chud pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong mas bkru ba la sogs pa'i las byas na gdod byed du bcug bar chud pa'o //
translated: If a nun performs the action of washing, etc., then it is lost when she makes someone else do it.

original: zin gyi bar du gcig go zhes pa ni bkru ba lan re zhing nyes pa lan rer brtsi ba ma yin gyis zin gyi bar du nyes pa gcig tu brtsir zad do //
analyzed: zin gyi bar du gcig go zhes pa ni bkru ba lan re zhing nyes pa lan rer brtsi ba ma yin gyis zin gyi bar du nyes pa gcig tu brtsir zad do //
translated: As long as it is not finished, it is one offense. It is not that each time it is washed, an offense is incurred each time, but as long as it is not finished, it is only one offense.🔽If it is so that only one action is involved, then when there are different actions, the offenses are individual.

original: las sna gcig pu ni de ltar yang 'gyur na las kyi sna grangs tha dad pa nyes pa so sor 'gyur ro zhes par dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir tshigs yod kyang 'bras bu gcig go zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: las sna gcig pu ni de ltar yang 'gyur na las kyi sna grangs tha dad pa nyes pa so sor 'gyur ro zhes par dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir tshigs yod kyang 'bras bu gcig go zhes pa yin te /
translated: In order to dispel that doubt, it is said that even though there are different actions, there is only one result.

original: 'khru ba dang 'tshed pa dang 'chag pa'i tshigs tha dad du zin kyang 'bras bu spang ba'i ltung ba gcig tu zad par ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'khru ba dang 'tshed pa dang 'chag pa'i tshigs tha dad du zin kyang 'bras bu spang ba'i ltung ba gcig tu zad par ston pa'o //
translated: Even though there are different actions of washing, cooking, and walking, it is taught that there is only one result, the downfall of forsaking the training.

original: 'du shes gtso yang don bzhin na rtsa ba'o zhes pa ni 'du shes brtsan pa yang don de bzhin te /
analyzed: 'du shes gtso yang don bzhin na rtsa ba'o zhes pa ni 'du shes brtsan pa yang don de bzhin te /
translated: Even though the perception is different, the meaning is the same as the root.

original: ma nor na gdod brtsan pa'o //
analyzed: ma nor na gdod brtsan pa'o //
translated: If it is not mistaken, then it is different.

original: don mi bzhin na rtsa ba dang nye ba'o zhes pa ni don ji lta ba bzhin du 'du shes par ma gyur na rtsa ba dang nye ba ste nyes byas su 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: don mi bzhin na rtsa ba dang nye ba'o zhes pa ni don ji lta ba bzhin du 'du shes par ma gyur na rtsa ba dang nye ba ste nyes byas su 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
translated: This shows that if it is not the case that the perception is as the meaning is, it is a root or a minor offense.

original: dper na chu srog chags dang bcas la bcas par yang shes na ltung ba dang srog chags med la yod par 'du shes na nyes byas su 'gyur ba dang 'dra'o//
analyzed: dper na chu srog chags dang bcas la bcas par yang shes na ltung ba dang srog chags med la yod par 'du shes na nyes byas su 'gyur ba dang 'dra'o//
translated: For example, if there is a living being in the water and one knows it, there is a downfall. If there is no living being in the water but one perceives that there is, it is a minor offense.🔽If one is unsure, it is as the perception.

original: the tshom pa ni 'du shes bzhin zhes pa ni gnyen dang dge slong ma yin nam ma yin ma nges te gnyen tsam yod bzhin du 'chol na 'du shes pa dang mgo mnyam mo //
analyzed: the tshom pa ni 'du shes bzhin zhes pa ni gnyen dang dge slong ma yin nam ma yin ma nges te gnyen tsam yod bzhin du 'chol na 'du shes pa dang mgo mnyam mo //
translated: If one is unsure whether the woman is a relative or not a nun, or whether one has a mere relative, and one commits adultery, it is the same as the perception.

original: 'di'i skabs su rnam par 'byed pa las 'byung ba zhar la ston pa ni /🔽dge 'dun gyi bya bar byas pa bzhin du bsrung zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i skabs su rnam par 'byed pa las 'byung ba zhar la ston pa ni / dge 'dun gyi bya bar byas pa bzhin du bsrung zhes pa yin te /
translated: In this context, the following is taught as an aside from the Vinaya:🔽One should guard oneself as if one were a monk who has been appointed to an office of the saṅgha.

original: dge 'dun gyi nang khrims rab tu srungs shig pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi nang khrims rab tu srungs shig pa'o //
translated: One should keep the internal rules of the saṅgha.

original: 'dir lhags pa yang mi gtogs pa ma yin zhes pa ni gud nas 'dron du lhags pas kyang gzhi pa'i nang khrims mi bsrung du mi rung bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir lhags pa yang mi gtogs pa ma yin zhes pa ni gud nas 'dron du lhags pas kyang gzhi pa'i nang khrims mi bsrung du mi rung bar ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase not excluding those who have come here shows that those who have come here from elsewhere are not exempt from the basic rules of the community.

original: 'di yod dam med pa dang dngos shes par bya ba'i phyir des dri zhes pa ni gud nas lhags pa rnams kyis 'di nang na khrims ji yod na ji lta bu zhes brtag cing rjes chod cig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yod dam med pa dang dngos shes par bya ba'i phyir des dri zhes pa ni gud nas lhags pa rnams kyis 'di nang na khrims ji yod na ji lta bu zhes brtag cing rjes chod cig pa'o //
translated: The phrase in order to know whether it exists or not, one should ask about it means that those who have come from elsewhere should investigate and follow what the rules are in this community.

original: de nam 'dri zhe na /
analyzed: de nam 'dri zhe na /
translated: When should one ask?

original: ring por ma lon te'o zhes pa yin te snod la sogs pa phog ma thag du dris shig pa'o //
analyzed: ring por ma lon te'o zhes pa yin te snod la sogs pa phog ma thag du dris shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase not long after means that one should ask immediately after one has been assigned a bowl, etc.

original: gong du dge 'dun gyi nang khrims bsrung zhes @82b smos pa 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: gong du dge 'dun gyi nang khrims bsrung zhes @82b smos pa 'grel pa ni /
translated: The commentary on the phrase one should observe the rules of the community above is as follows.

original: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa dge 'dun gyis skyor med ces pa yin te bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ngam mi gnang bar bsrungs na de brtsan gyi dge 'dun gyi nang khrims brtsan par ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa dge 'dun gyis skyor med ces pa yin te bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ngam mi gnang bar bsrungs na de brtsan gyi dge 'dun gyi nang khrims brtsan par ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: The phrase one should not observe whether it is approved by the community or not means that if one observes whether the Buddha approved or did not approve of something, one should not observe whether it is approved by the community.

original: lhung bzed dang gos dang 'dra ba dang phor bu dang ska rags lhag pa rnams byin na dge 'dun gyi 'theb tu blang zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di rnams bdag la yod bzhin du gzhan gyis lhag par byin na dge 'dun gyi 'theb tu long shig
analyzed: lhung bzed dang gos dang 'dra ba dang phor bu dang ska rags lhag pa rnams byin na dge 'dun gyi 'theb tu blang zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di rnams bdag la yod bzhin du gzhan gyis lhag par byin na dge 'dun gyi 'theb tu long shig
translated: If one has these items and someone else gives one extra ones, one should take them from the Sangha.🔽If the Sangha is in a hurry, one should take as much as one wants from that share.

original: pa'o // brel na 'theb de las ji 'dod pa blang zhes pa ni dge 'dun 'di dag gis brel na 'theb de las long shig pa'o //🔽'khru ba'i spang ba rnam par 'byed pa'o /
analyzed: pa'o // brel na 'theb de las ji 'dod pa blang zhes pa ni dge 'dun 'di dag gis brel na 'theb de las long shig pa'o // 'khru ba'i spang ba rnam par 'byed pa'o /
translated: If the Sangha is in a hurry, one should take from that share.🔽The analysis of the prohibition against washing.

original: // /'khru ba spang bzhus pa las 'byung ba bsdus te ston pa ni /
analyzed: // /'khru ba spang bzhus pa las 'byung ba bsdus te ston pa ni /
translated: The summary of the teaching on the prohibition against washing is:

original: bshang gci dang gsher ba dang rdzab la sogs pas ma rung ste /
analyzed: bshang gci dang gsher ba dang rdzab la sogs pas ma rung ste /
translated: If one puts in a washing place what is not suitable,

original: 'khrur bcug na yang nyes pa rangs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'khrur bcug na yang nyes pa rangs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: even if one washes it, the fault is complete.

original: dre'u rdog dang khyim pa'i gos dang sngas dang rung bar byas pa dang spangs pa dang dge 'dun gyi rnams ni nyes byas zhes pa ni gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong ma la 'di dag 'khru ba la sogs pa'i las byed du bcol na nyes byas su 'gyur🔽ba'o // 'khru ba spang ba zhus pa'o //
analyzed: dre'u rdog dang khyim pa'i gos dang sngas dang rung bar byas pa dang spangs pa dang dge 'dun gyi rnams ni nyes byas zhes pa ni gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong ma la 'di dag 'khru ba la sogs pa'i las byed du bcol na nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o // 'khru ba spang ba zhus pa'o //
translated: If one asks a nun who is not a relative to do these actions such as washing, it is a misdeed.🔽The abandonment of washing.

original: 'khru ba spang ba'o /
analyzed: 'khru ba spang ba'o /
translated: The abandonment of receiving.

original: // / len pa'i spang bston par 'dod pa'i zhar la ston pa ni /
analyzed: // / len pa'i spang bston par 'dod pa'i zhar la ston pa ni /
translated: The abandonment of receiving is taught in the context of the desire to teach.

original: dge slong mas gos rin po che brje bar blang zhes pa la sogs pa yin te bzang zhing rin che ba'i gos khyim pas dge slong ma la byin na bdag gis spyad pa'i phyir ni ma yin gyi brdze ba'i long shig pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong mas gos rin po che brje bar blang zhes pa la sogs pa yin te bzang zhing rin che ba'i gos khyim pas dge slong ma la byin na bdag gis spyad pa'i phyir ni ma yin gyi brdze ba'i long shig pa'o //
translated: “A nun should receive the exchange of a precious robe.” If a lay person gives a nun a good, precious robe, it is not for her to use, but for her to exchange it.

original: dge slong ma dang brdze bar bya zhes pa ni dge slong ma gos brjes shig pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma dang brdze bar bya zhes pa ni dge slong ma gos brjes shig pa'o //
translated: “Exchange it with a nun” means that the nun should exchange the robe.

original: nor ji lta bus brje zhe na /
analyzed: nor ji lta bus brje zhe na /
translated: What kind of wealth should be exchanged?

original: mtshungs pa'am de mgu bar byed pas so zhes pa yin te ri ba'i rin sbyin pa'am de mi mgu ba med pas brjes shig pa'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa'am de mgu bar byed pas so zhes pa yin te ri ba'i rin sbyin pa'am de mi mgu ba med pas brjes shig pa'o //
translated: Or, similar means pleasing to him, that is, give the proper price, or do not displease him.

original: ji ltar byas pas len pa spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas len pa spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one avoid the offense by doing what?

original: blangs pa zhes pa yin te pha rol las blangs shing khyer na nyes par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: blangs pa zhes pa yin te pha rol las blangs shing khyer na nyes par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: The text says if one takes, that is, if one takes and carries it away from another, there is an offense.

original: de la gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong ma dang der 'du shes pa dang / the tshom pa'i yan lag gzhan gong du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong ma dang der 'du shes pa dang / the tshom pa'i yan lag gzhan gong du bstan pa yin no //
translated: In this case, the other limbs are as explained above: the nun is not a relative, one perceives her as such, and there is no doubt.

original: ji ltar blangs pa zhe na /🔽blangs pa zhes smras pa yin te kha rog pa'am tshig @83a * //
analyzed: ji ltar blangs pa zhe na / blangs pa zhes smras pa yin te kha rog pa'am tshig @83a * //
translated: How does one take it?

original: las gzhan bas ma yin gyi tshig gis blangs na'o //
analyzed: las gzhan bas ma yin gyi tshig gis blangs na'o //
translated: The text says if one says 'take it,' that is, if one takes it by saying, Take it, not by silence, or by another action.🔽Not by saying, Take it, but by saying, Give it to me.

original: 'di blangs pas she na /
analyzed: 'di blangs pas she na /
translated: What is taken?

original: gos zhes pa yin te zas dang skom rdzas gzhan ma yin ba'o //
analyzed: gos zhes pa yin te zas dang skom rdzas gzhan ma yin ba'o //
translated: The text says cloth, not food, drink, or other substances.

original: de dag kun 'grel pa ni dge 'dun la gos phul ba ni nyes med ces pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag kun 'grel pa ni dge 'dun la gos phul ba ni nyes med ces pa yin te /
translated: The commentary on all of these is that there is no offense in offering cloth to the Saṅgha.

original: gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong mas dge 'dun gyi phyir gos phul ba blangs pa ni nyes med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong mas dge 'dun gyi phyir gos phul ba blangs pa ni nyes med par ston pa'o //
translated: It is not wrong for a nun who is not a relative to accept robes offered for the sake of the Sangha.

original: legs par smras pa'i phyir na yang ngo zhes pa ni dam pa'i chos bshad pa la sogs pa legs par smras pa'i phyir dge slong mas byin pa blangs pa ni nyes med /
analyzed: legs par smras pa'i phyir na yang ngo zhes pa ni dam pa'i chos bshad pa la sogs pa legs par smras pa'i phyir dge slong mas byin pa blangs pa ni nyes med /
translated: It is also not wrong to accept what a nun gives if she praises you well, that is, if she praises you well by explaining the sublime teachings and so forth.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs su cha'am ston na'o zhes pa ni bsnyen par rdzogs su byed pa dang ston na dge slong ma las khyer zhing blangs pa ni nyes med /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs su cha'am ston na'o zhes pa ni bsnyen par rdzogs su byed pa dang ston na dge slong ma las khyer zhing blangs pa ni nyes med /
translated: It is not wrong to accept what a nun carries for you if she is going to give you full ordination or teach you.🔽It is not wrong to accept what a nun places in front of you if you have made a bet with her about wealth or faith and you have won.

original: mdun du gzhag ste nor dang dad pa'i shags btab nas thag bcad de song na'o zhes pa ni dge slong mas gos byin pa dge slong len du ma btub pa dang btsun pa bdag la brtse ba'i slad du bdag gi nor 'di bzhes shig ces mdun du gzhag🔽nas song ba lta bu blangs pa'ang nyes med /
analyzed: mdun du gzhag ste nor dang dad pa'i shags btab nas thag bcad de song na'o zhes pa ni dge slong mas gos byin pa dge slong len du ma btub pa dang btsun pa bdag la brtse ba'i slad du bdag gi nor 'di bzhes shig ces mdun du gzhag🔽nas song ba lta bu blangs pa'ang nyes med /
translated: If a nun gives a monk a robe but he is unable to accept it, he may accept it if she places it in front of him and says, “Venerable, please accept this wealth of mine out of love for me.”

original: len pa spang ba rnam par 'byed pa'o /
analyzed: len pa spang ba rnam par 'byed pa'o /
translated: The analysis of the abandonment of taking.

original: // / zhus pa las 'byung ba ston pa ni /
analyzed: // / zhus pa las 'byung ba ston pa ni /
translated: The teaching that occurs in the Questions of Revata Sutra is:

original: lag tu 'ongs pa na thob pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: lag tu 'ongs pa na thob pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: When it comes into the hand, it is obtained.

original: nor lag tu 'ongs na gdod thob par ston pa'o //
analyzed: nor lag tu 'ongs na gdod thob par ston pa'o //
translated: When wealth comes into the hand, it is taught to be obtained.🔽When it comes into the visual field, it is the beginning.

original: mig lam du 'ongs na 'di thog ma'o zhes pa ni lag tu 'ongs pa'i tha ma mig lam du bab pa yin pas na mig lam du 'ongs pa yang thob pa'i khongs su gtogs par ston pa'o //
analyzed: mig lam du 'ongs na 'di thog ma'o zhes pa ni lag tu 'ongs pa'i tha ma mig lam du bab pa yin pas na mig lam du 'ongs pa yang thob pa'i khongs su gtogs par ston pa'o //
translated: Since the end of coming into the hand is coming into the visual field, it is taught that coming into the visual field is included in the category of obtaining.🔽Accepting future is preparation.

original: ma 'ongs pa khas blangs pa ni sbyor ba'o zhes pa gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong ma la gos blangs pa las 'phral du ni sa byin gyi ma sbyin no zhes zer ba dang blang bar khas blangs na sbyor bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa khas blangs pa ni sbyor ba'o zhes pa gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong ma la gos blangs pa las 'phral du ni sa byin gyi ma sbyin no zhes zer ba dang blang bar khas blangs na sbyor bar ston pa'o //
translated: This teaches that when a nonrelative nun accepts a robe, it is preparation to say, “I will not give it to you right now” or to accept it.

original: gos byin pa la sogs pa brtson pa ni phyi gzhag gi dbang gis ma yin zhing lag yangs pas na'o zhes pa ni yong gis gtong phod pa dang kha mgron tsam gyi dbang gis ma yin bar gos la sogs pa byin ba blangs pa ni nyes med /
analyzed: gos byin pa la sogs pa brtson pa ni phyi gzhag gi dbang gis ma yin zhing lag yangs pas na'o zhes pa ni yong gis gtong phod pa dang kha mgron tsam gyi dbang gis ma yin bar gos la sogs pa byin ba blangs pa ni nyes med /
translated: It is not that one gives clothes and so on out of a desire to give, or out of a desire to be a host, but that one gives them to those who have taken them up.

original: brnya ba'i sems kyis na nyes med zhes pa ni /
analyzed: brnya ba'i sems kyis na nyes med zhes pa ni /
translated: There is no fault if one does so with a mind of contempt.

original: dge slong ma'i gos re zhig brnyas pa la nyes med par ston pa'o //🔽brjed de rin ma byin na'o zhes pa ni rin sbyin par byas te /
analyzed: dge slong ma'i gos re zhig brnyas pa la nyes med par ston pa'o // brjed de rin ma byin na'o zhes pa ni rin sbyin par byas te /
translated: This shows that there is no fault in the clothes of a nun being taken for a while.🔽If one forgets and does not pay the price,

original: khyer ba las brjed kyi bar du ma byin pa ni nyes @83b med len pa spang ba zhus pa'o //
analyzed: khyer ba las brjed kyi bar du ma byin pa ni nyes @83b med len pa spang ba zhus pa'o //
translated: one should pay the price, but if one forgets and does not pay the price until it is taken, there is no fault.

original: len pa spang ba'o /
analyzed: len pa spang ba'o /
translated: This is the request to abandon taking.

original: // / slong ba'i ltung ba su las byed ce na /
analyzed: // / slong ba'i ltung ba su las byed ce na /
translated: From whom should one commit the downfall of begging?

original: mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim pa yin pa gson po gnyen ma yin pa rnams ltung bar byed ces pa yin te /
analyzed: mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim pa yin pa gson po gnyen ma yin pa rnams ltung bar byed ces pa yin te /
translated: One should commit the downfall from householders belonging to the human realm, who are not relatives, and who are alive.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di dag las blangs na ltung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di dag las blangs na ltung bar byed pa'o //
translated: If one takes from these mentioned by name, one commits a downfall.

original: go sla bar ston pa ni /
analyzed: go sla bar ston pa ni /
translated: The easy way to understand this is:🔽The three below are also.

original: 'og ma gsum yang ngo zhes pa yin te 'di 'og nas slong bar 'os pa dang / spags pa slong ba dang / so so nas spags pa slong ba gsum yang gong du smos pa 'di dag las nyes par 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'og ma gsum yang ngo zhes pa yin te 'di 'og nas slong bar 'os pa dang / spags pa slong ba dang / so so nas spags pa slong ba gsum yang gong du smos pa 'di dag las nyes par 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
translated: This shows that the three below, which are to be requested, the request for a favor, and the request for a specific favor, are also faults from the above.

original: ji lta bu las slong ba'i nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu las slong ba'i nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: From what kind of request is there a fault?

original: phrogs pa stor ba tshig pa rlung gis khyer ba chus g-yengs pa'i gos ma yin na'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: phrogs pa stor ba tshig pa rlung gis khyer ba chus g-yengs pa'i gos ma yin na'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: It is not a request for a robe that is stolen, lost, burned, blown away, or washed away.

original: rnam pa 'di dag gis rkyen med par blangs na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di dag gis rkyen med par blangs na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one takes it without these conditions, there is a fault.

original: ji ltar byas pas nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is there a fault?

original: blangs na nyes byas zhes pa dang / thob na rtsa bzhes pa yin te /
analyzed: blangs na nyes byas zhes pa dang / thob na rtsa bzhes pa yin te /
translated: If one takes it, there is an offense. If one obtains it, there is a root downfall.

original: gnyen pa'i khyim pa las blangs te khyer na slong ba dang / 'thob pa'i tshe nyes byas dang / rtsa bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: gnyen pa'i khyim pa las blangs te khyer na slong ba dang / 'thob pa'i tshe nyes byas dang / rtsa bar ston pa'o //
translated: If one takes it from a householder friend and carries it away, there is an offense at the time of the request and the obtainment. This shows the root downfall.

original: ji thob pa zhe na /
analyzed: ji thob pa zhe na /
translated: What is obtained?

original: gos zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: gos zhes pa yin no //
translated: It is a robe.

original: de'i tshad ji tsam zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshad ji tsam zhe na /
translated: What is the measure of that?

original: mi chung ba zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: mi chung ba zhes pa yin te /
translated: It is not small,

original: bdag gi chos gos kyi tshad las mi chung na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gi chos gos kyi tshad las mi chung na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: because there is an offense if it is smaller than the measure of one's own Dharma robes.

original: de yang ji 'dra ba las nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji 'dra ba las nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What kind of offense is it?

original: rin dang kha dog dang / khru bslang ba ji bzhin na'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: rin dang kha dog dang / khru bslang ba ji bzhin na'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: It is like the price, color, and cubit measure.

original: rin ji tsam pa dang kha dog ji 'dra ba dang / khru tshad ji tsam du bslangs pa bzhin du thob na nyes par 'gyur ba'o /
analyzed: rin ji tsam pa dang kha dog ji 'dra ba dang / khru tshad ji tsam du bslangs pa bzhin du thob na nyes par 'gyur ba'o /
translated: There is an offense if one obtains the price, color, and cubit measure just as requested.

original: ji bslangs pa bzhin du ma thob pa'i brdar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji bslangs pa bzhin du ma thob pa'i brdar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the sign of not obtaining what was requested?

original: gzhan na nyes med ces pa yin te //🔽gong du smos pa ltar bslangs pa bzhin du ma rnyed de che chung dang kha dog mi mthun ba zhig rnyed dam /
analyzed: gzhan na nyes med ces pa yin te // gong du smos pa ltar bslangs pa bzhin du ma rnyed de che chung dang kha dog mi mthun ba zhig rnyed dam /
translated: There is no offense if it is different.

original: bslangs pa'i dngos po nyid ma yin ba gzhan rnyed na nyes med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: bslangs pa'i dngos po nyid ma yin ba gzhan rnyed na nyes med par ston pa'o //
translated: It shows that there is no offense if one obtains something different from what was requested, such as a different size or color, or if one obtains something else entirely that is not the requested item.

original: dang po slong ba'i tshe /
analyzed: dang po slong ba'i tshe /
translated: When first requesting,
