original: kha dog la sogs pa dmigs kyis ma phye bar spyir ji bab bab tu bslangs na ni ji rnyed pa nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: kha dog la sogs pa dmigs kyis ma phye bar spyir ji bab bab tu bslangs na ni ji rnyed pa nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one asks for cloth and so forth in general, without specifying the color and so forth, then one commits an infraction for whatever one obtains.

original: ras ma dang kha tshar blangs pa yang ngo zhes pa ni 'di dag blangs te rnyed pa'i zhar la gos rangs pa rnyed kyang nyes par mi 'gyur ba'o //🔽rgyu spun ni 'bri'o zhes pa ni gos langs pa'i rgyu spun bslangs te rnyed @84a * //
analyzed: ras ma dang kha tshar blangs pa yang ngo zhes pa ni 'di dag blangs te rnyed pa'i zhar la gos rangs pa rnyed kyang nyes par mi 'gyur ba'o // rgyu spun ni 'bri'o zhes pa ni gos langs pa'i rgyu spun bslangs te rnyed @84a * //
translated: Also, one who asks for cotton and thread does not commit an infraction if he obtains cloth as a result of asking for these.

original: na yang nyes pa rangs par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: na yang nyes pa rangs par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One who asks for the materials for cloth does not commit an infraction if he obtains cloth as a result of asking for the materials such as thread.

original: de'i rgyu'ang de bzhin zhes pa ni de'i rgyu ste bal dang shing pa la lta bu zhig bslangs na yang rgyu spun dang 'dra bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu'ang de bzhin zhes pa ni de'i rgyu ste bal dang shing pa la lta bu zhig bslangs na yang rgyu spun dang 'dra bar ston pa'o //
translated: One who asks for the cause of cloth does not commit an infraction if he obtains cloth as a result of asking for the cause of cloth, such as cotton or silk.

original: bslangs pa spang ba'o /
analyzed: bslangs pa spang ba'o /
translated: This is the section on the prohibition against asking.

original: // / bslangs pa'i rigs pa yang ston pa ni /
analyzed: // / bslangs pa'i rigs pa yang ston pa ni /
translated: The section on the proper things to ask for.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa thams cad med na slong ba'i rigs zhes pa la sogs pa yin te yo byad bcu gsum med na slong ba'i rigs par ston pa'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa thams cad med na slong ba'i rigs zhes pa la sogs pa yin te yo byad bcu gsum med na slong ba'i rigs par ston pa'o //
translated: This teaches that if the thirteen articles are not present, it is proper to beg.

original: 'di dag gang las nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag gang las nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: From what is it a downfall to beg?🔽From this, it is a downfall to beg.

original: 'di las ltung bar byed ces pa yin te bslang ba'i rigs pa las lhag par bslangs na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di las ltung bar byed ces pa yin te bslang ba'i rigs pa las lhag par bslangs na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one begs more than is proper to beg, it is a downfall.

original: 'og nas phrugs su ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'og nas phrugs su ston pa ni /
translated: The following is taught in summary:🔽The best of lay clothing is twelve cubits, seven cubits, and two cubits.🔽The best of monk's clothing is the upper robe and the large lower robe, as explained.

original: khyim pa'i gos stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs kyi dam pa ni ras khru bcu gnyis dang bdun dang gnyis so zhes pa dang / dge slong gi ni sbyar ma dang / sham thabs chen po'i rim pa ji skad du bshad pa'o zhes pa yin te khyim pa'i gos dam pa phrugs gcig gi tshang khru bcu gnyis dang bdun dang gnyis su bstan pa /
analyzed: khyim pa'i gos stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs kyi dam pa ni ras khru bcu gnyis dang bdun dang gnyis so zhes pa dang / dge slong gi ni sbyar ma dang / sham thabs chen po'i rim pa ji skad du bshad pa'o zhes pa yin te khyim pa'i gos dam pa phrugs gcig gi tshang khru bcu gnyis dang bdun dang gnyis su bstan pa /
translated: The best of lay clothing is taught to be one set of twelve, seven, and two cubits.

original: dge slong gis gos sar pa las 'grub na sbyar ma nyi rim dang sham thabs thang ba phrugs gcig tu bya'am rnying na sbyar ma bzhi rim sham thabs nyi rim phrugs gcig tu ston pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis gos sar pa las 'grub na sbyar ma nyi rim dang sham thabs thang ba phrugs gcig tu bya'am rnying na sbyar ma bzhi rim sham thabs nyi rim phrugs gcig tu ston pa'o //
translated: If a monk can make a robe from new cloth, he should make the upper robe with two layers and the lower robe with one layer. If the cloth is old, he should make the upper robe with four layers and the lower robe with two layers.

original: gos bslangs pa'i tshad ji tsam zhe na /
analyzed: gos bslangs pa'i tshad ji tsam zhe na /
translated: What is the measure of cloth that one may request?

original: phrugs su bslang zhes pa yin te stod g-yogs dang smang g-yogs phrugs gcig las lhag par ma slong shig pa'o //🔽khyim pa dang dge slong gang gi phrugs gcig bslang zhe na /
analyzed: phrugs su bslang zhes pa yin te stod g-yogs dang smang g-yogs phrugs gcig las lhag par ma slong shig pa'o // khyim pa dang dge slong gang gi phrugs gcig bslang zhe na /
translated: “One set” means that one should not request more than one set of upper and lower robes.🔽From whom may one request a set?

original: gang yang rung zhes pa yin te gnyis kyi nang nas blangs kyang sla bar ston pa'o//
analyzed: gang yang rung zhes pa yin te gnyis kyi nang nas blangs kyang sla bar ston pa'o//
translated: “From anyone” means that it is permissible to request from either a layperson or a monk.

original: tshad 'di las lhag par mi blangs zhes pa ni phrugs gnyis kyi tshad gong du bstan pa las lhag par ma slong shig pa'o //
analyzed: tshad 'di las lhag par mi blangs zhes pa ni phrugs gnyis kyi tshad gong du bstan pa las lhag par ma slong shig pa'o //
translated: “One should not request more than this measure” means that one should not request more than two sets, the measure of which has been taught above.

original: snga ma rnyed pa bskang ba yang ngo zhes pa ni khyim pa'i gos kyi tshad du bslangs pa las rangs pa kho nar ma rnyed pa tsam gyi tshod na rangs pa'ang bskang ba'i phyir slong ba ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma rnyed pa bskang ba yang ngo zhes pa ni khyim pa'i gos kyi tshad du bslangs pa las rangs pa kho nar ma rnyed pa tsam gyi tshod na rangs pa'ang bskang ba'i phyir slong ba ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: If you request the amount of a householder's robe, but only receive the amount of a monk's robe, then you should not request more in order to make up the amount.

original: de la yang stod g-yogs kyi srid khru phyed dang lnga dang zheng khru phyed dang gsum du med pa dang / smad g-yogs 'khor gsum yang mi yog pa tsam zhig rnyed na /
analyzed: de la yang stod g-yogs kyi srid khru phyed dang lnga dang zheng khru phyed dang gsum du med pa dang / smad g-yogs 'khor gsum yang mi yog pa tsam zhig rnyed na /
translated: If you receive a robe that is less than half an arm span in length and less than three quarters of an arm span in width,

original: rangs shing bskang ba'i phyir blangs pa ni nyes med do //
analyzed: rangs shing bskang ba'i phyir blangs pa ni nyes med do //
translated: then there is no fault in receiving it in order to make up the amount.🔽The latter is to give more than the amount received.

original: phyi ma rnyed pa las lhag pa sbyin zhes pa ni dge slong gi @84b stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs kyi tshad kyang lhag par rnyed na ji lhag pa chos la slar byin cig pa'o //🔽ji ltar bslangs pa ltung ba'i nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: phyi ma rnyed pa las lhag pa sbyin zhes pa ni dge slong gi @84b stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs kyi tshad kyang lhag par rnyed na ji lhag pa chos la slar byin cig pa'o //🔽ji ltar bslangs pa ltung ba'i nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If you receive more than the amount of a monk's robe, then you should return the excess.🔽If you request more than the amount of a householder's robe, then you commit a downfall.

original: bslangs pa ma yin bslangs na nyes byas zhes pa dang / rnyed na rtsa ba zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: bslangs pa ma yin bslangs na nyes byas zhes pa dang / rnyed na rtsa ba zhes pa yin te /
translated: If one obtains it, it is a root downfall.

original: blang ba'i tshad ji tsam du bstan pa las lhag par blangs na slong ba'i tshe ni nyes byas /
analyzed: blang ba'i tshad ji tsam du bstan pa las lhag par blangs na slong ba'i tshe ni nyes byas /
translated: This shows that if one takes more than the prescribed amount, it is a wrong action when one asks for it.

original: rnyed na spang ba'i ltung ba ston pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed na spang ba'i ltung ba ston pa'o //
translated: If one obtains it, it is a root downfall.🔽The explanation of Tikapa is that if one asks for wool, cotton and so on that one is not allowed to ask for, it is a wrong action when one asks for it.

original: de la t'i ka pa 'chad pa ni rnga bal sogs pa bslang ba ma yin pa bslangs na slong ba'i tshe nyes byas yang ba thob na rtsa ba ste nyes byas la che ba'o zhes 'chad /
analyzed: de la t'i ka pa 'chad pa ni rnga bal sogs pa bslang ba ma yin pa bslangs na slong ba'i tshe nyes byas yang ba thob na rtsa ba ste nyes byas la che ba'o zhes 'chad /
translated: If one obtains it, it is a root downfall, a heavier wrong action.🔽If one does not return it, it is also a downfall.

original: phyir sbyin pa ma byin na yang ngo zhes pa ni lhag pa slar byin cig pa ma byin na yang spang bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: phyir sbyin pa ma byin na yang ngo zhes pa ni lhag pa slar byin cig pa ma byin na yang spang bar ston pa'o //
translated: This shows that if one does not return the excess, it is a downfall.

original: bslang ba'i rigs pa spang ba'o /
analyzed: bslang ba'i rigs pa spang ba'o /
translated: It is a downfall to give up what is proper to ask for.

original: // / slong ba'i spang ba'i khyad par ston pa ni spags la ma bstabs par shes na ma spags su zad ces pa yin te spags ni spags la khyod sbyin no zhe'am khyod khyer cig ces sbyin pa dag gis bstabs pa med na ma spags pa dang 'dra bas
analyzed: // / slong ba'i spang ba'i khyad par ston pa ni spags la ma bstabs par shes na ma spags su zad ces pa yin te spags ni spags la khyod sbyin no zhe'am khyod khyer cig ces sbyin pa dag gis bstabs pa med na ma spags pa dang 'dra bas
translated: The special rule for avoiding begging is stated: “If you know that it is not offered, it is as if it is not offered.” If it is not offered by giving it to them, saying “I give it to you” or “Take it,” it is as if it is not offered.

original: de lta bu bslangs na spags pa slong ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu bslangs na spags pa slong ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If you beg in this way, it is a downfall to beg for what is offered.

original: don de nyid gsal bar ston pa ni /
analyzed: don de nyid gsal bar ston pa ni /
translated: The meaning of this is clarified:

original: de nyid bzhin no zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid bzhin no zhes pa yin te /
translated: “It is just like that.”

original: spags par ma shes te bslangs na ni 'di las gzhan pa ste slong ba'i ltung bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: spags par ma shes te bslangs na ni 'di las gzhan pa ste slong ba'i ltung bar ston pa'o //
translated: If you beg without knowing that it is offered, it is a downfall to beg, as explained above.

original: de la slong ba'i tshe ni spags par ma shes pa la thob pa'i tshe shes na sbyor ba ni slong bar gtogs pa'i nyes byas rtsa ba ni 'di'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la slong ba'i tshe ni spags par ma shes pa la thob pa'i tshe shes na sbyor ba ni slong bar gtogs pa'i nyes byas rtsa ba ni 'di'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you beg, but do not know that it is offered, and you know it when you receive it, the fault is included in the begging, but the root is a downfall.

original: spags pa slong ba'i spang pa'o /
analyzed: spags pa slong ba'i spang pa'o /
translated: This is the downfall of begging for what is offered.

original: // / spags pa slong ba ni rnam pa ston pa ni so sor spags pa slong ba'i zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: // / spags pa slong ba ni rnam pa ston pa ni so sor spags pa slong ba'i zhes pa yin te /
translated: The line “Even if the donor is generous” shows the teaching.

original: de ston pa ni ster ba lag yangs kyang ngo zhes pa yin nam sbyin bdag lag yangs pas gsha' gsha' ltar byin na yang yan lag gong du smos pa rnams dang ldan na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ston pa ni ster ba lag yangs kyang ngo zhes pa yin nam sbyin bdag lag yangs pas gsha' gsha' ltar byin na yang yan lag gong du smos pa rnams dang ldan na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The line “Even if the donor is generous” shows that even if the donor is very generous, giving as if he were a fool, if the monk has the above mentioned limbs, he will still commit an offense.

original: sbyor ba gcig gis thob pa ni gcig go zhes pa ni sbyor ba gcig gis so sor ram sbyor ba gcig gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong ma dang khyim pa la slong ba dang dbyar gyi ras chen la sogs pa thob pa du ma cig car du grub🔽na yang ltung ba gcig las med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba gcig gis thob pa ni gcig go zhes pa ni sbyor ba gcig gis so sor ram sbyor ba gcig gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong ma dang khyim pa la slong ba dang dbyar gyi ras chen la sogs pa thob pa du ma cig car du grub na yang ltung ba gcig las med par ston pa'o //
translated: The line “One offense is obtained by one application” shows that even if many things are obtained at once by one application, or if many things are obtained by one application, such as asking a nun or a layperson who is not a relative, or obtaining many things such as the rainy season robes and so on,🔽there is only one offense.

original: so sor spags pa slong ba'i spang ba'o /
analyzed: so sor spags pa slong ba'i spang ba'o /
translated: This is the explanation of the offense of asking for many things.

original: // / @85a * //  ji ltar byas pas skur pa'i spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / @85a * //  ji ltar byas pas skur pa'i spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one commit the offense of boasting?

original: las mi rung ba'i gos zong skur ba bkyigs pa las dris pa dang gdod zhal ta ba bstan te pho nyas bsgo nas gtan tshigs bsnyad na gdong bskul zhes pa yin te yon bdag gis gser dngul la sogs pa mi rung ba'i gos zong zhig bskur te 'ongs
analyzed: las mi rung ba'i gos zong skur ba bkyigs pa las dris pa dang gdod zhal ta ba bstan te pho nyas bsgo nas gtan tshigs bsnyad na gdong bskul zhes pa yin te yon bdag gis gser dngul la sogs pa mi rung ba'i gos zong zhig bskur te 'ongs
translated: If a patron sends unsuitable goods such as gold and silver,🔽the messenger should say to the monk, “Venerable, you should not accept these goods without examining them.”

original: na tshe dang ldan pa pho nya dge slong la gos zong 'di ni ma brtags kyis blang du mi rung ngo zhes smras pa dang / de na re 'o na btsun pa'i zhal ta pa rung ba bgyid pa su mchis zhes dris pa dang ming 'di zhes bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: na tshe dang ldan pa pho nya dge slong la gos zong 'di ni ma brtags kyis blang du mi rung ngo zhes smras pa dang / de na re 'o na btsun pa'i zhal ta pa rung ba bgyid pa su mchis zhes dris pa dang ming 'di zhes bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: If the patron asks, “Who is the monk’s suitable attendant?” the monk should reply, “So-and-so.”🔽The messenger then tells the attendant, “Give so-and-so monk this much cloth for such-and-such cloth.”

original: de nas pho nyas kyang de la gos zong 'di lta su gos 'di lta bu spur la dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba 'ongs tang byin cig ces bsgo nas slar dge slong gi thad du phyin te btsun pas bstan pa'i zhal ta bgyid pa la bdag gis
analyzed: de nas pho nyas kyang de la gos zong 'di lta su gos 'di lta bu spur la dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba 'ongs tang byin cig ces bsgo nas slar dge slong gi thad du phyin te btsun pas bstan pa'i zhal ta bgyid pa la bdag gis
translated: The messenger then returns to the monk and says, “Venerable, I have told the attendant you indicated to give you this much cloth for that much cloth.”

original: 'di skad du bsgos btsun pa der bzhud la pa zhes shig ces zer na gdong zhal ta ba de la bskul cig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di skad du bsgos btsun pa der bzhud la pa zhes shig ces zer na gdong zhal ta ba de la bskul cig pa'o //
translated: If he says, Go to the monk and tell him, then the messenger should tell the monk.

original: de la bskul ba'i snyad ni nga la gos rung ba dgos so zhes bskul /
analyzed: de la bskul ba'i snyad ni nga la gos rung ba dgos so zhes bskul /
translated: The messenger should tell him, I need suitable cloth.

original: bskul ba las des ma thos sam ma go na bskul bar mi chung par ston pa ni /
analyzed: bskul ba las des ma thos sam ma go na bskul bar mi chung par ston pa ni /
translated: If the messenger does not hear or understand the response, the text shows that the messenger is not at fault:

original: go bar ma nus na bskul ba ma yin zhes pa yin te ra ro'am gnyid kyis log gam /
analyzed: go bar ma nus na bskul ba ma yin zhes pa yin te ra ro'am gnyid kyis log gam /
translated: If he does not understand, he is not the messenger. If the monk is drunk, asleep,

original: nad kyis thebs sam brel ba las sogs pas rkyen te bskul bar ma shes ma gon bskul ba'i grang su mi chud par ston pa'o //
analyzed: nad kyis thebs sam brel ba las sogs pas rkyen te bskul bar ma shes ma gon bskul ba'i grang su mi chud par ston pa'o //
translated: or distracted by illness or other circumstances, and does not understand the messenger's request, the messenger is not at fault.

original: bskul ba drug cig car du bskul kyang bskul ba gcig tu rtsi mod kyi so sor bya'o //
analyzed: bskul ba drug cig car du bskul kyang bskul ba gcig tu rtsi mod kyi so sor bya'o //
translated: Even if the messenger requests the six articles all at once, it is considered one request, but each article must be requested individually.

original: ma grub na lan gnyis su yang ngo zhes pa ni lan gcig gis ma grub na lan gnyis su'ang bskul cig pa'o //
analyzed: ma grub na lan gnyis su yang ngo zhes pa ni lan gcig gis ma grub na lan gnyis su'ang bskul cig pa'o //
translated: If it is not accomplished, then a second time. If it is not accomplished by one request, then request a second time.

original: lan gsum du yang ngo zhes pa ni gnyis kyis ma grub na gsum gyi bar du'ang bskul cig pa'o //
analyzed: lan gsum du yang ngo zhes pa ni gnyis kyis ma grub na gsum gyi bar du'ang bskul cig pa'o //
translated: And three times, “I will do so” means that if it is not established by two, it is also urged up to three.

original: de nas lan gsum gyi bar du phyogs su bsdad ces pa ni ma smra bar phyogs su bsdad pa lan gsum du gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: de nas lan gsum gyi bar du phyogs su bsdad ces pa ni ma smra bar phyogs su bsdad pa lan gsum du gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Then, “sit in the direction” up to three times means that you should sit in the direction without speaking three times.

original: de la rnam par 'byed pa las ni lan bzhi'am lnga drug gi bar du mi smra bar phyogs su sdod cig ces 'byung la 'dir ni lan gsum gyi bar du zhes smos pa ci phyir zhe na rnam par bsnyad ces pa ni de ltar bskul du zin gyis
analyzed: de la rnam par 'byed pa las ni lan bzhi'am lnga drug gi bar du mi smra bar phyogs su sdod cig ces 'byung la 'dir ni lan gsum gyi bar du zhes smos pa ci phyir zhe na rnam par bsnyad ces pa ni de ltar bskul du zin gyis
translated: Why is it said here that it is up to three times, when the Exposition says that you should sit in the direction without speaking up to four, five, or six times?

original: kyang ma ster na khong brtul pa'i tshig tu zad pas @85b na ;
analyzed: kyang ma ster na khong brtul pa'i tshig tu zad pas @85b na ;
translated: Even though it is urged in that way, if it is not given, it is just a word of his own mind.

original: gong du bskul ba gsum smos pa'i phyir 'di phyogs su bsdad pa gsum zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: gong du bskul ba gsum smos pa'i phyir 'di phyogs su bsdad pa gsum zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because three urgings are mentioned above, here it is said that there are three sittings in the direction.

original: ma grub na sbyin pa po la bsnyad ces pa ni de ltar bskul du zin gyis kyang ma ster na sbyin bdag gi khungs po la kho bo zhal ta byed pas 'di ltar ma ster gyis khyod kyi nor bar ma dor du chud zos pa re zhes slar
analyzed: ma grub na sbyin pa po la bsnyad ces pa ni de ltar bskul du zin gyis kyang ma ster na sbyin bdag gi khungs po la kho bo zhal ta byed pas 'di ltar ma ster gyis khyod kyi nor bar ma dor du chud zos pa re zhes slar
translated: If, despite such urging, the donor still does not give, the monk should say to him, “I am the steward of the Sangha. I have not given your wealth to the Sangha. You have lost it.”

original: sprin cig pa'o //
analyzed: sprin cig pa'o //
translated: This is the sixth permutation.🔽If the donor says, “I will give if you go,” the monk should say, “I have already gone and informed the donor.”🔽If the donor says, “I will give if you do not go,” the monk should say, “I have already gone and informed the donor.”🔽If the donor says, “I will give if you return,” the monk should say, “I have already returned and informed the donor.”🔽If the donor says, “I will give if you do not return,” the monk should say, “I have already returned and informed the donor.”

original: de ltar gyur te btang ba dang / byin na btang ngo zhes smras kyang sbyin bdag gi sems bdag gis bsrung bar bya'o zhes khas len na bslang bar bya zhes pa ni de ltar re thag chad nas btang ba'i 'og tu des gos khyer te 'ongs na ngas mtang ste yon bdag la'ang spran zin gyis
analyzed: de ltar gyur te btang ba dang / byin na btang ngo zhes smras kyang sbyin bdag gi sems bdag gis bsrung bar bya'o zhes khas len na bslang bar bya zhes pa ni de ltar re thag chad nas btang ba'i 'og tu des gos khyer te 'ongs na ngas mtang ste yon bdag la'ang spran zin gyis
translated: If the donor says, “I will give if you stay,” the monk should say, “I have already stayed and informed the donor.”

original: mi 'dod do zhes byas kyang de na re yon bdag gi sems kho bos bsrung gi mi bzhes su mi rung zhes sprul na long shig pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod do zhes byas kyang de na re yon bdag gi sems kho bos bsrung gi mi bzhes su mi rung zhes sprul na long shig pa'o //
translated: If the donor says, “I will give if you do not stay,” the monk should say, “I have already stayed and informed the donor.”🔽If the donor says, “I will give if you go and return,” the monk should say, “I have already gone and returned and informed the donor.”🔽If the donor says, “I will give if you do not go and return,” the monk should say, “I have already gone and returned and informed the donor.”🔽If the donor says, “I will give if you go and do not return,” the monk should say, “I have already gone and returned and informed the donor.”🔽If the donor says, “I will give if you do not go and do not return,” the monk should say, “I have already gone and returned and informed the donor.”

original: ji ltar byas pa skur pa spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pa skur pa spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the donor says, “I will give if you stay and return,” the monk should say, “I have already stayed and returned and informed the donor.”🔽If the donor says, “I will give if you stay and do not return,” the monk should say, “I have already stayed and returned and informed the donor.”🔽If the donor says, “I will give if you stay and go,” the monk should say, “I have already stayed and returned and informed the donor.”🔽If the donor says, “I will give if you stay and do not go,” the monk should say, “I

original: bskul ba dang bsdad pa las 'das sam khas mi len na'o zhes pa yin te bskul ba dang bsdad pa lan drug tu bya ba las 'das sam yon bdag gi sems kho bos bsrung ngo zhes khas mi len par blangs na spang bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bskul ba dang bsdad pa las 'das sam khas mi len na'o zhes pa yin te bskul ba dang bsdad pa lan drug tu bya ba las 'das sam yon bdag gi sems kho bos bsrung ngo zhes khas mi len par blangs na spang bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One exceeds the urging and the sitting, which are done six times, or does not accept, saying, “I will protect the patron’s mind.”

original: de la bskul zhing bsdad pa lan drug las 'da' ba'am go rims pa snor du mi rung gi nad bskul ba ni nyes med do //
analyzed: de la bskul zhing bsdad pa lan drug las 'da' ba'am go rims pa snor du mi rung gi nad bskul ba ni nyes med do //
translated: In that, exceeding the urging and the sitting six times, or reversing the order, is not suitable. But urging the sick is not a fault.

original: sngar bya ba'i las de ltar byas nas nyes par 'gyur ba nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: sngar bya ba'i las de ltar byas nas nyes par 'gyur ba nyid ston pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the very fault when one acts in that way, the action to be done previously, is:

original: khyer na'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: khyer na'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: “If one takes it.”

original: gos bslangs sam khyer na gdod nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gos bslangs sam khyer na gdod nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one asks for or takes the cloth, then there is a fault.

original: sbyin bdag dang pho nya dang zhal ta ba ji lta bu las nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: sbyin bdag dang pho nya dang zhal ta ba ji lta bu las nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What kind of patron, messenger, or attendant causes a fault?

original: gsum char mi dang khyim pa na'o zhes pa yin te 'di gsum mi yin pa dang / khyim pa yin pa las nyes pa rangs par 'gyur gyi sel zhing gyur na nyes pa'i 'bri bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: gsum char mi dang khyim pa na'o zhes pa yin te 'di gsum mi yin pa dang / khyim pa yin pa las nyes pa rangs par 'gyur gyi sel zhing gyur na nyes pa'i 'bri bar ston pa'o //
translated: If one does not say it, there is an offense.

original: ma smras na nyes byas zhes pa ni pho nyas zhal ta pa la 'di ltar gtad kyis 'phags pa der bzhud pa la bzhes shig tsam mi zer bas bskul na nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ma smras na nyes byas zhes pa ni pho nyas zhal ta pa la 'di ltar gtad kyis 'phags pa der bzhud pa la bzhes shig tsam mi zer bas bskul na nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one does not say, “Go to the noble one and accept this,” to the messenger who has been sent with the message, “Give this to so and so,” then one incurs an offense.🔽If one does not take it, there is an offense.

original: ma bkyigs na yang ngo zhes pa ni pho nyas mi rung ba'i gos zong khyer te 'ongs pa'i cho ma bkyigs na nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ma bkyigs na yang ngo zhes pa ni pho nyas mi rung ba'i gos zong khyer te 'ongs pa'i cho ma bkyigs na nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one does not take the messenger’s gift of unsuitable cloth, one incurs an offense.

original: re thag chad pa'i 'og tu khyer te 'ongs pa'i tshe bkyigs na yang de bzhin no//
analyzed: re thag chad pa'i 'og tu khyer te 'ongs pa'i tshe bkyigs na yang de bzhin no//
translated: If one does not take it when it is brought after one has given up hope, it is the same.

original: @86a * // ma dris par ston na yang ngo zhes pa ni 'phags pa'i zhal ta ba su lags zhes pho nyas ma dris par bdag gis sngan tshogs su bstan na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: @86a * // ma dris par ston na yang ngo zhes pa ni 'phags pa'i zhal ta ba su lags zhes pho nyas ma dris par bdag gis sngan tshogs su bstan na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If you show it without being asked, it is a fault.

original: re thag chad nas ma bsnyad na'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: re thag chad nas ma bsnyad na'o zhes pa ni /
translated: If you do not report it because you have lost hope,

original: re thag chad pa'i 'og tu yon bdag la ma sbran na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: re thag chad pa'i 'og tu yon bdag la ma sbran na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: it is a fault if you do not inform the patron after you have lost hope.

original: de kha cig 'chad pa ni gser dngul la sogs pa brtag par ma byas na cho ga 'di ltar bya'i brtag par byas na cho ga 'di dag ltar bya 'ang mi dgos zhes 'chad /
analyzed: de kha cig 'chad pa ni gser dngul la sogs pa brtag par ma byas na cho ga 'di ltar bya'i brtag par byas na cho ga 'di dag ltar bya 'ang mi dgos zhes 'chad /
translated: Some explain that if you do not examine gold, silver, and so on, you should perform the rite in this way, but if you do examine it, you do not need to perform these rites.

original: t'i ka bas bya ba ni gzhan ni de ltar yang rung gi gos zong du bskur ba zhig na ni cho ga 'di ltar mi sbyar yang mi rung ngo zhes 'chad /
analyzed: t'i ka bas bya ba ni gzhan ni de ltar yang rung gi gos zong du bskur ba zhig na ni cho ga 'di ltar mi sbyar yang mi rung ngo zhes 'chad /
translated: Daktsang says that it is suitable to do it this way in other cases, but if you send cloth as a gift, it is not suitable to not apply this rite.

original: skur ba spang ba'o /
analyzed: skur ba spang ba'o /
translated: This is the section on giving up gifts.

original: // / srin bal gyi stan spang bar ston pa ni /
analyzed: // / srin bal gyi stan spang bar ston pa ni /
translated: The section on giving up a bed of shellac

original: stan bcang zhes pa yin te rlod can dang phying pa'i stan chongs shig pa'o //
analyzed: stan bcang zhes pa yin te rlod can dang phying pa'i stan chongs shig pa'o //
translated: The word spread means to take up a thick mat or a woolen mat.🔽Some explain that the word mat refers to a mat for sitting.🔽But a mat is to be spread out on the ground, while a mat for sitting is a thick mat or a woolen mat.

original: de la kha cig na re stan zhes smos pa 'di gding ba yin du zad do zhes kyang 'chad mod kyi gding ba ni gcig thang dang nyi rim du bya zhes 'byung stan ni rlod can dang / phying pa'o zhes 'byung ba dang / dgos pa'i dmigs kyang tha dad pas na /
analyzed: de la kha cig na re stan zhes smos pa 'di gding ba yin du zad do zhes kyang 'chad mod kyi gding ba ni gcig thang dang nyi rim du bya zhes 'byung stan ni rlod can dang / phying pa'o zhes 'byung ba dang / dgos pa'i dmigs kyang tha dad pas na /
translated: And the purposes of the two are different.

original: gding ba dang stan ni gcig tu mi rung ste tha dad do //
analyzed: gding ba dang stan ni gcig tu mi rung ste tha dad do //
translated: Therefore, a mat and a mat for sitting are not the same thing.

original: de la 'khor gsum yog ba tsam byas na yang rtsa ba'i nyes bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'khor gsum yog ba tsam byas na yang rtsa ba'i nyes bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you merely set up the three spheres, you will incur a root downfall.

original: de las chung ba ni nyes pa 'ang de bzhin du 'bri'o //
analyzed: de las chung ba ni nyes pa 'ang de bzhin du 'bri'o //
translated: If it is smaller than that, you should draw it as being the same size.

original: de'i tshad ni rab 'bring rnam pa gsum yod do //
analyzed: de'i tshad ni rab 'bring rnam pa gsum yod do //
translated: It has three sizes: large, medium, and small.

original: de la chen po'i srid ni khru phyed dang lnga /
analyzed: de la chen po'i srid ni khru phyed dang lnga /
translated: The large one is five and a half cubits long.

original: chung du'i srid ni khru phyed dang gsum /
analyzed: chung du'i srid ni khru phyed dang gsum /
translated: The small one is four and a half cubits long.

original: 'bring gi srid ni de gnyis kyi bar du ma'o zhes pa ni sum char 'dra ste /
analyzed: 'bring gi srid ni de gnyis kyi bar du ma'o zhes pa ni sum char 'dra ste /
translated: The intermediate size is called the measure of the two, and the small size is called the measure of one.

original: gding ba dang mnyam mo //
analyzed: gding ba dang mnyam mo //
translated: The measure of the small is the same as the measure of the three.

original: ji ltar byas pas srin bal spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas srin bal spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one abandon cotton?🔽If one makes a mat of cotton or causes it to be made.

original: srin bal las byed dam byed du bcug na'o zhes pa yin te srin bal las byed pa'i stan bdag gis byas sam gzhan byed du bcug na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: srin bal las byed dam byed du bcug na'o zhes pa yin te srin bal las byed pa'i stan bdag gis byas sam gzhan byed du bcug na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one makes a mat of cotton oneself or causes another to make it, one commits an offense.

original: byed pa 'am byed du bcug pa zin pa'i tshad ston pa ni /
analyzed: byed pa 'am byed du bcug pa zin pa'i tshad ston pa ni /
translated: The measure of the completion of making or causing it to be made is taught:🔽The first spreading is the completion of the mat.

original: thog ma bdal ba ni gding ba byas zin pa'o zhes pa yin te srin bal gyi khod bdal na byas zin pa'i dang po de yin pas na de'i tshe spad bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thog ma bdal ba ni gding ba byas zin pa'o zhes pa yin te srin bal gyi khod bdal na byas zin pa'i dang po de yin pas na de'i tshe spad bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one spreads a layer of cotton, that is the first completion, and at that time it is abandoned.🔽If one obtains and uses what was made or if another made it, there is no offense.

original: byas pa rnyed cing spyod pa dang bcol ba la nyes med ces pa ni zas byin pa rnyed cing spyod pa 'am gzhan gyis byas pa bdag gis @86b bcos pa ni nyes med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: byas pa rnyed cing spyod pa dang bcol ba la nyes med ces pa ni zas byin pa rnyed cing spyod pa 'am gzhan gyis byas pa bdag gis @86b bcos pa ni nyes med par ston pa'o //
translated: This teaches that if one obtains and uses what was given or if another made it and one repaired it, there is no offense.

original: srin bal spang ba rnam par byed pa'o //
analyzed: srin bal spang ba rnam par byed pa'o //
translated: The remedy is to avoid silk.

original: zhus pa las bsdus pa ston pa ni /
analyzed: zhus pa las bsdus pa ston pa ni /
translated: The summary of the questions is presented:

original: nyung ba dang bsres pa ni 'bri zhes pa la sogs pa yin te bal dang zar ma dang / gso ma la sogs pa dang srin bal du bsres pa ni nyes par rangs par mi 'gyur gyi srin bal dang rin thang mnyam pa zhig dang bsres na nyes pa rangs par ston pa'o //
analyzed: nyung ba dang bsres pa ni 'bri zhes pa la sogs pa yin te bal dang zar ma dang / gso ma la sogs pa dang srin bal du bsres pa ni nyes par rangs par mi 'gyur gyi srin bal dang rin thang mnyam pa zhig dang bsres na nyes pa rangs par ston pa'o //
translated: “If one mixes in a small amount” and so forth means that if one mixes in a small amount of cotton with wool, flax, and silk, and so forth, the fault is not serious. But if one mixes in an amount equal to the cotton, the fault is serious.

original: rdzas nyams na yang ngo zhes pa ni srin bal rnyings shing nyams pa zhig las byas na yang nyes pa rangs bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rdzas nyams na yang ngo zhes pa ni srin bal rnyings shing nyams pa zhig las byas na yang nyes pa rangs bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Even if the material is damaged” means that if one makes it from old, damaged cotton, the fault is not serious.

original: srin bal gyi stan zhu ba'o //
analyzed: srin bal gyi stan zhu ba'o //
translated: The request is for a cotton mat.

original: srin bal spang ba'o //
analyzed: srin bal spang ba'o //
translated: The avoidance of silk.

original: bal nag po nyi tshe spang ba zhig gong ma las blangs te de'i bye brag tsam zhig ston pa ni //
analyzed: bal nag po nyi tshe spang ba zhig gong ma las blangs te de'i bye brag tsam zhig ston pa ni //
translated: The avoidance of black wool is taken from the previous section, and only the differences are presented:

original: bal nag po nyi tshes so zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: bal nag po nyi tshes so zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: “Black wool” and so forth.

original: bal nag pho 'ba' zhig las byas sam byed du bcug na'o //
analyzed: bal nag pho 'ba' zhig las byas sam byed du bcug na'o //
translated: If one makes it from only black wool or has it made.

original: rang bzhin gyis gnag pa 'am bsgyur bas she na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis gnag pa 'am bsgyur bas she na /
translated: If you say that it is naturally black or becomes so by dyeing,

original: rang bzhin zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes pa yin te /
translated: it is naturally so,

original: bsgyur ba ma yin gyi rang bzhin gyis gnag na'o //
analyzed: bsgyur ba ma yin gyi rang bzhin gyis gnag na'o //
translated: because it is not dyed, but is naturally black.

original: sngon po dang sa nag gi mdog dang sngo nag dag kyang de bzhin zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sngon po dang sa nag gi mdog dang sngo nag dag kyang de bzhin zhes pa ni /
translated: Blue and the color of black earth and blue-black are also like that.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'di dag ltar 'dug pa yang nag po dang 'dra bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'di dag ltar 'dug pa yang nag po dang 'dra bar ston pa'o //
translated: This shows that these are naturally like that, like black.

original: nag po nyi tshe spang ba'o //
analyzed: nag po nyi tshe spang ba'o //
translated: Black is only to be abandoned.

original: cha gnyis spang ba ston pa ni /
analyzed: cha gnyis spang ba ston pa ni /
translated: The teaching on abandoning two parts is:

original: de'i phyed las lhag pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyed las lhag pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: More than half, and so on.

original: phyed phyed du mnyam pa las nag po lhag par bcug na spang bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: phyed phyed du mnyam pa las nag po lhag par bcug na spang bar ston pa'o //
translated: This shows that if more than half of the equal parts of black is put in, it is to be abandoned.

original: zar ma dang gso ma la sogs pa 'god pa dang bsres pa ni nyes pa'ang 'bri bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zar ma dang gso ma la sogs pa 'god pa dang bsres pa ni nyes pa'ang 'bri bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is mixed with flax, hemp, and so on, the fault will be reduced.

original: gzhan ni 'jam bal dang khob bal las shas mnyam du'o zhes pa ni nag po las gzhan pa ste de'i phyir shas su bya ba ni bal 'di gnyis las phyed phyed du snyoms shig pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni 'jam bal dang khob bal las shas mnyam du'o zhes pa ni nag po las gzhan pa ste de'i phyir shas su bya ba ni bal 'di gnyis las phyed phyed du snyoms shig pa'o //
translated: The other means other than black. Therefore, the measure is that these two wools should be mixed in equal parts.

original: de la 'jam bal las lhag na ni nyes byas khob bal las lhag na ni nyes med do //
analyzed: de la 'jam bal las lhag na ni nyes byas khob bal las lhag na ni nyes med do //
translated: If it exceeds the cotton, there is an offense. If it exceeds the wool, there is no offense.

original: de la srin bal dang bal nag po ni dgon pa'i phyir glag tu mi rung bar ston gyi /
analyzed: de la srin bal dang bal nag po ni dgon pa'i phyir glag tu mi rung bar ston gyi /
translated: In this regard, silk and black wool are taught as unsuitable for robes because they are wild.

original: dkar po la sogs pa gzhan rin che na yang 'di bzhin nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dkar po la sogs pa gzhan rin che na yang 'di bzhin nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if other colors such as white are expensive, the same offense applies.

original: de la 'jam bal ni gang khob bal ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'jam bal ni gang khob bal ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is cotton and what is wool?🔽That which grows on the back, sides and neck is the former,

original: rgyab dang rtsib logs dang gnya' ba las skyes pa ni snga ma'o zhes pa dang / mgo dang rkang lag dang lto las @87a * //🔽skyes pa ni phyi ma'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyab dang rtsib logs dang gnya' ba las skyes pa ni snga ma'o zhes pa dang / mgo dang rkang lag dang lto las @87a * // skyes pa ni phyi ma'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: and that which grows on the head, feet, hands and belly🔽is the latter.

original: cha gnyis spang ba'o //
analyzed: cha gnyis spang ba'o //
translated: This is the rejection of two parts.

original: lo drug pa ston te gong du mi gtsang na mi gsol zhes pa la sogs pa las gzhi blang ngo //
analyzed: lo drug pa ston te gong du mi gtsang na mi gsol zhes pa la sogs pa las gzhi blang ngo //
translated: The sixth year is taught.  The basis is taken from the above statement, “If it is not clean, do not request.”

original: de ni chu zheng las lhag pa bcad ces pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni chu zheng las lhag pa bcad ces pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: “That which exceeds the width and length should be cut” and so forth.

original: rtog pa'i dge slong dag gis las su bya ba ni chu zheng las lhag na chod cig pa la sogs par ston pa'o //🔽thung ngam chung na skyed ces pa ni /
analyzed: rtog pa'i dge slong dag gis las su bya ba ni chu zheng las lhag na chod cig pa la sogs par ston pa'o // thung ngam chung na skyed ces pa ni /
translated: The actions to be performed by the monks of imagination are taught as “If it exceeds the width and length, cut it” and so forth.🔽“If it is short or small, add.”

original: chung ngam thung na yang skyed cig pa'o //
analyzed: chung ngam thung na yang skyed cig pa'o //
translated: If it is small or short, add.

original: chad na sbyar zhes pa spyad spyad de rked du chang na yang slar sbyor cig pa'o //
analyzed: chad na sbyar zhes pa spyad spyad de rked du chang na yang slar sbyor cig pa'o //
translated: “If it is broken, join it” means that if it is broken in the middle, join it again.

original: gzhigs sam zad du chad na glan ces pa ni zad du byed dam khol khol du rdol na lhan pas thob cig pa'o //
analyzed: gzhigs sam zad du chad na glan ces pa ni zad du byed dam khol khol du rdol na lhan pas thob cig pa'o //
translated: “If it is torn or worn out, patch it” means that if it is worn out or torn, patch it with a patch.

original: bcos su mi rung na sbyin zhes pa ni gong du smos pa ltar byar yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: bcos su mi rung na sbyin zhes pa ni gong du smos pa ltar byar yang mi rung ste /
translated: “If it is not suitable to be repaired, give it away” means that if it is not suitable to be repaired as stated above,

original: stan rnyings shing zegs na sdom pa byin cig pa'o //
analyzed: stan rnyings shing zegs na sdom pa byin cig pa'o //
translated: “If the seat is old and torn, give it away.”

original: las sar pa pa zhes smos mod kyi 'di 'dra bar rnyings shing bcos su mi rung na su la sdom pa byin kyang mi rung ba med /
analyzed: las sar pa pa zhes smos mod kyi 'di 'dra bar rnyings shing bcos su mi rung na su la sdom pa byin kyang mi rung ba med /
translated: Although it is said that the site is new, if it is like this, old and not suitable for repair, there is no fault in giving vows to anyone.

original: ji ltar byas pas lo drug gi spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas lo drug gi spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one become suspended for six years?

original: sdom pa ma thob pa gzhan yod nyid kyis thug thub tu btang ngam lo drug la ma thug par stan byas na'o //
analyzed: sdom pa ma thob pa gzhan yod nyid kyis thug thub tu btang ngam lo drug la ma thug par stan byas na'o //
translated: If another who has not obtained vows is present, one is suspended, or if one is seated without reaching six years.

original: zhes pa yin te ming gis smos pa 'di rnams lta bu'i rkyen yod na spang bar 'gyur ba'o//
analyzed: zhes pa yin te ming gis smos pa 'di rnams lta bu'i rkyen yod na spang bar 'gyur ba'o//
translated: If these conditions mentioned by name exist, one becomes suspended.

original: de la sdom pa ma thob ces pa ni dge 'dun gyis gnad ba ma byin pa'o //
analyzed: de la sdom pa ma thob ces pa ni dge 'dun gyis gnad ba ma byin pa'o //
translated: In this regard, one who has not obtained vows means one who has not been given the opportunity by the Saṅgha.

original: gzhan yod ces pa ni snga ma yod bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yod ces pa ni snga ma yod bzhin pa'o //
translated: Another is present means that the previous one is present.

original: thug thub tu btang zhes pa ni lo drug ma lon bar stan gzhan byin pa la sogs pas med par byas pa'o //
analyzed: thug thub tu btang zhes pa ni lo drug ma lon bar stan gzhan byin pa la sogs pas med par byas pa'o //
translated: Suspended means that one is made absent by giving another seat and so on without reaching six years.

original: rtsom pa na shom ba ni yod pa bzhin zhes pa ni snga ma gcig ma zin par phyi ma byed na zin pa yod bzhin du byas pa dang 'dra ste nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rtsom pa na shom ba ni yod pa bzhin zhes pa ni snga ma gcig ma zin par phyi ma byed na zin pa yod bzhin du byas pa dang 'dra ste nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: When one begins, as if it existed, it is as if one were to do the latter without having finished the former, and as if one were to do it while it existed. It becomes a misdeed.

original: mthar phyin na sbyor ba nyes par mi byed pa ma yin zhes pa ni gong ma ltar brtsams pa las phyi ma zin par byas na phyi ma dang po rtsom pa'i nyes byas med pa ma yin par ston pa'o //
analyzed: mthar phyin na sbyor ba nyes par mi byed pa ma yin zhes pa ni gong ma ltar brtsams pa las phyi ma zin par byas na phyi ma dang po rtsom pa'i nyes byas med pa ma yin par ston pa'o //
translated: If one perfects it, it is not that one does not commit a fault.  It shows that if one does the latter after beginning as above, it is not that there is no misdeed of beginning the latter for the first time.

original: rab tu byung ba tha dad pa ni so so 'o zhes pa ni rab tu 'byung ba las babs te phyis rab tu 'byung na stan byed na sngon gyi stan la ma gtogs par ston pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba tha dad pa ni so so 'o zhes pa ni rab tu 'byung ba las babs te phyis rab tu 'byung na stan byed na sngon gyi stan la ma gtogs par ston pa'o //
translated: The different ordinations are individual.  It shows that if one renounces the ordination and later becomes ordained again, one should not use the former seat, except for the former seat.

original: lo drug gi spang ba'o //
analyzed: lo drug gi spang ba'o //
translated: This is the abandonment of six years.

original: ji ltar byas pas mtho'i spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas mtho'i spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one become abandoned by doing it?

original: gding ba rnying pa las bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang @87b gis gding ba gsar pa la ma glan par spyod na'o zhes pa la sogs pa yin te 'di ltar ma byas na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gding ba rnying pa las bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang @87b gis gding ba gsar pa la ma glan par spyod na'o zhes pa la sogs pa yin te 'di ltar ma byas na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one uses a new mat without adding a span of the Sugata to the old mat, one will be at ease.🔽If one does not do it this way, there is an offense.

original: gding ba rnying pa med nas bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gis ma glan par spyod na nyes par 'gyur ram zhen yod na'o zhes pa yin te yod na gdod gong ma ltar bya'i med na nyes med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: gding ba rnying pa med nas bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gis ma glan par spyod na nyes par 'gyur ram zhen yod na'o zhes pa yin te yod na gdod gong ma ltar bya'i med na nyes med par ston pa'o //
translated: If one uses a new mat without adding a span of the Sugata to the old mat, is there an offense? If there is, it is as above. If there is not, it shows that there is no offense.

original: rnying pa rangs par med kyang 'di tsam gyis glan tam zhe na /
analyzed: rnying pa rangs par med kyang 'di tsam gyis glan tam zhe na /
translated: If the old one is not torn, is it enough to add this much?

original: de tsam na yang ngo zhes pa yin te rangs pa med du zin kyang bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang tsam gyis glon cig pa'o //
analyzed: de tsam na yang ngo zhes pa yin te rangs pa med du zin kyang bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang tsam gyis glon cig pa'o //
translated: Even if it is that much, it is not enough. Even if it is not torn, add a span of the Sugata.

original: ma ral ba bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang tsam gyis glan tam zhe na /
analyzed: ma ral ba bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang tsam gyis glan tam zhe na /
translated: If it is torn, is it enough to add a span of the Sugata?

original: bcos su rung bas kyang ngo zhes pa yin te ral na yang chos la glon cig pa'o //
analyzed: bcos su rung bas kyang ngo zhes pa yin te ral na yang chos la glon cig pa'o //
translated: Even if it can be repaired, it is not enough. If it is torn, add a span of the Dharma.

original: dum bu bsdus te yang ngo zhes pa ni dam dum du gyur na yang bsdus la glon cig pa'o //
analyzed: dum bu bsdus te yang ngo zhes pa ni dam dum du gyur na yang bsdus la glon cig pa'o //
translated: The phrase if it is torn, one should gather it together and sew it means that if it is torn, one should gather it together and sew it.

original: mtho'i spang pa'o //
analyzed: mtho'i spang pa'o //
translated: This is the section on wool.

original: ji ltar byas pas bal khyer ba spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas bal khyer ba spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one avoid the offense of carrying wool?

original: khyer pa med na lus bal dpag tshad gsum las lhag par khyer ba na yod na ni 'ong zhes pa yin te khyer ba med na bdag gis dpag tshad gsum las ma lhag par khyer cig pa'o //
analyzed: khyer pa med na lus bal dpag tshad gsum las lhag par khyer ba na yod na ni 'ong zhes pa yin te khyer ba med na bdag gis dpag tshad gsum las ma lhag par khyer cig pa'o //
translated: If one does not carry it, one should carry it no more than three krośas. If one carries it, one should say, “I will come.” If one does not carry it, one should say, “Carry it no more than three krośas.”

original: yod na ni der yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yod na ni der yang ma yin no //
translated: If one does carry it, one should not say that.

original: lam du 'gro ba las nyes par 'gyur ba dang / mi 'gyur ba rnam pa gnyis te bal khyer ba dang dge slong ma dang lhan cig tu lam dang grur 'gro ba dang skyes pa med par bud med dang 'grogs pa dang rkun po dang 'grogs pa ni nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lam du 'gro ba las nyes par 'gyur ba dang / mi 'gyur ba rnam pa gnyis te bal khyer ba dang dge slong ma dang lhan cig tu lam dang grur 'gro ba dang skyes pa med par bud med dang 'grogs pa dang rkun po dang 'grogs pa ni nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: There are two types of offenses related to traveling on the road: offenses related to carrying wool and traveling on the road or in a boat with a fully ordained nun, traveling with a woman without a man, and traveling with a thief.

original: yang yang 'dus shing za ba dang khrus ni nyes par mi 'gyur ba ste dpag tshad phyed kyis nyes par mi 'gyur ba ni phyis 'chad nyes par 'gyur ba da ston pa ni /
analyzed: yang yang 'dus shing za ba dang khrus ni nyes par mi 'gyur ba ste dpag tshad phyed kyis nyes par mi 'gyur ba ni phyis 'chad nyes par 'gyur ba da ston pa ni /
translated: It is not a fault to gather and eat again and again, or to wash. It is not a fault if the distance is a half league.

original: lam du 'gro na rgyang grags dngos so zhes pa yin te nyes par 'gyur ba rnams ni rgyang grags gcig gis so //
analyzed: lam du 'gro na rgyang grags dngos so zhes pa yin te nyes par 'gyur ba rnams ni rgyang grags gcig gis so //
translated: If one goes on the road, it is a league.🔽The half is preparation.

original: phyed ni sbyor ba'i 'o zhes pa ni rgyang grags phyed kyi bar du khyer ba nyes byas su ston pa'o //
analyzed: phyed ni sbyor ba'i 'o zhes pa ni rgyang grags phyed kyi bar du khyer ba nyes byas su ston pa'o //
translated: If one carries it half a league, it is a misdeed.

original: 'phrul las gzhan pas nam mkha' las khyer na nyes byas zhes pa ni sngags la sogs pas /
analyzed: 'phrul las gzhan pas nam mkha' las khyer na nyes byas zhes pa ni sngags la sogs pas /
translated: If one carries it through the sky by other means, it is a misdeed.

original: 'di ltar khyer na nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyer na nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one carries it in this way, it is a misdeed.🔽It is also by emanation.

original: sprul pas kyang ngo zhes pa ni sprul pa rgyur na yang nyes byas /
analyzed: sprul pas kyang ngo zhes pa ni sprul pa rgyur na yang nyes byas /
translated: If one carries it by emanation, it is a misdeed.

original: zhva dang lham dang tshangs dang sras skyogs dang lcags pod dang shur bu la @88a * //
analyzed: zhva dang lham dang tshangs dang sras skyogs dang lcags pod dang shur bu la @88a * //
translated: Shoes, boots, a water strainer, a metal cup, and a water filter.

original: sogs pa tsam gyi phyir nyes pa med ces pa ni 'di dag tsam gyi phyir ni ji srid du khyer yang nyes par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sogs pa tsam gyi phyir nyes pa med ces pa ni 'di dag tsam gyi phyir ni ji srid du khyer yang nyes par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: There is no fault, just because of this and so on, means that as long as one carries, there is no fault, just because of this and so on.

original: rgyang grags kyi tshad ston pa ni /
analyzed: rgyang grags kyi tshad ston pa ni /
translated: The measure of a krośa is taught:

original: yang rdul dang rdul phran dang chu dang khar ba dang ri bong dar ra dang ba dang gseb nyi zer gyi rdul dang sro ma dang shig dang nas dang sor rnams su drug cing bsgre zhes pa ni /
analyzed: yang rdul dang rdul phran dang chu dang khar ba dang ri bong dar ra dang ba dang gseb nyi zer gyi rdul dang sro ma dang shig dang nas dang sor rnams su drug cing bsgre zhes pa ni /
translated: Again, the measure of a krośa is six times the measure of a finger, a finger joint, a barley grain, a finger, a rabbit, a sheep, a cow, a sun ray particle, a louse, a nit, a barley grain, and a finger.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di dag drug drug cing rim bzhin du bsgre'o //
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di dag drug drug cing rim bzhin du bsgre'o //
translated: These six mentioned by name are each multiplied by six, respectively.

original: sor bzhi phrag drug la khru /
analyzed: sor bzhi phrag drug la khru /
translated: Six times four fingers is one cubit.

original: khru phyed dang bzhi la gzhu /
analyzed: khru phyed dang bzhi la gzhu /
translated: Four and a half cubits is one bow.

original: de lnga brgya la rgyang grags zhes pa ni 'di bzhin du bsgres nas rgyang grags su ston pa'o//
analyzed: de lnga brgya la rgyang grags zhes pa ni 'di bzhin du bsgres nas rgyang grags su ston pa'o//
translated: Five hundred of those is one krośa. This is taught as a krośa, having been multiplied in this way.

original: de'i mtha' ni dgon pa'i thog ma'o zhes pa ni rgyang grags phan chad dgon par ston pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mtha' ni dgon pa'i thog ma'o zhes pa ni rgyang grags phan chad dgon par ston pa'o //
translated: Its limit is the beginning of the wilderness. This teaches that beyond a krośa is wilderness.

original: lus kyis khur mi bskur zhes pa ni phrag khur ma khyer cig pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyis khur mi bskur zhes pa ni phrag khur ma khyer cig pa'o //
translated: “Do not carry a load on the body” means do not carry a load on the shoulder.

original: rgyab dang logs dang sta zur dang mgos ma yin zhes pa ni 'di rnams kyis kyang ma khyer cig pa'o //
analyzed: rgyab dang logs dang sta zur dang mgos ma yin zhes pa ni 'di rnams kyis kyang ma khyer cig pa'o //
translated: “Do not carry on the back, the side, the hip, or the head” means do not carry it on these either.

original: 'di khong mi thul bar re ba mi bya zhes pa ni khur mi bskur bar bstan pa ni 'di dag dge slong mas kyang bsrung dgos te thun mong bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'di khong mi thul bar re ba mi bya zhes pa ni khur mi bskur bar bstan pa ni 'di dag dge slong mas kyang bsrung dgos te thun mong bar ston pa'o //
translated: “Do not hope to carry it without a strap” means that the teaching of not carrying a load is to be observed by the nuns as well, showing that it is common to both.

original: khur phyed las lhag par mi gdeg ces pa ni mi khur phyed las lhag ma gdeg shig pa'o //
analyzed: khur phyed las lhag par mi gdeg ces pa ni mi khur phyed las lhag ma gdeg shig pa'o //
translated: “Do not carry more than half a load” means do not carry more than half a load.

original: bal khyer ba'i spang ba'o /🔽// / bal rmel ba'i spang ba ston pa ni /
analyzed: bal khyer ba'i spang ba'o / // / bal rmel ba'i spang ba ston pa ni /
translated: This is the precept on carrying wool.

original: gos rnyid pa zhes pa'i gor lug bal lo zhes bya ba dang / 'chag par rmel ba'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: gos rnyid pa zhes pa'i gor lug bal lo zhes bya ba dang / 'chag par rmel ba'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: The precept on spinning wool is presented in the line, “One should not spin wool,” which includes the phrase “old wool” and “one should not spin while walking.”

original: ltung ba 'di 'khru ba dang 'dra bas na gong du gos rnying pa 'khrur bcug ces smos pa'i gor lug bal gzhag pa dang 'chag ces pa'i gos rmel zhes bcug la rim pa la sogs pa gong du bshad pa bzhin du rig par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: ltung ba 'di 'khru ba dang 'dra bas na gong du gos rnying pa 'khrur bcug ces smos pa'i gor lug bal gzhag pa dang 'chag ces pa'i gos rmel zhes bcug la rim pa la sogs pa gong du bshad pa bzhin du rig par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Since this downfall is like washing, the phrase “having washed old clothes” above should be understood as “having placed wool in a frame and woven it.” The phrase “having woven cloth” should be understood as “having woven cloth.” The stages and so forth are as explained above.

original: bal rmel ba'i spang ba'o /
analyzed: bal rmel ba'i spang ba'o /
translated: This is the downfall of weaving wool.

original: // / ji ltar byas pas gser dngul spang bar 'gyur zhe na /🔽rin po che bdag gir byas na'o zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: // / ji ltar byas pas gser dngul spang bar 'gyur zhe na / rin po che bdag gir byas na'o zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: How does one abandon gold and silver?🔽By accepting precious things.

original: pad ma r'a ga la sogs pa'i rin po che bdag gis byas na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: pad ma r'a ga la sogs pa'i rin po che bdag gis byas na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Precious things such as rubies are to be accepted.

original: gang gi tshe bdag gir byed par rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag gir byed par rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: When does one complete the acceptance?🔽When one has accepted it in one’s hand.

original: gan du na da rdzogs pa'o zhes pa yin te gan du 'ongs shing blangs la rag par gyur na bdag gir bya ba grub pa'o //
analyzed: gan du na da rdzogs pa'o zhes pa yin te gan du 'ongs shing blangs la rag par gyur na bdag gir bya ba grub pa'o //
translated: When one has accepted it in one’s hand, the acceptance is complete.

original: de'i snga rol na phyed do zhes pa ni @88b gan kho nar ma phyin pa phan chad gcig na 'dug pa bdag gir byed na ltung ba'i phyed de nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i snga rol na phyed do zhes pa ni @88b gan kho nar ma phyin pa phan chad gcig na 'dug pa bdag gir byed na ltung ba'i phyed de nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The statement “Half of that is a downfall if one has not yet reached the vicinity” means that if one takes possession of something while still in the vicinity of the place where it was lost, it is half a downfall, a minor offense.

original: gzhan las 'ongs pa bdag gir byas pa 'ba' zhig spang bar 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan las 'ongs pa bdag gir byas pa 'ba' zhig spang bar 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Does this refer only to taking possession of something that belongs to another?

original: bdag gi zhig na yang rung bar ma byas na'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag gi zhig na yang rung bar ma byas na'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: It is said that it is also a downfall if it belongs to oneself, but one has not made it available to others.

original: bdag khyim pa byed pa'i tshe srel srel ba zhig na yang rung bar byin gyis ma brlabs par reg cig spyod na yang spong bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: bdag khyim pa byed pa'i tshe srel srel ba zhig na yang rung bar byin gyis ma brlabs par reg cig spyod na yang spong bar ston pa'o //
translated: This means that if one is a householder, and one has some grain, but has not consecrated it as being available to others, and one uses it, one commits a downfall.

original: ji ltar byas pas ltung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas ltung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one commit a downfall?

original: reg gam reg tu bcug na'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: reg gam reg tu bcug na'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: It is said that one commits a downfall by touching it or causing it to be touched.

original: rin po che bdag gis reg gam gzhan reg du bcug na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rin po che bdag gis reg gam gzhan reg du bcug na nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One commits a downfall if one touches a precious object or causes it to be touched.

original: ji ltar reg pas nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar reg pas nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one commit a downfall by touching it?

original: ji ltar yang rung zhes pa yin te 'di khong 'di khyer 'di tsam khyer zhes pa la sogs pa ji ltar reg tu bcug kyang rung ste nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar yang rung zhes pa yin te 'di khong 'di khyer 'di tsam khyer zhes pa la sogs pa ji ltar reg tu bcug kyang rung ste nyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is in any case because it is all right to let him touch it, saying Take this, Take this much, and so on.

original: zong gis zangs la nyes byas zhes pa ni mtshan ma btab cing 'tshong bar byas pa'i zangs la reg par nyes byas su ston pa'o //
analyzed: zong gis zangs la nyes byas zhes pa ni mtshan ma btab cing 'tshong bar byas pa'i zangs la reg par nyes byas su ston pa'o //
translated: The line There is an offense for copper with a price shows that there is an offense for touching copper that has been marked and is being sold.

original: gzhan la nyes med ces pa ni mtshan ma btab pa la sogs pa'i zangs gzhan la nyes med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la nyes med ces pa ni mtshan ma btab pa la sogs pa'i zangs gzhan la nyes med par ston pa'o //
translated: The line There is no offense for others shows that there is no offense for others' copper that has been marked and so on.

original: ro nye dang khar ba dang tshon mo steng dang lcags kyang ngo zhes pa ni 'di dag la reg pha'ang nyes med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: ro nye dang khar ba dang tshon mo steng dang lcags kyang ngo zhes pa ni 'di dag la reg pha'ang nyes med par ston pa'o //
translated: The line Also tin, lead, brass, and iron shows that there is no offense for touching these.

original: dge tshul dag gis kyang ngo zhes pa ni dge tshul pha dang dge tshul ma 'dzin cing reg tu bcug pa nyes med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: dge tshul dag gis kyang ngo zhes pa ni dge tshul pha dang dge tshul ma 'dzin cing reg tu bcug pa nyes med par ston pa'o //
translated: The line Also for novices shows that there is no offense for letting novices, both male and female, touch it.

original: gong du bdag gi zhig na yang rung bar ma byas na'o zhes bstan pa de'i rung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gong du bdag gi zhig na yang rung bar ma byas na'o zhes bstan pa de'i rung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: If one does not make it suitable for the above, what is the suitability?

original: sbyin bdag bdag por bsams pa dang zhal ta ba bdag por blang ba dang byin gyis brlabs par rung ba'o//
analyzed: sbyin bdag bdag por bsams pa dang zhal ta ba bdag por blang ba dang byin gyis brlabs par rung ba'o//
translated: It is suitable for the master of the offering, the master of the rite, and the consecration.

original: zhes pa yin te rnam pa 'di gsum gong ltar byas kyang rung bar byas pa'i cho gar ston pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa yin te rnam pa 'di gsum gong ltar byas kyang rung bar byas pa'i cho gar ston pa'o //
translated: These three aspects are taught as the ritual for making it suitable.

original: de la sus bskur pa nyid bdag por bsams pa ni sbyin bdag bdag por bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de la sus bskur pa nyid bdag por bsams pa ni sbyin bdag bdag por bsams pa'o //
translated: Among them, the master of the offering is the master of the rite, and the master of the rite is the consecration.

original: nam 'tsho'i bar du mi rung ba'i rdzas dge bsnyen tam lha 'bangs spro bar byas la /
analyzed: nam 'tsho'i bar du mi rung ba'i rdzas dge bsnyen tam lha 'bangs spro bar byas la /
translated: One should delight the lay practitioner or the servant with unsuitable substances for as long as one lives.

original: de'i yin par spyod pa ni zhal ta pa bdag por khas blang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i yin par spyod pa ni zhal ta pa bdag por khas blang ba'o //
translated: The consecration is the consecration.

original: mi rung ba'i nor bar du bzhag la tshe dang ldan pa dgongs shig / bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i dge slong 'di lta bu mi rung ba rnyed pa 'di rung ba'i dngos por bsgyur zhing btsal te bdag gir bya'o zhes lan gnyis gsum du byin gyis rlob
analyzed: mi rung ba'i nor bar du bzhag la tshe dang ldan pa dgongs shig / bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i dge slong 'di lta bu mi rung ba rnyed pa 'di rung ba'i dngos por bsgyur zhing btsal te bdag gir bya'o zhes lan gnyis gsum du byin gyis rlob
translated: The monk who is the owner of the object says, Venerable ones, please give your attention.🔽This monk named so-and-so has found this unsuitable object and has made it suitable and searched for it and made it his own.🔽

original: pa ni @89a * //
analyzed: pa ni @89a * //
translated: The one who is to be consecrated should say, I, so and so, will make this unsuitable object suitable, and having sought it, I will make it my own.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: This is the consecration.

original: de lta bas na rung bar byas te reg gam reg tu bcug pa ni nyes med kyi rung bar byas kyang bdag gir byed pa mi btang na rung ba nyid bdag gis byed pa'i gnyen po bas na nyes pa rangs par ston pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na rung bar byas te reg gam reg tu bcug pa ni nyes med kyi rung bar byas kyang bdag gir byed pa mi btang na rung ba nyid bdag gis byed pa'i gnyen po bas na nyes pa rangs par ston pa'o //
translated: Therefore, if one touches it or causes it to be touched after making it suitable, there is no fault. But if one does not give up making it one's own even though it has been made suitable, then the antidote to making it one's own is to confess the fault.

original: rung bar bya ba'i cho ga de don de ji lta bu la 'chags she na /
analyzed: rung bar bya ba'i cho ga de don de ji lta bu la 'chags she na /
translated: In what situation is the rite of making it suitable explained?

original: chos kyi don ma yin pa las gzhan du mi skye zhes pa yin te sangs rgyas mchod pa la sogs pa dang bdag gi lhung bzed la sogs pa'i yo byad kyi ched du ma yin na gzhan du dgos pa'i phyir rung ba'i cho ga byas kyang byas par
analyzed: chos kyi don ma yin pa las gzhan du mi skye zhes pa yin te sangs rgyas mchod pa la sogs pa dang bdag gi lhung bzed la sogs pa'i yo byad kyi ched du ma yin na gzhan du dgos pa'i phyir rung ba'i cho ga byas kyang byas par
translated: It is not born as something other than the meaning of the Dharma.

original: mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If it is not for the sake of worshipping the Buddha and so on, or for the sake of one's own bowl and so on, then even if one performs the proper ritual, it is not considered to be done.

original: ring yang bdag po mi 'jig ces pa ni bdag por bsam pa dang / zhal ta pa ring mo zhig na 'dug tu zin kyang bdag por byin gyis brlabs pa la mi gdod par ston pa'o //
analyzed: ring yang bdag po mi 'jig ces pa ni bdag por bsam pa dang / zhal ta pa ring mo zhig na 'dug tu zin kyang bdag por byin gyis brlabs pa la mi gdod par ston pa'o //
translated: Even if the master is far away, the consecration does not perish. This shows that even if the consecrated master is far away, the consecration is not lost.

original: bdag gi phyir zas sbyor ba ni rung zhes pa ni bdag gi phyir zas sbyor zhing zas lnga shom pa lto 'dun la sogs pa'i nyes pa ma yin par ston pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi phyir zas sbyor ba ni rung zhes pa ni bdag gi phyir zas sbyor zhing zas lnga shom pa lto 'dun la sogs pa'i nyes pa ma yin par ston pa'o //
translated: It is proper to prepare food for oneself. This shows that there is no fault of greed for food and so on in preparing food for oneself and arranging the five foods.

original: 'di man chad kham pa zhes pa yang chad las rgyags su ni rin po che man chad do zhes rnam par 'byed pa las 'byung ba ma gtogs pa gzhan thams cad phran tshegs las 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di man chad kham pa zhes pa yang chad las rgyags su ni rin po che man chad do zhes rnam par 'byed pa las 'byung ba ma gtogs pa gzhan thams cad phran tshegs las 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: From here on, the term “fine” means a fine, and “provisions” means up to precious substances.

original: de byed du gzhug pa'i phyir k'ar sh'a pa na bzung zhing long shig par ston pa'o //
analyzed: de byed du gzhug pa'i phyir k'ar sh'a pa na bzung zhing long shig par ston pa'o //
translated: The Teacher shows that in order to make him do it, he should be seized and made to pay a kārṣāpaṇa.

original: de yang rung bar ni bya dgos so //
analyzed: de yang rung bar ni bya dgos so //
translated: And that should be made allowable.

original: rgyags ni rin po che man chad do zhes pa ni rgyags zong du ni rin po che man chad rig cing khyer na yang nyes med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: rgyags ni rin po che man chad do zhes pa ni rgyags zong du ni rin po che man chad rig cing khyer na yang nyes med par ston pa'o //
translated: “Provisions are up to precious substances” shows that it is permissible to take precious substances as provisions and to carry them without fault.

original: me'i ched du me shel bcang zhes pa ni chos 'di bdag gi ched du na me shel yang chongs shig pa'o//
analyzed: me'i ched du me shel bcang zhes pa ni chos 'di bdag gi ched du na me shel yang chongs shig pa'o//
translated: “For the sake of fire, carry a fire glass” means that if you are going to carry this Dharma, you should also carry a fire glass.

original: 'di ni dben par bzhag ces pa ni me shel de legs par sbos shig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dben par bzhag ces pa ni me shel de legs par sbos shig pa'o //
translated: “Place it in a secluded place” means that you should keep the fire glass well hidden.

original: ma byin par len pa la mi bstan zhes pa ni 'di rkun pos ma mthong bar gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa la mi bstan zhes pa ni 'di rkun pos ma mthong bar gyis shig pa'o //
translated: “Do not show it to those who have not taken the precepts” means that you should not let thieves see it.

original: 'di'i 'bras bu phyung la sbyin rkun po la me shel ma bstan par me ni phyung la byin cig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i 'bras bu phyung la sbyin rkun po la me shel ma bstan par me ni phyung la byin cig pa'o //
translated: The result of this is: “Give the fire-crystal to the thief, but do not show him the fire.”

original: chu'i ched du chu shel to zhes pa chu dbyung ba'i phyir chu shel yang chongs shig pa'o //
analyzed: chu'i ched du chu shel to zhes pa chu dbyung ba'i phyir chu shel yang chongs shig pa'o //
translated: “Keep the water-crystal for the sake of water” means: “Keep the water-crystal for the sake of producing water.”

original: bsrung ba'i cho ga mtshungs so zhes pa ni chu shel spa ba'i cho ga yang gong ma bzhin tu gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: bsrung ba'i cho ga mtshungs so zhes pa ni chu shel spa ba'i cho ga yang gong ma bzhin tu gyis shig pa'o //
translated: “The rite of protection is the same” means: “The rite of protecting the water-crystal is the same as before.”

original: yo byad gnang ba'i nang du rin po che bdag gir byed pa gtogs pa ma yin zhes pa ni rgya dang khab @89b ral la sogs pa yo byad gnang ba rin po che las ma byed cig par ston pa'o //
analyzed: yo byad gnang ba'i nang du rin po che bdag gir byed pa gtogs pa ma yin zhes pa ni rgya dang khab @89b ral la sogs pa yo byad gnang ba rin po che las ma byed cig par ston pa'o //
translated: “Precious things are not included in the list of permitted articles” means: “Do not make articles such as seals and needles from precious substances.”

original: ra gan dang zangs dang khar ba dang shing gi lhung bzed bdag gir mi bya zhes pa ni lhung bzed 'di dag las ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: ra gan dang zangs dang khar ba dang shing gi lhung bzed bdag gir mi bya zhes pa ni lhung bzed 'di dag las ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: “Do not use a begging-bowl made of tin, copper, brass, or wood” means: “Do not make a begging-bowl from these materials.”

original: 'di dag gam gzhan gal te bdag gir byas na sman snod kyi gor spyad ces pa ni gong du smos pa'i rin po che gang yin pa las byas pa 'am gzhan las byas pa yod na sman snod du byas pa tsam gyi gor spyod kyi /
analyzed: 'di dag gam gzhan gal te bdag gir byas na sman snod kyi gor spyad ces pa ni gong du smos pa'i rin po che gang yin pa las byas pa 'am gzhan las byas pa yod na sman snod du byas pa tsam gyi gor spyod kyi /
translated: One should use it merely as a bowl of medicine.

original: byin gyis brlabs par ni ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs par ni ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: One should not consecrate it.

original: lcags dang kham pa gnyis byin gyis brlab pa'o zhes pa ni 'di gnyis las byas pa'i lhung bzed ni byin gyis rlobs shig pa'o //
analyzed: lcags dang kham pa gnyis byin gyis brlab pa'o zhes pa ni 'di gnyis las byas pa'i lhung bzed ni byin gyis rlobs shig pa'o //
translated: The consecration of iron and clay is that one should consecrate a begging bowl made of these two.

original: gong du rin po che bdag gir byed ces smos pa'i rin po che gang yin pa ston pa ni /
analyzed: gong du rin po che bdag gir byed ces smos pa'i rin po che gang yin pa ston pa ni /
translated: The precious substances mentioned above as to be appropriated are indicated.

original: nor bu mu tig bee d'u rya shes byi ru gser dngul aa sma garbha /
analyzed: nor bu mu tig bee d'u rya shes byi ru gser dngul aa sma garbha /
translated: They are: jewels, pearls, lapis lazuli, coral, gold, silver, and amber.

original: mu sa ra gal ba dmar po g-yas phyogs su 'khyil pa la sogs pa rin po che'o zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: mu sa ra gal ba dmar po g-yas phyogs su 'khyil pa la sogs pa rin po che'o zhes pa yin no //
translated: Musaragalva, red and turning to the right, etc. are precious substances.

original: mi lhum ba ni 'bri zhes pa ni bdar spyad ma byas pa la sogs pa mi sdom par gyur pa reg pa ni nyes pa 'bri bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: mi lhum ba ni 'bri zhes pa ni bdar spyad ma byas pa la sogs pa mi sdom par gyur pa reg pa ni nyes pa 'bri bar ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase not to diminish means not to be restrained, such as not to use the hide. To diminish means to show a fault.

original: 'di 'og nas 'byung ba'i bslab pa yang 'di dang 'dra bar ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'di 'og nas 'byung ba'i bslab pa yang 'di dang 'dra bar ston pa ni /
translated: The phrase the same as above shows that the training that will be taught below is the same as this.

original: 'og ma yang ngo zhes pa yin te 'og nas mtshan ma btab pa 'tshong ba yang mi sdom na 'bri bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'og ma yang ngo zhes pa yin te 'og nas mtshan ma btab pa 'tshong ba yang mi sdom na 'bri bar ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase the same as below shows that if one is not restrained from selling the hide that has been marked, then one is not restrained from diminishing it.

original: mi sdom pa ji lta bu yin pa ston pa ni /
analyzed: mi sdom pa ji lta bu yin pa ston pa ni /
translated: The phrase what kind of non-restraint? shows the kind of non-restraint.

original: chad pa 'phan can yar ba cig sngon mi spyod pa ma thebs pa byid pa bcos pa rnams so zhes pa yin te /🔽'di dag ltar gyur na mi sdom pa ste de la chad ces pa ni gcad par bkyigs pa las chad kyang rung ba'o //
analyzed: chad pa 'phan can yar ba cig sngon mi spyod pa ma thebs pa byid pa bcos pa rnams so zhes pa yin te / 'di dag ltar gyur na mi sdom pa ste de la chad ces pa ni gcad par bkyigs pa las chad kyang rung ba'o //
translated: The phrase those who are suspended, those who have been expelled, those who have not been disciplined, those who have been disciplined, and those who are not disciplined shows the kind of non-restraint.

original: 'phan zhes pa ni bub cing snang pa'o //
analyzed: 'phan zhes pa ni bub cing snang pa'o //
translated: If one is like this, one is not restrained. In this regard, the word suspended means those who have been suspended from the community. Expelled means those who have been expelled from the community. Not disciplined means those who have not been disciplined by the Buddha. Disciplined means those who have been disciplined by the Buddha. Not disciplined means those who have not been disciplined by the Buddha.🔽The word suspended means those who have been suspended from the community. Expelled means those who have been expelled from the community. Not disciplined means those who have not been disciplined by the Buddha. Disciplined means those who have been disciplined by the Buddha. Not disciplined means those who have not been disciplined by the Buddha.

original: yar ces pa ni phyogs 'ga' nas kham tshad du yar ba'o //
analyzed: yar ces pa ni phyogs 'ga' nas kham tshad du yar ba'o //
translated: The word suspended means those who have been suspended from the community. Expelled means those who have been expelled from the community. Not disciplined means those who have not been disciplined by the Buddha. Disciplined means those who have been disciplined by the Buddha. Not disciplined means those who have not been disciplined by the Buddha.

original: sngon mi spyod ces pa ni sngon su'ang mi spyod cing ngo mi shes pa'o //🔽ma thebs zhes pa ni mtshan mas ma thebs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon mi spyod ces pa ni sngon su'ang mi spyod cing ngo mi shes pa'o // ma thebs zhes pa ni mtshan mas ma thebs pa'o //
translated: The term uninhabited means that no one has ever been there before, and no one knows about it.🔽The term unmarked means that it is not marked by any sign.

original: byid ces pa ni byang ste mtshan ma mi mngon pa'o //
analyzed: byid ces pa ni byang ste mtshan ma mi mngon pa'o //
translated: The term unclaimed means that it is not claimed by any sign.

original: bcos ma zhes pa ni rdo dang rtsva la sogs pa las rin po che dang 'dra ba 'am rgyan lta bur bcos bcos pa'o //
analyzed: bcos ma zhes pa ni rdo dang rtsva la sogs pa las rin po che dang 'dra ba 'am rgyan lta bur bcos bcos pa'o //
translated: The term artificial means that it is made of stone, grass, and so forth, like a precious substance or an ornament.

original: gser dngul spang ba'o /🔽// / mtshan mas btab pa spogs byed pa sten pa ni /🔽khe 'dod na ltung ba'o zhes la sogs pa yin te khe 'dod pas spogs @90a * //
analyzed: gser dngul spang ba'o / // / mtshan mas btab pa spogs byed pa sten pa ni / khe 'dod na ltung ba'o zhes la sogs pa yin te khe 'dod pas spogs @90a * //
translated: Gold and silver are to be avoided.🔽The basis of the downfall is to engage in trade.

original: byed na ltung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: byed na ltung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one engages in trade with the desire for profit, there is a downfall.

original: de yang bdag gi phyir na de lta'i gzhan gyi phyir na nyes pa 'bri'o //
analyzed: de yang bdag gi phyir na de lta'i gzhan gyi phyir na nyes pa 'bri'o //
translated: Moreover, if it is for one's own sake, the fault is slight; if it is for the sake of others, the fault is great.

original: pha rol khyim dang gnyen ma yin na rtsa ba'o zhes pa ni spogs zla khyim pa'ang yin gnyen yang ma yin na gdod nyes pa rangs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol khyim dang gnyen ma yin na rtsa ba'o zhes pa ni spogs zla khyim pa'ang yin gnyen yang ma yin na gdod nyes pa rangs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If the trading partner is a layperson who is not a relative, the downfall is a serious one.

original: spogs byed pa gang gi tshe rtsa bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: spogs byed pa gang gi tshe rtsa bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: When does one become a root violator by bartering?🔽When one gives the barter.

original: dge 'dun gsol bar nas rin gyis nyo na dge 'dun gyi las sbyin zhes pa ni dge 'dun mchod ston gsol pa'i rgyu dge 'dun nyid kyis btsang las rin gyis nyo ba yod na byin cig par ston pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gsol bar nas rin gyis nyo na dge 'dun gyi las sbyin zhes pa ni dge 'dun mchod ston gsol pa'i rgyu dge 'dun nyid kyis btsang las rin gyis nyo ba yod na byin cig par ston pa'o //
translated: If you buy it with the price of an invitation to the Saṅgha, it is called “the Saṅgha’s work of giving.” This shows that if there is a pure transaction with the price of an invitation to the Saṅgha, you should give it.

original: gal te de'i rin mdongs sol zhes pa ni mtshams de nyid kyi dge 'dun gsol bar nyo na de'i dge 'dun bdag gis mdongs sol gyis la klogs te byin cig pa'o //
analyzed: gal te de'i rin mdongs sol zhes pa ni mtshams de nyid kyi dge 'dun gsol bar nyo na de'i dge 'dun bdag gis mdongs sol gyis la klogs te byin cig pa'o //
translated: If you buy it with the price of an invitation to the Saṅgha of that very boundary, you should give it after you have asked the Saṅgha of that very boundary.
